full_text: [Standing up, throwing his hands in the air.] Okay, you caught me. [Frontal shot of the three friends.] I'm the Avatar. Doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out. [Aang looks underneath table.] No firebenders here. So, good work, everybody! [Pulling Katara and Sokka into a hug.] Love each other, [Cut to a dismayed looking king.] respect all life, [Cut to a shot of the threesome walking backward toward the exit.] and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!
character_words: Okay, you caught me.  I'm the Avatar. Doing my Avatar thing, keeping the world safe. Everything checks out.  No firebenders here. So, good work, everybody!  Love each other,  respect all life,  and don't run with your spears. We'll see you next time!

full_text: As they near the guard at the exit door, the two men cross their spears, effectively blocking their paths. Camera zooms back to a back shot of the king.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Accusingly.] You can't keep us here! Let us leave!
character_words: You can't keep us here! Let us leave!

full_text: Frontal shot of the king as he questioningly picks up a lettuce leaf from his plate and waves it in the air.
character_words: NA

full_text: Lettuce leaf?
character_words: Lettuce leaf?

full_text: Switch to a side shot of Bumi's mouth as he takes a bite out of a lettuce leaf and chews it slowly.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Cut to the threesome. Sokka holds his hand for his mouth; whispering.] We're in serious trouble. This guy is nuts.
character_words: We're in serious trouble. This guy is nuts.

full_text: [Close-up.] Tomorrow, the Avatar will [Slowly zooming in close-up of Aang.] face three deadly challenges. [Back to Bumi.] But for now, the guards will show you to your chamber.
character_words: Tomorrow, the Avatar will  face three deadly challenges.  But for now, the guards will show you to your chamber.

full_text: [Leaning in toward Bumi.] My liege, do you mean the good chamber or the bad chamber?
character_words: My liege, do you mean the good chamber or the bad chamber?

full_text: [Turning to the guard.] The newly refurbished chamber.
character_words: The newly refurbished chamber.

full_text: [Putting finger in the air.] Wait, which one are we talking about?
character_words: Wait, which one are we talking about?

full_text: The one that used to be the bad chamber, until the recent refurbishing, that is. Of course, we've been calling it the new chamber, but we really should number them. [Switch to a frontal shot of the three children as they are being led out of the room, flanked by two guards. Commanding.] Uh, take them to the refurbished chamber that was once bad!
character_words: The one that used to be the bad chamber, until the recent refurbishing, that is. Of course, we've been calling it the new chamber, but we really should number them.  Uh, take them to the refurbished chamber that was once bad!

full_text: As the children and their guards walk out of the room, the camera rapidly zooms in on Bumi's face. He stares at them before chewing on a new lettuce leaf. The scene changes to inside a room. A wall cracks and moves down, revealing Aang with Momo perched on his shoulders, Katara, and Sokka. They are roughly pushed inside, and the wall is immediately bent up again after them. Switch to a scene of the room, panning to the left, revealing the content of the room, and the fact that there is no door anywhere. The room has three green beds in the center with three green drapes hanging from the ceiling above them. The scene stops on the children.
character_words: NA

full_text: This is a prison cell? But it's so nice.
character_words: This is a prison cell? But it's so nice.

full_text: [Momo jumps off Aang's shoulders and onto a bed.] He did say it was newly refurbished.
character_words: He did say it was newly refurbished.

full_text: Nice or not, we're prisoners!
character_words: Nice or not, we're prisoners!

full_text: [Close-up; worried.] I wonder what these challenges are gonna to be.
character_words: I wonder what these challenges are gonna to be.

full_text: [Determined.] We're not sticking around to find out. There's got to be some way out of here.
character_words: We're not sticking around to find out. There's got to be some way out of here.

full_text: [Excitedly pointing at something at the other side of the room.] The air vents!
character_words: The air vents!

full_text: Scene quickly moves around the room and halts at a hole in the wall. Cut back to the trio. Aang smiles happily, staring at the hole, while Katara and Sokka eye each other in wonder.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Harshly.] If you think we're going to fit through there, you're crazier than that king.
character_words: If you think we're going to fit through there, you're crazier than that king.

full_text: [Turning to Sokka.] We can't, but Momo can!
character_words: We can't, but Momo can!

full_text: Happily points in front of him. Cut to Momo lazily lying on the bed, licking a half-eaten apple. His belly protrudes from eating so much. Aang appears at the side of the bed.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Hopeful.] Momo, I need you to find Appa and bust us outta here!
character_words: Momo, I need you to find Appa and bust us outta here!

full_text: Momo looks up surprised to his friend, blinking and chittering softly. Cut to a shot from inside the air vent looking out. Momo's head appears and the animal is pushed inside the tube. The animal is shoved back and forth a few times, much to its displeasure. Cut to Aang standing on a chair, trying to push Momo into the air vent without success.
character_words: NA

full_text: Go on, boy, get Appa!
character_words: Go on, boy, get Appa!

full_text: Aang quits trying, looking down discouraged, leaving Momo stuck in the vent. Cut to Sokka who is relaxing on a bed.
character_words: NA

full_text: Eh, how was Appa supposed to save us anyway?
character_words: Eh, how was Appa supposed to save us anyway?

full_text: Cut to Momo trying to free himself by pushing against the wall with his hind legs.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] Appa's a ten-ton flying bison; I think he could figure something out.
character_words: Appa's a ten-ton flying bison; I think he could figure something out.

full_text: Momo was unsuccessful and gives up, his hind legs hanging down in defeat. Cut to an overview shot of the three beds.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Climbing into her bed.] Well, no point arguing about it now. Get some rest, Aang. [Aang walks toward his bed.] Looks like you'll need it for tomorrow.
character_words: Well, no point arguing about it now. Get some rest, Aang.  Looks like you'll need it for tomorrow.

full_text: Aang sadly sits on the side of his bed, looking down. Switch to the next scene of Aang lying on his bed, snoring loudly and drooling on his pillow. The room is only dimly lit, casting a somewhat green glow. The wall behind Aang opens, revealing a guard. The crunching sound of the earth being moved wakes Aang, who quickly raises his head and glances around.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Alarmed.] Sokka? [Switch to Aang's point of view; the other beds are empty.] Katara? [Frontal shot as Aang turns toward the guard.] Where are my friends?
character_words: Sokka?  Katara?  Where are my friends?

full_text: [Frontal shot.] The king will free them if you complete your challenges.
character_words: The king will free them if you complete your challenges.

full_text: [Frontal shot; unsure.] And if I fail?
character_words: And if I fail?

full_text: [Frontal shot.] He didn't say. [Extending his arm; switch back to a shot of the guard.] Your staff, please?
character_words: He didn't say.  Your staff, please?

full_text: Aang lifts his staff with his foot, grabs it, and spins it around, places it upright next to him, before tossing it to the guard. Switch to a frontal shot of Aang, flanked by two guards, entering the large throne room. The scene slightly pans to the left, showing a bit of King Bumi's back.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Serious.] First, Avatar, [Frontal shot as Bumi spread his arms, showing off his purple outfit; lighthearted.] what do you think of my new outfit? I want your honest opinion. [Frontal shot of Aang who blankly stares at the king. Someone coughs during the ensuing silence. Switch back to a frontal shot of Bumi.] I'm waiting.
character_words: First, Avatar,  what do you think of my new outfit? I want your honest opinion.  I'm waiting.

full_text: [Scratching his head.] I ... guess it's fine.
character_words: I ... guess it's fine.

full_text: Excellent! You passed the first test.
character_words: Excellent! You passed the first test.

full_text: Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: [Upbeat.] Well, not one of the deadly tests. [Waving his finger from side to side, emphasizing his words.] The real challenges are much more, uh, challenging.
character_words: Well, not one of the deadly tests.  The real challenges are much more, uh, challenging.

full_text: Cut to a side shot of Aang as he suddenly dashes forward to the surprise of his two guards. Using his airbending, his speed is enhanced. Close-up of his feet as he quickly crosses the distance between him and King Bumi. Cut to a back shot of Bumi as Aang halts in front of him, the wind passing over them.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Aggressively.] I don't have time for your crazy games! [Close-up of King Bumi.] Give me my friends back! We're leaving!
character_words: I don't have time for your crazy games!  Give me my friends back! We're leaving!

full_text: Oh, I thought you might refuse, [Side shot of the two. A wall opens, revealing Katara and Sokka struggling in the grasp of a guard. Aang turns to them.] so I will give your friends some special souvenirs.
character_words: Oh, I thought you might refuse,  so I will give your friends some special souvenirs.

full_text: Aang looks back at Bumi. Cut to a frightened Katara as her guard slides a green ring over her finger. Close-up of the ring being put on. The moment the guard retracts his hand, the ring glows and tightens around her finger. The scene broadens, showing Sokka has gotten a ring as well, his being blue, and is now frantically trying to remove it from his finger. Katara tries to pull it off as well, both are unsuccessful.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] Those delightful rings are made of pure jennamite, also known as creeping crystal. It's a crystal that grows remarkably fast. [Close-up of Bumi; sinister.] By nightfall your friends will be completely covered in it. [Slightly sympathetic.] Terrible thing, really. [Serious.] I can stop it, but only if you cooperate.
character_words: Those delightful rings are made of pure jennamite, also known as creeping crystal. It's a crystal that grows remarkably fast.  By nightfall your friends will be completely covered in it.  Terrible thing, really.  I can stop it, but only if you cooperate.

full_text: Bumi glances toward the siblings. Cut to a shot of Sokka's finger now donning a blue jennamite ring. The ring glows and expands toward his hand.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Panicking.] Ah! It's already creeping!
character_words: Ah! It's already creeping!

full_text: [Cut back to a side shot of Aang and Bumi; serious.] I'll do what you want.
character_words: I'll do what you want.

full_text: Close-up of an evil grinning Bumi. Scene changes to a cave filled with stalagmites and stalactites. Camera pans to the left where Aang stands on a flat rock with a waterfall in front of him. In the waterfall, there is a ladder, and above the ladder hangs a rope. Sokka, Katara, and Bumi are on a balcony cut into the wall to the left of the waterfall. King Bumi is laughing. Cut to a frontal shot of the king looking over the balcony rim. Katara and Sokka are guarded behind him. The jennamite ring has already expanded to engulf part of their right forearm. Bumi glances back at the siblings with a grin on his face. Close-up of the jennamite as it glows and creeps a bit further on the arms of Sokka and Katara. Switch to a back shot of Bumi as he is looking out toward where Aang is standing.
character_words: NA

full_text: It seems I've lost my lunch box key and I'm hungry. Ooh, there it is! [Bumi points to inside the waterfall.] Would you mind fetching it for me?
character_words: It seems I've lost my lunch box key and I'm hungry. Ooh, there it is!  Would you mind fetching it for me?

full_text: The key hanging from a chain and a vertical iron ladder are dimly visible behind the waterfall. Aang airbends to the base of the fall and plunges into the waterfall. He manages to climb up the rock face to the base of the ladder and grasp it with one hand. Before he can get any further, the torrent of water pushes him away and out.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Ooh, climbing the ladder. No one's ever done that before.
character_words: Ooh, climbing the ladder. No one's ever done that before.

full_text: Panting, Aang rests a moment between two stalagmites, leaps from them to the stalactites above, and closer to the waterfall still high by the roof of the cavern. He dives into the fall above the key and tries to grab the key as he falls with the water; the rush of the water carries him past and in a moment he shoots out again, keyless.
character_words: NA

full_text: That's right. Keep diving head in. I'm sure it'll work eventually.
character_words: That's right. Keep diving head in. I'm sure it'll work eventually.

full_text: Aang cuts a stalagmite with airbending and throws it like a spear at the key, accelerating it with another air blast. The stone spear snags the chain suspending the key, and carries it out of the waterfall. The spear pierces the stone wall above the King's balcony, the key now dangling right in front of Bumi.
character_words: NA

full_text: There! Enjoy your lunch! I want my friends back now!
character_words: There! Enjoy your lunch! I want my friends back now!

full_text: Ah, not yet. I need help with another matter. It seems I've lost my pet, Flopsie.
character_words: Ah, not yet. I need help with another matter. It seems I've lost my pet, Flopsie.

full_text: Scene changes to Aang in a large sunken enclosure in a new room, with Bumi, Katara, and Sokka up above. Aang finds a lop-eared bunny.
character_words: NA

full_text: Okay! Found him!
character_words: Okay! Found him!

full_text: Bring him to me. Daddy wants a kiss from Flopsie!
character_words: Bring him to me. Daddy wants a kiss from Flopsie!

full_text: Come here, Flopsie. [Flopsie jumps down behind Aang, startling both him and the bunny.] Huh?
character_words: Come here, Flopsie.  Huh?

full_text: Squealing with terror, the bunny bolts across the arena with Aang in pursuit until it goes into a hole. Aang puts his arm in the hole up to the shoulder trying to grab hold of the frightened rabbit. The light dawns on his face.
character_words: NA

full_text: Flopsie, wait! Flopsie! [Cut to Bumi laughing. Back to Aang chasing the bunny.] Flopsie!
character_words: Flopsie, wait! Flopsie!  Flopsie!

full_text: Aang puts his arm in the hole up to the shoulder trying to grab hold of the frightened rabbit. The light dawns on his face. The snarling goat gorilla bounds toward Aang but instead of attacking, picks him up and licks him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Wait a minute. [Close-up of Flopsie snarling. Cut to behind Aang.] Flopsie?
character_words: Wait a minute.  Flopsie?

full_text: The snarling goat gorilla bounds toward Aang but instead of attacking, picks him up and licks him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Flopsie!
character_words: Flopsie!

full_text: Flopsie puts Aang down and, obeying a whistle from the king, climbs up from the arena to him and rolls onto his back, offering his belly.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Rubbing Flopsie's belly.] Oh, that's a good boy. Yes, who has a soft belly?
character_words: Oh, that's a good boy. Yes, who has a soft belly?

full_text: [Aang jumps up to where Katara and Sokka. Both are encased in crystal to their shoulders.] Guys, are you okay?
character_words: Guys, are you okay?

full_text: Other than the crystals slowly encasing my entire body, doing great!
character_words: Other than the crystals slowly encasing my entire body, doing great!

full_text: At that moment, a crystal grows on one side of Sokka's body, making him become unbalanced and fall. Aang walks over to Bumi.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Rubbing Flopsie's belly.] Oh, yes.
character_words: Oh, yes.

full_text: Come on! I'm ready for the next challenge.
character_words: Come on! I'm ready for the next challenge.

full_text: The king gives an evil laugh and the scene dissolves to an earthbending arena. Aang and the king are on a balcony overlooking the arena, Sokka and Katara along with a guard are on an adjacent balcony. The crystals are past their heads, leaving their faces exposed.
character_words: NA

full_text: Your final test is a duel. And as a special treat, you may choose your opponent.
character_words: Your final test is a duel. And as a special treat, you may choose your opponent.

full_text: Two tough-looking men come out, standing next to the king. Aang looks at them uncertainly.
character_words: NA

full_text: Point and choose.
character_words: Point and choose.

full_text: So ... you're saying whoever I point to, that's the person I get to fight?
character_words: So ... you're saying whoever I point to, that's the person I get to fight?

full_text: Choose wisely!
character_words: Choose wisely!

full_text: I ... choose ... you. [Aang points to the king.]
character_words: I ... choose ... you.

full_text: Wrong choice!
character_words: Wrong choice!

full_text: The king straightens up and removes his outer robe, proving himself to be a powerfully built old man. He earthbends Aang off of the balcony, making him fly into the arena. The king jumps down right in front of Aang, and laughs.
character_words: NA

full_text: You thought I was a frail old man, but I'm the most powerful earthbender you'll ever see.
character_words: You thought I was a frail old man, but I'm the most powerful earthbender you'll ever see.

full_text: Can I fight the guy with the axe instead?
character_words: Can I fight the guy with the axe instead?

full_text: There are no take-backsies in my kingdom. You might need this. [Points to the guard standing near Katara and Sokka.]
character_words: There are no take-backsies in my kingdom. You might need this.

full_text: The guard tosses Aang his staff. The king bends several rocks at Aang who just avoids and evades the attacks.
character_words: NA

full_text: Typical airbender tactic: avoid and evade. I hoped the Avatar would be less predictable.
character_words: Typical airbender tactic: avoid and evade. I hoped the Avatar would be less predictable.

full_text: The king attacks Aang some more. Aang just keeps avoiding and evading.
character_words: NA

full_text: Don't you have any surprises for me? Sooner or later you'll have to strike back!
character_words: Don't you have any surprises for me? Sooner or later you'll have to strike back!

full_text: Aang uses his staff to helicopter into the air. The king bends a large boulder into the ceiling, raining rocks onto Aang, knocking him from the air. He charges at the king on foot, but a series of bending attacks leaves him flat atop a large rock pile
character_words: NA

full_text: You'll have to be a little more creative than that!
character_words: You'll have to be a little more creative than that!

full_text: Aang bends an air scooter and charges forward on it, throwing a huge air blast at the king as he comes. The king throws up a stone barrier and the blast deflects to both sides of it.
character_words: NA

full_text: Did someone leave the windows open? It feels a little drafty in here. Are you hoping I'll catch a cold?
character_words: Did someone leave the windows open? It feels a little drafty in here. Are you hoping I'll catch a cold?

full_text: The king bends more attacks at Aang, leading him across half of the arena.
character_words: NA

full_text: How are you going to get me from way over there?
character_words: How are you going to get me from way over there?

full_text: Aang charges forward on foot again, using airbending to accelerate but the king softens the arena floor, leaving him sunk to the waist. The king bends two stones to collide on the spot but Aang pops out at the top of them when they meet. Visibly angry now, he bends the slab the king is standing on all the way to the back of the arena. The king bends the largest boulder yet to come at Aang from behind but he does an air-assisted back flip over it. The king makes more bending moves, cracking the floors and walls of the arena, tearing out a huge chunk of the wall and balcony they had been standing on. Seeing what is coming, Aang gasps and runs in tight circles, conjuring a tornado. When the king flings the huge piece at Aang, it is caught in the tornado and instantly whips around right back at the king. The king bends it to sand before it can smash him, but before he can recover, Aang attacks from the top of the tornado, landing at the king's feet with his staff poised to strike. The king's arms are raised as if surrendering but a small pebble strikes Aang's head, drawing his attention to the large boulder suspended over the both of them.
character_words: NA

full_text: Well done, Avatar. You fight with much fire in your heart. [He tosses the boulder aside and bends up to the balcony where the two siblings are almost completely encased. Aang joins him.] You've passed all my tests. Now, you must answer one question.
character_words: Well done, Avatar. You fight with much fire in your heart.  You've passed all my tests. Now, you must answer one question.

full_text: That's not fair! You said you would release my friends if I finished your tests.
character_words: That's not fair! You said you would release my friends if I finished your tests.

full_text: Oh, but what's the point of tests if you don't learn anything?
character_words: Oh, but what's the point of tests if you don't learn anything?

full_text: Oh, come on!
character_words: Oh, come on!

full_text: Answer this one question and I will set your friends free. What ... is my name? From the looks of your friends I'd say you only have a few minutes.
character_words: Answer this one question and I will set your friends free. What ... is my name? From the looks of your friends I'd say you only have a few minutes.

full_text: Bumi walks out of frame. Aang confers with Katara and Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: How am I supposed to know his name?
character_words: How am I supposed to know his name?

full_text: Think about the challenges. Maybe it's some kind of riddle.
character_words: Think about the challenges. Maybe it's some kind of riddle.

full_text: I got it!
character_words: I got it!

full_text: Yeah?
character_words: Yeah?

full_text: He's an earthbender, right? Rocky. You know, because of all the rocks.
character_words: He's an earthbender, right? Rocky. You know, because of all the rocks.

full_text: We're going to keep trying, but that is a good back-up.
character_words: We're going to keep trying, but that is a good back-up.

full_text: Okay. So back to the challenges. I got a key from the waterfall, I saved his pet, and I had a duel.
character_words: Okay. So back to the challenges. I got a key from the waterfall, I saved his pet, and I had a duel.

full_text: And what did you learn?
character_words: And what did you learn?

full_text: Well, everything was different than I expected.
character_words: Well, everything was different than I expected.

full_text: [The jennamite grows as she talks with anxiety.] And?
character_words: And?

full_text: Well, they weren't straight forward. To solve each test, I had to think differently than I usually would. I know his name.
character_words: Well, they weren't straight forward. To solve each test, I had to think differently than I usually would. I know his name.

full_text: Cut to Aang confronting Bumi.
character_words: NA

full_text: I solved the question the same way I solved the challenges. As you said a long time ago, I had to open my brain to the possibilities. [The king laughs with the same odd snort Bumi did a hundred years ago.] Bumi, you're a mad genius.
character_words: I solved the question the same way I solved the challenges. As you said a long time ago, I had to open my brain to the possibilities.  Bumi, you're a mad genius.

full_text: Aang and Bumi hug like old friends.
character_words: NA

full_text: Oh Aang, it's good to see you. You haven't changed a bit. Literally.
character_words: Oh Aang, it's good to see you. You haven't changed a bit. Literally.

full_text: Uh, over here!
character_words: Uh, over here!

full_text: Little help?
character_words: Little help?

full_text: Bumi breaks the crystals using earthbending, making pieces fly everywhere. He catches one of them.
character_words: NA

full_text: Jennamite is made of rock candy. [He takes a bite into the crystal.] Delicious!
character_words: Jennamite is made of rock candy.  Delicious!

full_text: So this crazy king is your old friend Bumi?
character_words: So this crazy king is your old friend Bumi?

full_text: Who are you calling old? Okay, I'm old.
character_words: Who are you calling old? Okay, I'm old.

full_text: Why did you do all of this instead of just telling Aang who you were?
character_words: Why did you do all of this instead of just telling Aang who you were?

full_text: First of all, it's pretty fun messing with people. [Snorts.] But I do have a reason. Aang, you have a difficult task ahead. The world has changed in the hundred years that you've been gone. It's the duty of the Avatar to restore balance to the world by defeating Fire Lord Ozai. You have much to learn. You must master the four elements and confront the Fire Lord. And when you do, I hope you will think like a mad genius. And it looks like you're in good hands. You'll need your friends to help defeat the Fire Nation. [Momo climbs up on Aang.] And you'll need Momo, too.
character_words: First of all, it's pretty fun messing with people.  But I do have a reason. Aang, you have a difficult task ahead. The world has changed in the hundred years that you've been gone. It's the duty of the Avatar to restore balance to the world by defeating Fire Lord Ozai. You have much to learn. You must master the four elements and confront the Fire Lord. And when you do, I hope you will think like a mad genius. And it looks like you're in good hands. You'll need your friends to help defeat the Fire Nation.  And you'll need Momo, too.

full_text: Thank you for your wisdom, but before we leave, I have a challenge for you.
character_words: Thank you for your wisdom, but before we leave, I have a challenge for you.

full_text: Scene changes to show Bumi and Aang riding down the mail system. Cut to view of the entire city. A cloud of dust is raised as a crash is heard.
character_words: NA

full_text: My cabbages!
character_words: My cabbages!

full_text: Fade to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text: The scene opens up in a forest. Katara and Aang are on a raised, grassy plateau. A gentle stream is running out beneath it. Katara is folding one of their sleeping blankets. Aang is lying on the root of a tree. Momo screeches and lands on the plateau as Sokka approaches.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Enthusiastically.] Great, you're back!
character_words: Great, you're back!

full_text: Aang leaps off the root with his airbending, landing beside the Water Tribe siblings as Sokka digs in his bag.
character_words: NA

full_text: What's for dinner?
character_words: What's for dinner?

full_text: [Digs nuts from his bag.] We've got a few options. First; round nuts. And some kind of oval shaped nuts? And some rock-shaped nuts, that might just be rocks. [Throws the rock-shaped nut toward Momo.] Dig in! [Aang and Katara look at each other then back at Sokka.]
character_words: We've got a few options. First; round nuts. And some kind of oval shaped nuts? And some rock-shaped nuts, that might just be rocks.  Dig in!

full_text: Seriously ... what else you got?
character_words: Seriously ... what else you got?

full_text: Momo coos, and sniffs the rock-shaped nut, before taking it with one of his paws and slapping it against a stone twice. Attempting to break it, he takes it with both paws and slams it down on the big rock. The moment he does so, however, the entire earth quakes, making Momo shriek and his hair stand up on end.
character_words: NA

full_text: What was that?
character_words: What was that?

full_text: Momo, believing he may have caused the quake, cautiously drops the rock to the ground in test. The quake returns, causing Momo to leap away.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's coming from over there!
character_words: It's coming from over there!

full_text: [Aang and Katara run off-camera.] Shouldn't we run away from huge booms? Not toward them?
character_words: Shouldn't we run away from huge booms? Not toward them?

full_text: The three, joined by Momo, hide behind a fallen tree and spy on a young boy bending boulders into the air and punching them into the side of the ravine.
character_words: NA

full_text: An earthbender!
character_words: An earthbender!

full_text: Let's go meet him!
character_words: Let's go meet him!

full_text: He looks dangerous, so we better approach cautiously.
character_words: He looks dangerous, so we better approach cautiously.

full_text: [Suddenly Katara is a few feet in front of them, excitedly addressing the earthbender.] Hello there! I'm Katara! What's your name?
character_words: Hello there! I'm Katara! What's your name?

full_text: The young boy gasps in surprise, dropping the boulder he was bending to the ground. He flees quickly, bringing down an avalanche of boulders with his bending to block his exit.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sokka and Aang approach Katara; yelling.] Nice to meet you!
character_words: Nice to meet you!

full_text: [Shrugging.] I just wanted to say hi.
character_words: I just wanted to say hi.

full_text: Hey! That guy's gotta be running somewhere. Maybe we're near a village? And I bet that village has a market!
character_words: Hey! That guy's gotta be running somewhere. Maybe we're near a village? And I bet that village has a market!

full_text: [Excitedly.] Which means no nuts for dinner!
character_words: Which means no nuts for dinner!

full_text: [Katara and Aang chase after Haru.] Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts! [Momo flies overhead, chasing Katara and Aang.] Yeah, I hate 'em too. [Slowly follows Katara and Aang.]
character_words: Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts!  Yeah, I hate 'em too.

full_text: Katara and Sokka stroll through the mining village's streets while Aang speaks with a shopkeeper under a terrace.
character_words: NA

full_text: Great hat! [Tries on the hat.] I'll trade you some nuts for it.
character_words: Great hat!  I'll trade you some nuts for it.

full_text: [Notices the boy enter a shop. Speaks to herself in surprise.] Hey ...
character_words: Hey ...

full_text: The boy enters into the dark, wooden building and approaches a woman.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hi, Mom.
character_words: Hi, Mom.

full_text: Where have you been, Haru? You're late! Get started on your chores.
character_words: Where have you been, Haru? You're late! Get started on your chores.

full_text: [Enters the shop's front door, startling Haru.] Hey. You're that kid. Why did you run away before?
character_words: Hey. You're that kid. Why did you run away before?

full_text: Uh, you must have me confused with some other kid.
character_words: Uh, you must have me confused with some other kid.

full_text: [Aang and Sokka enter the shop.] No, she doesn't. We saw you earthbending.
character_words: No, she doesn't. We saw you earthbending.

full_text: Haru and his mother gasps in horror at his secret being revealed and both the door and window to the small shop are promptly slammed shut.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Standing by the window.] They saw you doing what?!
character_words: They saw you doing what?!

full_text: They're crazy, Mom! I mean, look at how they're dressed.
character_words: They're crazy, Mom! I mean, look at how they're dressed.

full_text: Aang gazes to his conical hat, shifting it about in confusion. Katara awkwardly grasps at her dress, looking with astonishment at herself. Sokka quirks an eyebrow and smooths out his sleeve.
character_words: NA

full_text: You know how dangerous that is! You know what would happen if they caught you earthbending!
character_words: You know how dangerous that is! You know what would happen if they caught you earthbending!

full_text: [Heavy knocks on the door.] Open up!
character_words: Open up!

full_text: [Sokka peeks through the window's blinds.] Fire Nation! Act natural!
character_words: Fire Nation! Act natural!

full_text: Haru's mother opens the door, allowing the Fire Nation tax collector to walk inside. He stares awkwardly at the four children in front of him. Haru grasps his chin and stares toward Katara, cross-eyed. Sokka eyeballs an apple. Katara hunches forward with her eyes wide open, having stuffed her mouth with berries. Aang has his hand atop a barrel, beaming an immense toothy smile. His pose is short-lived as the barrel's lid spins, dunking Aang's hand into the barrel of water and causes him to fall down.
character_words: NA

full_text: [The tax collector stares sourly toward the four children; aggressively.] What do you want? I've already paid you this week!
character_words: What do you want? I've already paid you this week!

full_text: The tax just doubled. [Arrogantly.] And we wouldn't want an accident now would we? [Creates a ball of fire between his hands, making everyone slightly back away.] Fire is sometimes so hard to control.
character_words: The tax just doubled.  And we wouldn't want an accident now would we?  Fire is sometimes so hard to control.

full_text: Haru's mother and the tax collector approach the store's counter, where she opens a small chest and passes a meager handful of Earth Kingdom currency to the tax collector. Haru leans against the counter, staring with contempt toward the Fire Nation man.
character_words: NA

full_text: You can keep the copper ones. [Walks away, dropping four copper pieces to the floor, exits.]
character_words: You can keep the copper ones.

full_text: [Door slams.] Nice guy. How long has the Fire Nation been here?
character_words: Nice guy. How long has the Fire Nation been here?

full_text: Five years. Fire Lord Ozai uses our town's coal mines to fuel his ships.
character_words: Five years. Fire Lord Ozai uses our town's coal mines to fuel his ships.

full_text: They're thugs. They steal from us. And everyone here's too much of a coward to do anything about it.
character_words: They're thugs. They steal from us. And everyone here's too much of a coward to do anything about it.

full_text: [Angered.] Quiet, Haru! Don't talk like that.
character_words: Quiet, Haru! Don't talk like that.

full_text: [Curiously.] But, Haru's an earthbender? He can help!
character_words: But, Haru's an earthbender? He can help!

full_text: Earthbending is forbidden. It's caused nothing but misery for this village! [Casts a meaningful glance toward her son.] He must never use his abilities.
character_words: Earthbending is forbidden. It's caused nothing but misery for this village!  He must never use his abilities.

full_text: How can you say that? Haru has a gift! Asking him not to earthbend is like asking me not to waterbend. It's a part of who we are.
character_words: How can you say that? Haru has a gift! Asking him not to earthbend is like asking me not to waterbend. It's a part of who we are.

full_text: [Shakes head in dismay.] You don't understand.
character_words: You don't understand.

full_text: I understand that Haru can help you fight back. What can the Fire Nation do to you that they haven't done already?
character_words: I understand that Haru can help you fight back. What can the Fire Nation do to you that they haven't done already?

full_text: They could take Haru away! Like they took his father.
character_words: They could take Haru away! Like they took his father.

full_text: Scene changes to late evening, viewing farmland and a barn. Appa walks into the barn. Cut to a closer view of Sokka, Katara, Haru, and Aang standing inside the barn.
character_words: NA

full_text: My mom said you can sleep here tonight. But you should leave in the morning.
character_words: My mom said you can sleep here tonight. But you should leave in the morning.

full_text: Thanks. I'll make sure Appa doesn't eat all your hay.
character_words: Thanks. I'll make sure Appa doesn't eat all your hay.

full_text: Appa engulfs a mouthful of hay. Appa pauses, turning to stare dubiously toward Aang before continuing to chew hay. The scene switches to Katara and Haru taking a walk into the woods outside under the setting sun.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm sorry about what I said earlier. I didn't know about your father.
character_words: I'm sorry about what I said earlier. I didn't know about your father.

full_text: That's okay. It's funny, the way you were talking back in the store? It reminded me of him.
character_words: That's okay. It's funny, the way you were talking back in the store? It reminded me of him.

full_text: [Flattered.] Thanks.
character_words: Thanks.

full_text: My father was very courageous. When the Fire Nation invaded, he and the other earthbenders were outnumbered ten to one. But they fought back anyway.
character_words: My father was very courageous. When the Fire Nation invaded, he and the other earthbenders were outnumbered ten to one. But they fought back anyway.

full_text: He sounds like a great man.
character_words: He sounds like a great man.

full_text: The two approach the top of a steep cliff, gazing out to the setting sun beyond.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Stops.] After the attack, they rounded up my father and every other earthbender, and took them away. [Kneels.] We haven't seen them since.
character_words: After the attack, they rounded up my father and every other earthbender, and took them away.  We haven't seen them since.

full_text: So that's why you hide your earthbending.
character_words: So that's why you hide your earthbending.

full_text: Yeah. Problem is ... [Close-up, earthbends two stones in a circle above his hand.] the only way I can feel close to my father now [Crushes the stones to sand with his hands. The sand blows away.] is when I practice my bending. He taught me everything I know.
character_words: Yeah. Problem is ...  the only way I can feel close to my father now  is when I practice my bending. He taught me everything I know.

full_text: [Sits beside Haru, sets her fingertips on her necklace.] See this necklace? My mother gave it to me.
character_words: See this necklace? My mother gave it to me.

full_text: It's beautiful.
character_words: It's beautiful.

full_text: I lost my mother in a Fire Nation raid. [Hangs her head, turning away.] This necklace is all I have left of her.
character_words: I lost my mother in a Fire Nation raid.  This necklace is all I have left of her.

full_text: It's not enough, is it?
character_words: It's not enough, is it?

full_text: No. [Hangs her head and turns away.]
character_words: No.

full_text: The scene switches to Katara and Haru who have continued their walk along the dirt trail. A loud boom sounds and rock and dust blasts from a distant mine entrance. An old man cries out.
character_words: NA

full_text: Help, help!
character_words: Help, help!

full_text: The mine!
character_words: The mine!

full_text: Katara and Haru run quickly to the entrance, which has caved in and left a tremendous pile of rocks pinning the old man to the ground on his stomach. Sand continues to pour down, rocks intermittently falling.
character_words: NA

full_text: Help me!
character_words: Help me!

full_text: [Haru braces his back against the mine entrance. Katara pulls the old man.] Ugh! It's not working! We have to get help!
character_words: Ugh! It's not working! We have to get help!

full_text: There's no time, pull harder!
character_words: There's no time, pull harder!

full_text: [Getting an idea.] Haru. There's a way you can help him.
character_words: Haru. There's a way you can help him.

full_text: [Guilty fear.] I can't.
character_words: I can't.

full_text: Please, there's no one around to see you. It's the only way!
character_words: Please, there's no one around to see you. It's the only way!

full_text: Haru leaps away from the falling debris, spinning back to face it as he assumes an earthbending form. With a sudden and strong move, he blasts all the rocks down the tunnel, freeing the old man.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Excitedly.] Haru! You did it! [The two take place beside the old man and aid him walking away from the mine.]
character_words: Haru! You did it!

full_text: At the barn, Katara is sitting up in her bedroll with a lamp in her lap. Sokka is lying on a square bale of hay with his blanket over him, and Aang is sprawled out on Appa's head with Momo lying on his back.
character_words: NA

full_text: It was so brave of Haru to use his earthbending to help that old man.
character_words: It was so brave of Haru to use his earthbending to help that old man.

full_text: You must have really inspired him.
character_words: You must have really inspired him.

full_text: I guess so.
character_words: I guess so.

full_text: Everyone should get some sleep, we're leaving at dawn.
character_words: Everyone should get some sleep, we're leaving at dawn.

full_text: [Unhappily.] Dawn?! Can't we sleep in for once?
character_words: Dawn?! Can't we sleep in for once?

full_text: [Commandingly.] Absolutely not! This village is crawling with Fire Nation troops. If they discover you're here, Aang, we'll be eating fireballs for breakfast. Goodnight.
character_words: Absolutely not! This village is crawling with Fire Nation troops. If they discover you're here, Aang, we'll be eating fireballs for breakfast. Goodnight.

full_text: [Slyly, with a wry smirk.] I'd rather eat fireballs than nuts.
character_words: I'd rather eat fireballs than nuts.

full_text: [With finality.] Goodnight!
character_words: Goodnight!

full_text:
Katara and Aang share a few playful chuckles with each other before she blows out the lamplight to get some rest.
Fire Nation troops march on a mission through the dead of night. The man in the lead raps on a wooden door. Haru answers the door, suddenly gasping in shock as he sees the troops.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Points accusingly.] That's him! That's the earthbender!
character_words: That's him! That's the earthbender!

full_text:
The Fire Nation leader shoves the old man out of the way and approaches Haru. Haru screams as the man forces Haru into his grip and hauls him away.
In the morning, Katara carries a jar outside of the barn. She sets it down beside a water pump and proceeds to waterbend, drawing water out of the spigot and into the waiting pot. Picking it up, she spots Haru's mother standing with her back to her, gazing toward the distant ocean. Haru's mother slowly turns around, laying a tearful gaze upon Katara. Katara realizes Haru has been taken and drops the pot, as it shatters to pieces at her feet.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Enters barn to see Aang and Sokka folding blankets; emotionally.] They took him! They took Haru away!
character_words: They took him! They took Haru away!

full_text: [Surprised.] What?
character_words: What?

full_text: [Hurriedly.] The old man turned him in to the Fire Nation - it's all my fault - I forced him into earthbending!
character_words: The old man turned him in to the Fire Nation - it's all my fault - I forced him into earthbending!

full_text: [Steps beside her, taking her hand in his and laying his other hand supportively behind her shoulder.] Slow down, Katara. When did this happen?
character_words: Slow down, Katara. When did this happen?

full_text: Haru's mother said they came for him at midnight.
character_words: Haru's mother said they came for him at midnight.

full_text: Then it's too late to track him, he's long gone.
character_words: Then it's too late to track him, he's long gone.

full_text: [Turns defiantly to the open door, clenches fists.] We don't need to track him. The Fire Nation is going to take me right to Haru.
character_words: We don't need to track him. The Fire Nation is going to take me right to Haru.

full_text: [Confused.] And ... why would they do that?
character_words: And ... why would they do that?

full_text: [Determined.] Because they're going to arrest me for earthbending. [Aang and Sokka share a horrified look.]
character_words: Because they're going to arrest me for earthbending.

full_text: Scene changes to Sokka and Katara working together to push a boulder overtop an air vent on a rocky road.
character_words: NA

full_text: I thought you were crazy at first, Katara, but this might work. There are ventilation shafts throughout these mines. All Aang has to do is send an air current from that vent to this one right here. The boulder levitates and ta-da! Fake earthbending.
character_words: I thought you were crazy at first, Katara, but this might work. There are ventilation shafts throughout these mines. All Aang has to do is send an air current from that vent to this one right here. The boulder levitates and ta-da! Fake earthbending.

full_text: [Props hands off hips, turns to Aang.] Aang? Did you get all that?
character_words: Aang? Did you get all that?

full_text: [Snapping small puffs of air at a sooty copper fritillary butterfly; dismissively.] Sure, sure. I got it.
character_words: Sure, sure. I got it.

full_text: Do you remember your cue?
character_words: Do you remember your cue?

full_text: [Continues snapping puffs of air; still dismissive.] Yeah, yeah. Just relax. You're taking all the fun out of this.
character_words: Yeah, yeah. Just relax. You're taking all the fun out of this.

full_text: [Aggravated.] By this, do you mean intentionally being captured by a group of ruthless firebenders?
character_words: By this, do you mean intentionally being captured by a group of ruthless firebenders?

full_text: [Humored.] Exactly! That's fun stuff!
character_words: Exactly! That's fun stuff!

full_text: [Group of firebenders with spears approach.] Here they come! Get in your places!
character_words: Here they come! Get in your places!

full_text: Aang stops playing with the butterfly and Momo tries catching it as it flies away. As the group of spear-wielding guards approach, Katara and Sokka make a show of walking into one another by their stomachs before emphatically shouting.
character_words: NA

full_text: [While angrily pointing at Katara.] Get out of my way, pipsqueak! [The soldiers watch in confusion. One of them even raises an eyebrow.]
character_words: Get out of my way, pipsqueak!

full_text: [Angrily hunched over.] How dare you call me pipsqueak, you giant-eared cretin!
character_words: How dare you call me pipsqueak, you giant-eared cretin!

full_text: [Just as angrily hunched over.] What did you call me?
character_words: What did you call me?

full_text: [Far too dramatically as her hair loopies move with her motion.] A giant-eared cretin! Look at those things! Do herds of animals use them for shade?! [Imitates an elephant's ears.]
character_words: A giant-eared cretin! Look at those things! Do herds of animals use them for shade?!

full_text: [Towers over his sister.] You better back off! [Slips his hand by his mouth and mutters.] Seriously, back off.
character_words: You better back off!  Seriously, back off.

full_text: [More determined, heightens above her now-cowering brother.] I will not back off! I bet elephants get together and make fun of how large your ears are!
character_words: I will not back off! I bet elephants get together and make fun of how large your ears are!

full_text: That's it! You're going down!
character_words: That's it! You're going down!

full_text: I'll show you who's boss! [Angrily points at Sokka.] Earthbending style! [Over-dramatically leaps toward the boulder, clenching her fist upward to which there is no reaction. Angrily.] I said, earthbending style!
character_words: I'll show you who's boss!  Earthbending style!  I said, earthbending style!

full_text: At Katara's shout, Aang gasps quietly as he realizes his mistake by missing his cue. The young airbender ceases playing with the butterfly, leaps up, and blasts a strong jet of air into the ventilation duct, suddenly sending the boulder levitating into the air. This reveals Momo behind the boulder, who has his arms raised, licking himself.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Points a finger to the lemur; surprised.] That lemur! He's earthbending!
character_words: That lemur! He's earthbending!

full_text: [Katara and Momo each remain in their positions. Katara eyes the man in surprise. Sokka, angrily, waves his arms toward her.] No, you idiot, it's the girl!
character_words: No, you idiot, it's the girl!

full_text: Oh. [Blushes shamefully.] Of course.
character_words: Oh.  Of course.

full_text: Sokka steps beside Katara, laying his hands on her shoulders as the boulder falls to the ground. Katara stands patiently.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'll hold her. [Close-up. Whispers to Katara.] You've got twelve hours to find Haru. We'll be right behind you.
character_words: I'll hold her.  You've got twelve hours to find Haru. We'll be right behind you.

full_text: The guards escort Katara away, leaving Aang, Sokka, and Momo to watch as she takes a final glance back. Sokka unhappily tugs at his ears, testing their sizes.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Eyeballs Momo perched off of Aang's shoulder. Points accusingly.] Momo, you have some big ears! [Momo folds his ears back, hunches down, and coos in protest.]
character_words: Momo, you have some big ears!

full_text:
Katara is in the back of a Fire Nation transport with other earthbender prisoners. She wears a brown, tattered prison garb over her blue Water Tribe outfit and stares glumly downward. Sokka and Aang each have conical yellow hats in a crowd, attempting to stealthily observe her travel. Katara looks longingly over shoulder as the cart bobs along a pier, heading toward a waiting barge on the ocean.
Aang and Sokka chase the barge, riding Appa through the clouds. The immense, smoking, off-shore Fire Nation prison rig is seen just ahead. Close-up of the rig.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Aang stares nervously at the barge carrying Katara to the prison.] She'll be fine, Aang. Katara knows what she's doing.
character_words: She'll be fine, Aang. Katara knows what she's doing.

full_text: After the barge arrives, six prisoners, including Katara, line up on the deck of the prison. Spear-wielding guards stand at either side. A prison warden approaches.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Smugly.] Earthbenders. It is my pleasure to welcome you aboard my modest shipyard. I am your warden. I prefer to think of you not as prisoners, [Quips smartly.] but as honored guests. And I hope you come to think of me as your humble and caring host. [Paces nonchalantly.] You will succeed here, if you simply abide-
character_words: Earthbenders. It is my pleasure to welcome you aboard my modest shipyard. I am your warden. I prefer to think of you not as prisoners,  but as honored guests. And I hope you come to think of me as your humble and caring host.  You will succeed here, if you simply abide-

full_text: The warden pauses, suddenly interrupted by a prisoner in line coughing. With no forewarning, the warden leaps into the air and aims a blast of fire at the prisoner's legs in anger. The prisoner cowers away for safety as the warden stands defiantly toward the man.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Very angrily.] What kind of guest dishonors his host by interrupting him?! Take him below! [Swings his arms. Some guards escort the man away. Mutters.] One week in solitary will improve his manners. [Continues smug gait.] Simply treat me with the courtesy that I give you-
character_words: What kind of guest dishonors his host by interrupting him?! Take him below!  One week in solitary will improve his manners.  Simply treat me with the courtesy that I give you-

full_text: Approaches Katara, kneeling to stare into her obstinate expression. She crosses her eyebrows, scowling coarsely at the man.
character_words: NA

full_text: And we'll get along famously.
character_words: And we'll get along famously.

full_text: The prisoners are taken on a tour of the facility. Below, fellow prisoners are seen laboring.
character_words: NA

full_text: You will notice, earthbenders, that this rig is made entirely of metal. You are miles away from any rock or earth. [Katara pauses, glancing over the expansive ocean to the land far away.] So, if you have any illusions about employing that brutish savagery that passes for bending among you people ... [Lowly.] forget them. It is impossible. Good day.
character_words: You will notice, earthbenders, that this rig is made entirely of metal. You are miles away from any rock or earth.  So, if you have any illusions about employing that brutish savagery that passes for bending among you people ...  forget them. It is impossible. Good day.

full_text: A guard escorts the prisoners into the prison courtyard. Katara enters last and the metal gates close behind her. Among many earthbender prisoners, Haru takes notice of Katara. Above the courtyard, a watchman and the warden monitor the scene.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Surprised.] Katara?
character_words: Katara?

full_text: [Excitedly. Runs and hugs Haru.] Haru!
character_words: Haru!

full_text: [Confused.] What are you doing here?
character_words: What are you doing here?

full_text: [Somewhat apologetically.] It's my fault you were captured. I came to rescue you.
character_words: It's my fault you were captured. I came to rescue you.

full_text: [Shocked.] So, you got yourself arrested?
character_words: So, you got yourself arrested?

full_text: It was the only way to find you.
character_words: It was the only way to find you.

full_text: You've got guts, Katara. I'll give you that. [Places hand on her shoulder.] Come on. There's someone I want you to meet.
character_words: You've got guts, Katara. I'll give you that.  Come on. There's someone I want you to meet.

full_text: The two approach an old, gray-bearded man eating dinner among other prisoners.
character_words: NA

full_text: Katara. This is my father, Tyro. [The older man looks up.] Dad. This is Katara.
character_words: Katara. This is my father, Tyro.  Dad. This is Katara.

full_text: [Slightly bows.] It's an honor to meet you.
character_words: It's an honor to meet you.

full_text: [Hands Katara a bowl.] Have some dinner, Katara. [Katara accepts the bowl, but grimaces.] It's not as bad as it looks. [Katara tries a spoonful, but becomes further disgusted. He finds humor in this with a small chuckle.] It's still pretty bad though.
character_words: Have some dinner, Katara.  It's not as bad as it looks.  It's still pretty bad though.

full_text: [Walks up and lays a hand on Tyro's shoulder.] Tyro. The prisoners are complaining there aren't enough blankets to go around.
character_words: Tyro. The prisoners are complaining there aren't enough blankets to go around.

full_text: I'll talk to the guards. In the meantime, make sure the elderly are taken care of. The rest of us will simply have to hope for warmer weather.
character_words: I'll talk to the guards. In the meantime, make sure the elderly are taken care of. The rest of us will simply have to hope for warmer weather.

full_text: If you don't mind me asking, what's your escape plan?
character_words: If you don't mind me asking, what's your escape plan?

full_text: Excuse me?
character_words: Excuse me?

full_text: You know, the plan to get everyone off the rig? What is it? Mutiny, sabotage?
character_words: You know, the plan to get everyone off the rig? What is it? Mutiny, sabotage?

full_text: The plan? The plan is to survive. Wait out this war. Hope that one day some of us can get back home and forget this ever happened.
character_words: The plan? The plan is to survive. Wait out this war. Hope that one day some of us can get back home and forget this ever happened.

full_text: [Shocked.] How can you say that? You sound like you've already given up!
character_words: How can you say that? You sound like you've already given up!

full_text: Katara, I admire your courage. And I envy your youth. But people's lives are at stake here. The warden is a ruthless man, and he won't stand for any rebellion. I'm sorry, but we're powerless.
character_words: Katara, I admire your courage. And I envy your youth. But people's lives are at stake here. The warden is a ruthless man, and he won't stand for any rebellion. I'm sorry, but we're powerless.

full_text: [Obstinately.] We'll see about that.
character_words: We'll see about that.

full_text: Katara stands up and carries a trash can lid and a ladle, climbing on top of a wooden table. From there, she bangs the ladle against the lid to draw attention.
character_words: NA

full_text: Earthbenders! You don't know me, but I know of you. Every child in my Water Tribe village was rocked to sleep with stories of the brave Earth Kingdom, and the courageous earthbenders who guard its borders. [The watchman walks up to talk the warden, but the warden stops him and listens.] Some of you may think that the Fire Nation has made you powerless. Yes, they have taken away your ability to bend. But they can't take away your courage. And it is your courage they should truly fear! Because it runs deeper than any mine you've been forced to dig, any ocean that keeps you far from home! It is the strength of your hearts that make you who you are. Hearts that will remain unbroken when all rock and stone has eroded away. The time to fight back is now! I can tell you the Avatar has returned! So remember your courage earthbenders, [Shouts clearly.] let us fight for our freedom!
character_words: Earthbenders! You don't know me, but I know of you. Every child in my Water Tribe village was rocked to sleep with stories of the brave Earth Kingdom, and the courageous earthbenders who guard its borders.  Some of you may think that the Fire Nation has made you powerless. Yes, they have taken away your ability to bend. But they can't take away your courage. And it is your courage they should truly fear! Because it runs deeper than any mine you've been forced to dig, any ocean that keeps you far from home! It is the strength of your hearts that make you who you are. Hearts that will remain unbroken when all rock and stone has eroded away. The time to fight back is now! I can tell you the Avatar has returned! So remember your courage earthbenders,  let us fight for our freedom!

full_text: Katara's speech is met with utter silence and a small cough in the background, leaving her to fall into sorrow as she realizes the muted answer she receives. The warden walks away from the courtyard. Later that night while she is sleeping, Aang sneaks into the prison and taps his hand to her shoulder, waking her. Urging her to be quiet, he leads her to the perimeter where Sokka and Appa are waiting to make their escape.
character_words: NA

full_text: Your twelve hours are up; where's Haru? We've gotta get outta here!
character_words: Your twelve hours are up; where's Haru? We've gotta get outta here!

full_text: I can't.
character_words: I can't.

full_text: [Hurriedly.] We don't have much time. There are guards everywhere. Get on!
character_words: We don't have much time. There are guards everywhere. Get on!

full_text: [Concerned.] Katara, what's wrong?
character_words: Katara, what's wrong?

full_text: I'm not leaving. [Aang and Sokka share a questionable look.] I'm not giving up on these people.
character_words: I'm not leaving.  I'm not giving up on these people.

full_text: Fade to black. Cut to Sokka, Aang, and Katara on the metal perimeter.
character_words: NA

full_text: What do you mean you're not leaving?
character_words: What do you mean you're not leaving?

full_text: We can't abandon these people! There has to be a way to help them.
character_words: We can't abandon these people! There has to be a way to help them.

full_text: Maybe she's right. What do you say, Sokka?
character_words: Maybe she's right. What do you say, Sokka?

full_text: I say you're both crazy! [The trio ducks a searching spotlight.] Last chance! We need to leave, now!
character_words: I say you're both crazy!  Last chance! We need to leave, now!

full_text: [Sternly.] No!
character_words: No!

full_text: [Shakes his head dismally.] I hate when you get like this. Come on, we better hide.
character_words: I hate when you get like this. Come on, we better hide.

full_text: [Katara and Sokka flee. Aang whispers to Appa before joining them.] Go hide.
character_words: Go hide.

full_text: [Appa soars overhead to fly away and hide.] Look!
character_words: Look!

full_text: The two guards who witnessed Appa take to the skies approach the warden on a catwalk.
character_words: NA

full_text: Tell me exactly what you saw.
character_words: Tell me exactly what you saw.

full_text: Well, sir, it looked like a flying bison.
character_words: Well, sir, it looked like a flying bison.

full_text: [Surprised.] What?
character_words: What?

full_text: It was a giant flying buffalo, sir. With an empty saddle.
character_words: It was a giant flying buffalo, sir. With an empty saddle.

full_text: Which was it? A buffalo or a bison?
character_words: Which was it? A buffalo or a bison?

full_text: Uh, I'm not sure what the difference is, but that's not really the point, is it, sir?
character_words: Uh, I'm not sure what the difference is, but that's not really the point, is it, sir?

full_text: [Furiously.] I'll decide what the point is, fool!
character_words: I'll decide what the point is, fool!

full_text: The warden throws the first guard overboard. The man screams in horror before finally being silenced by a splash below.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To the second guard as he straightens up.] You! Wake up the captain. Search the entire rig! [Turns to walk away.]
character_words: You! Wake up the captain. Search the entire rig!

full_text: Uh, sir.
character_words: Uh, sir.

full_text: [Annoyed.] What?
character_words: What?

full_text: [Somewhat timidly.] That was ... the captain you just threw overboard, so ...
character_words: That was ... the captain you just threw overboard, so ...

full_text: [Still quite annoyed.] Then wake up someone I haven't thrown overboard and search the rig! There's something going on here and I don't like it.
character_words: Then wake up someone I haven't thrown overboard and search the rig! There's something going on here and I don't like it.

full_text: Cut scene; Momo peeps over a wooden crate where the trio is safely hiding behind numerous boxes. Scene opens up to show the three huddled together seated on the metal ground in the darkness.
character_words: NA

full_text: We don't have much time. What are we gonna do?
character_words: We don't have much time. What are we gonna do?

full_text: I wish I knew how to make a hurricane!
character_words: I wish I knew how to make a hurricane!

full_text: Both Sokka and Katara provide Aang with assuredly un-entertained facial expressions.
character_words: NA

full_text: The warden would run away and we'd steal his keys!
character_words: The warden would run away and we'd steal his keys!

full_text: Wouldn't he just take his keys with him?
character_words: Wouldn't he just take his keys with him?

full_text: I'm just tossing ideas around.
character_words: I'm just tossing ideas around.

full_text: I tried talking the earthbenders into fighting back but, it didn't work! If there was just a way to help them help themselves.
character_words: I tried talking the earthbenders into fighting back but, it didn't work! If there was just a way to help them help themselves.

full_text: For that they'd need some kind of earth, or some rock. Something they can bend.
character_words: For that they'd need some kind of earth, or some rock. Something they can bend.

full_text: [Lays her palm to the surface.] But this entire place is made of metal!
character_words: But this entire place is made of metal!

full_text: No, it's not. [Points to smokestacks.] Look at the smoke! I bet they're burning coal. In other words, earth.
character_words: No, it's not.  Look at the smoke! I bet they're burning coal. In other words, earth.

full_text: Morning arrives, the scene gaining light. Sokka and Katara are alone by an air duct. Sokka is peering down into it, while Katara kneels beside it with her hands on its rim.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's almost dawn. We're running out of time! You sure this is gonna work?
character_words: It's almost dawn. We're running out of time! You sure this is gonna work?

full_text: It should. These vents reminded me of our little trick back at the village. We're gonna do the same thing, but on a much bigger scale. [The camera zooms through a visual walkthrough of Sokka's explanation.] There's a huge deposit of coal at the base of the silo. And the whole system is ventilated. Aang closed off all the vents except one. When he does his airbending the coal only has one place to go, right back here.
character_words: It should. These vents reminded me of our little trick back at the village. We're gonna do the same thing, but on a much bigger scale.  There's a huge deposit of coal at the base of the silo. And the whole system is ventilated. Aang closed off all the vents except one. When he does his airbending the coal only has one place to go, right back here.

full_text: There's the intruder!
character_words: There's the intruder!

full_text: The two siblings are suddenly surrounded by a number of spear-wielding Fire Nation guards. The prisoners have gathered a safe distance away from this spectacle, observing what is happening.
character_words: NA

full_text: Stay back! I'm warning you! [Pulls out his boomerang, turning back-to-back with his sister.]
character_words: Stay back! I'm warning you!

full_text: [Roughly.] Katara, stop! You can't win this fight!
character_words: Katara, stop! You can't win this fight!

full_text: Listen to him well, child. You're one mistake away from dying where you stand.
character_words: Listen to him well, child. You're one mistake away from dying where you stand.

full_text: A sudden rush of air fills their ears as the facility shakes. The ventilation shaft bursts off its hinges as an immense blast of coal soars into the air, crashing down into a gathered pile. Everyone present is silent, staring in stark surprise at this turn of events. Lastly, Aang leaps out from the barren ventilation shaft, landing atop the coal pile and coughing, covered in soot and dirt. Momo follows him and Katara runs up to the coal, turning to face the earthbenders.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Lifting up a piece of coal.] Here's your chance, earthbenders! Take it! Your fate is in your own hands!
character_words: Here's your chance, earthbenders! Take it! Your fate is in your own hands!

full_text: Haru bolts ahead without hesitation, prepared to bend the waiting coal as a weapon. Tyro throws his hand up, bracing his son's chest to halt his advance.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Bursts out into highly amused laughter.] Foolish girl. You thought a few inspirational words and some coal would change these people? Look at these blank, hopeless faces. Their spirits were broken a long time ago. [Katara's expression dims as she does as instructed, staring at the forlorn prisoners.] Oh, but you still believe in them. How sweet. They're a waste of your energy little girl. You failed.
character_words: Foolish girl. You thought a few inspirational words and some coal would change these people? Look at these blank, hopeless faces. Their spirits were broken a long time ago.  Oh, but you still believe in them. How sweet. They're a waste of your energy little girl. You failed.

full_text: The warden finishes his speech by turning to take leave of the facility. As he does so, a single piece of coal sails through the air and pelts the back of his head. Outraged, the warden spins back to see who dared to attack him. Haru stands defiantly levitating three pieces of coal above his hand. The warden sends a blast of fire toward Haru, but the fire is blocked, as Tyro raises a wall of coal in his defense.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Guards line up and prepare for battle.] Show no mercy! [The guards send a blast of fire as one toward the rebelling prisoners.]
character_words: Show no mercy!

full_text: [The earthbenders work together to haul a sizable mass of coal to block the fire.] For the Earth Kingdom, attack!
character_words: For the Earth Kingdom, attack!

full_text:
Slamming the coal to the ground; chunks of rock assault the guards. The battle immediately flares, prisoners ducking blasts of fire and countering with fists of coal. Katara and Aang chase after Sokka as he snaps soldiers spears in two with his boomerang, tossing the broken shafts to Momo overhead. Momo continues to collect other pieces of broken spears that are thrown up to him.
Tyro and Haru work in unison to compress gathered coal into one lump, slinging this through the doors to make way for their escape. The guards on top fall down.
character_words: NA

full_text: Get to the ships! We'll hold them off!
character_words: Get to the ships! We'll hold them off!

full_text: Do not let them escape!
character_words: Do not let them escape!

full_text: [Generates an air funnel and holds it between his hands; to Katara and Sokka.] Guys! Throw me some coal!
character_words: Guys! Throw me some coal!

full_text: Katara and Sokka drop heaps of coal into his funnel, firing the material rapidly at the warden and his fellow benders, knocking them to the ground. Following this, Tyro and two other earthbenders work together to lift coal beneath these adversaries, moving them away from the rig and over the ocean.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Pleading.] No, please! I can't swim!
character_words: No, please! I can't swim!

full_text: Don't worry. I hear cowards float. [Drops their enemies into the ocean.]
character_words: Don't worry. I hear cowards float.

full_text: On the barge headed to their homes, Haru and Tyro approach Katara on its deck.
character_words: NA

full_text: I want to thank you for saving me. For saving us.
character_words: I want to thank you for saving me. For saving us.

full_text: [Turning to face Haru. Denying.] All it took was a little coal.
character_words: All it took was a little coal.

full_text: It wasn't the coal, Katara. It was you. [Katara blushes.]
character_words: It wasn't the coal, Katara. It was you.

full_text: Thank you for helping me find my courage, Katara of the Water Tribe. My family and everyone here owes you much.
character_words: Thank you for helping me find my courage, Katara of the Water Tribe. My family and everyone here owes you much.

full_text: So, I guess you're going home now.
character_words: So, I guess you're going home now.

full_text: Yes. To take back my village. [Raises his voice to the crowd on the lower deck.] To take back all of our villages! The Fire Nation will regret the day they set foot on our land! [Crowd cheers at Tyro's bravado.]
character_words: Yes. To take back my village.  To take back all of our villages! The Fire Nation will regret the day they set foot on our land!

full_text: [To Katara.] Come with us.
character_words: Come with us.

full_text: I can't. Your mission is to take back your home. Ours is to get Aang to the North Pole. [Gazes over the rail to see Momo join Aang atop Appa's head, floating in the ocean.]
character_words: I can't. Your mission is to take back your home. Ours is to get Aang to the North Pole.

full_text: That's him, isn't it? The Avatar. [Aang airbends an encased piece of coal. Momo jumps into his lap.] Katara, thank you for bringing my father back to me. I never thought I'd see him again. I only wish there was some way ...
character_words: That's him, isn't it? The Avatar.  Katara, thank you for bringing my father back to me. I never thought I'd see him again. I only wish there was some way ...

full_text: I know. [Reaches for her necklace wistfully, but realizes it is not around her neck and panics.] My mother's necklace! It's gone!
character_words: I know.  My mother's necklace! It's gone!

full_text: Back on the prison rig, Zuko stands alone facing the sunset amid coal lying sparsely on the deck. He seizes Katara's necklace in his fingers, lifting it to stare at it grimly.
character_words: NA

full_text: Fade to credits.
character_words: NA

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: The episode opens to a cloudy sky, looking toward the ground. The point of view switches to one above the clouds as they pass by. A messenger hawk floats into view, emitting a cry. When Appa overshadows the bear and roars, it shrieks again and stoops down, swiveling out of view. The camera shifts to a side-view of Appa soaring along with Aang, Katara and Sokka in his saddle.
character_words: NA

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Voice-over; somewhat dreamily.] Those clouds look so soft, [Cut to Aang sitting lazily atop Appa's head, a twig in his mouth; the view pans to the left, showing Sokka carving something with an uninterested look on his face, Katara lying on her stomach, popped up on her elbows, staring dreamingly over the rim of Appa's saddle, and Momo sleeping on the luggage.] don't they? Like you could just jump down and you'd land in a big, soft, cottony heap?
character_words: Those clouds look so soft,  don't they? Like you could just jump down and you'd land in a big, soft, cottony heap?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Turns to Katara; mockingly with a smile.] Maybe you should give it a try.
character_words: Maybe you should give it a try.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Looks at Sokka with annoyance; sarcastically as she looks away from him.] You're hilarious.
character_words: You're hilarious.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Frontal shot; excitedly.] I'll try it! [Carrying his staff, he jumps off Appa with a big smile on his face. As he begins to fall, he turns once around his axis, winking at the camera as he passes. He falls down spreadeagled, laughing joyously.] Yeah!
character_words: I'll try it!  Yeah!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: Cut to a side-view of Appa's saddle as Katara and Sokka pop their heads over the rim, looking down in the direction Aang went. Cut to an upward looking shot following Aang falling down, still smiling broadly. As he passes the camera, it tilts down, following him as he vanishes in a cloud. Cut back to the siblings; Katara looks somewhat worried, while Sokka gazes wide-eyed at the point where Aang vanished. When he leans over to search the sky, Aang comes back up from behind them on his glider. The siblings turn around as they hear the snapping noise of Aang's glider being closed, and they watch how the airbender plops down on the saddle, his legs spread apart and a big smile on his face. Cut to a side-view of an unimpressed looking Sokka, before switching back to a frontal shot of Aang who is dripping wet.
character_words: NA

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Looking at himself.] Turns out, clouds are made of water.
character_words: Turns out, clouds are made of water.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: He breaths in deeply and slams his balled, right fist against his stretched left hand, creating an expanding air ball around him in the process, drying himself off. As Aang leans back to rest on both his hands, he contently looks at Momo, whose fur got all fluffed by Aang's airbending. Cut to a side-view of Sokka, who is still looking at Aang unimpressed. Katara glances at her brother, but her attention is drawn to something over his shoulder.
character_words: NA

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: Hey, what is that?
character_words: Hey, what is that?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: Sokka looks over his right shoulder in the direction Katara is looking as well. Katara gets up and walks to the front of Appa's saddle. Cut to a shot of the landscape in front of them, a large, dark patch of burned land standing out among the lush green of the forest. Cut to a frontal view of the trio now all looking over the front rim of Appa's saddle, surprised looks on their faces.
character_words: NA

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Camera zooms in.] It's like a scar ...
character_words: It's like a scar ...

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: The scene fades to a ground view of the scorched forest. The camera pans to the right, showing many burned trees, and Team Avatar standing in the middle of a gray, barren patch.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Voice-over.] Listen. [Cut to a frontal shot of a sad-looking Aang, his friends behind him.] It's so quiet. There's no life anywhere.
character_words: Listen.  It's so quiet. There's no life anywhere.

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: Aang? Are you okay?
character_words: Aang? Are you okay?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Noticing footprints; angrily.] Fire Nation! Those evil savages make me sick! They have no respect for -
character_words: Fire Nation! Those evil savages make me sick! They have no respect for -

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: Shhh!
character_words: Shhh!

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: [Whispering angrily.] What? I'm not allowed to be angry?
character_words: What? I'm not allowed to be angry?

chapter: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
full_text: Katara points to Aang with a somewhat concerned look on her face as he slumps over, downcast at the sight.
