full_text: [Airbends himself back on the ground.] What about me?
character_words: What about me?

full_text: I know the Avatar can do this.
character_words: I know the Avatar can do this.

full_text: Aang and Katara stand on one of the many geysers in the gully. While Jet looks on, they bend the water up. After a few minutes, a stream of water emerges from the hole. They pull it to their height and send it toward the river where it continues to flow like a waterfall. The water quickly joins the river.
character_words: NA

full_text: Yes! Good job! This river empties into the reservoir--a few more geysers and it'll be full.
character_words: Yes! Good job! This river empties into the reservoir--a few more geysers and it'll be full.

full_text: Look, there's another steam vent. [Aang and Katara walk off in its direction.]
character_words: Look, there's another steam vent.

full_text: Okay. You two keep it up, I'll go check on things at the reservoir. [He turns and walks away.]
character_words: Okay. You two keep it up, I'll go check on things at the reservoir.

full_text: When we're done we'll meet you over there.
character_words: When we're done we'll meet you over there.

full_text: Actually ... probably better if you meet me back at the hideout when you're done. [Jet resumes walking away Aang and Katara bend the next geyser into another fountain.]
character_words: Actually ... probably better if you meet me back at the hideout when you're done.

full_text: [Later.] I bet that's enough, and I'm not just saying that to be lazy. [Around them, over a dozen geysers flow into the river.]
character_words: I bet that's enough, and I'm not just saying that to be lazy.

full_text: Let's catch up with Jet at the reservoir.
character_words: Let's catch up with Jet at the reservoir.

full_text: I thought we agreed to meet Jet back at the hideout.
character_words: I thought we agreed to meet Jet back at the hideout.

full_text: Well, we finished early. I'm sure he'll be happy to see us.
character_words: Well, we finished early. I'm sure he'll be happy to see us.

full_text: The screen changes to a path in the forest. Pipsqueak and Smellerbee follow Sokka, who has his hands tied behind his back. Smellerbee gives Sokka a shove; Sokka stumbles but remains on his feet.
character_words: NA

full_text: Come on, move along!
character_words: Come on, move along!

full_text: How can you stand by and do nothing while Jet wipes out a whole town?
character_words: How can you stand by and do nothing while Jet wipes out a whole town?

full_text: Hey listen Sokka, Jet's a great leader. We follow what he says, and things always turn out okay. [Sokka notices a couple of snare leaf-piles nearby identical to the one that enticed Momo, right down to the pile of nuts.]
character_words: Hey listen Sokka, Jet's a great leader. We follow what he says, and things always turn out okay.

full_text: If that's how Jet leads, then he's got a lot to learn. [Sokka sprints off in the direction of the snares. Smellerbee makes a grab for him, but misses.]
character_words: If that's how Jet leads, then he's got a lot to learn.

full_text: Hey! [They give chase. Sokka leaps over the leaf piles. Pipsqueak and Smellerbee don't, and end up snared and hanging many feet up in the air.]
character_words: Hey!

full_text: While you two are up there, you might want to practice your knot work. [He holds up his now-worthless bindings, turns, and walks away.]
character_words: While you two are up there, you might want to practice your knot work.

full_text: Hey Smellerbee, you gonna eat your lychee nuts? [Smellerbee hits him in the head with a lychee nut and it lands in the pile he's holding.] Ooh. [He picks one up and licks his lips.]
character_words: Hey Smellerbee, you gonna eat your lychee nuts?  Ooh.

full_text: Katara and Aang are standing on the edge of the cliff. At the base of the dam, four of Jet's people are unloading barrels from the wagon and arranging them.
character_words: NA

full_text: What are they doing?
character_words: What are they doing?

full_text: Hey, those are the red barrels he got from the Fire Nation.
character_words: Hey, those are the red barrels he got from the Fire Nation.

full_text: Why would they need blasting jelly? [Zooms on Aang, who is horrified.]
character_words: Why would they need blasting jelly?

full_text: Because Jet's gonna blow up the dam.
character_words: Because Jet's gonna blow up the dam.

full_text: What? No, that would destroy the town. Jet wouldn't do that. [Aang opens his glider.]
character_words: What? No, that would destroy the town. Jet wouldn't do that.

full_text: I've gotta stop him. [He takes off.]
character_words: I've gotta stop him.

full_text: [Less convinced.] Jet wouldn't do that.
character_words: Jet wouldn't do that.

full_text: Before Aang can reach the edge, Jet crosses his path from behind and snatches the glider. Aang is left wobbling precariously on the edge, and uses airbending to get himself back on stable footing.
character_words: NA

full_text: Yes I would.
character_words: Yes I would.

full_text: Jet, why?
character_words: Jet, why?

full_text: Katara, you would too if you just stopped to think. Think about what the Fire Nation did to your mother, we can't let them do that to anyone else, ever again.
character_words: Katara, you would too if you just stopped to think. Think about what the Fire Nation did to your mother, we can't let them do that to anyone else, ever again.

full_text: This isn't the answer!
character_words: This isn't the answer!

full_text: I want you to understand me Katara. I thought your brother would understand, but—
character_words: I want you to understand me Katara. I thought your brother would understand, but—

full_text: Where's Sokka? [Tears fall from her eyes. Jet reaches out and touches her face.]
character_words: Where's Sokka?

full_text: Katara.
character_words: Katara.

full_text: She lowers her head, and with a shout, sends Jet flying with the water from her waterskin. She draws it back into the skin when she's done.
character_words: NA

full_text: I need to get to the dam.
character_words: I need to get to the dam.

full_text: Aang's closed glider is on the ground. As he reaches for it, one of Jet's hook swords pins it. Jet has the two swords hook to hook; with a yank he pulls Aang's glider to him.
character_words: NA

full_text: You're not going anywhere without your glider.
character_words: You're not going anywhere without your glider.

full_text: Jet swings the swords at Aang. Aang somersaults backward to avoid the extra reach. Aang finishes his retreat in a nearby tree.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm not gonna fight you, Jet.
character_words: I'm not gonna fight you, Jet.

full_text: [Taunting.] You'll have to if you want your glider back.
character_words: You'll have to if you want your glider back.

full_text: Aang retreats back into the forest, as Jet hooks the branch and pulls himself up. Katara follows on the ground. Jet attacks; Aang defends himself with balls of air, which Jet ducks. Jet attacks head on, but Aang blocks with his arms and sends his opponent flying into a tree trunk with an air kick. Jet combines his swords again and advances. Aang avoids the flail-like move and sends another air blast. Jet stoops down and lets the air flow over and past him before lunging.
character_words: NA

full_text: They continue the chase through the many levels of the forest. Jet catches up to Aang and sends them both freefalling, attacking as they go. They both end up on a branch. Jet continues his attack. Aang avoids it all. Jet charges again, but Aang hits him with a jetstream of air. Jet falls. He recovers, but loses the glider in the process. Before Aang can get to the ground Jet kicks him into a trunk. He lands with a thud next to his glider.
character_words: NA

full_text: A small tributary flows past him. Aang is slow to get up. Before Jet can take more than a step however, he his hit by a large water strike. Katara is there; she uses water from the river to throw Jet against the trunk of the tree. Over and over she attacks; Jet is unable to cut the water and its force plasters him against the trunk. She freezes Jet from toe to neck.
character_words: NA

full_text: Why, Jet? I can't believe I trusted you. You lied to me, you're sick and I trusted you! [A birdcall is heard. Katara and Aang are startled, and look to the valley beyond where it's coming from. Jet gives an answering birdcall.] What are you doing?
character_words: Why, Jet? I can't believe I trusted you. You lied to me, you're sick and I trusted you!  What are you doing?

full_text: You're too late.
character_words: You're too late.

full_text: [Horrified.] No!
character_words: No!

full_text: Aang opens his glider and runs for the nearby cliff. His glider's wings are damaged to the point that he has no lift, and slams back into the ground near the edge. Katara runs over to help him.
character_words: NA

full_text: [In pain from the fall.] Sokka's still out there, he's our only chance.
character_words: Sokka's still out there, he's our only chance.

full_text: Come on, Sokka. I'm sorry I ever doubted you, please.
character_words: Come on, Sokka. I'm sorry I ever doubted you, please.

full_text: Longshot stands on a branch, his bow pulled. He has a flaming arrow on the string. He takes aim and fires. It arcs down to the base of the dam. Katara watches in horror.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Whispers.] No ...
character_words: No ...

full_text: The center of the dam explodes in a cloud of smoke and fire. Katara and Aang watch a massive wall of water go to the town. Inside the town the streets are empty except for the occasional barrels and the Cabbage Merchant's cabbage cart. The water rushes through the open gate, as a cresting wave dwarfs it. The wall and gate are swallowed as the wave strikes the town. The flotsam carried away includes a smiling doll in a purple dress.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sokka didn't make it in time.
character_words: Sokka didn't make it in time.

full_text: All those people ... [She turns in rage back to Jet.] Jet, you monster!
character_words: All those people ...  Jet, you monster!

full_text: This was a victory, Katara. Remember that. The Fire Nation is gone and this valley will be safe.
character_words: This was a victory, Katara. Remember that. The Fire Nation is gone and this valley will be safe.

full_text: It will be safe, without you. [In shock, Jet looks up to see Sokka, Appa, and Momo rise from below the level of the cliff.]
character_words: It will be safe, without you.

full_text: Sokka!
character_words: Sokka!

full_text: I warned the villagers of your plan, just in time.
character_words: I warned the villagers of your plan, just in time.

full_text: What?!
character_words: What?!

full_text: [Cuts to an illustrated set of flashback stills each being panned through.] At first they didn't believe me. The Fire Nation soldiers assumed I was a spy. But one man vouched for me, the old man you attacked. He urged them to trust me, and we got everyone out in time. [The flashback ends and the townsfolk are seen on high ground above the river, on the bank opposite the town. A little girl, who was seen in the flashback, runs down to the water's edge as the doll floats by. She retrieves it.]
character_words: At first they didn't believe me. The Fire Nation soldiers assumed I was a spy. But one man vouched for me, the old man you attacked. He urged them to trust me, and we got everyone out in time.

full_text: [Happily.] Misses Pretty! [She hugs her doll.]
character_words: Misses Pretty!

full_text: Sokka, you fool! We could've freed this valley!
character_words: Sokka, you fool! We could've freed this valley!

full_text: Who would be free? Everyone would be dead.
character_words: Who would be free? Everyone would be dead.

full_text: You traitor!
character_words: You traitor!

full_text: No, Jet. You became the traitor when you stopped protecting innocent people.
character_words: No, Jet. You became the traitor when you stopped protecting innocent people.

full_text: Katara. Please, help me.
character_words: Katara. Please, help me.

full_text: Goodbye Jet. [Sokka gives Appa's reigns a flick.]
character_words: Goodbye Jet.

full_text: Yip yip. [Jet is left behind, still frozen to the tree.]
character_words: Yip yip.

full_text: The sky they fly in is empty, save a few wispy clouds.
character_words: NA

full_text: We thought you were going to the dam. How come you went to the town instead?
character_words: We thought you were going to the dam. How come you went to the town instead?

full_text: Let me guess, your instincts told you.
character_words: Let me guess, your instincts told you.

full_text: [Shrugs his right shoulder.] Hey, sometimes they're right.
character_words: Hey, sometimes they're right.

full_text: Um ... Sokka? You know we're going the wrong way, right? [Sokka is surprised, but quickly recovers.]
character_words: Um ... Sokka? You know we're going the wrong way, right?

full_text: And sometimes they're wrong. [With a grin, he pulls Appa's reigns. They fly off screen before reappearing, going in the opposite direction.]
character_words: And sometimes they're wrong.

full_text: Fades to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text: Opening shot of the sun setting behind some tall rock outcroppings. The sky is mostly cloudy and the clouds reflect the light of the dying sun. Pan down to show a patched up tent being jostled about from the inside. A rolled up tarp lies next to the tent. Sokka is inside a tent, trying to assemble it. Sokka can be heard grunting and fussing about as he tries to finish setting up the shelter. Katara walks in the frame, her back to the camera, with a pile of fire wood in her arms.
character_words: NA

full_text: Um, aren't you forgetting the tarp?
character_words: Um, aren't you forgetting the tarp?

full_text: Right, got it ... [Tosses the wrapped up tarp inside the tent.]
character_words: Right, got it ...

full_text: Sokka, you're supposed to put the tarp on top of the tent. You know, so we don't get rained on? [Cut to an overhead shot of the two, Sokka gesturing widely as he replies to his sister.]
character_words: Sokka, you're supposed to put the tarp on top of the tent. You know, so we don't get rained on?

full_text: Ordinarily, you'd be right, but seeing how it's the dry season, you're not. Besides that tarp makes a pretty warm blanket.
character_words: Ordinarily, you'd be right, but seeing how it's the dry season, you're not. Besides that tarp makes a pretty warm blanket.

full_text: But what if it does rain?
character_words: But what if it does rain?

full_text: [Spreading his arms wide in exasperation.] What if it doesn't? Then I would have put up the tarp for nothing.
character_words: What if it doesn't? Then I would have put up the tarp for nothing.

full_text: You're infuriating!
character_words: You're infuriating!

full_text: Katara, why don't you worry about gathering firewood, because that kindling is looking pretty sorry.
character_words: Katara, why don't you worry about gathering firewood, because that kindling is looking pretty sorry.

full_text: [Angrily.] Well, if you don't like my firewood- [Throws the sticks at Sokka who shields himself from the wood. He stands in anger after the hail of sticks subsides.]
character_words: Well, if you don't like my firewood-

full_text: [Angrily.] Fine by me, if you're not gonna do your job- [He tears the tent down and the two stare at each other angrily as Aang approaches.]
character_words: Fine by me, if you're not gonna do your job-

full_text: Okay, I got the grub if you guys got the- [The siblings turn away from each other in anger with their arms folded.] hey, where's the campfire? And what happened to the tent?
character_words: Okay, I got the grub if you guys got the-  hey, where's the campfire? And what happened to the tent?

full_text: Why don't you ask Miss Know-It-All, Queen of the Twigs.
character_words: Why don't you ask Miss Know-It-All, Queen of the Twigs.

full_text: Oh yeah? Well, you're Mister Lazy Bum, King of the [Picks up and throws a twig at Sokka's head.] Tents! [Sokka turns around, looking angrily at her.]
character_words: Oh yeah? Well, you're Mister Lazy Bum, King of the  Tents!

full_text: [Laughs.] Okay, listen guys, harsh words won't solve problems, action will. Why don't you just switch jobs?
character_words: Okay, listen guys, harsh words won't solve problems, action will. Why don't you just switch jobs?

full_text: Sounds good.
character_words: Sounds good.

full_text: [At the same time.] Whatever.
character_words: Whatever.

full_text: [Grinning while gloating.] You see that? Settling feuds and making peace, all in a day's work for the Avatar. [Turns his head to see Momo and Appa fighting over a watermelon. Momo continuously tries to fly away with it, while Appa pins it down. Aang takes the melon and uses airbending to slice it. Momo seems to be complaining about how he got the much smaller half and Appa got the bigger half.] Come on, Momo, that's fair. Appa's got five stomachs. [Appa eats his half of the melon.]
character_words: You see that? Settling feuds and making peace, all in a day's work for the Avatar.  Come on, Momo, that's fair. Appa's got five stomachs.

full_text: The scene fades to show the group standing on the edge of a huge canyon.
character_words: NA

full_text: There it is, guys, The Great Divide.
character_words: There it is, guys, The Great Divide.

full_text: [In awe.] Wow, I could just stare at it forever. [Zoom backward to show Sokka in the foreground.]
character_words: Wow, I could just stare at it forever.

full_text: Okay, I've seen enough.
character_words: Okay, I've seen enough.

full_text: How can you not be fascinated Sokka? This is the largest canyon in the entire world.
character_words: How can you not be fascinated Sokka? This is the largest canyon in the entire world.

full_text: Then I'm sure we'll be able to see it very clearly from the air while we fly away.
character_words: Then I'm sure we'll be able to see it very clearly from the air while we fly away.

full_text: [Shoving past Sokka.] If you're looking for the canyon guide, I was here first!
character_words: If you're looking for the canyon guide, I was here first!

full_text: Ooh, canyon guide? Sounds informative.
character_words: Ooh, canyon guide? Sounds informative.

full_text: Believe me, he's more than a tour guide, he's an earthbender, [Oblivious to the fact that Sokka is behind him, mocking him.] and the only way in and out of the canyon is with his help, and he's taking my tribe across next.
character_words: Believe me, he's more than a tour guide, he's an earthbender,  and the only way in and out of the canyon is with his help, and he's taking my tribe across next.

full_text: Calm down, we know you're next.
character_words: Calm down, we know you're next.

full_text: You wouldn't be so calm if the Fire Nation destroyed your home and forced you to flee! My whole tribe has to walk thousands of miles to the capital city of Ba Sing Se.
character_words: You wouldn't be so calm if the Fire Nation destroyed your home and forced you to flee! My whole tribe has to walk thousands of miles to the capital city of Ba Sing Se.

full_text: You're a refugee!
character_words: You're a refugee!

full_text: Huh, tell me something I don't know.
character_words: Huh, tell me something I don't know.

full_text: A large group of poorly dressed people is shown walking toward them.
character_words: NA

full_text: Is that your tribe?
character_words: Is that your tribe?

full_text: It most certainly is not! That's the Zhang tribe, a bunch of low-life thieves. They've been the enemies of my tribe for a hundred years. [Whistles to them.] Hey, Zhangs! I'm saving a spot for my tribe so don't even think about stealing it!
character_words: It most certainly is not! That's the Zhang tribe, a bunch of low-life thieves. They've been the enemies of my tribe for a hundred years.  Hey, Zhangs! I'm saving a spot for my tribe so don't even think about stealing it!

full_text: Where are the rest of the Gan Jin? Still tidying up their camp site?
character_words: Where are the rest of the Gan Jin? Still tidying up their camp site?

full_text: Yes, but they sent me ahead of them to hold a spot.
character_words: Yes, but they sent me ahead of them to hold a spot.

full_text: I didn't know the canyon guide took reservations.
character_words: I didn't know the canyon guide took reservations.

full_text: Ha, of course you didn't! That's the ignorance I'd expect from a messy Zhang. So unorganized and ill-prepared for a journey. [The Zhang tribe members yell out in protest behind them. Katara and Aang look at each other worriedly, but turn around to see a large pile of rocks being levitated up and thrown away. The canyon guide stands behind where the rocks used to be.]
character_words: Ha, of course you didn't! That's the ignorance I'd expect from a messy Zhang. So unorganized and ill-prepared for a journey.

full_text: Sorry about the wait, youngsters. Who's ready to cross this here canyon?
character_words: Sorry about the wait, youngsters. Who's ready to cross this here canyon?

full_text: Uh, one of them, I think. [Camera pans left to reveal the Zhang and the scout.]
character_words: Uh, one of them, I think.

full_text: [Rushing forward.] I was here first, my party's on their way.
character_words: I was here first, my party's on their way.

full_text: I can't guide people who aren't here. [Cut to a wider shot showing the Zhang filing past the three kids and the fuming Gan Jin scout.]
character_words: I can't guide people who aren't here.

full_text: [Mockingly.] Guess you guys will have to make the trip tomorrow.
character_words: Guess you guys will have to make the trip tomorrow.

full_text: The shot shifts to a close-up the scout, whose eyes twitch in anger. The camera zooms backward and pans left to reveal another tribe entering the canyon entrance area. The scout points to them in triumph.
character_words: NA

full_text: Wait, here they come! [A group of clean, finely dressed people are shown coming toward them.]
character_words: Wait, here they come!

full_text: [To the canyon guide.] You're not seriously gonna cave into these spoiled Gan Jins? I mean we're refugees too! And we've got sick people that need shelter.
character_words: You're not seriously gonna cave into these spoiled Gan Jins? I mean we're refugees too! And we've got sick people that need shelter.

full_text: I ... uh ... well ...
character_words: I ... uh ... well ...

full_text: We've got old people who are weary from traveling.
character_words: We've got old people who are weary from traveling.

full_text: Sick people get priority over old people.
character_words: Sick people get priority over old people.

full_text: Maybe you Zhangs wouldn't have so many sick people if you weren't such slobs.
character_words: Maybe you Zhangs wouldn't have so many sick people if you weren't such slobs.

full_text: If you Gan Jins weren't so clean, you wouldn't live to be so old.
character_words: If you Gan Jins weren't so clean, you wouldn't live to be so old.

full_text: [Over the two arguing tribes.] Well Aang, ready to put your peace-making skills to the test?
character_words: Well Aang, ready to put your peace-making skills to the test?

full_text: I don't know, a fight over chores is one thing, but these people have been feuding for a hundred years.
character_words: I don't know, a fight over chores is one thing, but these people have been feuding for a hundred years.

full_text: [Stepping forward.] Everybody listen up! This is the Avatar, and if you give him a chance, I'm sure he can come up with a compromise that will make everyone happy.
character_words: Everybody listen up! This is the Avatar, and if you give him a chance, I'm sure he can come up with a compromise that will make everyone happy.

full_text: Uh, you could share the earthbender and travel together?
character_words: Uh, you could share the earthbender and travel together?

full_text: Absolutely not! We'd rather be taken by the Fire Nation than travel with those stinking thieves!
character_words: Absolutely not! We'd rather be taken by the Fire Nation than travel with those stinking thieves!

full_text: We wouldn't travel with those pompous fools anyway! [The two tribes begin to shout at each other again.]
character_words: We wouldn't travel with those pompous fools anyway!

full_text: [Shouting.] All right here's the deal, you're all going down together and Appa here will fly your sick and elderly across! Does that seem fair? [Both leaders nod in agreement, and the scene fades to show the sick and elderly boarding Appa.]
character_words: All right here's the deal, you're all going down together and Appa here will fly your sick and elderly across! Does that seem fair?

full_text: [To Appa.] Sorry, Appa, you'll have to do this on your own.
character_words: Sorry, Appa, you'll have to do this on your own.

full_text: Aang, this feuding tribe stuff is serious business. Are you sure it's a good idea getting involved in this?
character_words: Aang, this feuding tribe stuff is serious business. Are you sure it's a good idea getting involved in this?

full_text: [Grinning broadly.] To tell you the truth, I'm not sure. But when have I ever been?
character_words: To tell you the truth, I'm not sure. But when have I ever been?

full_text: He's the Avatar, Sokka, making peace between people is his job.
character_words: He's the Avatar, Sokka, making peace between people is his job.

full_text: [Dismayed.] His job's gonna make us cross this whole canyon on foot isn't it? [Cut to an overhead wide shot of the two tribes and the others.]
character_words: His job's gonna make us cross this whole canyon on foot isn't it?

full_text: Okay, now comes the bad news. [Cut to a frontal shot of the guide.] No food allowed in the canyon, it attracts [He makes motions with his hands to illustrate the skittery monsters that might lurk in the canyon.] dangerous predators. [Both tribes yell out in protest.]
character_words: Okay, now comes the bad news.  No food allowed in the canyon, it attracts  dangerous predators.

full_text: No food?! This is ridiculous.
character_words: No food?! This is ridiculous.

full_text: Oh, you babies can go a day without food? Would you rather be hungry, or dead? [He raises an earth pillar to tower over the rest. He continues, cupping his hands to his mouth to amplify his voice.] Now, we're heading down in ten minutes. All food better be in your gut or in the garbage!
character_words: Oh, you babies can go a day without food? Would you rather be hungry, or dead?  Now, we're heading down in ten minutes. All food better be in your gut or in the garbage!

full_text: The Zhang tribe quickly whips out and shoves food into their mouths, which stands in stark contrast to the Gan Jin tribe, who eat slowly with chopsticks.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To the people on Appa.] Appa's going to take good care of you 'till we get there. [To Appa.] See you on the other side, buddy! Yip yip! [Appa roars and takes off. The camera fades to show both groups of people climbing down into the canyon. The tour guide earthbends to form a bridge in a gap in the path.]
character_words: Appa's going to take good care of you 'till we get there.  See you on the other side, buddy! Yip yip!

full_text: Nice bending!
character_words: Nice bending!

full_text: The job's much more than bending, kid. Folks want information. [Turns to the travelers.] Many of you are probably wondering how canyons are formed. Experts tell us this canyon was most likely carved into the ground by earth spirits who were angry at local farmers for not offering them a proper sacrifice.
character_words: The job's much more than bending, kid. Folks want information.  Many of you are probably wondering how canyons are formed. Experts tell us this canyon was most likely carved into the ground by earth spirits who were angry at local farmers for not offering them a proper sacrifice.

full_text: Katara and Sokka look up in fear as an avalanche of rocks comes falling toward them, and the canyon guide earthbends it away from them.
character_words: NA

full_text: He he he, guess the spirits are still angry! Hope you all brought sacrifices.
character_words: He he he, guess the spirits are still angry! Hope you all brought sacrifices.

full_text: Cut to a wide shot of the canyon floor and the canyon wall on the right side of the screen. The view pans slowly rightward before cutting to a closer, overhead shot of the group now at the bottom of the switchback trail. They have just entered the canyon floor. The guide stands in front of the two tribes and the kids. Katara, Aang, and Sokka look at each other in exasperation and the scene fades to show them standing at the bottom of the canyon next to a huge boulder.
character_words: NA

full_text: Okay, everyone stand clear of the wall. [He throws the boulder and destroys the bridge he had made earlier.]
character_words: Okay, everyone stand clear of the wall.

full_text: Why'd you do that?
character_words: Why'd you do that?

full_text: These people are fleeing the Fire Nation, aren't they? Gotta make sure we can't be followed. We'll be safe now. [Yells out, as he is picked up by a huge animal. Aang blows away the dust to reveal a canyon crawler.]
character_words: These people are fleeing the Fire Nation, aren't they? Gotta make sure we can't be followed. We'll be safe now.

full_text: We gotta help him! [He throws his boomerang at the crawler, which drops the canyon guide and comes after Sokka instead.] Okay, now we gotta help me! [Katara comes to his aid and does a water whip on the crawler, but she is quickly thrown aside. Aang jumps down and sends a multiple blasts of air at the crawler and drives it away.]
character_words: We gotta help him!  Okay, now we gotta help me!

full_text: [To the canyon guide.] What was that?
character_words: What was that?

full_text: [On the ground.] Canyon crawler. [Groans in pain.] And there's sure to be more!
character_words: Canyon crawler.  And there's sure to be more!

full_text: Your arms, they're broken!
character_words: Your arms, they're broken!

full_text: Without my arms, I got no bending. In other words-
character_words: Without my arms, I got no bending. In other words-

full_text: We're trapped in this canyon.
character_words: We're trapped in this canyon.

full_text: The camera fades to show them grouped together.
character_words: NA

full_text: I thought the whole point of ditching our food was so we wouldn't have to deal with things like canyon crawlers.
character_words: I thought the whole point of ditching our food was so we wouldn't have to deal with things like canyon crawlers.

full_text: It's the Zhangs! They took food down here even after the canyon guide told them not to.
character_words: It's the Zhangs! They took food down here even after the canyon guide told them not to.

full_text: What? If there's anyone who can't go without food for a day, it's you pampered Gan Jins!
character_words: What? If there's anyone who can't go without food for a day, it's you pampered Gan Jins!

full_text: I hope you're happy. We're stuck in this canyon with no way out.
character_words: I hope you're happy. We're stuck in this canyon with no way out.

full_text: Why don't you thank yourself, food hider?
character_words: Why don't you thank yourself, food hider?

full_text: Look, sticking together is the only way to-
character_words: Look, sticking together is the only way to-

full_text: I'm not walking another step with the likes of them!
character_words: I'm not walking another step with the likes of them!

full_text: Now there's something we can agree on.
character_words: Now there's something we can agree on.

full_text: [To the canyon guide.] Any ideas?
character_words: Any ideas?

full_text: No bendng ... we need to get out of this canyon ... I won't die down here! I won't become part of the food chain!
character_words: No bendng ... we need to get out of this canyon ... I won't die down here! I won't become part of the food chain!

full_text: See! We're going to become part of the food chain because of you! [Points to Zhangs.]
character_words: See! We're going to become part of the food chain because of you!

full_text: Sure, unjustly blame the Zhangs like you always do!
character_words: Sure, unjustly blame the Zhangs like you always do!

full_text: Gladly.
character_words: Gladly.

full_text: [Angrily.] Enough! I thought I could help you guys get along, but I guess that's not gonna happen. [Jumps onto a tall rock.] We should split up, Gan Jins on this side and Zhangs on that side. We'll travel in two separate lines. [The two leaders nod at each other and start walking. Aang jumps down to Sokka and Katara.] Sokka, you go with the Zhangs and Katara, you go with the Gan Jins. See if you can find out why they hate each other so much.
character_words: Enough! I thought I could help you guys get along, but I guess that's not gonna happen.  We should split up, Gan Jins on this side and Zhangs on that side. We'll travel in two separate lines.  Sokka, you go with the Zhangs and Katara, you go with the Gan Jins. See if you can find out why they hate each other so much.

full_text: They split up and the camera pans to show them walking separately. The scene changes to show Sokka in the Zhang camp.
character_words: NA

full_text: So, you guys aren't going to put up your tarps?
character_words: So, you guys aren't going to put up your tarps?

full_text: What for? Its the dry season.
character_words: What for? Its the dry season.

full_text: Exactly!
character_words: Exactly!

full_text: Besides, we like to use the tarp as a blanket.
character_words: Besides, we like to use the tarp as a blanket.

full_text: [Smiling.] Finally, someone gets it!
character_words: Finally, someone gets it!

full_text: Katara is shown at the Gan Jin camp, where they are putting up tarps over their tents.
character_words: NA

full_text: You really think it'll rain?
character_words: You really think it'll rain?

full_text: No, but you can never be too careful, right?
character_words: No, but you can never be too careful, right?

full_text: Katara smiles and the camera fades to nightfall, where they are sitting around their campfire. The Gan Jin leader looks around and pulls a piece of bread out of his sleeve. Katara looks stunned to see all the other tribe members doing the same.
character_words: NA

full_text: Would you care for some bread, Katara?
character_words: Would you care for some bread, Katara?

full_text: So it was you guys who had food!
character_words: So it was you guys who had food!

full_text: Oh come now, you really think that tribe of thieves isn't smuggling food? Why should my people go hungry when the sneaky Zhangs are stuffing their faces?
character_words: Oh come now, you really think that tribe of thieves isn't smuggling food? Why should my people go hungry when the sneaky Zhangs are stuffing their faces?

full_text: [Hesitates.] Well, I guess it's okay if everyone's doing it. [Takes the bread and eats it.] So, why does your tribe hate the Zhangs so much?
character_words: Well, I guess it's okay if everyone's doing it.  So, why does your tribe hate the Zhangs so much?

full_text: You seem like a smart girl Katara, I bet you would enjoy hearing some history. [Fades to show a large gate with a finely dressed man running toward it. Voice-over.] The patriarch of our tribe, Jin Wei, was an earthbender warrior who was assigned an important duty, transporting our sacred orb from the great eastern gate, to the great western gate. Taking the orb from the east to the west represents the sun's rising and setting. It was our tribe's ancient redemption ritual. But as he approached the gate, Jin Wei was attacked by one of the Zhang, a vermin named Wei Jin, who looked at the orb with envy. That coward Wei Jin knocked Jin Wei to the ground, and stole our sacred orb. [Camera goes back to the Gan Jin leader's face.] Our people have never forgotten. You can never trust a Zhang.
character_words: You seem like a smart girl Katara, I bet you would enjoy hearing some history.  The patriarch of our tribe, Jin Wei, was an earthbender warrior who was assigned an important duty, transporting our sacred orb from the great eastern gate, to the great western gate. Taking the orb from the east to the west represents the sun's rising and setting. It was our tribe's ancient redemption ritual. But as he approached the gate, Jin Wei was attacked by one of the Zhang, a vermin named Wei Jin, who looked at the orb with envy. That coward Wei Jin knocked Jin Wei to the ground, and stole our sacred orb.  Our people have never forgotten. You can never trust a Zhang.

full_text: Katara glares at the Zhang's camp and the scene fades to show the Zhang tribe and Sokka sitting around the campfire.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To Sokka.] Care for some meat?
character_words: Care for some meat?

full_text: Would I! [Takes the meat and bites down hungrily.]
character_words: Would I!

full_text: I know what you must be thinking, we're horrible for endangering everybody by bringing food down here.
character_words: I know what you must be thinking, we're horrible for endangering everybody by bringing food down here.

full_text: Hm-hmm.
character_words: Hm-hmm.

full_text: The Gan Jin think so badly of us, they probably assumed we brought food in and decided to bring food in themselves. That's why we brought food in.
character_words: The Gan Jin think so badly of us, they probably assumed we brought food in and decided to bring food in themselves. That's why we brought food in.

full_text: [Still eating.] Hmm.
character_words: Hmm.

full_text: Our conflict with the Gan Jin goes back over a hundred years. [Fades to show a poorly-dressed man running through a large gate. Voice-over.] Our forefather Wei Jin was leaving the western gate of our village, when he saw a figure in the distance. It was a man of the Gan Jin tribe, Jin Wei, collapsed on the ground. Noble Wei Jin stopped to help him. Jin Wei was transporting a sacred orb, a very powerful relic used in his tribe's redemption ritual. Wei Jin tried to tend to the man's wounds but Jin Wei insisted the orb was more important, and asked him to take it back to his tribe. Kind Wei Jin promised to send help for the man as soon as he could, but as Wei Jin crossed the border to return the orb into Gan Jin territory, he was arrested. Instead of thanking him for his kind and selfless deed, they sentenced him to twenty long years in prison. [Back to Zhang leader.] We Zhangs will never forget that injustice.
character_words: Our conflict with the Gan Jin goes back over a hundred years.  Our forefather Wei Jin was leaving the western gate of our village, when he saw a figure in the distance. It was a man of the Gan Jin tribe, Jin Wei, collapsed on the ground. Noble Wei Jin stopped to help him. Jin Wei was transporting a sacred orb, a very powerful relic used in his tribe's redemption ritual. Wei Jin tried to tend to the man's wounds but Jin Wei insisted the orb was more important, and asked him to take it back to his tribe. Kind Wei Jin promised to send help for the man as soon as he could, but as Wei Jin crossed the border to return the orb into Gan Jin territory, he was arrested. Instead of thanking him for his kind and selfless deed, they sentenced him to twenty long years in prison.  We Zhangs will never forget that injustice.

full_text: That's just terrible. [Looks at her piece of meat.] You gonna finish that?
character_words: That's just terrible.  You gonna finish that?

full_text: Fades to show Aang sitting with Momo far from both camps.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sure would be nice to be sitting around one of those campfires, telling stories and laughing. Its okay Momo, we'll be out of here soon enough, and then we can eat our weight in leechi nuts! [Momo jumps up and snatches a bug out of the air, he eats part of it before offering the rest to Aang.] Nah, I'll wait for the leechi nuts.
character_words: Sure would be nice to be sitting around one of those campfires, telling stories and laughing. Its okay Momo, we'll be out of here soon enough, and then we can eat our weight in leechi nuts!  Nah, I'll wait for the leechi nuts.

full_text: [Slowly approaching Aang.] Lonely isn't it, being impartial?
character_words: Lonely isn't it, being impartial?

full_text: I wish I could help these people get along, but it just seems impossible. Anyhow, I guess our biggest problem is getting out of here.
character_words: I wish I could help these people get along, but it just seems impossible. Anyhow, I guess our biggest problem is getting out of here.

full_text: I'm not so sure the two problems are unrelated.
character_words: I'm not so sure the two problems are unrelated.

full_text: Aang looks away sadly and the scene fades to show the two tribes traveling again in daylight.
character_words: NA

full_text: All clear, we're almost to the other side.
character_words: All clear, we're almost to the other side.

full_text: [Jumps down to Katara and Sokka.] Katara, Sokka, will these people cooperate long enough to get out of the canyon?
character_words: Katara, Sokka, will these people cooperate long enough to get out of the canyon?

full_text: I don't think so, Aang, the Zhangs really wronged the Gan Jins. They ambushed Jin Wei and stole the sacred orb.
character_words: I don't think so, Aang, the Zhangs really wronged the Gan Jins. They ambushed Jin Wei and stole the sacred orb.

full_text: What are you talking about?
character_words: What are you talking about?

full_text: Yeah Katara, what are you talking about? Wei Jin didn't steal the orb, he was returning it to their village gate and was wrongfully punished by the Gan Jin.
character_words: Yeah Katara, what are you talking about? Wei Jin didn't steal the orb, he was returning it to their village gate and was wrongfully punished by the Gan Jin.

full_text: Not punished enough if you ask me.
character_words: Not punished enough if you ask me.

full_text: [Over Sokka's frustrated growls.] Okay, okay I get it! Now I need your help, I need everyone together at the base of the canyon wall. [He takes off on his glider and the scene fades to show him landing between the two tribes.] Please everyone, as soon as we get out of here we can eat and then go our separate ways, but I need you all to put your heads together and figure out a way up this cliff.
character_words: Okay, okay I get it! Now I need your help, I need everyone together at the base of the canyon wall.  Please everyone, as soon as we get out of here we can eat and then go our separate ways, but I need you all to put your heads together and figure out a way up this cliff.

full_text: Maybe the Zhang can climb the wall with their long disgusting fingernails.
character_words: Maybe the Zhang can climb the wall with their long disgusting fingernails.

full_text: Oh sorry, I forgot that to the Gan Jin unclipped fingernails is a crime punishable by twenty years in jail!
character_words: Oh sorry, I forgot that to the Gan Jin unclipped fingernails is a crime punishable by twenty years in jail!

full_text: Why, you dirty thief!
character_words: Why, you dirty thief!

full_text: You pompous fool!
character_words: You pompous fool!

full_text: The tribes began to argue loudly again, accompanied by Katara and Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Shouting.] Guys, focus! How many times do I have to say it? Harsh words won't solve problems, action will!
character_words: Guys, focus! How many times do I have to say it? Harsh words won't solve problems, action will!

full_text: Perhaps the Avatar is right.
character_words: Perhaps the Avatar is right.

full_text: Yes, perhaps he is. [Aang grins happily at this.]
character_words: Yes, perhaps he is.

full_text: Harsh words will never solve our problems.
character_words: Harsh words will never solve our problems.

full_text: Action will!
character_words: Action will!

full_text: They both draw their swords and Aang yells in surprise, as they clash their swords.
character_words: NA

full_text: To the death! And let this be the end of this rivalry!
character_words: To the death! And let this be the end of this rivalry!

full_text: You know, I take it back. Harsh words aren't so bad!
character_words: You know, I take it back. Harsh words aren't so bad!

full_text: The two leaders ignore him as they begin to fight. They are evenly matched, and continue until Aang blows them apart with a strong gust of air. The two tribes go flying backward, revealing a large amount of hidden food.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Shocked.] Is that ... food? Everyone smuggled food down here? Unbelievable! You guys put our lives in danger because you couldn't go without a snack for a day? You're all awful! [He looks in wonder at a custard tart, and his stomach growls.] So hungry. Is that an egg custard in that tart? [He turns to see dozens of canyon crawlers approaching, and they all try to flee.]
character_words: Is that ... food? Everyone smuggled food down here? Unbelievable! You guys put our lives in danger because you couldn't go without a snack for a day? You're all awful!  So hungry. Is that an egg custard in that tart?

full_text: Oh no, that's a lot of canyon crawlers.
character_words: Oh no, that's a lot of canyon crawlers.

full_text: [Taking out his boomerang.] We barely survived one!
character_words: We barely survived one!

full_text: They're coming back for me! They've had a taste and they're coming back for me!
character_words: They're coming back for me! They've had a taste and they're coming back for me!

full_text: Sokka, wait. [Stops him as he runs forward.] I don't care about this stupid feud, I just want us to get out of here alive.
character_words: Sokka, wait.  I don't care about this stupid feud, I just want us to get out of here alive.

full_text: Me too. I only took their side 'cause they fed me.
character_words: Me too. I only took their side 'cause they fed me.

full_text: The camera cuts to show Aang fighting off the canyon crawlers, and soon has them all in a pile. The crawlers pick themselves up and target the refugees. Though Aang, Katara, Sokka, and the tribe leaders fight hard to hold them off, they are vastly out numbered. Aang looks around to see the crawlers eating the food out of the bags.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Shouting.] Everybody, watch me and do what I do! [He distracts a crawler with a piece of food, leaps on its back, and throws a bag over its snout. The two tribes mimic him, working together.] Now follow me! We're riding out of this hole! [Aang ties a huge bag of food onto a stick and uses it to guide the crawlers up the canyon wall.] Everyone, get off!
character_words: Everybody, watch me and do what I do!  Now follow me! We're riding out of this hole!  Everyone, get off!

full_text: [Jumping off a crawler.] We made it!
character_words: We made it!

full_text: As soon as all the people have made it up the cliff, Aang throws the bag back down, and the crawlers follow.
character_words: NA

full_text: I never thought a Gan Jin could get his hands dirty like that.
character_words: I never thought a Gan Jin could get his hands dirty like that.

full_text: And I never knew you Zhangs were so reliable in a pinch.
character_words: And I never knew you Zhangs were so reliable in a pinch.

full_text: Perhaps we're not so different after all. [They both smile at each other and Aang sighs in relief.]
character_words: Perhaps we're not so different after all.

full_text: Too bad we can't rewrite history. You thieves stole our sacred orb from Jin Wei! [Draws his sword.]
character_words: Too bad we can't rewrite history. You thieves stole our sacred orb from Jin Wei!

full_text: [Draws her sword.] You tyrants unjustly imprisoned Wei Jin for twenty long years!
character_words: You tyrants unjustly imprisoned Wei Jin for twenty long years!

full_text: [Sighs in frustration.] Wait a second ... Jin Wei? Wei Jin? I know those guys!
character_words: Wait a second ... Jin Wei? Wei Jin? I know those guys!

full_text: Yes, yes, we're all aware of the story.
character_words: Yes, yes, we're all aware of the story.

full_text: No, I mean I really knew them. I might not look it, but I'm a hundred and twelve years old. I was there one hundred years ago on the day you're talking about. [Scene fades to show the two men facing each other. Voice-over.] There seems to be a lot of confusion about what happened. First of all, Jin Wei and Wei Jin weren't enemies. They were brothers, twins in fact, and they were eight; and most importantly, they were just playing a game! The sacred orb from the legend, that was the ball! And the eastern and western gates were the goal posts. Jin Wei had the ball and was running toward the goal when he fell and fumbled it. Wei Jin didn't steal the ball, he picked it up and started running it toward the other goal, but he stepped out of bounds, so the official put him in the penalty box. Not for twenty long years but for two short minutes. [Fades back to Aang.] There was no stealing and no putting anyone in imprison, it was just a game.
character_words: No, I mean I really knew them. I might not look it, but I'm a hundred and twelve years old. I was there one hundred years ago on the day you're talking about.  There seems to be a lot of confusion about what happened. First of all, Jin Wei and Wei Jin weren't enemies. They were brothers, twins in fact, and they were eight; and most importantly, they were just playing a game! The sacred orb from the legend, that was the ball! And the eastern and western gates were the goal posts. Jin Wei had the ball and was running toward the goal when he fell and fumbled it. Wei Jin didn't steal the ball, he picked it up and started running it toward the other goal, but he stepped out of bounds, so the official put him in the penalty box. Not for twenty long years but for two short minutes.  There was no stealing and no putting anyone in imprison, it was just a game.

full_text: You're saying the sacred orb was actually a sacred ball?
character_words: You're saying the sacred orb was actually a sacred ball?

full_text: Nope, just a regular ball.
character_words: Nope, just a regular ball.

full_text: What about our tribe's redemption ritual?
character_words: What about our tribe's redemption ritual?

full_text: That's what the game was called, redemption. As soon as you got the ball from one end to the other, everyone would yell "redemption"! [The tribe leaders look at each other skeptically.] Don't get me wrong, Wei Jin was kind of a slob and Jin Wei was a little stuffy, that much is true. But they respected each other's differences enough to share the same playing field.
character_words: That's what the game was called, redemption. As soon as you got the ball from one end to the other, everyone would yell "redemption"!  Don't get me wrong, Wei Jin was kind of a slob and Jin Wei was a little stuffy, that much is true. But they respected each other's differences enough to share the same playing field.

full_text: [To the Gan Jin leader.] I suppose it's time we forget the past.
character_words: I suppose it's time we forget the past.

full_text: [Bowing.] And look to the future.
character_words: And look to the future.

full_text: The Zhang leader bows back and Aang looks at them happily. The scene fades to show them standing with Appa.
character_words: NA

full_text: Good to see you, boy. Did you miss me? [Appa licks Aang as the Gan Jin leader approaches.]
character_words: Good to see you, boy. Did you miss me?

full_text: I cannot thank you enough, Avatar.
character_words: I cannot thank you enough, Avatar.

full_text: [Covered in Appa's slobber.] Well, you know I try.
character_words: Well, you know I try.

full_text: [Recoils in disgust.] Ugh!
character_words: Ugh!

full_text: Fades to show the two tribes standing together.
character_words: NA

full_text: Let us travel to the Earth Kingdom capital as one tribe. [Both tribes cheer as they start walking.]
character_words: Let us travel to the Earth Kingdom capital as one tribe.

full_text: [Running forward.] I'm going too! I'm sick of this place!
character_words: I'm going too! I'm sick of this place!

full_text: That's some luck you knew Jin Wei and Wei Jin.
character_words: That's some luck you knew Jin Wei and Wei Jin.

full_text: You could call it luck. Or you could call it lying.
character_words: You could call it luck. Or you could call it lying.

full_text: [Flabbergasted.] What?
character_words: What?

full_text: I made the whole thing up.
character_words: I made the whole thing up.

full_text: [Shocked.] You did not! [In devilish admiration.] That is so wrong.
character_words: You did not!  That is so wrong.

full_text: Now where is that custard tart? I'm starving!
character_words: Now where is that custard tart? I'm starving!

full_text: Fades to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text: The episode begins in Aang's dream. The scene itself, dominated by a tinge of warm yellow, is filled with clouds for a moment before Aang slides into the frame of the shot, his face happy as he flicks the reins. The shot switches to a far view, showing that he is riding Appa, who is flapping his six legs in unison up and down as if he were a bird. The camera pans to the right, revealing Sokka as he pulls alongside Appa, using Aang's glider to fly with the Avatar. The shot cuts to a close-up of the Water Tribe warrior as he turns his head toward Aang, grinning broadly and contentedly at him. Cut to Aang as his face exhibits the same contented grin. He turns his attention to his right and the camera follows his gaze, revealing Katara sitting atop the head of an enormous Momo; she waves at Aang. Camera moves back to a wide frontal shot of the group coursing leisurely through the open sky.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] We need you, Aang.
character_words: We need you, Aang.

full_text: [Close-up as he is looking toward Katara; contentedly.] I need you, too.
character_words: I need you, too.

full_text: Aang notices something out of the corner of his eyes. As he turns toward it, his expression changes to shock. Focusing on Aang's face, the camera turns 180 degrees and switches to his point of view as the sky's coloring changes to a dark, ominous gray, revealing a churning storm cloud before him. Cut back to Aang, who yanks Appa's reins in fright.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Alarmed.] Be careful, guys! [He looks to his left and right, uneasy.] Guys?
character_words: Be careful, guys!  Guys?

full_text: The scene rapidly zooms out, revealing that Aang and Appa are alone, surrounded by nothing but the darkening sky. Cut back to Aang's point of view as Gyatso, in lotus, floats downward, positioning himself in front of Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Surprised.] Gyatso?
character_words: Gyatso?

full_text: [Whispering, his tone sad.] Why did you disappear?
character_words: Why did you disappear?

full_text: [Frontal shot; his voice soft and sad.] I didn't mean to.
character_words: I didn't mean to.

full_text: Cut to a side-view of the two monks, not a meter apart from one another. Aang reaches out to Gyatso, but before he can touch him, Gyatso turns gray and dissipates into smoke; it blows over Aang, causing him to raise his left arm in front of his face and turn away to shield himself from it. Frontal shot of Aang as the last of the smoke washes over him. He peeks over his arm, but instantly raises his head, his eyes growing big in shock; a dark shadow passes over him as the shot cuts to a distant side-view of Appa being swallowed by the dark cloud.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] We need you, Aang.
character_words: We need you, Aang.

full_text: A bolt of lightning splits the shot for an instant before cutting to a frontal shot of a screaming and frightened Aang, wrestling with the reins, as he and Appa are caught in the belly of the storm with rain beating down on them. Cut to an underwater shot as Aang and Appa plummet into the ocean. The duo floats for a moment. Cut to a close-up of Aang's hand as his grip on Appa's reins loosens and they slip from his limp grasp.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Echoing voice-over.] We need you, Aang. [Cut to a downward view of an unconscious Aang sinking.] We need you. We need you, Aang. We need you.
character_words: We need you, Aang.  We need you. We need you, Aang. We need you.

full_text:
Unmoving, Aang sinks and disappears into the darkness of the ocean. For a fraction of a second, lightning splits the shot once again and the silhouette of the Fire Lord surrounded by flames appears.
The scene cuts to reality as Aang, gasping for air and shooting upright, startles Momo, who was curled up on top of Aang. Momo leaps onto Katara's stomach, causing her to shoot up with a startled look on her face, before jumping on Sokka's, who shoots up, still sleepy, halfheartedly wielding his dagger and boomerang.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Drowsily.] What's going on? [He looks around.] Did we get captured again?
character_words: What's going on?  Did we get captured again?

full_text: [Shot looking down, sliding right; Aang turns to his friends.] It's nothing. I just had a bad dream. [He curls up, facing away from them.] Go back to sleep.
character_words: It's nothing. I just had a bad dream.  Go back to sleep.

full_text: [Curls up, facing away from Aang.] Don't have to tell me twice.
character_words: Don't have to tell me twice.

full_text: [Frontal shot of Aang with Katara behind him, looking at him in concern.] Are you all right, Aang?
character_words: Are you all right, Aang?

full_text: [Looking lost.] I'm okay.
character_words: I'm okay.

full_text: You seem to be having a lot of nightmares lately. You want to tell me about it?
character_words: You seem to be having a lot of nightmares lately. You want to tell me about it?

full_text: [Briefly closing his eyes.] I think I just need some rest.
character_words: I think I just need some rest.

full_text: [Sitting up behind Katara; upbeat.] You guys want to hear about my dream? [Katara glares at him, an expression Sokka returns.] That's okay. I didn't want to talk about it anyway.
character_words: You guys want to hear about my dream?  That's okay. I didn't want to talk about it anyway.

full_text:
Sokka lies down, disappearing from view; Katara does the same.
Scene changes to waves crashing on a sandy shore under a blue sky. Cut to a wide frontal shot of Katara as she carries their packs toward Appa, who yawns. As the animal closes its mouth again, Aang is revealed sitting on his head, while Sokka sits on the saddle.
character_words: NA

full_text: Look at those clear skies, buddy! [Pets Appa's head. Cut to a close shot as he looks up at a flock of birds arranged in a "V" flying overhead, their goose-like honking audible.] Should be some smooth flying.
character_words: Look at those clear skies, buddy!  Should be some smooth flying.

full_text: Cut to an overhead shot looking down of Katara looking into a bag before holding it upside down, sprinkling the ground with crumbs; Momo instantly eats them. Sokka walks past her toward Appa, carrying some of their luggage.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Looking from the contents of the bag up to Aang.] Well, we better smoothly fly [She steps onto Appa's tail and walks to the saddle.] ourselves to a market, 'cause we're out of food.
character_words: Well, we better smoothly fly  ourselves to a market, 'cause we're out of food.

full_text: [Side-shot as he suddenly straightens up, his tone serious.] Guys, wait. This was in my dream. [Momo lands on the pack behind him.] We shouldn't go to the market.
character_words: Guys, wait. This was in my dream.  We shouldn't go to the market.

full_text: [Shot cuts beside Sokka, facing out toward Katara and Aang, who turn to look at him; curious.] What happened in your dream?
character_words: What happened in your dream?

full_text: [Frontal shot; his eyes are bugged out in terror and the camera zooms in on him, rolling slightly as the shot takes on a greenish tint and alien music dubs the scene.] Food eats people! [The colors return to normal as the shot cuts to Katara's face as she shakes her head. Behind her, Aang goes back to adjusting the reins. Cut to Sokka again as he points at Momo.] Also, Momo could talk. [He glares at Momo while crossing his arms.] You said some very unkind things.
character_words: Food eats people!  Also, Momo could talk.  You said some very unkind things.

full_text: Momo's ears droop as Sokka speaks. Cut to downward looking shot of a flock of birds in V-formation flying over the open ocean. As the scene pans to the left, Zuko's ship sails into view. Cut to the deck, where Iroh stands on the deck, with Zuko looking through a spyglass behind him. As the flight of birds passes over Iroh's head in the distance, he sniffs the air and Zuko lowers the spyglass to turn to his uncle, who speaks.
character_words: NA

full_text: There is a storm coming. A big one.
character_words: There is a storm coming. A big one.

full_text: You're out of your mind, Uncle. [Walking up to Iroh.] The weather's perfect. There's not a cloud in sight.
character_words: You're out of your mind, Uncle.  The weather's perfect. There's not a cloud in sight.

full_text: The shot cuts behind the two, facing the prow of the ship and showing a clear sea and sky.
character_words: NA

full_text: A storm is approaching from the north. [He turns to face Zuko.] I suggest we alter our course and head southwest.
character_words: A storm is approaching from the north.  I suggest we alter our course and head southwest.

full_text: [Taking a few steps in Iroh's direction, pointing briefly northward.] We know the Avatar is traveling northward, so we will do the same.
character_words: We know the Avatar is traveling northward, so we will do the same.

full_text: [Cut to his face; stern.] Prince Zuko, consider the safety of the crew.
character_words: Prince Zuko, consider the safety of the crew.

full_text: [Cut to his face as he advances on his uncle angrily.] The safety of the crew doesn't matter!
character_words: The safety of the crew doesn't matter!

full_text: Behind them, Lieutenant Jee walks onto deck, inadvertently overhearing the conversation. As Zuko realizes Jee is behind him and turns to face him, his expression briefly loses its raging intensity. A quick close-up shows Jee raising an eyebrow as Zuko walks over to him; another cut shifts the view to the lieutenant's side as Zuko, addressing Jee directly, struts up to him, dominantly looking him right in the eyes from a close distance as he finishes speaking.
character_words: NA

full_text: Finding the Avatar is far more important than any individual's safety.
character_words: Finding the Avatar is far more important than any individual's safety.

full_text: As Zuko walks away, Jee glares after him. The shot switches, showing Zuko leaving the deck through the door at the base of the superstructure. Cut to a frontal shot of Jee, who looks slightly enraged as Iroh walks over to him.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Reassuringly, a twinge of uncertainty in his voice, almost as if he does not fully believe what he is saying.] He doesn't mean that. He's just all worked up.
character_words: He doesn't mean that. He's just all worked up.

full_text: The scene changes to a seaside hamlet built on the side of a cliff face, the roofs all teal-green; a collection of houses sits back from the waterfront, where a row of warehouses adjoins the docks. Among the several ships moored on the town's four piers is Appa, floating in the water by himself. Cut to Katara, who stands in front of a small merchants' stand, suspiciously eying a watermelon.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Scowling.] Ahhh, it's good. It's perfect, I'm telling you!
character_words: Ahhh, it's good. It's perfect, I'm telling you!

full_text: [Shaking the watermelon, which emits an audible sloshing sound.] I don't know if I like the sound of that swishing.
character_words: I don't know if I like the sound of that swishing.

full_text: [As the shot zooms out, the merchant moves around the stand where Katara stands. Sokka and Aang, staff in hand, stand beside them; the former is filling a basket with fruit.] Swishing means it's ripe! It's the ripe juices swishing around, eh?
character_words: Swishing means it's ripe! It's the ripe juices swishing around, eh?

full_text: [Taking a step toward Katara.] I think it's true, Katara. Swishing means it's ripe.
character_words: I think it's true, Katara. Swishing means it's ripe.

full_text: [As the shot cuts to a frontal view of her, she puts the melon back on the stand.] I just realized we're out of money anyway.
character_words: I just realized we're out of money anyway.

full_text: [Annoyed, grabbing a basket full of fruits from Sokka.] Awww!
character_words: Awww!

full_text: As Sokka walks past the merchant, she indignantly kicks him in the rear, drawing a cry of pain from Sokka. Cut to Sokka, Katara, and Aang on the docks. Sokka is rubbing where the lady kicked him and seems downcast.
character_words: NA

full_text: Out of food and out of money. Now what are we supposed to do?
character_words: Out of food and out of money. Now what are we supposed to do?

full_text: You could get a job, smart guy.
character_words: You could get a job, smart guy.

full_text: A fisherman and his wife are walking behind the gang. As Katara finishes, they begin a loud, heated conversation, which is overheard easily by Aang, Katara, and Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: We shouldn't go out there! Please, the fish can wait. There's going to be a terrible storm. [Camera cuts to show Aang, who appears alarmed by the prediction.]
character_words: We shouldn't go out there! Please, the fish can wait. There's going to be a terrible storm.

full_text: You're crazy. It's a nice day: [Gesturing to the sky with both arms.] No clouds, no winds, no nothing. So quit your nagging, woman.
character_words: You're crazy. It's a nice day:  No clouds, no winds, no nothing. So quit your nagging, woman.

full_text: [Nervously suggesting to Katara and Sokka.] Maybe we should find some shelter?
character_words: Maybe we should find some shelter?

full_text: [Indicating the fair weather.] Are you kidding? Shelter from what?
character_words: Are you kidding? Shelter from what?

full_text: My joints say there's going to be a storm! A bad one.
character_words: My joints say there's going to be a storm! A bad one.

full_text: Well, it's your joints against my brain.
character_words: Well, it's your joints against my brain.

full_text: Then I hope your brain can find someone else to haul that fish, 'cause I ain't comin'.
character_words: Then I hope your brain can find someone else to haul that fish, 'cause I ain't comin'.

full_text: Then I'll find a new fish hauler and pay him double what you get! [Cut to a side shot of the couple, showing Sokka running up to them.] How do you like that?
character_words: Then I'll find a new fish hauler and pay him double what you get!  How do you like that?

full_text: [Interrupting, raising his hand.] I'll go.
character_words: I'll go.

full_text: You're hired! [Shoots a triumphant look at his wife, who scowls back.]
character_words: You're hired!

full_text: [After a short pause, to Katara and Aang.] What? You said get a job ... and he's paying double.
character_words: What? You said get a job ... and he's paying double.

full_text: [Rounding on Sokka, his expression wild.] Double? Who told you that nonsense?
character_words: Double? Who told you that nonsense?

full_text: The scene changes to Zuko's ship on the open ocean. As the shot pans right, a massive bank of darkening clouds, having appeared seemingly out of nowhere, rolls into view, looming in front of the ship. Cut to the deck, where Lieutenant Jee and several other soldiers stand a short distance from the shot, staring at the clouds. Zuko walks into the foreground, regarding the clouds as Jee and the others turn to face him. Iroh walks between Zuko and Jee as the latter taunts the former.
character_words: NA

full_text: Looks like your uncle was right about the storm after all.
character_words: Looks like your uncle was right about the storm after all.

full_text: [Pleasantly.] Lucky guess.
character_words: Lucky guess.

full_text: [Whirling around and walking toward Jee; angry.] Lieutenant! You'd better learn some respect [Jabs two fingers into Jee's chest.] – or I will teach it to you. [Begins to walk away from Jee, who follows Zuko with his eyes, continuing his taunting after a short pause.]
character_words: Lieutenant! You'd better learn some respect  – or I will teach it to you.

full_text: What do you know about respect? [Behind Jee, Iroh's expression turns to panic and he makes a cutting motion at his throat with his hand, trying to signal Lieutenant Jee to stop. Cut to Zuko's back as he stops walking before switching to his face as he listens to Jee's words.] The way you talk to everyone around here, from your hard-working crew to your esteemed uncle, shows you know nothing about respect! [Cut to a close-up of Iroh's face as he gasps slightly, reaching out a hand in desperation before moving it to his forehead in resignation, believing Jee has gone too far. Cut back to Zuko's face, contorted with rage.] You don't care about anyone but yourself! Then again, what should I expect from a spoiled prince?
character_words: What do you know about respect?  The way you talk to everyone around here, from your hard-working crew to your esteemed uncle, shows you know nothing about respect!  You don't care about anyone but yourself! Then again, what should I expect from a spoiled prince?

full_text: Zuko turns around and extends his right arm as if preparing to firebend. Lieutenant Jee does the same.
character_words: NA

full_text: Easy now. [Both Zuko and Jee wrist-block the other's arm; smoke rises from a furious Zuko's hand. Interrupting the staredown, Iroh extends an arm and pulls theirs apart; the smoke fades.] Enough! We're all a bit tired from being at sea so long. I'm sure after a bowl of noodles, everyone will feel much better.
character_words: Easy now.  Enough! We're all a bit tired from being at sea so long. I'm sure after a bowl of noodles, everyone will feel much better.

full_text: Lieutenant Jee walks away.
character_words: NA

full_text: I don't need your help keeping order on my ship.
character_words: I don't need your help keeping order on my ship.

full_text: Iroh puts a comforting hand on Zuko's right shoulder, but Zuko shrugs it off and walks away. Scene changes back to a dock at the fishing town, where Team Avatar stands. Sokka is carrying supplies onto the fisherman's boat.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sokka, maybe this isn't such a good idea. Look at the sky.
character_words: Sokka, maybe this isn't such a good idea. Look at the sky.

full_text: I said I was going to do this job. I can't back out just because of some bad weather.
character_words: I said I was going to do this job. I can't back out just because of some bad weather.

full_text: The boy with the tattoos has some sense. You should listen to him!
character_words: The boy with the tattoos has some sense. You should listen to him!

full_text: Boy with tattoos? [The fisherman turns around to look at Aang.] Airbender tattoos. Well, I'll be a hog monkey's uncle. You're the Avatar, ain't ya?
character_words: Boy with tattoos?  Airbender tattoos. Well, I'll be a hog monkey's uncle. You're the Avatar, ain't ya?

full_text: That's right. [Katara and Aang smile.]
character_words: That's right.

full_text: Well, don't be so smiley about it. [Katara and Aang frown now.] The Avatar disappeared for a hundred years! You turned your back on the world!
character_words: Well, don't be so smiley about it.  The Avatar disappeared for a hundred years! You turned your back on the world!

full_text: Don't yell at him! Aang would never turn his back on anyone.
character_words: Don't yell at him! Aang would never turn his back on anyone.

full_text: Oh, he wouldn't, huh? Then I guess I just have imagined the last hundred years of war and suffering. [Aang's eyes widen.]
character_words: Oh, he wouldn't, huh? Then I guess I just have imagined the last hundred years of war and suffering.

full_text: Aang is the bravest person I know. He's done nothing but help people and save lives since I met him. [Behind Katara's back, Aang slowly begins to backpedal away from her.] It's not his fault he disappeared, right Aang? [Katara turns around to see Aang backing away.] Aang, what's wrong?
character_words: Aang is the bravest person I know. He's done nothing but help people and save lives since I met him.  It's not his fault he disappeared, right Aang?  Aang, what's wrong?

full_text: A look of shock and horrified guilt on his face, Aang opens his glider and vaults into the air, rapidly disappearing into the distance.
character_words: NA

full_text: That's right! Keep flying!
character_words: That's right! Keep flying!

full_text: You're a horrible old man! [She gets on Appa, who is floating beside the dock.] Appa, yip yip!
character_words: You're a horrible old man!  Appa, yip yip!

full_text: As Appa flies out of the water, a big wave splashes the fisherman. Sokka walks out from below deck on the boat.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey! They left without saying good-bye!
character_words: Hey! They left without saying good-bye!

full_text: Your friends ain't too polite, are they?
character_words: Your friends ain't too polite, are they?

full_text: I know! This one time, I was ...
character_words: I know! This one time, I was ...

full_text: [Hands Sokka a crate, interrupting him impolitely.] Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah. Get below deck!
character_words: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah. Get below deck!

full_text: Scene changes to show Katara riding on Appa in the rain, trying to find Aang. The shot cuts to show a cave in the side of a cliff face. Camera changes to a view of Katara outside the cave and Aang sitting alone inside, surrounded by darkness.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Quietly.] I'm sorry for running away.
character_words: I'm sorry for running away.

full_text: It's okay. That fisherman was way out of line.
character_words: It's okay. That fisherman was way out of line.

full_text: Actually, he wasn't.
character_words: Actually, he wasn't.

full_text: [Surprised.] What do you mean?
character_words: What do you mean?

full_text: [Speaks in a sad voice.] I don't want to talk about it.
character_words: I don't want to talk about it.

full_text: It has to do with your dream, doesn't it? [Puts her hand on his shoulder.] Talk to me.
character_words: It has to do with your dream, doesn't it?  Talk to me.

full_text: Well, it's kind of a long story.
character_words: Well, it's kind of a long story.

full_text: Suddenly, Momo leaps past Aang and Katara, startling them. Appa has also entered the cave. He nuzzles Aang's head with his nose, making Aang smile. Aang pats Appa's chin.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm going to try to get a little fire going.
character_words: I'm going to try to get a little fire going.

full_text: I'll never forget the day the monks told me I was the Avatar. I was playing with some other kids just outside the South Wall. I was trying to teach them how to do the air scooter.
character_words: I'll never forget the day the monks told me I was the Avatar. I was playing with some other kids just outside the South Wall. I was trying to teach them how to do the air scooter.

full_text: Okay, here goes.
character_words: Okay, here goes.

full_text: The boy forms it and tries getting on, but spins and falls off. Aang gently gets off his.

character_words: You kind of have to balance on it like it's a top.

full_text: Man, that's hard.
character_words: Man, that's hard.

full_text: Where'd you learn that trick, Aang?
character_words: Where'd you learn that trick, Aang?

full_text: Wow!
character_words: Wow!

full_text: Aang, come with us. We need to speak with you.
character_words: Aang, come with us. We need to speak with you.

full_text: Scene changes to when Aang and the elder monks are in the meeting room.

full_text: How do you know it's me?
character_words: How do you know it's me?

character_words: We have known you were the Avatar for some time. Do you remember these?

full_text: Monk Tashi airbends a wrapped-up mat to Aang. It opens up, revealing four toys.
character_words: NA

full_text: Those were some of my favorite toys when I was little! [He picks up the propeller toy.]
character_words: Those were some of my favorite toys when I was little!

full_text: You chose them from among thousands of toys, Aang. The toys you picked were the four Avatar relics. These items belonged to Avatars past. Your own past lives.
character_words: You chose them from among thousands of toys, Aang. The toys you picked were the four Avatar relics. These items belonged to Avatars past. Your own past lives.

full_text: I just chose them because they seemed fun.
character_words: I just chose them because they seemed fun.

full_text: He smiles and pulls the cord on the propeller toy, sending the propeller spinning into the air. It spins through the air and the scene cuts back to a close view of the five monks. The toy goes over Monk Tashi's head.
character_words: NA

full_text: You chose them because they were familiar.
character_words: You chose them because they were familiar.

full_text: Normally we would have told you of your identity when you turned sixteen, but there are troubling signs. Storm clouds are gathering.
character_words: Normally we would have told you of your identity when you turned sixteen, but there are troubling signs. Storm clouds are gathering.

full_text: I fear that war may be upon us, young Avatar.
character_words: I fear that war may be upon us, young Avatar.

full_text: We need you, Aang.
character_words: We need you, Aang.

full_text: Aang lowers his head, his responsibility crushing him. His head stays lowered as the flashback ends and his head remains lowered in the present as well. Cut to a wider shot of Aang on the left, Katara on the right, the fire between them. Katara looks upon him with concern and sympathy. The scene changes back to Zuko's ship. Jee is talking about Zuko to a couple other men.
