full_text: I'm sick of taking his orders! I'm tired of chasing his Avatar! I mean, who does Zuko think he is?
character_words: I'm sick of taking his orders! I'm tired of chasing his Avatar! I mean, who does Zuko think he is?

full_text: Do you really want to know?
character_words: Do you really want to know?

full_text: Jee is shown standing up at the sound of Iroh's voice.
character_words: NA

full_text: General Iroh. We were just- [Iroh cuts him off.]
character_words: General Iroh. We were just-

full_text: It's okay. May I join you?
character_words: It's okay. May I join you?

full_text: Of course, sir.
character_words: Of course, sir.

full_text: Iroh is shown sitting down.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Massages his beard.] Try to understand. My nephew is a complicated young man. He has been through much.
character_words: Try to understand. My nephew is a complicated young man. He has been through much.

full_text: Scene changes to a flashback. Zuko walks up to the curtains to get in the war room, but the guard on the left moves in front of the curtain to stop him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Let me in!
character_words: Let me in!

full_text: [Places his hands on Zuko's shoulders.] Prince Zuko, what's wrong?
character_words: Prince Zuko, what's wrong?

full_text: I want to go into the war chamber [Points to the guard.] but the guard won't let me pass!
character_words: I want to go into the war chamber  but the guard won't let me pass!

full_text: [Leads Zuko away with his left hand still on his shoulder.] You're not missing anything, trust me. These meetings are dreadfully boring.
character_words: You're not missing anything, trust me. These meetings are dreadfully boring.

full_text: If I'm going to rule this nation one day, don't you think I need to start learning as much as I can?
character_words: If I'm going to rule this nation one day, don't you think I need to start learning as much as I can?

full_text: Very well. But you must promise not to speak. [Another elder soldier walks by them into the war chamber.] These old folks are a bit sensitive, you know?
character_words: Very well. But you must promise not to speak.  These old folks are a bit sensitive, you know?

full_text: [Bows to Iroh.] Thank you, Uncle.
character_words: Thank you, Uncle.

full_text: Zuko and Iroh walk into the war room. The meeting starts.
character_words: NA

full_text: The Earth Kingdom defenses are concentrated here. [Bujing shows the place on the map.] A dangerous battalion of their strongest earthbenders and fiercest warriors. So I am recommending the forty-first division.
character_words: The Earth Kingdom defenses are concentrated here.  A dangerous battalion of their strongest earthbenders and fiercest warriors. So I am recommending the forty-first division.

full_text: But the forty-first is entirely new recruits. How do you expect them to defeat a powerful Earth Kingdom battalion?
character_words: But the forty-first is entirely new recruits. How do you expect them to defeat a powerful Earth Kingdom battalion?

full_text: I don't. They'll be used as a distraction while we mount an attack from the rear. What better to use as bait than fresh meat?
character_words: I don't. They'll be used as a distraction while we mount an attack from the rear. What better to use as bait than fresh meat?

full_text: [Zuko is shown standing up.] You can't sacrifice an entire division like that! Those soldiers love and defend our nation! How can you betray them?
character_words: You can't sacrifice an entire division like that! Those soldiers love and defend our nation! How can you betray them?

full_text: Camera shows everyone in the war room staring at Zuko, save for Iroh, who is kneeling behind his nephew. The scene changes back to the present time.
character_words: NA

full_text: Zuko was right, you see, [Massages his beard again.] but it was not his place to speak out. And there were dire consequences. [Slightly bows his head.]
character_words: Zuko was right, you see,  but it was not his place to speak out. And there were dire consequences.

full_text: Scene changes back to Aang and Katara.
character_words: NA

full_text: So you were upset that you were the Avatar? Why wouldn't you be excited about it?
character_words: So you were upset that you were the Avatar? Why wouldn't you be excited about it?

full_text: Well, I didn't know how to feel about it. All I knew was that after I found out, everything began changing.
character_words: Well, I didn't know how to feel about it. All I knew was that after I found out, everything began changing.

full_text: Scene changes back to flashback. Aang enters into the South Wall again. The Air Nomad kids are shown on air scooters.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, not bad! You guys have been practicing!
character_words: Hey, not bad! You guys have been practicing!

full_text: Not only that! We made up a game you can play with the air scooters!
character_words: Not only that! We made up a game you can play with the air scooters!

full_text: Great! [Aang is shown making his own. But everyone else makes theirs vanish.] What's going on?
character_words: Great!  What's going on?

full_text: Now that you're the Avatar, it's kind of an unfair advantage for whichever team you're on.
character_words: Now that you're the Avatar, it's kind of an unfair advantage for whichever team you're on.

full_text: But I'm still the same! Nothing's changed! So, what? I can't play?
character_words: But I'm still the same! Nothing's changed! So, what? I can't play?

full_text: That's the only fair way.
character_words: That's the only fair way.

full_text: Oh, okay.
character_words: Oh, okay.

full_text: Sorry, Aang.
character_words: Sorry, Aang.

full_text: Aang is shown leaving the South Wall.
character_words: NA

full_text: Okay. Now, who wants Jinju on their team?
character_words: Okay. Now, who wants Jinju on their team?

full_text: Jinju is shown in the corner with a gas around him, laughing. Scene changes to Aang and Gyatso playing a game of Pai Sho. Aang is shown moving a piece.
character_words: NA

full_text: Very interesting move, young one.
character_words: Very interesting move, young one.

full_text: What do you mean?
character_words: What do you mean?

full_text: Gyatso is shown using airbending to make a spiral, flipping a part of Aang's clothing. Gyatso quickly moves two pieces around. Aang is shown flipping his clothing back into place.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey!
character_words: Hey!

full_text: Gyatso and Aang laugh. Monk Tashi appears.
character_words: NA

full_text: You're playing games with him? The Avatar should be training!
character_words: You're playing games with him? The Avatar should be training!

full_text: Aang has already trained enough for today.
character_words: Aang has already trained enough for today.

full_text: Time is short. [To Aang.] Come with me. I must test you on some high level techniques.
character_words: Time is short.  Come with me. I must test you on some high level techniques.

full_text: No. As long as I'm his guardian, I will decide when he trains ... and when he gets his butt kicked at Pai Sho.
character_words: No. As long as I'm his guardian, I will decide when he trains ... and when he gets his butt kicked at Pai Sho.

full_text: Hmph.
character_words: Hmph.

full_text: Monk Tashi is shown walking away. The flashback ends, and the scene changes to on Zuko's ship. A flashback appears of the fire in front of the Fire Lord's throne rising.
character_words: NA

full_text: After Zuko's outburst in the meeting, the Fire Lord became very angry with him. [Flashback quickly ends.] He said the challenge against the general was an act of complete disrespect! And there was only one way to resolve this.
character_words: After Zuko's outburst in the meeting, the Fire Lord became very angry with him.  He said the challenge against the general was an act of complete disrespect! And there was only one way to resolve this.

full_text: Agni Kai. A fire duel.
character_words: Agni Kai. A fire duel.

full_text: That's right. Zuko looked upon the old general he had insulted and declared that he was not afraid. But Zuko misunderstood. [Flashback shows an overview of the chamber; the camera cuts to show Zuko preparing for the Agni Kai.] When he turned to face his opponent, he was surprised to see it was not the general. [Flashback shows the tippet that was on Zuko's shoulders fall down to the ground.] Zuko had spoken out against the general's plan, but by doing so in the Fire Lord's war room, it was the Fire Lord whom he had disrespected. [Frontal shot of a surprised Zuko; as the camera zooms in on him, his expression changes to one of fear.] Zuko would have to duel his own father.
character_words: That's right. Zuko looked upon the old general he had insulted and declared that he was not afraid. But Zuko misunderstood.  When he turned to face his opponent, he was surprised to see it was not the general.  Zuko had spoken out against the general's plan, but by doing so in the Fire Lord's war room, it was the Fire Lord whom he had disrespected.  Zuko would have to duel his own father.

full_text: Cut to a wall of the cave. The shot pans down to show Katara and a sad-looking Aang around their campfire. While Momo is asleep in his lap, Aang stares off into the fire with unseeing eyes as he continues his story.
character_words: NA

full_text: Then, just when I was feeling better, something worse happened.
character_words: Then, just when I was feeling better, something worse happened.

full_text: Scene changes to flashback of Monk Tashi and Monk Gyatso speaking to Monk Pasang.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aang needs to have freedom and fun. He needs to grow up as a normal boy.
character_words: Aang needs to have freedom and fun. He needs to grow up as a normal boy.

full_text: You cannot keep protecting him from his destiny.
character_words: You cannot keep protecting him from his destiny.

full_text: Gyatso, I know you mean well, but you are letting your affection for the boy cloud your judgment.
character_words: Gyatso, I know you mean well, but you are letting your affection for the boy cloud your judgment.

full_text: All I want is what is best for him.
character_words: All I want is what is best for him.

full_text: But what we need is what's best for the world. You and Aang must be separated! The Avatar will be sent away to the Eastern Air Temple to complete his training.
character_words: But what we need is what's best for the world. You and Aang must be separated! The Avatar will be sent away to the Eastern Air Temple to complete his training.

full_text: Aang is shown looking through a hole in the ceiling, shocked at the news that he just heard.
character_words: NA

full_text: That's awful, Aang. I don't know what to say.
character_words: That's awful, Aang. I don't know what to say.

full_text: [Stands up.] How could they do that to me? They wanted to take away everything I knew and everyone I loved! [He activates the Avatar State.]
character_words: How could they do that to me? They wanted to take away everything I knew and everyone I loved!

full_text: Whoa! Hot cinders!
character_words: Whoa! Hot cinders!

full_text: Aang comes out of the Avatar State, walks to the fire, and sits down again.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm sorry I got so mad.
character_words: I'm sorry I got so mad.

full_text: You have the right to be angry after the monks sent you away like that.
character_words: You have the right to be angry after the monks sent you away like that.

full_text: Well, that's not exactly what happened. [Flashback starts again, showing Aang looking out the window of his bedroom.] I was afraid and confused. I didn't know what to do.
character_words: Well, that's not exactly what happened.  I was afraid and confused. I didn't know what to do.

full_text: Flashback shows Aang lying on his bed before changing to Gyatso walking to Aang's room.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aang, I'm not going to let them take you away from me. Aang? [Gyatso is shown opening the door more, spotting the scroll, and opening it up. He gasps, and sees a storm coming outside the window.]
character_words: Aang, I'm not going to let them take you away from me. Aang?

full_text: [Still in present, but flashback playing still.] I never saw Gyatso again. [Flashback shows Aang and Appa through the storm, and how Aang got into the iceberg.] Next thing I knew, I was waking up in your arms after you found me in the iceberg.
character_words: I never saw Gyatso again.  Next thing I knew, I was waking up in your arms after you found me in the iceberg.

full_text: Flashback shows Katara's face that was seen in "The Boy in the Iceberg". The flashback ends.
character_words: NA

full_text: You ran away.
character_words: You ran away.

full_text: And then the Fire Nation attacked our temple. My people needed me and I wasn't there to help.
character_words: And then the Fire Nation attacked our temple. My people needed me and I wasn't there to help.

full_text: You don't know what would have-.
character_words: You don't know what would have-.

full_text: The world needed me and I wasn't there to help.
character_words: The world needed me and I wasn't there to help.

full_text: Aang ...
character_words: Aang ...

full_text: The fisherman was right! I did turn my back on the world!
character_words: The fisherman was right! I did turn my back on the world!

full_text: You're being too hard on yourself, even if you did run away. I think it was meant to be. If you had stayed, you would have been killed along with all the other airbenders.
character_words: You're being too hard on yourself, even if you did run away. I think it was meant to be. If you had stayed, you would have been killed along with all the other airbenders.

full_text: You don't know that.
character_words: You don't know that.

full_text: I know it was meant to be this way. The world needs you now. You give people hope.
character_words: I know it was meant to be this way. The world needs you now. You give people hope.

full_text: Scene changes back to Zuko's ship.
character_words: NA

full_text: When Prince Zuko saw that it was his father who had come to duel him, he begged for mercy.
character_words: When Prince Zuko saw that it was his father who had come to duel him, he begged for mercy.

full_text: Flashback shows a side overview of the Agni Kai chamber where Ozai is advancing on Zuko.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Cut to a side-view of Zuko.] Please, Father. I only had the Fire Nation's best interest at heart. I'm sorry I spoke out of turn! [Slightly lowers his head.]
character_words: Please, Father. I only had the Fire Nation's best interest at heart. I'm sorry I spoke out of turn!

full_text: Cut to a frontal shot from a worm's eye perspective of Ozai's silhouette walking up to Zuko.
character_words: NA

full_text: You will fight for your honor.
character_words: You will fight for your honor.

full_text: [Frontal shot; kneels on his knees and forearms, while looking at the floor.] I meant you no disrespect. [Gazes up at his father, tears shimmering in his eyes as his voice starts to waiver.] I am your loyal son.
character_words: I meant you no disrespect.  I am your loyal son.

full_text: [Far off frontal shot of Zuko as Ozai's shadow and eventually his head come into view.] Rise and fight, Prince Zuko!
character_words: Rise and fight, Prince Zuko!

full_text: Cut to a side-view from behind some of the spectators as Ozai reaches Zuko who lowers his head to the floor again.
character_words: NA

full_text: I won't fight you.
character_words: I won't fight you.

full_text: You will learn respect, [Zuko pushes himself up on his knees and hands. Cut to a frontal shot of Zuko as he starts to shake.] and suffering will be your [Zuko looks up at Ozai, tears streaming down his face.] teacher.
character_words: You will learn respect,  and suffering will be your  teacher.

full_text: Cut to a frontal view of Zhao, Iroh, and Azula in the crowd. While Iroh clenches his teeth and looks fearful and worried on Zuko's behalf, Zhao looks on with a smirk on his face, while Azula smiles and raises her left fist in front of her chest in anticipation.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over; Iroh closes his eyes and averts his head to the left.] I looked away.
character_words: I looked away.

full_text: As the sound of a fire blast is heard, Zuko is screaming "no", which echoes. While the faces of the spectators are brightened by the flames, the camera slowly zooms in on Iroh's averted face. The scene switches from the past to the present, where Iroh is sitting in the same manner.
character_words: NA

full_text: I always thought that Prince Zuko was in a training accident.
character_words: I always thought that Prince Zuko was in a training accident.

full_text: It was no accident. After the duel, the Fire Lord said that by refusing to fight, Zuko had shown shameful weakness. As punishment, he was banished and sent to capture the Avatar. Only then could he return with his honor.
character_words: It was no accident. After the duel, the Fire Lord said that by refusing to fight, Zuko had shown shameful weakness. As punishment, he was banished and sent to capture the Avatar. Only then could he return with his honor.

full_text: So that's why he's so obsessed. Capturing the Avatar is the only chance he has of things returning to normal.
character_words: So that's why he's so obsessed. Capturing the Avatar is the only chance he has of things returning to normal.

full_text: Things will never return to normal. But the important thing is the Avatar gives Zuko hope.
character_words: Things will never return to normal. But the important thing is the Avatar gives Zuko hope.

full_text: Scene changes to show Zuko meditating, while having flashbacks of his younger life. He is stopped by a hit on the ship. Scene changes to Aang and Katara. The fisherman's wife appears.
character_words: NA

full_text: Help! Oh, please help!
character_words: Help! Oh, please help!

full_text: [Grabs lady and brings her near the fire.] It's okay. You're safe.
character_words: It's okay. You're safe.

full_text: But my husband isn't.
character_words: But my husband isn't.

full_text: What do you mean? Where's Sokka?
character_words: What do you mean? Where's Sokka?

full_text: They haven't returned! They should have been back by now! And this storm is becoming a typhoon! They're caught out at sea!
character_words: They haven't returned! They should have been back by now! And this storm is becoming a typhoon! They're caught out at sea!

full_text: I'm going to find him!
character_words: I'm going to find him!

full_text: I'm going with you!
character_words: I'm going with you!

full_text: I'm staying here.
character_words: I'm staying here.

full_text: The fisherman's wife is shown sitting down by the fire. Aang and Katara are shown about to leave on Appa.
character_words: NA

full_text: We'll be back soon. I promise.
character_words: We'll be back soon. I promise.

full_text: Aang and Katara fly out. Scene changes to Zuko's ship, with Zuko on the deck.
character_words: NA

full_text: Where were we hit?
character_words: Where were we hit?

full_text: I don't know!
character_words: I don't know!

full_text: Look!
character_words: Look!

full_text: The helmsman!
character_words: The helmsman!

full_text: Zuko and Lieutenant Jee are shown climbing up a ladder to help a man who is about to fall. Lightning goes down to the middle of the ship, where Iroh is. He uses redirection so it does not damage the ship. Scene changes to Katara and Aang looking for the fisherman and Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: Where are they?
character_words: Where are they?

full_text: Appa is shown descending, hitting the water.
character_words: NA

full_text: Come on, Appa! The boat! There!
character_words: Come on, Appa! The boat! There!

full_text: Zuko is shown spotting Appa.
character_words: NA

full_text: The Avatar!
character_words: The Avatar!

full_text: What do you want to do, sir?
character_words: What do you want to do, sir?

full_text: Let him go. We need to get this ship to safety.
character_words: Let him go. We need to get this ship to safety.

full_text: Then we must head directly into the eye of the storm.
character_words: Then we must head directly into the eye of the storm.

full_text: Scene changes to show Sokka and the fisherman rocking back and forth on the boat.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm too young to die!
character_words: I'm too young to die!

full_text: I'm not, but I still don't wanna!
character_words: I'm not, but I still don't wanna!

full_text: Aang shows up. He jumps down onto the boat. As a pole is falling down, Aang brings up fours pouts of water, splitting the pole in half. After the pole splits in half, Sokka and the fisherman are shown hugging each other. A rope is seen.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hang onto the rope.
character_words: Hang onto the rope.

full_text: The fisherman and Sokka do so. Appa starts flying again. The rope swings up, making Sokka and the fisherman land on the saddle. A big wave hits the gang underwater. Everyone is shown floating away from Appa. Aang goes into the Avatar State and saves everyone. They all go back to the cave where the fisherman's wife is. Scene changes to Zuko and Iroh together.
character_words: NA

full_text: Uncle, I'm sorry.
character_words: Uncle, I'm sorry.

full_text: Your apology is accepted.
character_words: Your apology is accepted.

full_text: Scene changes to Appa, Katara, Aang, Sokka, and the fisherman at the cave. The fisherman's wife runs up to the fisherman and hugs him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Oh, you're alive! You owe this boy an apology!
character_words: Oh, you're alive! You owe this boy an apology!

full_text: He doesn't have to apologize.
character_words: He doesn't have to apologize.

full_text: What if, instead of an apology, I give him a free fish and we call it even?
character_words: What if, instead of an apology, I give him a free fish and we call it even?

full_text: Actually, I don't eat meat.
character_words: Actually, I don't eat meat.

full_text: Fish ain't meat!
character_words: Fish ain't meat!

full_text: Seriously, you're still going to pay me, right?
character_words: Seriously, you're still going to pay me, right?

full_text: The fisherman hands Sokka a fish. Katara and Aang are shown in a corner of the cave.
character_words: NA

full_text: Katara, I think you were right before. I'm done dwelling on the past.
character_words: Katara, I think you were right before. I'm done dwelling on the past.

full_text: Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: I can't make guesses about what would have turned out if I hadn't run away. I'm here now and I'm going to make the most out of it.
character_words: I can't make guesses about what would have turned out if I hadn't run away. I'm here now and I'm going to make the most out of it.

full_text: I don't think you're gonna have those nightmares anymore.
character_words: I don't think you're gonna have those nightmares anymore.

full_text: And if you weren't here now, well, I guess I wouldn't be either. Thank you for saving my life, Avatar.
character_words: And if you weren't here now, well, I guess I wouldn't be either. Thank you for saving my life, Avatar.

full_text: Do you hear that? It stopped raining.
character_words: Do you hear that? It stopped raining.

full_text: Everyone goes outside. Appa shakes raindrops off himself, splashing everyone.
character_words: NA

full_text: Appa!
character_words: Appa!

full_text: Fade to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text: The scene opens on a messenger hawk flying toward an imposing Fire Nation fortress as the scene changes to its tower. The camera pans across the tri-level fortress and it's tall balconies before settling on a courtyard where a group of archers stand at the ready. Switch to a closer shot of a single archer. The archer draws his bow and releases three times in succession, sharply and accurately. Switch to a shot of the bowman's target. The first arrow strikes dead center, the second arrow splits the first arrow in half, and the third arrow splits the second arrow in half and completely impales the target. Switch back to a shot of the archers as they draw their bows. The camera pans up to a balcony where Colonel Shinu is arguing heatedly with Commander Zhao.
character_words: NA

full_text: [In response to Zhao; somewhat angrily.] Absolutely not! The Yuyan Archers stay here. Your request is denied, Commander Zhao.
character_words: Absolutely not! The Yuyan Archers stay here. Your request is denied, Commander Zhao.

full_text: Colonel Shinu, please reconsider ... Their precision is legendary. The Yuyan can pin a fly to a tree from one hundred yards away ... without killing it. [Annoyed.] You're wasting their talents using them as mere security guards.
character_words: Colonel Shinu, please reconsider ... Their precision is legendary. The Yuyan can pin a fly to a tree from one hundred yards away ... without killing it.  You're wasting their talents using them as mere security guards.

full_text: I can do whatever I want with their talents, they're my archers, and what I say goes.
character_words: I can do whatever I want with their talents, they're my archers, and what I say goes.

full_text: Zhao turns to face the colonel, frustrated and angry.
character_words: NA

full_text: But my search for the Avatar is-
character_words: But my search for the Avatar is-

full_text: [Cutting Zhao off mid-sentence while getting close to him and scoffing angrily.] Is nothing but a vanity project! We're fighting a real war here, and I need every man I've got, commander.
character_words: Is nothing but a vanity project! We're fighting a real war here, and I need every man I've got, commander.

full_text: But-!
character_words: But-!

full_text: [Furiously.] That's final! I don't wanna hear another word about it!
character_words: That's final! I don't wanna hear another word about it!

full_text: Zhao fumes. In the background, the cry of a messenger hawk is heard. Camera shifts to an above view and follows a messenger hawk as it reaches Colonel Shinu. Shinu opens the container on the hawk's back and reads the message inside with a puzzled expression.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Intrigued.] News from Fire Lord Ozai?
character_words: News from Fire Lord Ozai?

full_text: Shinu hands Zhao the message with irritation. Zhao takes the message, rudely brushing past the Colonel as he reads the news. Zhao smiles smugly.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Pleased.] It appears I've been promoted to Admiral. My request ... is now an order.
character_words: It appears I've been promoted to Admiral. My request ... is now an order.

full_text:
Colonel Shinu bows respectfully, and leaves.
Shot of the Yuyan archers practicing. Zhao surveys their work with a glad expression playing on his face. The camera pans up to the roof of the tower where a mysterious figure in a blue mask is perched, seemingly for the entire conversation. The masked man disappears into the shadows. Switch to a shot of a vast mountain range. The landscape is blanketed with a ruined city.
The scene changes to a shot inside one of the ruined buildings where Team Avatar has set up camp. Sokka is lying against Appa, huddled in his sleeping bag. He is coughing, and there is sweat on his face.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Pressing a wet rag onto Sokka's forehead.] This should bring your fever down.
character_words: This should bring your fever down.

full_text: You know what I love about Appa the most? His sense of humor.
character_words: You know what I love about Appa the most? His sense of humor.

full_text: That's nice. I'll tell him.
character_words: That's nice. I'll tell him.

full_text: Appa growls.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Laughs.] Classic Appa.
character_words: Classic Appa.

full_text: How's Sokka doing?
character_words: How's Sokka doing?

full_text: Not so good, being out in that storm really did a number on him.
character_words: Not so good, being out in that storm really did a number on him.

full_text: Sokka starts sniffing pitifully.
character_words: NA

full_text: I couldn't find any ginger root for the tea. But I found a map. There's an herbalist institute on top of that mountain. We could probably find a cure for Sokka there.
character_words: I couldn't find any ginger root for the tea. But I found a map. There's an herbalist institute on top of that mountain. We could probably find a cure for Sokka there.

full_text: Aang, he's in no condition for travel. Sokka just needs more rest. I'm sure he'll be better by tomorrow. [Starts coughing.]
character_words: Aang, he's in no condition for travel. Sokka just needs more rest. I'm sure he'll be better by tomorrow.

full_text: Not you too!
character_words: Not you too!

full_text: Relax, it was just a little cough. I'm fi- [She coughs again, this time with greater force, and lightly groans after.]
character_words: Relax, it was just a little cough. I'm fi-

full_text: [Shielding his face.] That's how Sokka started yesterday. Now look at him! He thinks he's an earthbender!
character_words: That's how Sokka started yesterday. Now look at him! He thinks he's an earthbender!

full_text: [Delirious.] Take that, you rock! [He flails his arms as if he is hitting something.]
character_words: Take that, you rock!

full_text: A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense, too. I'm going to go find some medicine! [He grabs his glider and begins to head out just as a flash of lightning strikes.] Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot. [To Appa and Momo.] Keep an eye on them guys. [Appa groans while Momo chitters.]
character_words: A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense, too. I'm going to go find some medicine!  Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot.  Keep an eye on them guys.

full_text: Ha, ha! You guys are killing me!
character_words: Ha, ha! You guys are killing me!

full_text: Aang jumps, and uses airbending to help him run faster. The scene switches to Prince Zuko's ship.
character_words: NA

full_text: We haven't been able to pick up the Avatar's trail since the storm, but if we continue heading northeast ... [A larger Fire Nation ship pulls up next to theirs.]
character_words: We haven't been able to pick up the Avatar's trail since the storm, but if we continue heading northeast ...

full_text: What do they want?
character_words: What do they want?

full_text: Perhaps, a sporting game of Pai Sho!
character_words: Perhaps, a sporting game of Pai Sho!

full_text: A soldier from the other ship walks in.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To Zuko.] The hunt for the Avatar has been given prime importance. All information regarding the Avatar must be reported directly to Admiral Zhao.
character_words: The hunt for the Avatar has been given prime importance. All information regarding the Avatar must be reported directly to Admiral Zhao.

full_text: Zhao has been promoted? Well, good for him! [As Iroh makes a move in his Pai Sho game, another player slaps his hand against his own forehead as if he lost.]
character_words: Zhao has been promoted? Well, good for him!

full_text: [Looking down.] I've got nothing to report to Admiral Zhao. Now get off my ship and let us pass.
character_words: I've got nothing to report to Admiral Zhao. Now get off my ship and let us pass.

full_text: Admiral Zhao is not allowing ships in or out of this area.
character_words: Admiral Zhao is not allowing ships in or out of this area.

full_text: Off my ship!
character_words: Off my ship!

full_text: [Iroh wins his game.] Excellent! I take the pot! [A crew member punches himself.] But you're all improving! I'm certain you will win if we play again.
character_words: Excellent! I take the pot!  But you're all improving! I'm certain you will win if we play again.

full_text: The scene switches to a hidden outpost. One soldier is looking at Aang's wanted poster while the other is on watch duty.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Reading Aang's wanted poster out loud.] Says here that the Avatar can create tornadoes and run faster than the wind. Pretty amazing!
character_words: Says here that the Avatar can create tornadoes and run faster than the wind. Pretty amazing!

full_text: Ah, that's just a bunch of Fire Lord propaganda! There's no way that's true!
character_words: Ah, that's just a bunch of Fire Lord propaganda! There's no way that's true!

full_text:
The scout returns to his task and sees a cloud moving swiftly along the ground which turns out to be Aang. Aang runs by wrecking the outpost on accident. One of the scouts blows a horn signaling that Aang has been spotted.
The scene changes back to the gang's camp.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Weakly.] Katara, please, water.
character_words: Katara, please, water.

full_text: [Also weak.] Listen carefully, Momo. [Holds up a water skin.] I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water. [She is shown through Momo's eyes, speaking gibberish.] Got it? [Momo takes the skin and flies off.]
character_words: Listen carefully, Momo.  I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water.  Got it?

full_text: Aang runs up the stairs and enters the green house.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Speaking fast.] Hello, I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I need some medicine for my friends, they have fevers and they were coughing- [Gets cut off by the herbalist.]
character_words: Hello, I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I need some medicine for my friends, they have fevers and they were coughing-

full_text: Settle down, young man. Your friends are going to be fine. I've been up here for over forty years you know, used to be others, but they all left years ago. [She pets Miyuki who begins to purr.] Now it's just me and Miyuki.
character_words: Settle down, young man. Your friends are going to be fine. I've been up here for over forty years you know, used to be others, but they all left years ago.  Now it's just me and Miyuki.

full_text: That's nice.
character_words: That's nice.

full_text: Wounded Earth Kingdom troops still come by now and again, brave boys, and thanks to my remedies they always leave in better shape they when they arrive.
character_words: Wounded Earth Kingdom troops still come by now and again, brave boys, and thanks to my remedies they always leave in better shape they when they arrive.

full_text: That's nice. Are you almost done?
character_words: That's nice. Are you almost done?

full_text: Hold on, I just need to add one last ingredient. [Walking among the shrubbery, looking around and muttering to herself.] Oh, sandalwood ... oh, er, uh, that won't do, banana leaf? Ah, nope, uh, ginger root, uh uh, oh where is that pesky little plant?
character_words: Hold on, I just need to add one last ingredient.  Oh, sandalwood ... oh, er, uh, that won't do, banana leaf? Ah, nope, uh, ginger root, uh uh, oh where is that pesky little plant?

full_text: Aang looks exasperated in the background and face-palms himself. Cut to Zuko's ship steaming by the shore, the sunset in its last stages in the background. Cut to Zuko practicing firebending on the foredeck in the background. Iroh's arm comes into the frame.
character_words: NA

full_text: Is everything okay? It's been almost an hour and you haven't given the men an order.
character_words: Is everything okay? It's been almost an hour and you haven't given the men an order.

full_text: I don't care what they do.
character_words: I don't care what they do.

full_text: Don't give up hope yet. You can still find the Avatar before Zhao.
character_words: Don't give up hope yet. You can still find the Avatar before Zhao.

full_text: [Turning back, desperation and fear on his face.] How, Uncle? With Zhao's resources, it's just a matter of time before he captures the Avatar. [Turns back out to sea and whispers.] My honor, my throne, my country, I'm about to lose them all.
character_words: How, Uncle? With Zhao's resources, it's just a matter of time before he captures the Avatar.  My honor, my throne, my country, I'm about to lose them all.

full_text: Cut back to an exterior shot of the herbalist institute, followed by a shot of the old woman in front of some bushes.
character_words: NA

full_text: Ah! Plum blossom! [She plucks a flower from the tree.]
character_words: Ah! Plum blossom!

full_text: [He lifts up his head off the table.] Finally! [Close-up of the mixing bowl as the herbalist drops the flower into the mixture, and Aang grabs for the bowl.] Thanks for all your help!
character_words: Finally!  Thanks for all your help!

full_text: The scene moves back, just as Aang wants to yank the bowl out of the herbalist's hands, and she slaps his hands roughly away with her spoon.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hands off!
character_words: Hands off!

full_text: Ow!
character_words: Ow!

full_text: [Close-up, holding her spoon at the ready for a new attack.] What do you think you're doing?
character_words: What do you think you're doing?

full_text: [Rubs his hand, flinching.] Taking the cure to my friends.
character_words: Taking the cure to my friends.

full_text: [Lowers her spoon; laughs.] This isn't a cure! It's Miyuki's dinner. Plum blossom is her favorite.
character_words: This isn't a cure! It's Miyuki's dinner. Plum blossom is her favorite.

full_text: What about my friends?
character_words: What about my friends?

full_text: Well, all they need are some frozen wood frogs. There's plenty down in the valley swamp.
character_words: Well, all they need are some frozen wood frogs. There's plenty down in the valley swamp.

full_text: [Confused.] What am I supposed to do with frozen frogs?
character_words: What am I supposed to do with frozen frogs?

full_text: Why, suck on them of course!
character_words: Why, suck on them of course!

full_text: [Shocked and disgusted; his eye twitches.] Suck on them?
character_words: Suck on them?

full_text: The frog skin excretes a substance that will cure your friends. Be sure to get plenty because once those little critters thaw out, they're useless!
character_words: The frog skin excretes a substance that will cure your friends. Be sure to get plenty because once those little critters thaw out, they're useless!

full_text: You're insane, aren't you?
character_words: You're insane, aren't you?

full_text: [Crazily.] That's right! Well, don't stand there all day! Go!
character_words: That's right! Well, don't stand there all day! Go!

full_text: Aang runs out and the storm gets worse; he wipes his face from the excessive rainfall. Several arrows comes out of nowhere and pins Aang's pants to the ground; he airbends a shield sending some off them away. Aang removes one.
character_words: NA

full_text: Uh ... I think you dropped this ... [Screams as he sees the Yuyan Archers taking aim at him. Panicking, he frees himself from the arrow that had pinned his foot to the ground and runs. He falls off a cliff into a swamp and finds the frozen frogs.] A frog!
character_words: Uh ... I think you dropped this ...  A frog!

full_text:
Aang sticks the frog in his shirt and manages to get four more before getting one of his sleeves pinned to a rock. Aang waterbends an ice wall in front of himself. An arrow strikes the wall before two more land in the same spot and slice the arrows that came before it. The ice cracks and another set of arrows pin his other sleeve before a net is launched at him.
The scene cuts to show Aang bounded at his legs and arms with chains, barely able to move. He looks angry and struggles against the chains.
character_words: NA

full_text: So this is the great Avatar. Master of all the elements. I don't know how you've managed to elude the Fire Nation for a hundred years, but your little game of hide and seek is over.
character_words: So this is the great Avatar. Master of all the elements. I don't know how you've managed to elude the Fire Nation for a hundred years, but your little game of hide and seek is over.

full_text: [Angry.] I've never hidden from you! Untie me and I'll fight you right now!
character_words: I've never hidden from you! Untie me and I'll fight you right now!

full_text: Uhh, no. Tell me, how does it feel to be the only airbender left? Do you miss your people? [Aang looks down sadly.] Don't worry, you won't be killed like they were. [Aang looks angry again.] See, if you die you will just be reborn and the Fire Nation would have to start searching all over again. So I'll keep you alive, but just barely. [Aang takes a deep breath and blows at gale force at Zhao, who falls over.] Blow all the wind you want, but your situation is futile. There is no escaping this fortress, and no one is coming to rescue you.
character_words: Uhh, no. Tell me, how does it feel to be the only airbender left? Do you miss your people?  Don't worry, you won't be killed like they were.  See, if you die you will just be reborn and the Fire Nation would have to start searching all over again. So I'll keep you alive, but just barely.  Blow all the wind you want, but your situation is futile. There is no escaping this fortress, and no one is coming to rescue you.

full_text: Zhao exits the room with the door slamming behind him. Back to Katara and Sokka snuggled up in their sleeping bags which lie between Appa's feet. Sokka has a coughing fit.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Weakly.] Water ...
character_words: Water ...

full_text: [Weakly.] Momo should be back any minute.
character_words: Momo should be back any minute.

full_text: Momo jumps into the shot, chittering happily. He jumps up close to Katara. He drops a dead mouse on to her chest. She looks at it in disgust.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Weakly; in disgust.] Ugh! No, Momo, water. Wa-ter! [Momo's ear go straight up. He jumps off her and scampers.] Aang, what in the world is taking you so long?
character_words: Ugh! No, Momo, water. Wa-ter!  Aang, what in the world is taking you so long?

full_text: The scene changes to an overhead shot of Aang still bound between the pillars, still trying to get out of the chains. The scene changes again, to several exterior night shots of the fortress, culminating in a long shot of the Blue Spirit. The camera zooms in three step changes to a close-up of the Blue Spirit, who moves left. Cut to a view of the road leading to the fortress where a wagon is making its way toward the gate. Cut to a view of the undercarriage of the wagon as it passes. The Blue Spirit is holding on to the underside of the wagon. The wagon reaches the gate.
character_words: NA

full_text: All clear.
character_words: All clear.

full_text: A gate guard looks at the wagon and walks around it. When the guard checks the undercarriage, the Blue Spirit is gone. The guard gets back up. Cut to a wider shot of the wagon and the guards around it.
character_words: NA

full_text: All clear. Go on in.
character_words: All clear. Go on in.

full_text: Shift to a view from inside the wagon where the Blue Spirit has hidden himself; cut to an overhead shot of the wagon as it enters the first of the fortress' three gates. The shot pans up to rest on the massive central tower where Aang is held prisoner. Cut to a view of the first courtyard where the boxes in the wagon have been unloaded. The Blue Spirit runs from them and ducks into the shadows. Cut to a shot of an ornate balcony with bonfire pots on either side. The balcony is festooned with gold and red spades. Admiral Zhao appears flanked by attendants. During his speech the view cuts to show the innermost courtyard full of Fire Nation soldiers standing at attention.
character_words: NA

full_text: We are the sons and daughters of fire, the superior element! Until today only one thing stood our path to victory, the Avatar. I am here to tell you that he is now my prisoner! [The crowd cheers.] This is the year Sozin's Comet returns to grant us its power! [The crowd cheers.] This is the year the Fire Nation breaks through the walls of Ba Sing Se and burns the city to the ground!
character_words: We are the sons and daughters of fire, the superior element! Until today only one thing stood our path to victory, the Avatar. I am here to tell you that he is now my prisoner!  This is the year Sozin's Comet returns to grant us its power!  This is the year the Fire Nation breaks through the walls of Ba Sing Se and burns the city to the ground!

full_text: As Zhao speaks, various shots are seen of the Blue Spirit steadily and stealthily infiltrating the fortress. Cut back to Aang, still struggling fruitlessly against his chains. He finally stops, breathing heavily. It's useless. Suddenly, frogs start leaping out of his shirt.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To the frogs.] What? No! Don't leave, frogs! My friends are sick and they need you! Please go back to being frozen!
character_words: What? No! Don't leave, frogs! My friends are sick and they need you! Please go back to being frozen!

full_text:
He begins to struggle again as the frogs hop away toward the door, croaking. Cut to the four guards standing outside the chamber. They begin to look confused when they hear croaking. They look down to see the frogs coming from underneath the door. Suddenly they look up as a Fire Nation soldier's helmet comes bouncing down the corridor toward them. One of the guards walks up the corridor and turns right at the first junction, disappearing from view. A gout of flame erupts from the cross hallway as well as the sound of a brief scuffle. Two more guards go up to the junction and turn right, firebending stances at the ready. Cut to a view looking down the cross hallway. The first guard who went is hanging from the ceiling, tied up. Shift to the hanging soldier and pan up to reveal the Blue Spirit on the ceiling above the two new combatants. He drops down and melee begins, but it is over quickly. Cut back to the last guards, where they now see the Blue Spirit at the junction.
Cut to a view of the door to Aang's chamber. The lone guard grabs the alarm horn next to him, but a knife knocks it out of his hand. The guard lets loose a gout of flame at the Blue Spirit as he runs down the hall toward the door, but the intruder extinguishes the blast with a bucket of water, and proceeds to sweeps the guard's feet out from under him with the empty bucket. Cut to Aang still struggling inside the chamber. He stops and looks at the noises of violence coming from through door. These stop abruptly and are replaced by the sound of the lock turning in the door. The door opens and the Blue Spirit enters. He brandishes two curved swords and runs forward to Aang, who screams in fear. The Blue Spirit approaches and two sword cuts are heard. Aang pulls his arms back in surprise – the Blue Spirit has freed him. He looks at his liberator in wonder. The Blue Spirit comes closer and cuts his remaining bonds, turns and walks back toward the door.
character_words: NA

full_text: Who are you? What's going on? Are you here to rescue me? [The Blue Spirit opens the door and motions for him to follow.] I'll take that as a "yes."
character_words: Who are you? What's going on? Are you here to rescue me?  I'll take that as a "yes."

full_text: Aang follows him out past the gagged and tied guard at the door to his chamber. He hears frog noises and turns to see his half-frozen frogs crawling on the floor.
character_words: NA

full_text: My frogs! Come back! And stop thawing out! [The Blue Spirit comes back, picks him up by the collar and carries him out.] Wait! My friends need to suck on those frogs!
character_words: My frogs! Come back! And stop thawing out!  Wait! My friends need to suck on those frogs!

full_text: Meanwhile, back at the run-down temple, Momo has succeeded in piling up mountains of junk around Katara, but no water. Momo returns again with a crown.
character_words: NA

full_text: [With a weak, sickly voice.] How many times do I have to tell you, Momo? We need water, wa-ter. Oh forget it. Aang, please, hurry.
character_words: How many times do I have to tell you, Momo? We need water, wa-ter. Oh forget it. Aang, please, hurry.

full_text: [Delirious.] Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness? [Katara gets an annoyed look on her face.]
character_words: Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness?

full_text: Scene shifts back to a few exterior shots of the fortress before switching to Aang and the Blue Spirit walking silently in the sewer system underneath the fortress. Soldiers walk back and forth above them. They hope out of a grate and into one of the courtyards. Cut to Zhao walking in one of the torch-lit corridors of the fortress, followed by a scribe.
character_words: NA

full_text: I want a full transcription of my speech sent to the Fire Lord, along with glowing testimonials from all of the ranking officers present, and –
character_words: I want a full transcription of my speech sent to the Fire Lord, along with glowing testimonials from all of the ranking officers present, and –

full_text: He cuts himself off as he hears moans. Cut to Zhao's right, where the soldiers that the Blue Spirit tied still lie. Zhao, upset, slams open the door to Aang's prison cell. It is empty, except for a frog which croaks at him from the floor. Zhao turns in anger and leaves, the scribe in tow.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sir, should I hold off sending that speech to the Fire Lord?
character_words: Sir, should I hold off sending that speech to the Fire Lord?

full_text: Cut back to the two would-be escapees who are now scaling a rope on the innermost wall of the fortress. They are spotted and the view zooms out as one of the guards shouts.
character_words: NA

full_text: There, on the wall!
character_words: There, on the wall!

full_text: A soldier appears at the top of the wall they are climbing. He cuts the rope and the pair fall down the wall, Aang screaming. Cut to side-view where Aang airbends them to a soft landing. When the dust clears, the Blue Spirit unsheathes his swords and they run. Cut to Zhao on the ornate balcony.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Shouting.] The Avatar has escaped! Close all the gates immediately! [Cut to the escapees running, Aang passes the Blue Spirit.]
character_words: The Avatar has escaped! Close all the gates immediately!

full_text: Stay close to me!
character_words: Stay close to me!

full_text:
The third gate is closing in front of them, as are the two beyond it, and it is blocked by many soldiers. Aang airbends a blast of air that blows them out of the way. Aang makes for the gate, but the Blue Spirit gets involved in melee and has to stop and fend them off. Aang turns to see the Blue Spirit in trouble. He grabs a spear from a guard near him, airbends him out of the way, spins it around and breaks the head off the spear on the ground and launches back into battle to save his new friend. The gate closes behind him. The Blue Spirit is surrounded, but Aang airbends them all out of the way. With a mighty effort, he catapults the Blue Spirit to the top of the third wall.
He is instantly surrounded, but Aang appears using the stick as a helicopter blade. He plucks the Blue Spirit off the wall and heads into the next courtyard. Cut to a close-up of Aang struggling to keep them aloft. The Blue Spirit uses his swords to knock the spears sent up at them by the guards. They barely next the top of the next wall as they crash unceremoniously onto the battlement. Aang's stick goes spinning away as guards instantly rush them. Aang runs for his stick, but a guard stops him, taking several swings at Aang with his sword. The Blue Spirit throws the guard over the wall. Aang airbends the other guards off the wall.
Cut to a wide shot of the second wall, where more soldiers are scaling ladders. Aang and the Blue Spirit knock off the soldiers as they reach the top. With two mighty blasts, Aang depopulates the two scaling ladders nearest him as the Blue Spirit knocks the one final soldier off his. Aang brings over his two scaling ladders and steps onto the one the Blue Spirit has just emptied. He hands one ladder to the Blue Spirit.
character_words: NA

full_text: Take this. Jump on my back!
character_words: Take this. Jump on my back!

full_text: The Blue Spirit complies and Aang begins to use the ladders as massive stilts, shedding one each time a step is taken. Cut to a wide shot of the second courtyard, where dawn is approaching in the background. The first ladder shed still has some Fire Nation soldiers on it, but it falls into the dust.
character_words: NA

full_text: Give me the next one!
character_words: Give me the next one!

full_text: The Blue Spirit again complies. Cut to the bottom of their final stilt where a Fire Nation soldier sends a gout of flame up the ladder. It is too late though, as Aang and the masked man jump from the last stilt and just manage to grab the edge of the final wall. They are unable to hold on, however, and fall to the ground. The Blue Spirit draws his swords. Four firebenders unleash their flame on them, but Aang puts the masked man behind him and airbends the flames away.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hold your fire! The Avatar must be captured alive!
character_words: Hold your fire! The Avatar must be captured alive!

full_text: The Blue Spirit instantly comes up behind Aang and crosses his swords in front of Aang's throat, surprising him. Cut to a view behind the escapees that pans right slowly, accenting the stand-off, before cutting to the implacable blue mask of the intruder. Cut back to a close of Zhao's eyes.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Through gritted teeth.] Open the gate.
character_words: Open the gate.

full_text: Admiral, what are you doing?
character_words: Admiral, what are you doing?

full_text: Let them out, now!
character_words: Let them out, now!

full_text: The gate is opened and the Blue Spirit backs out with his captives, swords still at his throat. Cut back to Zhao, the officer questioning him still visible over his left shoulder.
character_words: NA

full_text: How could you let them go?
character_words: How could you let them go?

full_text: A situation like this requires ... precision.
character_words: A situation like this requires ... precision.

full_text: The Blue Spirit continues backing away from the fortress. Zhao now looks on from the top of the main gate. Cut to an arrow being strung on a bow by an unseen soldier; cut back to Zhao, who looks to his right as he speaks.
character_words: NA

full_text: Do you have a clear shot?
character_words: Do you have a clear shot?

full_text: Cut to a Yuyan Archer, who is silent, but aims.
character_words: NA

full_text: Knock out the thief. I'll deliver him to the Fire Lord along with the Avatar.
character_words: Knock out the thief. I'll deliver him to the Fire Lord along with the Avatar.

full_text: The archer releases his arrow, which the camera follows across the field to its impact point on the Blue Spirits masks. Cut to a side-view of Aang and the Blue Spirit as the masked man collapses backward in slow motion. Aang turns in horror, his eyes glazed. He recovers, turns around and airbends up a huge cloud of dust around him and the Blue Spirit.
character_words: NA

full_text: Quick! Recover the Avatar!
character_words: Quick! Recover the Avatar!

full_text: Cut to the main gate opening and a crowd Fire Nation soldiers emerging and running toward the dust cloud. Cut to inside the dust cloud, where Aang removes the Blue Spirit's mask to reveal Zuko. Aang starts back in horror and falls backward on the ground. He jumps up and runs away, but turns to look at Zuko, his eyes huge and full of compassion. He sees the Fire Nation soldiers getting close through the smoke. Still, he hesitates. When the dust clears, however, the soldiers find nothing. Cut back to Zhao, looking insanely angry. A frog hops up onto the railing, croaks, and hops off. Fade to white, followed by a blurry shot of a forest looking straight up into the canopy overhead. It is morning. The screen pans down to Aang sitting on a nearby root, the view is still blurry. He looks forlorn. Cut to Zuko, whose view we were clearly just seeing. He looks a bit dazed still.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To Zuko.] You know what the worst part of being born over a hundred years ago is? I miss all the friends I used to hang out with. Before the war started, I used to always visit my friend Kuzon. The two of us, we'd get in and out of so much trouble together. He was one of the best friends I ever had, and he was from the Fire Nation, just like you. If we knew each other back then, do you think we could have been friends, too?
character_words: You know what the worst part of being born over a hundred years ago is? I miss all the friends I used to hang out with. Before the war started, I used to always visit my friend Kuzon. The two of us, we'd get in and out of so much trouble together. He was one of the best friends I ever had, and he was from the Fire Nation, just like you. If we knew each other back then, do you think we could have been friends, too?

full_text: Cut to a wide shot of Zuko lying on the ground, Aang next to him, perched a large tree root. After a pause, Zuko lets loose a huge fireball at him, but Aang dodges and flies away on a current of air. Zuko watches him hop away from tree branch to tree branch and out sight. Cut to Zuko as the camera slowly zooms backward. Zuko raises his eye in consideration. Fade to a close-up of the swamp, where Aang is collecting frozen frogs once again. Cut back to a wide shot of Zuko's ship reeling in the cutter vessel back into the mother ship. Shift to Zuko, sullen, walking past his Uncle on the main deck.
character_words: NA

full_text: Where have you been, Prince Zuko? You missed music night! Lieutenant Jee sang a stirring love song.
character_words: Where have you been, Prince Zuko? You missed music night! Lieutenant Jee sang a stirring love song.

full_text: I'm going to bed. No disturbances.
character_words: I'm going to bed. No disturbances.

full_text: Iroh rubs his head and begins to blow his horn again. Fade back to the ruins. Aang returns, downcast. He puts frogs in his friends' mouths.
character_words: NA

full_text: Suck on these. They'll make you feel better.
character_words: Suck on these. They'll make you feel better.

full_text: Aang collapse backward onto Appa's tail with a sigh. Cut to Sokka with a frog in his mouth.
character_words: NA

full_text: [With his mouth full; still spouting out nonsense.] Aang, how was your trip? Did you make any new friends?
character_words: Aang, how was your trip? Did you make any new friends?

full_text: No, I don't think I did.
character_words: No, I don't think I did.

full_text: Aang rolls over. Fade to Prince Zuko lying awake in his own chamber, lost in thought. He looks at the Fire Nation symbol hanging on his wall, and rolls over himself. Cut back to the ruins and to Sokka, a happy expression on his face, still sucking on the frog in his mouth.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aang follows Aunt Wu out of the room and into her chamber. The chamber is a fairly spacious, dimly lit room. full_text: We used to have a tradition once a year of going up the mountain to check the volcano ourselves. [Smiles.] But every since Aunt Wu moved to the village twenty years ago, we have a tradition of not doing that.

full_text: Cuts to shot to shot of Appa flying through the clouds with Aang and Katara on his back, Aang at the reins, Katara seated in his saddle.

full_text: Clouds are made of water and air, so between the two of us, we ought to be able to bend them into any shape we want.

full_text: [Reading Aunt Wu's book.] I found it. The symbol for volcanic doom.

full_text: She turns the book around, but keeps her hand placed on the image for volcanic doom, obscuring the person's view of the symbol. A cloud passes over the screen, signaling the change of scene. The cloud cover clears, depicting both Aang and Katara standing on Appa's saddle. In synchronization, they raise their arms upward, preparing to shape the clouds. Cuts to shot of Appa sailing through the sky; he leans over on his side and sprawls out his legs, dipping into the clouds below. Cuts to shot of the villagers below, viewing the changing cloud formations. Cuts to shot of the clouds; Appa appears from beneath one of the clouds and flies upward, Aang and Katara seen mounted on his saddle. The bison emerges from the top of a cloud. Cuts to Katara, who swivels around, a smile spread across her face. Cuts to Aang, who swings his arms in a circular motion, using airbending to shape the formation. Cuts to shot of Appa flying in the sky that is now rapidly changing. Below, the villagers look up to see the clouds shifting. Sokka brings Aunt Wu over to her stage. He points to the sky.

full_text: Aunt Wu, look! Something is happening in the clouds.

full_text: Cut to a view of the new skull-shaped cloud that Aang and Katara formed. Cut to a view of a mountain spewing smoke into the air. The screen pans down to the village before cutting to a shot where Aang is addressing the crowds.

full_text: If any of you are earthbenders, come with me.

full_text: The crowd disperses very fast, now desperate to put Sokka's plan into action. A few cries of urgency are uttered. Cut to overhead shot of the ground outside the town during twilight, a deep trench is beginning to form. Team Avatar and the town's people labor to dig the trench, using both earthbending and manual means. Cuts to shot of two earthbenders, who make motions with their arms and legs. Cuts to overhead shot of a portion of the trench as two large boulders are cleared out of the way. Cuts to shot from inside the trench as villagers continue their labor; Appa is seen transporting loose boulders from the scene, using a net attached to his body. Another explosion makes a cut to the mountain again, now lava is spewing out.

full_text: [Resuming work.] Dig faster! Dig faster!
character_words: Dig faster! Dig faster!

full_text: As lava begins to flow down the volcano in the background, the shot cuts to Poi as he runs and sweeps his arms forward. Cuts to overhead shot of the trench, the bank of the river lying just ahead. A torrent of boulders is cleared and sent down the river as Poi creates a channel toward the river. Cuts to shot of the villagers standing inside the trench. Aang leaps onto the edge of the trench. In the background, the lava steadily creeps further down the mountain toward the village.
