full_text: Everyone needs to evacuate! We'll come for you when it's safe!
character_words: Everyone needs to evacuate! We'll come for you when it's safe!

full_text: Everyone runs. Momo arrives and puts a small rock on the edge of the trench and lands on Aang, who pets him before also running away from the edge. Cut to the volcano as lava is erupting from its peak. A stream of stream of the burning liquid is coursing down the mountain and into the forest. The scene cuts to Aang, Sokka, and Katara; their faces illuminated by the approaching lava as they watch anxiously, ash falling down upon them. The scene switches to a view of the village gate. An eerie reddish light emerges from the forest with its source, the approaching lava, close behind. As it passes the gate, the burning substance causes the structure to catch fire and crumble down. Unwavering and all-consuming, the lava continuous its descent through the cemetery, destroying several headstones as it passes. Reaching the trench, the lava falls in the ditch, though the steady incoming river of lava quickly threatens to overflow the trench. Cut to the group on the safe side of the trench.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's too much! It's gonna overflow!
character_words: It's too much! It's gonna overflow!

full_text: Another explosion rocks the village. Cut to the volcano, where a huge column of lava and smoke explodes out of the peak. Burning rocks begin to rain down in addition to the ash. Katara and Sokka begin to run for safety but turn to see Aang has not moved. A huge boulder falls out of the sky and lands in the trench, throwing up a fountain of lava. A massive wave of lava begins to head toward the village. Cut to Aang, who is rushing forward with a furious face. He propels himself into the air and begins to airbend. As the lava begins to overflow, Aang blows the lava straight up, not allowing it to advance on the village. Finally, he draws in a mighty intake of breath and expels it, airbending it as it exits, cooling all the lava to stone. Aang relaxes and assumes a meditation pose. Cut to Katara and Sokka watching in surprise, their backs to the camera.
character_words: NA

full_text: Man, sometimes I forget what a powerful bender that kid is. [Katara's expression changes at this, remembering Aunt Wu's words about her future marriage.]
character_words: Man, sometimes I forget what a powerful bender that kid is.

full_text: Wait, what did you just say?
character_words: Wait, what did you just say?

full_text: [Casually.] Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender.
character_words: Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender.

full_text: Cut to Katara's and Sokka's view of Aang and back to shot of Katara.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Slowly widens her eyes in realization; as if having an epiphany.] I suppose he is.
character_words: I suppose he is.

full_text: Cuts to the volcano, smoking, but no longer erupting. Cuts to a view of the square where Aunt Wu and the town's people, including the Calm man, have assembled. A tall, jagged wall-like formation of cooled lava towers over the square. Aang stands in front of Aunt Wu, offering her back the cloud book he took.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sheepishly.] By the way, we kind of borrowed your book.
character_words: By the way, we kind of borrowed your book.

full_text: So you messed with the clouds, did you?
character_words: So you messed with the clouds, did you?

full_text: Wu grabs the book in anger while Katara looks guilty and Sokka smiles and points at her, indicating that she had a part in the cloud manipulation, too.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Laughs in amusement.] Very clever!
character_words: Very clever!

full_text: No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortune telling.
character_words: No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortune telling.

full_text: [Cheerfully.] But Aunt Wu predicted the village wouldn't be destroyed and it wasn't. She was right, after all.
character_words: But Aunt Wu predicted the village wouldn't be destroyed and it wasn't. She was right, after all.

full_text: [Gets near the Calm man's face, through gritted teeth.] I hate you.
character_words: I hate you.

full_text: [Holding Sokka by the shoulders and leading him away.] It's okay, Sokka. Everything's going to be all right.
character_words: It's okay, Sokka. Everything's going to be all right.

full_text: Cuts to a shot of Aang and Wu.
character_words: NA

full_text: Can I ask you something?
character_words: Can I ask you something?

full_text: Of course, honey.
character_words: Of course, honey.

full_text: [Disappointed.] You didn't really see love in my fortune, did you? You just told me what I wanted to hear.
character_words: You didn't really see love in my fortune, did you? You just told me what I wanted to hear.

full_text: I'll tell you a little secret, young airbender. [Gestures to the sky.] Just as you reshaped those clouds, [Cuts to shot of Aang, who smiles; off-camera.] you have the power to shape your own destiny.
character_words: I'll tell you a little secret, young airbender.  Just as you reshaped those clouds,  you have the power to shape your own destiny.

full_text: Aang smiles. Cut to shot of Appa and Team Avatar. Meng stands in front of Appa. Aang airbends himself onto Appa's saddles; Katara is at the reins.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Brightly.] Goodbye everyone! It was so nice to meet you! [To Meng.] Take care, Meng.
character_words: Goodbye everyone! It was so nice to meet you!  Take care, Meng.

full_text: [Waving.] Take care! [Appa turns away. Cuts to Meng's face, whose smile disappears and is replaced by a frown.] Floozy.
character_words: Take care!  Floozy.

full_text: Fades to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text: The episode opens up to a body of water, waves crashing against the rocks. The camera cuts to grass and sticks, before slowly panning up to reveal a whale tooth scimitar standing upright in the ground. Aang's hand comes into view as he grasps the weapon's hilt and yanks it out of the ground. Cut to a shot of him holding it up while Sokka slides down a dirt slope.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, look! [Examines the sword.] A sword made out of a whale's tooth.
character_words: Hey, look!  A sword made out of a whale's tooth.

full_text: While Aang draws the weapon free from the ground, Sokka slides down the slope and pulls up behind the Avatar, snatching the weapon from his hands as Aang turned to show it to him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Let me see that.
character_words: Let me see that.

full_text: Sokka walks on for a little while, before he stops, not too far from Aang, to study the weapon closely. Cut to a shot of the scimitar in his hand. The scene switches into a flashback; Southern Water Tribe warriors are preparing their ships, loading them with supplies. The camera pans to the left as a warrior walks past, carrying a bundle, revealing that a younger Sokka is observing them, his back to the camera. Cuts to frontal shot of him as he looks at the scene wistfully, cradling his battle club. Flashback fades to present-day, where Sokka bears the same wistful expression while holding the whale's tooth scimitar in the same way as his club.
character_words: NA

full_text: This is a Water Tribe weapon. [Turns to Aang, his expression serious.] See if you can find anything else.
character_words: This is a Water Tribe weapon.  See if you can find anything else.

full_text: Cuts to shot of Aang and Sokka searching the wooded area for more weapons. Katara walks toward them, curious.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Curiously.] Did someone lose something?
character_words: Did someone lose something?

full_text: [Rummaging through the bushes; somewhat cheerfully.] No, we found something!
character_words: No, we found something!

full_text: Cut to shot of a spearhead lying on the ground beneath a few fallen leaves. Sokka kneels before it, brushes aside the debris and picks up the spearhead, examining it and running his fingers along its point, noticing ash on it.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's burned. [Cut to shot of a tree trunk, scorch marks and sharp cuts running across its bark. Cut to shot of Sokka and the others.] There was a battle! Water Tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders. [He turns away from the tree and looking down the slope of the hill seeing a black spot on the ground.] The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill.
character_words: It's burned.  There was a battle! Water Tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders.  The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill.

full_text: Cut to shot of Sokka racing down the hill along a dirt path, the camera panning downward. He leaps over a few large rocks in his way and continues forward. Cuts to shot of a sandy beach. Sokka appears on screen followed closely by Aang and Katara.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Intrigued.] So, then what happened?
character_words: So, then what happened?

full_text: [Disappointed.] I don't know. The trail ends here.
character_words: I don't know. The trail ends here.

full_text: [Pointing at something in the distance.] Wait, look! [Cut to shot of a Water Tribe ship, half obscured behind large rocks, sitting idly on the shore.]
character_words: Wait, look!

full_text: [Happily.] It's one of our boats!
character_words: It's one of our boats!

full_text: Is this dad's boat? [She and Sokka run toward it. Cut to shot of entire ship as they approach.]
character_words: Is this dad's boat?

full_text: No, but it's from his fleet. [Strokes the boat off, while Aang appears behind them.] Dad was here. [Turns to Katara.]
character_words: No, but it's from his fleet.  Dad was here.

full_text: The scene changes to a close-up of Iroh sipping a cup of tea, with a relaxed expression on his face.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Exhaling.] Aahh! [Cuts to shot of entire room where he and Zuko are seated at a low-lying table.] See Prince Zuko, a moment of quiet is good for your mental well-being. [Pours Zuko a cup of tea.]
character_words: Aahh!  See Prince Zuko, a moment of quiet is good for your mental well-being.

full_text: Zuko raises the cup to take a sip, but the ship suddenly jerks; the vibrations cause the tea in the cup to go flying, soaking Zuko's face and hair. Zuko grunts in frustration, pushes his ponytail back, and rises to see what the commotion is about. Cut to the deck of the ship, several firebenders stand poised, ready to attack. A large beast, called a shirshu, suddenly leaps onto the deck, a young woman mounted on its back. The firebenders flee from the beast. Cuts to closer-up shot of the woman, who slows down the beast's progress.
character_words: NA

full_text: Look out! Argh!
character_words: Look out! Argh!

full_text: [Holding a rolled up whip.] Get back! We're after a stowaway! [Cut to overhead shot of the ship's deck.]
character_words: Get back! We're after a stowaway!

full_text: [Arrives with Iroh.] There are no stowaways on my ship.
character_words: There are no stowaways on my ship.

full_text:
Cuts to shot of Nyla, the shirshu, who tears off a chunk of the metal deck flooring and hurls it in Zuko's direction. Alarmed, the prince ducks for cover, the firebenders and Iroh move to the side, and the metal piece hits the doorway leading to the main compartments of the ship with a clang as they turn around to watch it hit the door. Zuko looks on in frustration while the firebenders and Iroh take a firebending stance.
Cut to shot of the interior of the ship, a gaping hole present where the metal flooring once was. Nyla sticks his head inside and begins sniffing around. Cut to shot from his point of view, the scenery slightly warped and in black-and-white to reflect how he envisions things. A stream of green is visible, drifting through the air. The camera pans right and left as the beast surveys the entire room. It focuses on a single barrel which topples over, revealing that a strange man has been hiding in there. Cut to a shot above the deck where Nyla raises his head out of the hole. The stowaway appears, dashing away from the scene. Nyla shoots forward in hot pursuit of him. Cut to side-view of the man trying to flee; Nyla appears on-camera and lashes out his elongated tongue. Close-up of the tongue striking the man who falls onto the deck, paralyzed, and with a terrified look on his face.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Shocked.] He's paralyzed.
character_words: He's paralyzed.

full_text: Only temporarily. [Lifts the man and slings him over her shoulder.] The toxins will wear off in about an hour. But by then, he'll be in jail and I'll have my money. [Walks to Nyla.]
character_words: Only temporarily.  The toxins will wear off in about an hour. But by then, he'll be in jail and I'll have my money.

full_text: But how did you find him on my ship?
character_words: But how did you find him on my ship?

full_text: [Prepares to mount Nyla, the stowaway already slung onto his back.] My shirshu can smell a rat a continent away. [Mounts her shirshu.]
character_words: My shirshu can smell a rat a continent away.

full_text: Well, I'm impressed. [June cracks her whip. Cuts to shot of the shirshu bolting off the ship and racing down the dock.] Very impressed. [Leaning over the ledge of the ship with Zuko, stroking his beard thoughtfully; Zuko look at him, disgusted.]
character_words: Well, I'm impressed.  Very impressed.

full_text: The scene changes to that night, the camera panning downward to show that Team Avatar has settled down for the night beside the Water Tribe ship. Cut to shot of Appa. Aang and Momo are lying on his right paw, all three fast asleep. The camera pans left, showing Katara having also drifted off in her sleeping bag. Sokka remains awake, poking a stick into a blazing campfire, looking worried. Cut to side-shot of him; the scene fades to the flashback seen earlier. A younger Sokka is seen walking by, carrying a large bundle in his arms, wearing face-paint. Cut to a shot of Hakoda standing beside a ship, having handed a bundle to a man in the ship. He turns and walks forward. Cut to a shot of Sokka who has halted in his tracks, his father approaching him and standing before his son.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sokka.
character_words: Sokka.

full_text: I'm coming with you.
character_words: I'm coming with you.

full_text: You're not old enough to go to war, Sokka, you know that.
character_words: You're not old enough to go to war, Sokka, you know that.

full_text: [Desperately.] I'm strong, I'm brave, I can fight! Please, Dad!
character_words: I'm strong, I'm brave, I can fight! Please, Dad!

full_text: [Lays a hand on his son's shoulder; grimly and sadly.] Being a man is knowing where you're needed the most. And for you right now, that's here, protecting your sister.
character_words: Being a man is knowing where you're needed the most. And for you right now, that's here, protecting your sister.

full_text: I don't understand. [His eyes glisten.]
character_words: I don't understand.

full_text: Someday you will. [Sokka throws aside his bag and throws himself into his father's arms. Cut to close-up of him as he sobs and buries his face in his father's parka.] I'm gonna miss you so much.
character_words: Someday you will.  I'm gonna miss you so much.

full_text: The scene fades back to present day, Sokka still looking sullenly into the fire. Suddenly a strange noise can be heard, its source originating from somewhere off-camera.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Alert.] Who's there? [Stands up, boomerang in hand.]
character_words: Who's there?

full_text: Cut to a shot of the campsite from several feet away. A pair of boots appears in front of the camera. Cut to shot of a man, hailing from the Water Tribe with white bandages wrapped around the upper left portion of his torso, stepping out of the shadows. He is clearly surprised to see them.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sokka?
character_words: Sokka?

full_text: [Quizzically, raising an eyebrow.] Bato? [Spirited.]
character_words: Bato?

full_text: [Having awoken, along with Katara.] Who the what now?
character_words: Who the what now?

full_text: [Cheerfully.] Bato!
character_words: Bato!

full_text: [Cuts to side-shot of Bato, Sokka running over to him, followed closely by Katara.] Sokka! Katara! It is so good to see you two. [Hugs Katara and Sokka.] You've grown so much! [Aang follows them, but remains standing a few feet away.]
character_words: Sokka! Katara! It is so good to see you two.  You've grown so much!

full_text: [Bows in greeting.] Hi, I'm Aang.
character_words: Hi, I'm Aang.

full_text: Where's Dad?
character_words: Where's Dad?

full_text: Is he here?
character_words: Is he here?

full_text: No, he and the other warriors should be in the Eastern Earth Kingdom by now. [Both siblings look crestfallen at this news. A gust of wind blows, causing them to shiver. Cut to a shot of Bato who shivers as well.] This is no place for a reunion. Let's get inside.
character_words: No, he and the other warriors should be in the Eastern Earth Kingdom by now.  This is no place for a reunion. Let's get inside.

full_text: He turns and slings his arms around Sokka and Katara, leading them away. After a moment, he looks back at Aang and gestures for him to follow. Cut to an overhead shot of the shore, the campsite in the distance, as the group begins walking away. The scene cuts to a different location altogether, the moon hanging in a purplish-blue night sky. The camera pans downward to show the roof over of the entrance to an open courtyard. Cut to a shot inside the courtyard, a few nuns milling about, Appa and the group approaching.
character_words: NA

full_text: After I was wounded, your father carried me to this abbey. The sisters have cared for me ever since. Superior, [A woman turns around.] these are Hakoda's children. They've been traveling with the Avatar. I found them by my boat.
character_words: After I was wounded, your father carried me to this abbey. The sisters have cared for me ever since. Superior,  these are Hakoda's children. They've been traveling with the Avatar. I found them by my boat.

full_text: Young Avatar, it gives me great joy to be in your presence. Welcome to our abbey.
character_words: Young Avatar, it gives me great joy to be in your presence. Welcome to our abbey.

full_text: Thank you, it's truly an honor to be here. If there's anything- [Sokka abruptly cuts him off.]
character_words: Thank you, it's truly an honor to be here. If there's anything-

full_text: What smells so good, Bato?
character_words: What smells so good, Bato?

full_text: [Sniffs.] The sisters craft ointments and perfumes.
character_words: The sisters craft ointments and perfumes.

full_text: Perfume? [Pointing his thumbs at Appa.] Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much. [Waves his hand in front of his face.] Am I right? [Everyone is silent, a single person coughs.]
character_words: Perfume?  Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much.  Am I right?

full_text: You have your father's wit.
character_words: You have your father's wit.

full_text: The scene cuts to the hut in which Bato is staying, with a tent on the opposite side of the door being the bed chamber, a fire with cousins in the middle, and various pelts placed and hung everywhere.
character_words: NA

full_text: Bato, it looks like home! [Bato, Katara, Sokka, and Aang file inside.]
character_words: Bato, it looks like home!

full_text: Everything's here, even the pelts!
character_words: Everything's here, even the pelts!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, nothing's cozier than dead animal skins.
character_words: Yeah, nothing's cozier than dead animal skins.

full_text: Momo leaps from Aang's arms and starts hitting the head of a bear pelt. The bear's mouth closes, Momo is alarmed a retreats back to Aang. Katara and Sokka are by the fire. Katara opens the lid of a pot cooking over the fire as Bato joins them.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Surprised and delighted.] No way! Stewed sea prunes!
character_words: No way! Stewed sea prunes!

full_text: Help yourself!
character_words: Help yourself!

full_text: Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things!
character_words: Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things!

full_text: Aang takes a bowl of stewed sea prunes and sniffs it, but looks away in disgust and sets it to the side.
character_words: NA

full_text: Bato, is it true that you and dad lassoed an arctic hippo?
character_words: Bato, is it true that you and dad lassoed an arctic hippo?

full_text: It was your father's idea, he just dragged me along. Well, the hippo did the dragging! [Momo, sitting by Aang, starts to eat the stewed sea prunes that Aang set aside, but ends up spitting it out.]
character_words: It was your father's idea, he just dragged me along. Well, the hippo did the dragging!

full_text: [Sokka and Katara are slurping their stewed sea prunes as Aang speaks.] Hey, I ride animals, too! There was this one time when I rode a giant eel and I-
character_words: Hey, I ride animals, too! There was this one time when I rode a giant eel and I-

full_text: [Cutting Aang off.] So, who was it that came up with the Great Blubber Fiasco?
character_words: So, who was it that came up with the Great Blubber Fiasco?

full_text: [Chuckles to himself.] You knew about that?
character_words: You knew about that?

full_text: Everyone does!
character_words: Everyone does!

full_text: [Curiously.] What's that story?
character_words: What's that story?

full_text: [Waving Aang off.] It's a long one Aang, some other time.
character_words: It's a long one Aang, some other time.

full_text: [To Bato.] You and Dad had so many hilarious adventures.
character_words: You and Dad had so many hilarious adventures.

full_text: Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny in hindsight. [Chuckling.] Hey, Aang! Please put that down, [Aang is shown wearing a fur pelt on his head.] it's ceremonial and very fragile. [Aang puts the pelt back on the wall, and sits in the back of the room.]
character_words: Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny in hindsight.  Hey, Aang! Please put that down,  it's ceremonial and very fragile.

full_text: Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit?
character_words: Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit?

full_text: Your dad wore the octopus, [Lowers his voice.] but I did the spooky voice.
character_words: Your dad wore the octopus,  but I did the spooky voice.

full_text: The scene cuts to a seedy tavern in the Earth Kingdom. A man is thrown through the roof and land of the ground. Cut to a snake tattoo on a woman's arm. The camera zooms out, showing that it is June's tattoo. She calmly arm-wrestles a man, who gnashes his teeth and sweats. The shot changes to the back of the crowd where Zuko arrives.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Annoyed.] Out of my way! [Pushing a man out of the way.] Step aside, filth!
character_words: Out of my way!  Step aside, filth!

full_text: [Apologetically.] He means no offense! I'm certain you bathe regularly!
character_words: He means no offense! I'm certain you bathe regularly!

full_text: Zuko approaches June, who is still arm wrestling. Iroh reaches her as well.
character_words: NA

full_text: I need to talk to you!
character_words: I need to talk to you!

full_text: Well, if it isn't my new friends: Angry Boy and Uncle Lazy.
character_words: Well, if it isn't my new friends: Angry Boy and Uncle Lazy.

full_text: Her opponent strains to get the upper hand. Iroh laughs at her remark and June wins her match without breaking a sweat. The crowd cheers and throws money at the winner.
character_words: NA

full_text: Your beast trashed my ship. You have to pay me back!
character_words: Your beast trashed my ship. You have to pay me back!

full_text: [As she collects her winnings.] Well, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money. [To the crowd.] Drinks on me! [The crowd cheers.]
character_words: Well, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money.  Drinks on me!

full_text: June moves to take sip of her drink, but Zuko grabs her wrist in anger.
character_words: NA

full_text: Money isn't what I had in mind.
character_words: Money isn't what I had in mind.

full_text: Cut to moths flying around a lantern.
character_words: NA

full_text: I need you to find someone. [Cut to Katara's necklace.]
character_words: I need you to find someone.

full_text: Shot changes to show June leaning on Nyla while Iroh and Zuko stand in front of June.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sarcastically.] What happened, your girlfriend run off on you?
character_words: What happened, your girlfriend run off on you?

full_text: It's not the girl I'm after, it's the bald monk she's traveling with.
character_words: It's not the girl I'm after, it's the bald monk she's traveling with.

full_text: [Unamused.] Whatever you say.
character_words: Whatever you say.

full_text: If you find them, I'll consider the damage to my ship paid for.
character_words: If you find them, I'll consider the damage to my ship paid for.

full_text: [Scoffs.] Heh, forget it. [She starts to climb her saddle.]
character_words: Heh, forget it.

full_text: Plus, we'll pay your weight in gold.
character_words: Plus, we'll pay your weight in gold.

full_text: [Stops and widens her eyes in surprise. She smiles. Cut to a side-shot of June walking over to Iroh.] Make it your [Pokes his stomach.] weight, and we gotta deal.
character_words: Make it your  weight, and we gotta deal.

full_text: [Laughs with his hand on his stomach.] You got it!
character_words: You got it!

full_text: [As she turns back to Nyla.] Get on!
character_words: Get on!

full_text: June takes Katara's necklace from Zuko, and shows it to Nyla. The camera shows the surroundings through Nyla's sight. As the shirshu looks around, the colored scents of humans are shown. Nyla soon finds Katara's purple scent on the necklace, and the threesome head off. The scene changes to an aerial shot of the abbey, and cuts to inside Bato's room.
character_words: NA

full_text: There's something I should tell you kids. I'm expecting a message from your father. [Aang is shown with his eyes closed, excluded from the group.]
character_words: There's something I should tell you kids. I'm expecting a message from your father.

full_text: [Excited.] Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: [Slightly demanding.] When?
character_words: When?

full_text: Any day now. Your father said he'd send a message when they found the rendezvous point. If you wait until the message arrives, you can come with me, and see your father again.
character_words: Any day now. Your father said he'd send a message when they found the rendezvous point. If you wait until the message arrives, you can come with me, and see your father again.

full_text: Aang looks toward his friends with a sad and worried look.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's been over two years since we've seen Dad. That would be so incredible! Katara!
character_words: It's been over two years since we've seen Dad. That would be so incredible! Katara!

full_text: I do really miss him, it would be great to see Dad. [Aang gets up to leave, but no one notices him.]
character_words: I do really miss him, it would be great to see Dad.

full_text: It's been far too long, hasn't it? [As Aang leaves.] I'm not sure when word will arrive, but when it does-
character_words: It's been far too long, hasn't it?  I'm not sure when word will arrive, but when it does-

full_text: Aang closes the door and heads toward the abbey gate. Cut back to inside Bato's room.
character_words: NA

full_text: It would be great, but we can't. We have to take Aang to the North Pole first.
character_words: It would be great, but we can't. We have to take Aang to the North Pole first.

full_text: Even if we do have time to wait for the message, who knows how far we'd have to travel. We don't have time for a long detour.
character_words: Even if we do have time to wait for the message, who knows how far we'd have to travel. We don't have time for a long detour.

full_text: I'm sure your father would understand, and be proud that his children are helping the Avatar.
character_words: I'm sure your father would understand, and be proud that his children are helping the Avatar.

full_text: The scene cuts to footprints on the beach at night. The camera pans upward to reveal Aang sitting on the bow of Bato's boat.
character_words: NA

full_text: I can't believe they would leave me.
character_words: I can't believe they would leave me.

full_text: An ostrich horse can be heard coming. A messenger arrives.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm looking for Bato of the Water Tribe.
character_words: I'm looking for Bato of the Water Tribe.

full_text: Uhhh, I know Bato!
character_words: Uhhh, I know Bato!

full_text: Make sure he gets this! [Hands Aang the scroll and rides away.]
character_words: Make sure he gets this!

full_text: Aang curiously unravels at the message, finding that it is actually a map.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's the map to Sokka and Katara's dad!
character_words: It's the map to Sokka and Katara's dad!

full_text: Aang's curious look changes to frustration as he crumples the map and stuffs it inside his clothes. Shot changes to a further distance of Aang sitting on the boat. Cut to an aerial shot of the abbey. Cut to a door which Aang opens.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey everyone! Sorry I was gone so long.
character_words: Hey everyone! Sorry I was gone so long.

full_text: [Turns to face him.] Hey, Aang, I didn't notice you left.
character_words: Hey, Aang, I didn't notice you left.

full_text: Yup, but now I'm back. [Sitting down.] Sure could go for some delicious sea prunes!
character_words: Yup, but now I'm back.  Sure could go for some delicious sea prunes!

full_text: Aang quickly takes some bites of sea prunes, but chokes them back up, yet he pretends to enjoy them. Katara, Bato, and Sokka look at him strangely. The scene changes to the herbalist's home that Aang visited to find a cure to Katara and Sokka's sickness in the past. Nyla growl can be heard, to which Miyuki hisses. The herbalist turns around to find Nyla, June, Zuko, and Iroh.
character_words: NA

full_text: Out for a bit of fresh air, are we?
character_words: Out for a bit of fresh air, are we?

full_text: We're looking for someone.
character_words: We're looking for someone.

full_text: I hope it's not Miyuki [To Miyuki.] Miyuki, did you get in trouble with the Fire Nation, again? [Miyuki meows.]
character_words: I hope it's not Miyuki  Miyuki, did you get in trouble with the Fire Nation, again?

full_text: The Avatar's been through here. Let's keep moving.
character_words: The Avatar's been through here. Let's keep moving.

full_text: Cut to an aerial shot of the abbey. The shot changes to show Aang airbending a pile of hay to Appa. As he finishes his form, the map falls out of his sleeve.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aha! I caught you. [Picks up the crumpled paper as Aang looks at her nervously.] You should be ashamed of yourself ... Littering in the courtyard.
character_words: Aha! I caught you.  You should be ashamed of yourself ... Littering in the courtyard.

full_text: [Takes back the crumpled paper.] I'm sorry, I'll take care of this. [Bows. As Mother Superior walks away, Aang stuffs the map back up his sleeve.]
character_words: I'm sorry, I'll take care of this.

full_text: The scene cuts to Bato's ship the next day. Bato, Sokka, Katara, and Aang are seen walking toward it.
character_words: NA

full_text: This ship is sentimental to me. It was built by my father.
character_words: This ship is sentimental to me. It was built by my father.

full_text: Aang looks down at the ground, noticing the tracks from the messenger's ostrich horse are still visible. He airbends the sand to cover the tracks and whistles nonchalantly. Aang walks up to Bato.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To Bato.] Is this the boat he took you ice dodging in?
character_words: Is this the boat he took you ice dodging in?

full_text: Yep! It's got the scar to prove it. Ha. How 'bout you Sokka? You must have some good stories from your first time ice dodging. [Sokka begins to look saddened.]
character_words: Yep! It's got the scar to prove it. Ha. How 'bout you Sokka? You must have some good stories from your first time ice dodging.

full_text: He never got to go. Dad left before he was old enough.
character_words: He never got to go. Dad left before he was old enough.

full_text: Oh, I forgot you were too young.
character_words: Oh, I forgot you were too young.

full_text: What's ice dodging?
character_words: What's ice dodging?

full_text: It's a rite of passage for young Water Tribe members. When you turn fourteen, your dad takes you- [Bato smile and puts his hand on Sokka's shoulder with a new thought.] You know what, you're about to find out!
character_words: It's a rite of passage for young Water Tribe members. When you turn fourteen, your dad takes you-  You know what, you're about to find out!

full_text: June, Zuko, and Iroh followed Katara's trail to the Makapu Village. As citizens flee from Nyla in terror, he stops in front of Aunt Wu's shop. Wu remains outside her shop, completely calm.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Annoyed.] Why are we stopping?
character_words: Why are we stopping?

full_text: Because the girl must have spent a lot of time here.
character_words: Because the girl must have spent a lot of time here.

full_text: We have no time for this!
character_words: We have no time for this!

full_text: Zuko gets off Nyla and hangs the necklace in front of his face. Nyla appears agitated and he snaps at Zuko, who swiftly ducks down.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey! Watch it!
character_words: Hey! Watch it!

full_text: [As Iroh laughs from behind her.] Oh look, he likes you!
character_words: Oh look, he likes you!

full_text: Aunt Wu approaches Iroh, still calm.
character_words: NA

full_text: Care to hear your fortune, handsome?
character_words: Care to hear your fortune, handsome?

full_text: At my age, there's really only one big surprise left, and I'd just as soon leave it a mystery.
character_words: At my age, there's really only one big surprise left, and I'd just as soon leave it a mystery.

full_text: The threesome leave on Nyla, and the scene cuts back to Bato's ship, which is now sailing close to shore.
character_words: NA

full_text: Ice dodging is a ceremonial test of wisdom, bravery, and trust. [Shot changes to on the boat.] In our village, ice dodging was done by weaving a boat through a field of icebergs.
character_words: Ice dodging is a ceremonial test of wisdom, bravery, and trust.  In our village, ice dodging was done by weaving a boat through a field of icebergs.

full_text: How are we supposed to ice dodge without ice?
character_words: How are we supposed to ice dodge without ice?

full_text: You'll be dodging those. [Points to a group of tall, sharp, jagged rocks near the shore. Katara and Sokka appear nervous.] Sokka, you steer and call the shots, lead wisely. Katara, you secure the main sail. [Katara grabs a rope.] The winds can be brutal, so be brave. Aang, you control the jib. Without your steady hand, we all go down. Your position is about trust.
character_words: You'll be dodging those.  Sokka, you steer and call the shots, lead wisely. Katara, you secure the main sail.  The winds can be brutal, so be brave. Aang, you control the jib. Without your steady hand, we all go down. Your position is about trust.

full_text: [Blinks. Defensively.] I know that. Why wouldn't I know that? [Folds his arms.] I'm the Avatar; I know about trust. [He crosses his arms and looks away, but gives Bato a second glance.]
character_words: I know that. Why wouldn't I know that?  I'm the Avatar; I know about trust.

full_text: For this is to be done right, I cannot help. [Sits cross-legged at the front of the boat.] You pass or fail on your own.
character_words: For this is to be done right, I cannot help.  You pass or fail on your own.

full_text: [Studies the rocky shores.] Aang, ease up on the jib. Katara, steady. [Katara looks at the shore with concern.] Aang, less sail. Katara, give him room. [The ship moves to the side and sails between some rocks.] Aang, helm to lee. Helm to lee!
character_words: Aang, ease up on the jib. Katara, steady.  Aang, less sail. Katara, give him room.  Aang, helm to lee. Helm to lee!

full_text: What does that even mean?
character_words: What does that even mean?

full_text: The waves knock Bato around. Sokka struggles while Katara and Aang close their eyes. The shot changes to show the boat pass between more rocks.
character_words: NA

full_text: Great job!
character_words: Great job!

full_text: Katara and Aang smile. Aerial shot of the boat heading toward a large bundle of rocks.
character_words: NA

full_text: There's no way through!
character_words: There's no way through!

full_text: We can make it.
character_words: We can make it.

full_text: [Stands up and grabs the side of the boat.] Sokka, you've already proven yourself. Maybe we should-
character_words: Sokka, you've already proven yourself. Maybe we should-

full_text: Aang, I'm gonna need air in that sail. [Aang nods.] Katara, I want you to bend as much water as you can between us and those rocks. Now!
character_words: Aang, I'm gonna need air in that sail.  Katara, I want you to bend as much water as you can between us and those rocks. Now!

full_text: Katara bends the water below the boat while Aang fires airbending blasts at the sail. Sokka groans nervously as the boat clears the rocks. When they reach clear water, Sokka sighs and relaxes. The rest of the group smiles at him. Fade to an aerial shot of Bato's boat beached on the shore. Shot changes to Bato carrying a small cup of purple paint.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Dips his fingers in the paint.] The spirits of water bear witness to these marks. For Sokka, the Mark of the Wise. [Uses his thumb to put an arc and small dot on Sokka's forehead.] The same mark your father earned. For Katara, [Uses his thumb to put a crescent moon mark on Katara's forehead.] the Mark of the Brave. Your courage inspires us. [Using his thumb to put an arc on Aang's forehead.] And for Aang, the Mark of the Trusted. You are now an honorary member of the Water Tribe.
character_words: The spirits of water bear witness to these marks. For Sokka, the Mark of the Wise.  The same mark your father earned. For Katara,  the Mark of the Brave. Your courage inspires us.  And for Aang, the Mark of the Trusted. You are now an honorary member of the Water Tribe.

full_text: I can't. [Looks down.]
character_words: I can't.

full_text: Of course you can!
character_words: Of course you can!

full_text: [Rubbing off his mark and backing away.] No, you can't trust me.
character_words: No, you can't trust me.

full_text: [Concerned.] Aang, what are you talking about?
character_words: Aang, what are you talking about?

full_text: [Takes the crumpled map out of his sleeve.] A messenger gave this to me for Bato. [Katara takes it from him.] You have to understand. I was afraid you would-
character_words: A messenger gave this to me for Bato.  You have to understand. I was afraid you would-

full_text: [Angrily.] This is the map to our father! You had it the whole time? How could you? [Aang shrugs his shoulders.] Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own. I'm going to find Dad. [Walks away.]
character_words: This is the map to our father! You had it the whole time? How could you?  Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own. I'm going to find Dad.

full_text: Well, Sokka. I think you should-
character_words: Well, Sokka. I think you should-

full_text: [Turns back.] Katara, are you with me?
character_words: Katara, are you with me?

full_text: [Turns to look at Aang and closes her eyes.] I'm with you Sokka.
character_words: I'm with you Sokka.

full_text: Aang sadly looks at Sokka, Katara, and Bato as they walk away. Cut to an aerial shot of the abbey. The shot changes to show Bato helping Katara secure her pack as Sokka puts on his own pack. Sokka and Bato off camera. Cut to Aang sitting on Appa with Momo next to him. Shot changes to show Katara walking in front of the camera.
character_words: NA

full_text: Good luck.
character_words: Good luck.

full_text: Okay. You too.
character_words: Okay. You too.

full_text: Katara joins Sokka and Bato at the abbey gate. Mother Superior, in front of Appa, stares at Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: Guess I should be moving on.
character_words: Guess I should be moving on.

full_text: That would be best.
character_words: That would be best.

full_text: Appa growls. The shot changes to outside the abbey. Appa walks out and Aang notices three figures walk away in the distance.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm an idiot, Momo. [Momo chitters.]
character_words: I'm an idiot, Momo.

full_text: Cut to an aerial view of the abbey. The shot cuts to three nuns stirring perfume. The sound of rumbling alerts the nuns as they stare in fright as Nyla enters the abbey holding June, Iroh, and Zuko. The shot cuts to Nyla's point of view, who sees the purple scent and turns his head to follow it.
character_words: NA

full_text: We're getting close. [Whips Nyla, who runs out of the abbey and into the woods.]
character_words: We're getting close.

full_text: Cut to a view of the sky amidst some trees and the camera pans down to show Bato, Katara, and Sokka walking through the woods. A wolf's howl can be heard in the distance.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To Sokka.] That wolf sounds so sad.
character_words: That wolf sounds so sad.

full_text: It's probably wounded.
character_words: It's probably wounded.

full_text: [Turns back to them.] No, it's been separated from the pack. I understand that pain. It's how I felt when the Water Tribe warriors had to leave me behind. They were my family, [Shot of Sokka, who looks sadly at the camera.] and being apart from them was more painful than my wounds.
character_words: No, it's been separated from the pack. I understand that pain. It's how I felt when the Water Tribe warriors had to leave me behind. They were my family,  and being apart from them was more painful than my wounds.

full_text: Fade to another one of Sokka's flashbacks. The young Sokka stands at the end of an ice pier as eight ships travel away, fading into the fog. Frontal shot of the young Sokka fades to Sokka wearing a similar expression from the flashback as he stares at the camera.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sokka?
character_words: Sokka?

full_text: We need to go back. I wanna see Dad, but, helping Aang is where we're needed the most.
character_words: We need to go back. I wanna see Dad, but, helping Aang is where we're needed the most.

full_text: [Smiles.] You're right.
character_words: You're right.

full_text: [Walks up to Katara and Sokka and puts his arms on their shoulders.] Your father will understand, and I know he's proud of you.
character_words: Your father will understand, and I know he's proud of you.

full_text: Thanks, Bato.
character_words: Thanks, Bato.

full_text: I know where to go from here. [Takes the map from out of his Water Tribe outfit.] Take this in case you want to find us. I'll leave a message at the rendezvous point.
character_words: I know where to go from here.  Take this in case you want to find us. I'll leave a message at the rendezvous point.

full_text: The camera pans up and cuts to Aang and Momo sitting on Appa with the abandoned Water Tribe ship behind them.

full_text: Looks like we're going alone, guys.

full_text: [Runs on camera. Desperately.] Avatar, you must leave!
character_words: Avatar, you must leave!

full_text: [Annoyed.] Okay, I get it. Everybody wants me gone.
character_words: Okay, I get it. Everybody wants me gone.

full_text: A group of people came to the abbey looking for you.
character_words: A group of people came to the abbey looking for you.

full_text: Who?
character_words: Who?

full_text: A fierce looking woman with a horrible monster, and a young man with a scar.
character_words: A fierce looking woman with a horrible monster, and a young man with a scar.

full_text: Zuko.
character_words: Zuko.

full_text: The beast was using the scent of a necklace to follow you.
character_words: The beast was using the scent of a necklace to follow you.

full_text: A necklace? [Gasps.] Katara!
character_words: A necklace?  Katara!

full_text: Cut to a long path heading toward the abbey and the camera pans down to two figures walking toward the abbey. The shot changes to show Sokka and Katara walking down the path. Sokka hears a rumbling noise and puts his hand up to stop his sister from walking. Nyla jumps behind them and they both turn around in fear. Nyla looks at Katara.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To Zuko.] So this is your girlfriend. [Zuko jumps down.] No wonder she left, she's way too pretty for you.
character_words: So this is your girlfriend.  No wonder she left, she's way too pretty for you.

full_text: [To Sokka and Katara.] Where is he? Where is the Avatar?
character_words: Where is he? Where is the Avatar?

full_text: We split up. He's long gone.
character_words: We split up. He's long gone.

full_text: How stupid do you think I am?
character_words: How stupid do you think I am?

full_text: Pretty stupid. [Grabs his sister.] Run!
character_words: Pretty stupid.  Run!

full_text: They start running, but Nyla uses his tongue to paralyze them.
character_words: NA

full_text: What are we supposed to do now?
character_words: What are we supposed to do now?

full_text: [Nyla walks closer to Sokka and Katara.] It's seeking a different scent. Perhaps something that the Avatar held.
character_words: It's seeking a different scent. Perhaps something that the Avatar held.

full_text: Nyla knocks the map off Sokka's pack and smells its blue scent and follows the trail. Cut to the gates of the abbey as Nyla breaks them down. Nuns scatter and the shot shows Nyla holding June, Iroh, Zuko, Katara, and Sokka. Nyla walks around in a circle.
character_words: NA

full_text: What's it doing? It's just going in a circle.
character_words: What's it doing? It's just going in a circle.

full_text: The camera shows Nyla's point of view as he follows the blue scent trail up into the air and sees Aang flying down. The shot changes to Aang flying over Nyla, who stands on his hind legs and attempts to paralyze the Avatar with his tongue, throwing off his riders. Nyla falls down, too.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Looks up.] Aang!
character_words: Aang!

full_text: Up! [June cracks her whip. Nyla stands up and June mounts him.]
character_words: Up!

full_text: June and Nyla charge at Aang, but Appa knocks down Nyla by leaping on the shirshu's side. Appa growls and snorts at June and Nyla. Cut to Zuko and Aang facing each other. In the background, two nuns drag Sokka and Katara to the side of the abbey. Shot changes from Zuko to Aang to Zuko. Zuko firebends a blast at Aang, who stops it by waving his glider. Aang sends a blast of air at Zuko, who sidesteps it and sends a fire blast at Aang, who spins his staff to stop the blast. Aang sends an airbending blast at Zuko, who sidesteps it and sends another fire blast at Aang. Aang jumps to avoid the blast. Zuko moves in closer to Aang and sends two fire blasts at Aang's head and feet. Aang throws his staff and both jump and duck at the blasts. Zuko punches and kicks at Aang, sending fire blasts at him. Aang avoids these blasts and sends an air blast at Zuko's head. Zuko ducks and sends more fire blasts at Aang. Zuko and Aang both firebend and airbend, respectively, at each other at the same time, creating large explosion that forms a mushroom cloud. The shot changes to show Zuko and Aang fall on different roofs. Cut to Nyla and June lying on the ground. Iroh runs up to June and puts his hand on her cheek. June wakes up and stands up.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Whips Nyla.] Come on! Get up!
character_words: Come on! Get up!

full_text:
Nyla gets up. Shot of Iroh smiling. Cut to Nyla running across the abbey with June riding him. Cut to Appa's paw as Nyla lashes his tongue at it. Appa lands and falls down, paralyzed. Cut to a shot of June looking at Appa, who opens his eyes and slowly gets back up to his feet and growls. Nyla growls back and they charge at each other when June cracks her whip. The collision between the two beasts sends June flying over Appa, and she takes the opportunity to whip the sky bison. She lands on the ground and quickly rolls to the side before Appa stomps on the ground behind him where June had landed, cracking the floor.
Cut to Aang on the roof as he lifts his head and groans and gasps. Cut to Zuko running across the roof and sending a fire blast at the camera. Aang jumps into the air. Zuko sends a fire blast at Aang's feet. Aang jumps up and sends an airbending blast at Zuko. When Aang lands, Zuko sends a fire blast at him. Aang uses an air shield to stop it. Aang gets up and sends a stream of air at Zuko, sending him to an abbey corner tower. Aang runs toward Zuko and attacks him with an air blast. Zuko jumps off the roof and Nyla jumps on. As Aang runs away from the shirshu, Appa uses his tail to send an airbending blast at the roof. Cut to Sokka and Katara sitting by a wall.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm ... starting to get some feeling back! [Rubble from the roof falls on him.] Ow.
character_words: I'm ... starting to get some feeling back!  Ow.

full_text: Cut to Aang jumping in the abbey courtyard stream and Nyla follows him. Cut to June and Nyla on the roof. They run to the side as a part of the abbey roof explodes. The dust clears to show Appa. Cut to Iroh examining some perfume bottles. He sniffs one and sneaks it into his sleeves. Cut to Aang standing by a well. Zuko sends him three firebending blasts. Aang jumps to the other side of the well to dodge them. Zuko sends another fire blast at him. Aang ducks and notices Zuko is carrying Katara's necklace.
character_words: NA

full_text: You've got something I want.
character_words: You've got something I want.

full_text:
Aang jumps between the four beams of the well. He dodges Zuko's fire blasts by moving on all sides of the well. Zuko breaks two of the well's beams and sends the wooden structure away. Zuko jumps on the well's circular stone structure to join Aang. Zuko sends two fire blasts at Aang, who dodges them by stepping around the well. Aang sends two air blasts at Zuko. The shot focuses on well as the two opponents walk on top of the well. Aang snatches at Katara's stole necklace, but misses. Zuko lunges at Aang, who jumps onto his back. Cut to a shot of Aang flying through the air as he grabs Katara's necklace off his foot. Aang lands in the well. Zuko sends a fire blast down the well. The water from the well rises out and sends Zuko flying. Aang jumps out with the water, which rains a little before Zuko falls down. Zuko stands up.
Cut to Appa, who walks toward Zuko. Nyla's tongue lashes out at Appa from off-camera. Appa growls and the shot changes to show June riding Nyla. June cracks her whip and Nyla's tongue lashes out at Appa again. Appa falls down and Nyla looks toward Sokka and Katara. Mother Superior makes both of them smell a vial of perfume.

full_text: That thing sees with its nose. Let's give him something to look at.

full_text: The perfume?
character_words: The perfume?

Sokka and the nuns pour the perfume pots onto the ground. Katara waterbends the perfume into the air and pours it on Nyla. The shot changes to show Nyla's point of view as the perfume scents cloud his vision of Aang.

full_text: [Nyla paralyzes Zuko as Iroh looks at Nyla in concern.] June! No! [Nyla tongue lashes out and hits June, who falls back into Iroh's arms.]

Katara and Sokka stand next to Aang and smile at him. Cut to Zuko and Iroh lying down on the ground. Iroh cradles June in one hand.

character_words: Uncle? I didn't see you get hit with the tongue.

full_text: So ... where do we go?
character_words: So ... where do we go?

full_text: We're getting you to the North Pole.
character_words: We're getting you to the North Pole.

full_text: Yeah, we've lost too much time as it is.

full_text: [Turns to the group.] Don't you want to see your father?
character_words: Don't you want to see your father?

character_words: Of course we do, Aang. But, you're our family, too. And right now, you need us more.

character_words: I wish I could give you a little piece of home, Katara. Something to remind you ...

character_words: Aang, how'd you get that?

character_words: Aw, that's so sweet of Zuko. Could you give him a kiss for me when you see him?

full_text: The scene opens with a shot of the full moon. The camera pans down to reveal the Water Tribe ship and Team Avatar, who decided to make camp next to the boat.

full_text: So, how long do you think it's been since someone was here?
character_words: So, how long do you think it's been since someone was here?

full_text: Long enough for moss to grow on the hull. [He turns to Katara; unsure.] About three months.
character_words: Long enough for moss to grow on the hull.  About three months.

full_text: [Close-up of Katara; disappointed.] Oh. [She looks down, saddened.] So dad's probably long gone.
character_words: Oh.  So dad's probably long gone.

full_text: [Cut to a shot from behind Aang.] I wonder why they left this boat? There's nothing wrong with it.
character_words: I wonder why they left this boat? There's nothing wrong with it.

full_text: When was the last time you saw your dad?
character_words: When was the last time you saw your dad?

full_text: [He turns away.] I don't want to talk about it.
character_words: I don't want to talk about it.

full_text: [The camera cuts to a frontal of Aang.] Sorry. [He looks down in guilt.] I didn't mean to bring that up.
character_words: Sorry.  I didn't mean to bring that up.

full_text: [Shot of Katara and Aang around the campfire.] It's okay Aang. Our dad left about two years ago, with all the other Water Tribe men.
character_words: It's okay Aang. Our dad left about two years ago, with all the other Water Tribe men.

full_text: [Sokka enters the shot and proceeds to lay down in front of the campfire; interrupting Katara.] Maybe we should all get some sleep.
character_words: Maybe we should all get some sleep.

full_text: Sokka pulls a blanket over himself. Fade to a shot of Aang lying on one of Appa's legs.
character_words: NA

full_text: The episode opens in a forest while Momo suddenly appears, jumping from a tree to another tree. A mysterious figure is seen following him, and Momo lands on a roadside kiosk, while Team Avatar is arriving at it.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Walking toward a poster on the kiosk, present in the middle of a crossroad.] This should give us a good idea of what's around here.
character_words: This should give us a good idea of what's around here.

full_text: [Flips a small pouch to find it empty aside from a few crumbs.] See if you can find a menu, I'm starving! [Wipes his mouth.]
character_words: See if you can find a menu, I'm starving!

full_text: I bet we'll find something to eat here, [Pointing at the poster.] the Fire Day's Festival. [Momo jumps down. Aang begins reading-out the poster.] Fire Nation cultural exhibits, jugglers, benders, magicians ... [Turns to Katara.] This would be a great place for me to study some real firebenders.
character_words: I bet we'll find something to eat here,  the Fire Day's Festival.  Fire Nation cultural exhibits, jugglers, benders, magicians ...  This would be a great place for me to study some real firebenders.

full_text: [Looking at another poster on the other side of the kiosk; seriously.] You might wanna rethink that. Look at this.
character_words: You might wanna rethink that. Look at this.

full_text: [Comes over to at the poster.] Hey, a poster of me!
character_words: Hey, a poster of me!

full_text: A wanted poster! This is bad. [Aang removes the poster from the wall and starts reading it.]
character_words: A wanted poster! This is bad.

full_text: [Stares at the wanted poster.] I think we better keep moving.
character_words: I think we better keep moving.

full_text: [Looking at Katara.] I have to learn firebending at some point and this could be my only chance to watch a master's up close.
character_words: I have to learn firebending at some point and this could be my only chance to watch a master's up close.

full_text: [Swayed by Aang; while her head is bowed.] I guess we could go check it out. [Aang begins rejoicing.]
character_words: I guess we could go check it out.

full_text: [Moves in front of Katara; in an opposing tone.] What? You wanna walk into a Fire Nation town where they're all fired-up with their ... you know, fire? [Aang becomes serious again.]
character_words: What? You wanna walk into a Fire Nation town where they're all fired-up with their ... you know, fire?

full_text: [Starts walking toward Appa and is followed by Aang.] We'll wear disguises and if it looks like trouble, we'll leave.
character_words: We'll wear disguises and if it looks like trouble, we'll leave.

full_text: [Not convinced; sarcastically.] Yeah! Because we always leave before we get into trouble.
character_words: Yeah! Because we always leave before we get into trouble.

full_text: [To Appa and Momo.] You guys stay out of sight here while we go to the festival. [To Katara and Sokka.] Ready disguises!
character_words: You guys stay out of sight here while we go to the festival.  Ready disguises!

full_text: Sokka and Katara put on their black cloaks while Aang pulls his orange shawl over his head with a smile on his face making him look ridiculous.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sarcastically at Aang's goofy disguise.] It's like you're a whole different person ... [Katara giggles.]
character_words: It's like you're a whole different person ...

full_text: Let's go.
character_words: Let's go.

full_text: The gang looks around seeing everyone in masks.
character_words: NA

full_text: I think we need some new disguises.
character_words: I think we need some new disguises.

full_text: Where are we gonna get masks like that?
character_words: Where are we gonna get masks like that?

full_text: Get your genuine Fire Festival masks here!
character_words: Get your genuine Fire Festival masks here!

full_text: That was surprisingly easy.
character_words: That was surprisingly easy.

full_text: The gang chooses three masks. Katara chooses a lady with makeup, Sokka a blue smiling mask with petals around the rim, and Aang who chooses a red mask with a frown on it. Katara removes Sokka's mask, revealing him to be frowning, and Aang's mask, revealing him to be the one smiling. She places Sokka's original mask over Aang's face and Aang's over Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, there's some food.
character_words: Hey, there's some food.

full_text: Finally! [To the shop keeper.] What do you have?
character_words: Finally!  What do you have?

full_text: Flaming fire flakes! Best in town.
character_words: Flaming fire flakes! Best in town.

full_text: I'll take'em!
character_words: I'll take'em!

full_text: Sokka gobbles down the fire flakes, but has a spasm from the spiciness.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aaahhh! Hot! Hot!
character_words: Aaahhh! Hot! Hot!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] "Flaming fire flakes", hot? What do you know?
character_words: "Flaming fire flakes", hot? What do you know?

full_text: Hey, look at this.
character_words: Hey, look at this.

full_text: Don't worry loyal citizens! No one can surprise the Fire Lord!
character_words: Don't worry loyal citizens! No one can surprise the Fire Lord!

full_text: [As an Earth Kingdom general puppet pops up behind the Fire Lord's puppet, with a rock ready to attack.] Oh no! Look out! [The puppet breaths fire, burning the other puppet.]
character_words: Oh no! Look out!

full_text: Aang, hold on! Where are we going?
character_words: Aang, hold on! Where are we going?

full_text: I don't know, but there's a big crowd so it must be good.
character_words: I don't know, but there's a big crowd so it must be good.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Knowing the Fire Nation, it's probably an execution.
character_words: Knowing the Fire Nation, it's probably an execution.

full_text: I gotta learn that trick!
character_words: I gotta learn that trick!

full_text: Thank you! For my next trick I need a volunteer from the audience!
character_words: Thank you! For my next trick I need a volunteer from the audience!

full_text: [Waving his hand up in the air all around childishly.] Oh! Oh! Me! Me!
character_words: Oh! Oh! Me! Me!

full_text: [In a stern tone while pulling his arm down.] What do you think you're doing?
character_words: What do you think you're doing?

full_text: I want to get a closer look.
character_words: I want to get a closer look.

full_text: It's better that we don't attract any attention to ourselves.
character_words: It's better that we don't attract any attention to ourselves.

full_text: How about you, little lady?
character_words: How about you, little lady?

full_text: [While backing away.] Uh.
character_words: Uh.

full_text: Awww, she's shy. Leeet's give her some encouragement, folks!
character_words: Awww, she's shy. Leeet's give her some encouragement, folks!

full_text: [In a jealous tone while folding his arms.] Awww! That could've been me.
character_words: Awww! That could've been me.

full_text: This next trick is called "Taming the Dragon." [While sitting her down in a chair and tying her to it.] You will be my captured princess! Don't worry, young maiden! I will tame this fiery beast! It's too strong, I can't hold it!
character_words: This next trick is called "Taming the Dragon."  You will be my captured princess! Don't worry, young maiden! I will tame this fiery beast! It's too strong, I can't hold it!

full_text: We gotta help her!
character_words: We gotta help her!

full_text: No, we don't want to make a scene!
character_words: No, we don't want to make a scene!

full_text: The rope, it's breaking! [Aang saves Katara with his airbending, dispersing the flames is a ray of colors while he loses his mask in the process.] Hey, you tryin' to upstage me, kid?
character_words: The rope, it's breaking!  Hey, you tryin' to upstage me, kid?

full_text: Aang starts doing a goofy dance as everyone boos at him for ruining the trick.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey! That kid's the Avatar! [Aang stops dancing and runs.]
character_words: Hey! That kid's the Avatar!

full_text: I think it's time to go.
character_words: I think it's time to go.

full_text: Follow me! I can get you outta here! [The kids follow Chey.]
character_words: Follow me! I can get you outta here!

full_text: There they are!
character_words: There they are!

full_text: Chey throws a series of explosives at the Fire Nation soldiers that are chasing them.
character_words: NA

full_text: Over there!
character_words: Over there!

full_text: I'm calling Appa. [Aang blows his whistle.]
character_words: I'm calling Appa.

full_text: I hope he can really hear that bison whistle!
character_words: I hope he can really hear that bison whistle!

full_text: [Making a sharp turn down one of the several alleys.] This way! [Comes running back.] Okay! Not this way!
character_words: This way!  Okay! Not this way!

full_text: They make another turn, but the way they came is blocked by guards. Chey throws another smoke bomb and runs past them into another alley. They group comes across another dead end where there is an enormous supply of fireworks. Cut to an overhead shot that reveals Appa has arrived in the nick of time.
character_words: NA

full_text: Appa! Down here!
character_words: Appa! Down here!

full_text: Appa lands between the kids and the guards, with his backside facing the guards. Appa airbends a gale force wind which results in the guards getting blown out of sight. As the guards run back into the alley, Appa has already taken off. Cut to Chey, he bites the top off a bomb to light it. He throws it at the fireworks supply and it blows up creating a beautiful display of fireworks. Cut to Chey removing his hood as they cruise away.
character_words: NA

full_text: Nice touch setting off the fireworks.
character_words: Nice touch setting off the fireworks.

full_text: [Impressed.] You really know your explosives ...
character_words: You really know your explosives ...

full_text: I'm familiar.
character_words: I'm familiar.

full_text: You're a Fire Nation Soldier!
character_words: You're a Fire Nation Soldier!

full_text: Was. My name's Chey.
character_words: Was. My name's Chey.

full_text: The group lands and makes camp.
character_words: NA

full_text: I serve a man. More than a man really, he's a myth, but he's real, a living legend, Jeong Jeong the Deserter. He was a Fire Nation general, or wait, was he an admiral?
character_words: I serve a man. More than a man really, he's a myth, but he's real, a living legend, Jeong Jeong the Deserter. He was a Fire Nation general, or wait, was he an admiral?

full_text: [Not amused.] He was very highly ranked, we get it.
character_words: He was very highly ranked, we get it.

full_text: Yeah! Way up there! But he couldn't take the madness any more. He's the first person ever to leave the army - and live. I'm the second, but you don't get to be a legend for that. That's okay though. Jeong Jeong's a firebending genius. Some say he's mad - but he's not! He's enlightened.
character_words: Yeah! Way up there! But he couldn't take the madness any more. He's the first person ever to leave the army - and live. I'm the second, but you don't get to be a legend for that. That's okay though. Jeong Jeong's a firebending genius. Some say he's mad - but he's not! He's enlightened.

full_text: You mean there's a firebender out here who's not with the Fire Lord? [Gets up in excitement.] We've gotta go see him! He can train me!
character_words: You mean there's a firebender out here who's not with the Fire Lord?  We've gotta go see him! He can train me!

full_text: [Snaps at Aang.] We're not gonna go find some crazy firebender!
character_words: We're not gonna go find some crazy firebender!

full_text: [Annoyed; Stands up to gesture.] He's not crazy! He's a genius! And he's the perfect person to train the Avatar! That's why I followed you into the festival.
character_words: He's not crazy! He's a genius! And he's the perfect person to train the Avatar! That's why I followed you into the festival.

full_text: Look, thanks for the help, but we're leaving for the North Pole in the morning.
character_words: Look, thanks for the help, but we're leaving for the North Pole in the morning.

full_text: Sokka, this could be my only chance to meet a firebending master who would actually be willing to teach me.
character_words: Sokka, this could be my only chance to meet a firebending master who would actually be willing to teach me.

full_text: It can't hurt just to talk to him.
character_words: It can't hurt just to talk to him.

full_text: [Very annoyed.] That's what you said about going to the festival! Why doesn't anyone ever listen to me?
character_words: That's what you said about going to the festival! Why doesn't anyone ever listen to me?

full_text: As Sokka turns to pout, he almost runs right into a spear. In a flash, they are surrounded by men wearing straw hats, light armor, wearing tribal make up, and wielding spears.
character_words: NA

full_text: Don't move!
character_words: Don't move!

full_text: The tribal folks escort them to their settlement.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Angry.] Jeong Jeong told you not to look for Avatar!
character_words: Jeong Jeong told you not to look for Avatar!

full_text: Hold on, you know these guys?
character_words: Hold on, you know these guys?

full_text: Oh yeh! Lin Yee's an old buddy! Right, Lin Yee?
character_words: Oh yeh! Lin Yee's an old buddy! Right, Lin Yee?

full_text: [Not amused with Chey.] Shut up! Keep moving.
character_words: Shut up! Keep moving.

full_text: Down the hill, there is a little cottage with leaves and logs.
character_words: NA

full_text: Go on. He sees you only.
character_words: Go on. He sees you only.

full_text: Oh that's okay, we can chat later.
character_words: Oh that's okay, we can chat later.

full_text: Is that where Jeong Jeong is? I need to talk to him right away.
character_words: Is that where Jeong Jeong is? I need to talk to him right away.

full_text: Aang tries to move forward, but it stopped by a spear shaft.
character_words: NA

full_text: No! You wait there. [Pushes Chey forward.] Go now!
character_words: No! You wait there.  Go now!

full_text: Don't worry! Everything'll be fine. He's a great man, great man!
character_words: Don't worry! Everything'll be fine. He's a great man, great man!

full_text: Chey walks toward Jeong Jeong's cottage. Back in the Fire Days Festival in the now deserted central square of the town where some guards are being interrogated by Admiral Zhao who is accompanied by a few guards himself.
character_words: NA

full_text: So, the Avatar was here and you let him slip away?
character_words: So, the Avatar was here and you let him slip away?

full_text: [Anxiously.] Yes, sir, but other than that the festival went off without a hitch! [A huge piece of burning planks of wood falls in the background with a massive crash making the guards twitch.] No fights. Theft was way down.
character_words: Yes, sir, but other than that the festival went off without a hitch!  No fights. Theft was way down.

full_text: [Irritated.] I don't care about your local crime rates! Which way did they go?
character_words: I don't care about your local crime rates! Which way did they go?

full_text: They headed into the forest, up the river I suspect.
character_words: They headed into the forest, up the river I suspect.

full_text: Ready the river boats. We're going after the Avatar.
character_words: Ready the river boats. We're going after the Avatar.

full_text: Back in the settlement, Chey exits Jeong Jeong's cottage. He arrives back where Aang and the others are fast asleep. Everyone wakes up instantly as Chey approaches.
character_words: NA

full_text: What happened? Can I see Jeong Jeong now?
character_words: What happened? Can I see Jeong Jeong now?

full_text: [Looking downcast.] He won't see you. He's very angry that I brought you here. He wants you to leave immediately.
character_words: He won't see you. He's very angry that I brought you here. He wants you to leave immediately.

full_text: Finally! Let's hit the road. [He stretches back out again.]
character_words: Finally! Let's hit the road.

full_text: Why won't he see me?
character_words: Why won't he see me?

full_text: He says you're not ready. Says you haven't mastered waterbending and earthbending yet.
character_words: He says you're not ready. Says you haven't mastered waterbending and earthbending yet.

full_text: [Shocked.] Wait, how does he know that?
character_words: Wait, how does he know that?

full_text: He saw the way you walked into camp. He could tell.
character_words: He saw the way you walked into camp. He could tell.

full_text: I'm going in, anyway!
character_words: I'm going in, anyway!

full_text: Aang walks to Jeong Jeong's cottage. He takes a deep breath, parts the curtain, and walks into the darkness. Cut to a dark figure seated cross legged amidst a semicircle of candles, his back to Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: Get out.
character_words: Get out.

full_text: Master, I need to learn firebending.
character_words: Master, I need to learn firebending.

full_text: Only a fool seeks his own destruction.
character_words: Only a fool seeks his own destruction.

full_text: [To Jeong Jeong.] I'm the Avatar, it's my destiny to— [Gets interrupted.]
character_words: I'm the Avatar, it's my destiny to—

full_text: Destiny? What would a boy know of destiny? If a fish lives its whole life in this river, does he know the river's destiny? No! Only that it runs on and on out of his control! He may follow where it flows, but he cannot see the end. He cannot imagine the ocean.
character_words: Destiny? What would a boy know of destiny? If a fish lives its whole life in this river, does he know the river's destiny? No! Only that it runs on and on out of his control! He may follow where it flows, but he cannot see the end. He cannot imagine the ocean.

full_text: Okay, but it's the Avatar's duty to master all of the bending disciplines.
character_words: Okay, but it's the Avatar's duty to master all of the bending disciplines.

full_text: To master the bending disciplines, you must first master discipline itself. But you have no interest in this, so I have no interest in you! Now, get out.
character_words: To master the bending disciplines, you must first master discipline itself. But you have no interest in this, so I have no interest in you! Now, get out.

full_text: Please, I have to learn. This could be my only chance.
character_words: Please, I have to learn. This could be my only chance.

full_text: Are you deaf? How can I teach you if you refuse to listen? Before learning firebending you must learn water and earth. Water is cool and soothing, earth is steady and stable, but fire, fire is alive! It breathes, it grows. Without the bender, a rock will not throw itself! But fire will spread and destroy everything in its path if one does not have the will to control it! That is its destiny! You are not ready! You are too weak!
character_words: Are you deaf? How can I teach you if you refuse to listen? Before learning firebending you must learn water and earth. Water is cool and soothing, earth is steady and stable, but fire, fire is alive! It breathes, it grows. Without the bender, a rock will not throw itself! But fire will spread and destroy everything in its path if one does not have the will to control it! That is its destiny! You are not ready! You are too weak!

full_text: At this final gesture the candles around Jeong Jeong violently flame up to illuminate the entire hut before quickly going out. A vision in front of Jeong Jeong begins, as one candle is seen lit in front of the firebender. A tree is in the background behind the Deserter. In front of him, stands Avatar Roku.
character_words: NA

full_text: You think I am weak?
character_words: You think I am weak?

full_text: Avatar Roku! No, No! I did not mean that.
character_words: Avatar Roku! No, No! I did not mean that.

full_text: I have mastered the elements a thousand times in a thousand lifetimes. Now, I must do it once again. You will teach the Avatar [He raises his hand and ignites the tree behind Jeong Jeong.] firebending.
character_words: I have mastered the elements a thousand times in a thousand lifetimes. Now, I must do it once again. You will teach the Avatar  firebending.

full_text: Yes, yes, I will teach you.
character_words: Yes, yes, I will teach you.

full_text: Really? That's great! [Raises his hands happily; Jeong Jeong groans in dismay fearing this may not end well.]
character_words: Really? That's great!

full_text: In the morning outside of Jeong Jeong's cottage. Sokka is sitting on a boulder by the river, fishing. The screen pans up the river where Katara is practicing waterbending before switching to Aang and Jeong Jeong in front of the cottage. Aang stands, bandy legged, on a flat stone in the river. Jeong Jeong stands a foot or two away on the bank in front of his cottage.
character_words: NA

full_text: Widen your stance. Wider! Bend your knees. Now, concentrate. [Aang expresses his concentration.] Good, good!
character_words: Widen your stance. Wider! Bend your knees. Now, concentrate.  Good, good!

full_text: Wait! What do I do now?
character_words: Wait! What do I do now?

full_text: [Turns around.] Silence! Talking is not concentrating! Look at your friend, is she talking? [Points at Sokka.] Even that oaf knows to concentrate on what he's doing!
character_words: Silence! Talking is not concentrating! Look at your friend, is she talking?  Even that oaf knows to concentrate on what he's doing!

full_text: [Annoyed.] Hey!
character_words: Hey!

full_text: But what am I concentrating on?
character_words: But what am I concentrating on?

full_text: Feel the heat of the sun. It is the greatest source of fire. Yet, it is in complete balance with nature!
character_words: Feel the heat of the sun. It is the greatest source of fire. Yet, it is in complete balance with nature!

full_text: So when do I get to make some fire?
character_words: So when do I get to make some fire?

full_text: Concentrate!
character_words: Concentrate!

full_text: Aang breathes and is embarrassed as his friends laugh at him from behind. He turns to look at them, but they stop instantly, as he tries to innocent. Cut to a long shot of the figures in the distance climbing the slope of a mountain. Cut to a close-up shot of Aang and Jeong Jeong walking up the path to the mountain's summit.
character_words: NA

full_text: Are we coming up here so I don't burn anything with my fire blasts?
character_words: Are we coming up here so I don't burn anything with my fire blasts?

full_text: No fire yet.
character_words: No fire yet.

full_text: What?
character_words: What?

full_text: Power in firebending comes from the breath. That is why you must master proper breath control.
character_words: Power in firebending comes from the breath. That is why you must master proper breath control.

full_text: You brought me up here to breathe?
character_words: You brought me up here to breathe?

full_text: Assume your stance.
character_words: Assume your stance.

full_text: Aang assumes the proper stance.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Faces the opposite direction of Aang.] Wider.
character_words: Wider.

full_text: You're not even look— [Interrupted by Jeong Jeong.]
character_words: You're not even look—

full_text: Wider! Now, inhale through the nose and exhale through the mouth - without talking. Good. Keep going.
character_words: Wider! Now, inhale through the nose and exhale through the mouth - without talking. Good. Keep going.

full_text: Jeong Jeong walks down the path and out of the frame as Aang continues to breathe, a look of fierce concentration on his face. Cut to a view of Aang's lower body as he parts the curtain into Jeong Jeong's cottage.
character_words: NA

full_text: What are you doing here? I did not tell you to stop!
character_words: What are you doing here? I did not tell you to stop!

full_text: I've been breathing for hours!
character_words: I've been breathing for hours!

full_text: You want to stop breathing?
character_words: You want to stop breathing?

full_text: I want you to stop wasting my time! I already know how to squat and breathe and feel the sun! [Wiggles fingers to the ceiling to gesture this.] I wanna know how to shoot fire out of my fingertips!
character_words: I want you to stop wasting my time! I already know how to squat and breathe and feel the sun!  I wanna know how to shoot fire out of my fingertips!

full_text: [Sighs gruffly.] I had a pupil once who had no interest in learning discipline.
