He was only concerned with the power of fire - how he could use it to destroy his opponents and wipe out the obstacles in his path, but fire is a horrible burden to bear. Its nature is to consume and without control it destroys everything around it. [While he was speaking, the camera cuts to Zhao on his boat; several men attack him, but he fends them off easily, leaving a fire in his wake. Cuts back to Jeong Jeong.]
character_words: I had a pupil once who had no interest in learning discipline. He was only concerned with the power of fire - how he could use it to destroy his opponents and wipe out the obstacles in his path, but fire is a horrible burden to bear. Its nature is to consume and without control it destroys everything around it.

full_text: Learn restraint, or risk destroying yourself and everything you love.
character_words: Learn restraint, or risk destroying yourself and everything you love.

full_text: After several hours Jeong Jeong finds Aang in front of the hut meditating.
character_words: NA

full_text: I thought about what you said, I promise I'll be more patient.
character_words: I thought about what you said, I promise I'll be more patient.

full_text: We're going to work with fire now.
character_words: We're going to work with fire now.

full_text: Oh yeah! [Aang gets excited and airbends himself into the air. He quickly gets serious again.] I mean, let us begin.
character_words: Oh yeah!  I mean, let us begin.

full_text: Jeong Jeong grabs a falling leaf and burns the center.
character_words: NA

full_text: Concentrate on the fire. I want you to keep the flame from reaching the edges of the leaf for as long as you can.
character_words: Concentrate on the fire. I want you to keep the flame from reaching the edges of the leaf for as long as you can.

full_text: Master! There is trouble.
character_words: Master! There is trouble.

full_text: What's going on?
character_words: What's going on?

full_text: Concentrate on your leaf!
character_words: Concentrate on your leaf!

full_text: [Annoyed.] This is the worst firebending instruction ever! All he does is leave me for hours to concentrate or breathe!
character_words: This is the worst firebending instruction ever! All he does is leave me for hours to concentrate or breathe!

full_text: I'm sure there's a good reason.
character_words: I'm sure there's a good reason.

full_text: But I'm ready to do so much more.
character_words: But I'm ready to do so much more.

full_text: Aang remembers to concentrate on his leaf and gets into a stance and breaths. Moments later, the leaf burns up creating a small flame.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Excited.] I did it! I made fire!
character_words: I did it! I made fire!

full_text: Aang, that's great, but you should take it slow.
character_words: Aang, that's great, but you should take it slow.

full_text: Aang starts playing with it by tossing it back and forth from in front to behind himself. He makes a blast go in the opposite direction.
character_words: NA

full_text: Now that's some firebending!
character_words: Now that's some firebending!

full_text: Aang, you'll hurt yourself!
character_words: Aang, you'll hurt yourself!

full_text: I wonder how that juggler did it.
character_words: I wonder how that juggler did it.

full_text: Aang tosses it into the air and spreads his arms out. For a second, he has a smile on his face, but it vanishes as he accidentally burns Katara's hands. Katara shrieks in pain.
character_words: NA

full_text: Katara! I'm so sorry!
character_words: Katara! I'm so sorry!

full_text: Sokka comes running to Katara's side.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Concerned.] Katara, what's wrong? [Angrily.] What did you do!?
character_words: Katara, what's wrong?  What did you do!?

full_text: I'm sorry! It was an accident!
character_words: I'm sorry! It was an accident!

full_text: Sokka tackles Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: I told you we shouldn't mess around with this! Look what you did! You burned my sister! [Katara runs away.] You burned my sister! [As Jeong Jeong walks in.] This is all your fault!
character_words: I told you we shouldn't mess around with this! Look what you did! You burned my sister!  You burned my sister!  This is all your fault!

full_text: I know! Now pack your things. You must leave immediately.
character_words: I know! Now pack your things. You must leave immediately.

full_text: Katara runs off.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm sorry, I didn't ... [Sokka runs off.] I'm sorry! [Jeong Jeong looks at Aang, displeased.]
character_words: I'm sorry, I didn't ...  I'm sorry!

full_text: The scene cuts to Katara who is sulking by a creek due to the pain of her burns. She dips her hands in; they glow briefly, and a few seconds later her hands are healed.
character_words: NA

full_text: You have healing abilities. The great benders of the Water Tribe sometimes have this ability. I've always wished I were blessed like you - free from this burning curse.
character_words: You have healing abilities. The great benders of the Water Tribe sometimes have this ability. I've always wished I were blessed like you - free from this burning curse.

full_text: But you're a great master. You have powers that I will never know.
character_words: But you're a great master. You have powers that I will never know.

full_text: Water brings healing and life. But fire brings only destruction and pain. It forces those of us burdened with its care to walk a razor's edge between humanity and savagery. Eventually, we are torn apart.
character_words: Water brings healing and life. But fire brings only destruction and pain. It forces those of us burdened with its care to walk a razor's edge between humanity and savagery. Eventually, we are torn apart.

full_text: Suddenly the water is front of them is blasted with flames. Jeong Jeong gets up and gets into a defensive bending stance and breaks the flames that wash over him and Katara. The screen changes to a frontal shot of Zhao's riverboats coming toward them before switching back to Katara and Jeong Jeong.
character_words: NA

full_text: Go get your friends and flee! Do not come back here or you will all be destroyed. Hurry!
character_words: Go get your friends and flee! Do not come back here or you will all be destroyed. Hurry!

full_text: Jeong Jeong faces the boats that land harmlessly around him. The screen shows Zhao looking ahead through a telescope from the main deck of his ship. He lowers it and smiles. The screen goes back to Jeong Jeong produces a large wall of fire in front of the ships. An overhead shot of the ships is shown; the boats turn to land on the beach. The screen goes back to the front of the beach. Zhao comes into view.
character_words: NA

full_text: Don't worry, men. My old teacher gave up fighting a long time ago. [The screen pans to Jeong Jeong. Suddenly, Zhao parts through the wall.] Haven't you, Master Jeong Jeong?
character_words: Don't worry, men. My old teacher gave up fighting a long time ago.  Haven't you, Master Jeong Jeong?

full_text: [The screen goes for a close of Jeong Jeong's face, and a wide shot as he drops the wall of fire. Cut to Katara running up to where Sokka is preparing Appa to leave.]
character_words: NA

full_text: Katara! Are you all right?
character_words: Katara! Are you all right?

full_text: I'm fine, we've got to get out of here. Where's Aang? [Sokka gestures to the cottage.]
character_words: I'm fine, we've got to get out of here. Where's Aang?

full_text: Katara enters the cottage to find Aang sulking.
character_words: NA

full_text: Jeong Jeong tried to tell me that I wasn't ready. I wouldn't listen. I'm never going to firebend again.
character_words: Jeong Jeong tried to tell me that I wasn't ready. I wouldn't listen. I'm never going to firebend again.

full_text: You'll have to eventually.
character_words: You'll have to eventually.

full_text: No, never again.
character_words: No, never again.

full_text: It's okay, Aang. I'm healed.
character_words: It's okay, Aang. I'm healed.

full_text: [Surprised.] What? How?
character_words: What? How?

full_text: I'll explain later. But right now, we have to get out here. Zhao and his soldiers are attacking!
character_words: I'll explain later. But right now, we have to get out here. Zhao and his soldiers are attacking!

full_text: [Gets on his feet.] Where?
character_words: Where?

full_text: By the river. They captured Jeong Jeong.
character_words: By the river. They captured Jeong Jeong.

full_text: I have to help him!
character_words: I have to help him!

full_text: [The screen switches to an overhead shot of the beach. Zhao and his men stand against Jeong Jeong, before cutting to a closer shot.]
character_words: NA

full_text: Look at you. You were once so great. I can't believe my former master has become nothing more than a simple savage.
character_words: Look at you. You were once so great. I can't believe my former master has become nothing more than a simple savage.

full_text: It is you who have embraced savagery, Zhao.
character_words: It is you who have embraced savagery, Zhao.

full_text: It's Admiral Zhao, now.
character_words: It's Admiral Zhao, now.

full_text: That title will not help you against the Avatar. Do not try to fight him! You are no match!
character_words: That title will not help you against the Avatar. Do not try to fight him! You are no match!

full_text: [Amused.] I think I can handle a child.
character_words: I think I can handle a child.

full_text: I have never seen such raw power ...
character_words: I have never seen such raw power ...

full_text: Jeong Jeong!
character_words: Jeong Jeong!

full_text: We'll see. Men! Take the deserter!
character_words: We'll see. Men! Take the deserter!

full_text: Cut to overhead shot of Jeong Jeong surrounded by five firebenders. Aang tops short in horror as they close in. Jeong Jeong smirks and wraps himself in a ball of flames. When the flames completely dissipates Jeong Jeong is nowhere to be seen.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Angry.] It's a trick! He's run off into the woods. Find him! [Faces Aang.] Let's find out what my old master has taught you.
character_words: It's a trick! He's run off into the woods. Find him!  Let's find out what my old master has taught you.

full_text: [Shocked.] You were Jeong Jeong's student?!
character_words: You were Jeong Jeong's student?!

full_text: Until I got bored.
character_words: Until I got bored.

full_text: Zhao throws a fireball at Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: I see he taught you how to duck and run like a coward. But I doubt he showed you what a firebender is truly capable of! [Throws another intense fireball.]
character_words: I see he taught you how to duck and run like a coward. But I doubt he showed you what a firebender is truly capable of!

full_text: Whoa! Wild shot!
character_words: Whoa! Wild shot!

full_text: [Roars with rage.] I'll show you wild!
character_words: I'll show you wild!

full_text: Aang looks over to the side where Zhao just burned.
character_words: NA

full_text: No self-control ... [Gets an idea.]
character_words: No self-control ...

full_text: Stand and fight, Avatar!
character_words: Stand and fight, Avatar!

full_text: [Mockingly.] Oh, were we fighting? I thought you were just getting warmed up!
character_words: Oh, were we fighting? I thought you were just getting warmed up!

full_text: [Burns in anger at the remark.] I was ... [Shoots another fireball.]
character_words: I was ...

full_text: Zhao fires many more fireballs which all miss.
character_words: NA

full_text: Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days! [Nearly gets blasted.] [Aang cups his hands over his to sound louder.] Ahoy! [Moons Zhao with pants up.] I'm Admiral Zhao! [Zhao gets even angrier and Aang nearly gets blasted again.] I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko. [Aang looks disappointed when he says this. His eyes go wide and he lies down on the deck fast enough to avoid being burnt. Mocking Zhao's firebending.] Sloppy. Very sloppy.
character_words: Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days!   Ahoy!  I'm Admiral Zhao!  I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko.  Sloppy. Very sloppy.

full_text: Nowhere to run now, you little smart mouth!
character_words: Nowhere to run now, you little smart mouth!

full_text: [Having dodged a series of blasts from Zhao on several ships.] You've lost this battle.
character_words: You've lost this battle.

full_text: [Enraged disbelief.] Are you crazy? You haven't thrown a single blow!
character_words: Are you crazy? You haven't thrown a single blow!

full_text: No, but you have. [He gestures around, all the boats are on fire and sinking.] Jeong Jeong said you had no restraint. [Jumps in the water.] Have a nice walk home!
character_words: No, but you have.  Jeong Jeong said you had no restraint.  Have a nice walk home!

full_text: Aang, come on! Let's go!
character_words: Aang, come on! Let's go!

full_text: Cut a shot from behind Aang, who is now looking at the river bank beach. Aang hops on Appa and they fly away.
character_words: NA

full_text: Wait! Where's Jeong Jeong?
character_words: Wait! Where's Jeong Jeong?

full_text: He disappeared. They all did.
character_words: He disappeared. They all did.

full_text: [Walks into the now abandoned village; not amused.] Hey, where did everybody go? [Sarcastically.] Very funny guys
character_words: Hey, where did everybody go?  Very funny guys

full_text: Aang, you're burned! Let me help you. [Katara heals the burn on Aang's arm.]
character_words: Aang, you're burned! Let me help you.

full_text: Wow, that's good water.
character_words: Wow, that's good water.

full_text: When did you learn that?
character_words: When did you learn that?

full_text: I guess I always knew.
character_words: I guess I always knew.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Oh ... Well then thanks for all the first aid over the years. Like when I fell into the greaseberry bramble. [Angrily.] Or that time I had two fishhooks in my thumb!
character_words: Oh ... Well then thanks for all the first aid over the years. Like when I fell into the greaseberry bramble.  Or that time I had two fishhooks in my thumb!

full_text: [Shocked.] Two?
character_words: Two?

full_text: [Amused.] He tried to get the first fishhook out with another fishhook.
character_words: He tried to get the first fishhook out with another fishhook.

full_text: [Still being sarcastic.] Oh, and the time that mink snake bit me! Thanks for healing that up. That was great. Really helpful.
character_words: Oh, and the time that mink snake bit me! Thanks for healing that up. That was great. Really helpful.

full_text: Fade to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text: The episode begins with the gang sitting around a camp site with several other groups, listening to a man telling a story of 'airbenders'.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Dramatically; out of view.] So, travelers. The next time you think you hear a strange, large bird talking, take a closer look. It might not be a giant parrot, but a flying man. A member of a secret group of air walkers, who laugh at gravity, and laugh at those bound to the earth by it!
character_words: So, travelers. The next time you think you hear a strange, large bird talking, take a closer look. It might not be a giant parrot, but a flying man. A member of a secret group of air walkers, who laugh at gravity, and laugh at those bound to the earth by it!

full_text: [Cuts to a wide shot, showing the gang and the other travelers surrounding a small campfire. The Storyteller, having finished his story, is going around collecting coins from the other travelers.] Aren't airbender stories the greatest? [Talking to Katara and Sokka, who are sitting next to him.]
character_words: Aren't airbender stories the greatest?

full_text: [Excitedly.] Was it realistic? Is that how it was back then?
character_words: Was it realistic? Is that how it was back then?

full_text: Cuts to the three kids.
character_words: NA

full_text: I laugh at gravity all the time. [Chuckling to himself.] Gravity.
character_words: I laugh at gravity all the time.  Gravity.

full_text: [Arrives in front of the gang, having already collected money from the rest of the audience.] Jingle, jingle! [Jingles the hat in front of Sokka, asking for money.]
character_words: Jingle, jingle!

full_text: Sokka searches inside his heavy cloak, and manages to pull out a bug, a worm and a few crumbs.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sorry ...
character_words: Sorry ...

full_text: [Upset and somewhat downcast.] Aww, cheapskates! [Walks away as Sokka puts the bugs back in his pocket.]
character_words: Aww, cheapskates!

full_text: Aang stands up and runs after the storyteller, who is kneeling in front of an old man.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Happily.] Hey! Thanks for the story.
character_words: Hey! Thanks for the story.

full_text: [Holds out his cap.] Tell it to the cap, boy.
character_words: Tell it to the cap, boy.

full_text: The Storyteller shakes his cap behind him as he kneels in front of an old man. The shaking causes a coin to come loose and fall from the cap. As Aang searches his clothes for some money, Momo picks up the coin and puts it in the cap as the Storyteller turns around.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aww, much obliged, little bat-thing. [He pets Momo on the head.]
character_words: Aww, much obliged, little bat-thing.

full_text: [Having given up trying to find a coin.] It means a lot to hear airbender stories. It must have been a hundred years ago your great grandpa met them.
character_words: It means a lot to hear airbender stories. It must have been a hundred years ago your great grandpa met them.

full_text: [Confused.] What are you prattling about, child? Great Grandpappy saw the air walkers last week. [He indicates to the old man he was kneeling in front of before. The old man makes a sound in his throat akin to a laugh, and waves a greeting to Aang. The shot cuts to Aang, who has a shocked and disbelieving expression.]
character_words: What are you prattling about, child? Great Grandpappy saw the air walkers last week.

full_text: The scene changes from the campsite to a shot of clouds, and Appa flying above them.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sitting on Appa's neck, steering. He is talking to Katara and Sokka, who are riding in Appa's saddle.] Hey, we're almost at the Northern Air Temple. This is where they had the championships for Sky Bison polo.
character_words: Hey, we're almost at the Northern Air Temple. This is where they had the championships for Sky Bison polo.

full_text: [Moving to sit at the back of the saddle with her brother.] Do you think we'll really find airbenders?
character_words: Do you think we'll really find airbenders?

full_text: [He is whittling a piece of wood. The design is indecipherable.] You want me to be like you, or totally honest?
character_words: You want me to be like you, or totally honest?

full_text: [Crossing her arms, obviously angry with him.] Are you saying I'm a liar?
character_words: Are you saying I'm a liar?

full_text: [He shrugs, unconcerned with her mood.] I'm saying you're an optimist. Same thing, basically.
character_words: I'm saying you're an optimist. Same thing, basically.

full_text: [Excitedly.] Hey, guys, look at this!
character_words: Hey, guys, look at this!

full_text: The camera moves to show Appa, who is flying toward a mountain with a large structure on top. It looks very similar to the Southern Air Temple, with obvious spires reminiscent of a temple's architecture. Around them are several dark specks. The camera zooms in, and the specks are revealed to be people, flying around the temple in plane-shaped contraptions.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Amazed.] They really are airbenders!
character_words: They really are airbenders!

full_text: [His face falls as he sees the 'airbenders', and after Katara's excited outburst, he leans back and scowls while crossing his arms.] No, they're not.
character_words: No, they're not.

full_text: [Exuberantly.] What do you mean "they're not"? Those guys are flying!
character_words: What do you mean "they're not"? Those guys are flying!

full_text: [Bitterly. He is glaring at the direction of the people flying around the temple.] Gliding maybe, but not flying. You can tell by the way they move, they're not airbending. Those people have no spirit.
character_words: Gliding maybe, but not flying. You can tell by the way they move, they're not airbending. Those people have no spirit.

full_text: Suddenly, a boy sitting in an oddly shaped chair flies right above them, nearly hitting them, and laughing as he does so.
character_words: NA

full_text: I don't know, Aang.[Katara points to the boy.] That kid seemed pretty spirited. [Katara indicates to the boy, who is flying dangerously close, but still laughing.]
character_words: I don't know, Aang. That kid seemed pretty spirited.

full_text: The boy begins to fly away, shooting Aang one more look back as he does so while grinning. Aang grins devilishly, and opens up his glider to follow the boy. He leaves Katara and Sokka on Appa, and they quickly become surrounded by gliders as they get closer to the temple. Several gliders almost hit Appa, which causes Katara to knock into her brother and shout in pain as Appa moves sharply to avoid them.
character_words: NA

full_text: We better find some solid ground, before it finds us. [The siblings land Appa on the temple courtyard, out of the hazardous sky. Aang is still flying with the boy, and seems to be having fun at the surprise competition.]
character_words: We better find some solid ground, before it finds us.

full_text: [Several children are on the ground, cheering on their friend.] Go Teo! Show that bald kid how it's done!
character_words: Go Teo! Show that bald kid how it's done!

full_text: Teo and Aang do two loop-de-loops as they fly around the air temple. The two boys do a spiral downwards.
character_words: NA

full_text: [The boy doesn't seem upset at Aang, and seems happy that he isn't angry for nearly flying into him.] Hey there, you're pretty good!
character_words: Hey there, you're pretty good!

full_text: [Nonchalantly, but with a smirk.] Yeah, I know. But I can do more than fancy gliding.
character_words: Yeah, I know. But I can do more than fancy gliding.

full_text: Aang begins flying closer to the temple, under a bridge. Cut to a scene of Aang jumping off his glider and allowing it to fly forward on its own. He begins running along a wall, switching to an air scooter halfway, before jumping off onto his glider again.
character_words: NA

full_text: [He is looking amazed, before thinking of his own plan.] Wow, I don't think I can do that. But here's a good one.
character_words: Wow, I don't think I can do that. But here's a good one.

full_text: Teo turns on a small canister that is positioned under his glider. White smoke begins to stream from the strange contraption, and Teo flies around in the sky. The camera pans to show the sight from the ground, where it is revealed that he has created an image of Aang's face, complete with an annoyed expression. The crowd below cheers.
character_words: NA

full_text: What do you think?
character_words: What do you think?

full_text: [Annoyed; his face mimics the one Teo has just drawn.] It's great.
character_words: It's great.

full_text: Aang lands beside Katara and Sokka. Teo lands soon after and pulls on the brakes. Other children take the glider off of the top of his wheel chair. Teo rolls up to Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, you're a real airbender. You must be the Avatar! That's amazing! I-I've heard stories about you!
character_words: Hey, you're a real airbender. You must be the Avatar! That's amazing! I-I've heard stories about you!

full_text: [Rubs his head, embarrassed.] Thanks.
character_words: Thanks.

full_text: [Sokka ignores all formalities, instead going over to Teo's chair and examining the strange shape and design.] Wow! This glider chair is incredible!
character_words: Wow! This glider chair is incredible!

full_text: You think this is good, wait until you see the other stuff my dad designed.
character_words: You think this is good, wait until you see the other stuff my dad designed.

full_text: All four walk inside the building. They enter a room filled with pipes and machinery. Aang looks around worriedly. Beneath the pipes, an original mural can be seen, although it has been destroyed by the pipes, which are sticking into the walls.
character_words: NA

full_text: Wow! [Runs up to machines.]
character_words: Wow!

full_text: Yeah, my dad is the mastermind behind this whole place. Everything's powered by hot air. [Shows women using an elevator like contraption.] It even pumps hot air currents outside to give us a lift while we're gliding.
character_words: Yeah, my dad is the mastermind behind this whole place. Everything's powered by hot air.  It even pumps hot air currents outside to give us a lift while we're gliding.

full_text: [Monotonously.] This place is unbelievable.
character_words: This place is unbelievable.

full_text: Yeah, it's great, isn't it?
character_words: Yeah, it's great, isn't it?

full_text: No, just unbelievable. [Walks away.]
character_words: No, just unbelievable.

full_text: [Katara approaches Teo, who seems disappointed at Aang's reaction.] Aang used to come here a long time ago. I think he's a little shocked it's so ... different.
character_words: Aang used to come here a long time ago. I think he's a little shocked it's so ... different.

full_text: So better!
character_words: So better!

full_text: Katara walks up to Aang, who is looking at a painted wall with pipes going through it.
character_words: NA

full_text: This is supposed to be the history of my people.
character_words: This is supposed to be the history of my people.

full_text: Katara puts her hand on his shoulder. He walks over to a fountain with an air bison statue on it. He looks at his reflection in the dirty green water, Aang looks at it squeamishly. The sky bison statue suddenly has black smoke coming out of it's mouth.
character_words: NA

full_text: Ugh!
character_words: Ugh!

full_text: [Walks up and puts her hand on his shoulder.] I'm sure some parts of the temple are still the same.
character_words: I'm sure some parts of the temple are still the same.

full_text: Screen pans off to show Aang, Katara, Sokka and Teo walking across a bridge to a large room that looks well kept. The room has no roof, although around the walls there are statues of monks, mostly meditating.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's nice to see that at least one part of the temple that isn't ruined.
character_words: It's nice to see that at least one part of the temple that isn't ruined.

full_text: Katara and Aang look at a statue of a long-bearded airbender meditating.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Off-screen.] Look out!
character_words: Look out!

full_text: The statue is knocked down by a wrecking ball and all four cover their heads. Dust is coming from the statue, so all four cough. The dust clears to show six men standing where the statue used to be.
character_words: NA

full_text: What the doodle? Don't you know enough to stay away from construction sites? We have to make room for the bathhouse! [He has approached Aang and the group, looking more surprised than upset.]
character_words: What the doodle? Don't you know enough to stay away from construction sites? We have to make room for the bathhouse!

full_text: [He turns to the mechanist and yells angrily at him.] Do you know what you did!? You just destroyed something sacred! For a stupid bathhouse!
character_words: Do you know what you did!? You just destroyed something sacred! For a stupid bathhouse!

full_text: Well, people around here are starting to stink. [Waves his hand in front of his face, as though trying to dissipate a bad smell.]
character_words: Well, people around here are starting to stink.

full_text: [Points at the mechanist.] This whole place stinks! [Using his airbending, Aang flips the crane contraption off of the edge of the building.]
character_words: This whole place stinks!

full_text: Cut to exterior shot, showing the crane falling and landing heavily against the side of the cliff the temple is situated on. It is covered by a cloud of dirt and snow as it is utterly destroyed.
character_words: NA

full_text: This is a sacred temple! You can't treat it this way! [Walks closer to the mechanist.] I've seen it when the monks were here! I know what it's supposed to be like!
character_words: This is a sacred temple! You can't treat it this way!  I've seen it when the monks were here! I know what it's supposed to be like!

full_text: The monks? But, [Scratches his beard.] you're twelve.
character_words: The monks? But,  you're twelve.

full_text: [Teo rolls up.] Dad, he's the Avatar. He used to come here a hundred years ago.
character_words: Dad, he's the Avatar. He used to come here a hundred years ago.

full_text: Aang takes a menacing step closer to the mechanist, who takes a step back.
character_words: NA

full_text: What are you doing? Who said you could be here?
character_words: What are you doing? Who said you could be here?

full_text: [Turns away from Aang.] Hmm, doing here ... A long time ago, [Points finger up.] but not a hundred years, my people became refugees [Walks behind his son's wheelchair.] after a terrible flood. My infant son, [Teo looks down sadly.] Teo, was badly hurt and lost his mother. [Sniffles.] I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty, [Looks around.] nobody home. Then, [Does a airplane like gesture, like he's flying up to Aang.] I came across these fan-like contraptions!
character_words: Hmm, doing here ... A long time ago,  but not a hundred years, my people became refugees  after a terrible flood. My infant son,  Teo, was badly hurt and lost his mother.  I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty,  nobody home. Then,  I came across these fan-like contraptions!

full_text: Our gliders.
character_words: Our gliders.

full_text: Yes! Little, light flying machines! [Waves his hands up and down.] They gave me an idea. Build a new life for my son, in the air! Then everyone will be on equal ground! So to speak. We're just in the process of improving upon what's already here. [Katara wipes her tears on Aang's shirt, and Sokka looks like he's holding back tears.] And, after all, isn't that what nature does?
character_words: Yes! Little, light flying machines!  They gave me an idea. Build a new life for my son, in the air! Then everyone will be on equal ground! So to speak. We're just in the process of improving upon what's already here.  And, after all, isn't that what nature does?

full_text: Nature knows where to stop.
character_words: Nature knows where to stop.

full_text: I suppose that's true. Unfortunately, progress has a way of getting away from us. Look at the time! [Points at candles.] Come! [To other workers.] The pulley system must be oiled before dark.
character_words: I suppose that's true. Unfortunately, progress has a way of getting away from us. Look at the time!  Come!  The pulley system must be oiled before dark.

full_text: Wait, how can you tell the time from that thing? The notches all look the same.
character_words: Wait, how can you tell the time from that thing? The notches all look the same.

full_text: The candle will tell us. Watch. [Candle pops four times.]
character_words: The candle will tell us. Watch.

full_text: You put spark powder in the candle!
character_words: You put spark powder in the candle!

full_text: Four flashes. So it's exactly four hours past mid-day. Or, as I call it: four o'candle. [Sokka laughs. Cut to a frontal shot of the mechanist, pleased that Sokka is interested.] If you like that, wait till you see my finger-safe knife sharpener. [He holds up his left hand, revealing that three of the fingers are made of wood.] Only took me three tries to get it right. [He pulls off the three wooden fingers, and throws them into Sokka's hand.]
character_words: Four flashes. So it's exactly four hours past mid-day. Or, as I call it: four o'candle.  If you like that, wait till you see my finger-safe knife sharpener.  Only took me three tries to get it right.

full_text: [Horrified.] Aaah!
character_words: Aaah!

full_text: [Pokes Sokka in the back with his one remaining finger and gestures for him to come.] Follow me! [Sokka runs after him.]
character_words: Follow me!

full_text: Hey, Aang. I want to show you something.
character_words: Hey, Aang. I want to show you something.

full_text: Screen fades to black before reappearing with Katara, Teo and Aang walking inside a building.
character_words: NA

full_text: I just can't get over it. There's not a single thing that's the same.
character_words: I just can't get over it. There's not a single thing that's the same.

full_text: I don't know about that. The temple might be different [Picks up hermit crab from the ground.] but the creatures that live here [Hands it to Katara.] are probably direct descendants of the ones who lived here a long time ago.
character_words: I don't know about that. The temple might be different  but the creatures that live here  are probably direct descendants of the ones who lived here a long time ago.

full_text: [Pokes hermit crab.] You're right. They're kind of keepers of the temple's origins. [Katara hands it to Aang. It moves around in his hand and he smiles.]
character_words: You're right. They're kind of keepers of the temple's origins.

full_text: Besides, there's one part of the temple that hasn't changed at all.
character_words: Besides, there's one part of the temple that hasn't changed at all.

full_text: Screen fades slightly and reappears at a long hallway with airbending symbols through it. Shows all three looking at a door with an airbending contraption on it.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, it's just like the one in the other temple!
character_words: Hey, it's just like the one in the other temple!

full_text: [Confidently, with a matter-of-fact tone.] Only an airbender can open it, so inside it's completely untouched. Just the way the monks left it. I've always wondered what it's like in there ...
character_words: Only an airbender can open it, so inside it's completely untouched. Just the way the monks left it. I've always wondered what it's like in there ...

full_text: [She looks at him, as though slightly scared of his reaction. Her tone is gentle and questioning.] Aang?
character_words: Aang?

full_text: [He turns away from the door and his friends.] I'm sorry. This is the last part of the temple that's the same as it was. I want it to stay that way.
character_words: I'm sorry. This is the last part of the temple that's the same as it was. I want it to stay that way.

full_text: [Somewhat disappointed, although he tries not to let it show.] I completely understand. I just wanted you to know that it's here.
character_words: I completely understand. I just wanted you to know that it's here.

full_text: Thanks. [All three start to walk away.]
character_words: Thanks.

full_text: Screen cuts to Sokka and the mechanist walking down a dark stairway holding lanterns.
character_words: NA

full_text: These lanterns are terrible. I can't see! [Opens the top of his lantern only to find them filled with fireflies.] Why would you want to use fireflies for light? [One flies out.]
character_words: These lanterns are terrible. I can't see!  Why would you want to use fireflies for light?

full_text: Hey! Close that up! They'll get loose! [Sokka closes it.] Fireflies are a non-flammable light source. [Both begin to walk again.]
character_words: Hey! Close that up! They'll get loose!  Fireflies are a non-flammable light source.

full_text: They continue for a while until they arrive at a wooden door.
character_words: NA

full_text: Cover your nose [Both plug their noses.] and hold your breath. [The mechanist opens an eye slot in the door, both look inside a pitch-black room.]
character_words: Cover your nose  and hold your breath.

full_text: [Nasally, due to his nose being blocked.] Okay ... so you brought me all the way down here to see an empty room.
character_words: Okay ... so you brought me all the way down here to see an empty room.

full_text: [Closes eye slot.] Wrong. It's filled to the brim with natural gas. Came across it my first time here. Unfortunately, I was carrying a torch at the time. Nearly blew my self and the whole place even more sky high! Thought my eyebrows would never grow back. [Pans up to his eyebrows.] Anyway, there's a vital problem that needs solving. From time to time, we have gas leaks. And they're nearly impossible to find.
character_words: Wrong. It's filled to the brim with natural gas. Came across it my first time here. Unfortunately, I was carrying a torch at the time. Nearly blew my self and the whole place even more sky high! Thought my eyebrows would never grow back.  Anyway, there's a vital problem that needs solving. From time to time, we have gas leaks. And they're nearly impossible to find.

full_text: So, this place is an explosion waiting to happen.
character_words: So, this place is an explosion waiting to happen.

full_text: Yes, until I figure out how to locate something I can't see, hear, smell, or touch.
character_words: Yes, until I figure out how to locate something I can't see, hear, smell, or touch.

full_text: Cut to a exterior of temple with people flying in the sky. Aang, Katara and Teo are on the ground.
character_words: NA

full_text: The wind will carry you. It supports something inside you. Something even lighter than air. [Shows Katara holding a glider and standing at the edge of a building.] And that something takes over when you fly. [Katara puts down her glider and looks up at the other people flying.]
character_words: The wind will carry you. It supports something inside you. Something even lighter than air.  And that something takes over when you fly.

full_text: [Nervously.] I've changed my mind. I think I was born without that something.
character_words: I've changed my mind. I think I was born without that something.

full_text: [Laughs.] Impossible! Everybody has it!
character_words: Impossible! Everybody has it!

full_text: Spirit.
character_words: Spirit.

full_text: What?
character_words: What?

full_text: Spirit. That's the something you're talking about.
character_words: Spirit. That's the something you're talking about.

full_text: [Thoughtfully.] Yeah, I suppose it is.
character_words: Yeah, I suppose it is.

full_text: Shows Katara with the glider in her hands again.
character_words: NA

full_text: Are you ready?
character_words: Are you ready?

full_text: No! [Jumps off anyway.] Aaaaah! [Starts to fall down wards, but eventually starts to fly straight. Her scream peters off as she begins laughing.] I can't believe I'm flying!
character_words: No!  Aaaaah!  I can't believe I'm flying!

full_text: Aang and Momo fly up beside her.
character_words: NA

full_text: Just make sure you keep your mouth closed so you don't swallow a bug! [Shows Momo flying by and eating a bug.]
character_words: Just make sure you keep your mouth closed so you don't swallow a bug!

full_text: Teo was right about the air. All I had to do was trust it, let it carry me.
character_words: Teo was right about the air. All I had to do was trust it, let it carry me.

full_text: Even though Teo's not an airbender, he really does have the spirit of one! [Aang lands beside him on the building.] I've been thinking. If you want to see what's in that room, I'd be happy to open the door for you.
character_words: Even though Teo's not an airbender, he really does have the spirit of one!  I've been thinking. If you want to see what's in that room, I'd be happy to open the door for you.

full_text: Great!
character_words: Great!

full_text: Wait! [Katara flies by.] How do I land this thing? What if I land over a-ack-ack-bleck! Bug! Bug! Ack, that was a bug!
character_words: Wait!  How do I land this thing? What if I land over a-ack-ack-bleck! Bug! Bug! Ack, that was a bug!

full_text: Back to Sokka and the mechanist. The mechanist is drawing on a large piece of paper and Sokka is looking through shelves. Sokka drops various things, including seven scrolls, four pieces of paper, a hard-boiled egg and a model of a hot air balloon.
character_words: NA

full_text: I said don't touch anything! [Comes over to help Sokka pick things up.] Oh, don't worry. That experiment's old, [Referring to the hot air balloon.] and that egg was just part of last week's lunch.
character_words: I said don't touch anything!  Oh, don't worry. That experiment's old,  and that egg was just part of last week's lunch.

full_text: [He sniffs the air before wincing.] Ugh! Week old egg smell!
character_words: Ugh! Week old egg smell!

full_text: Quick, find that egg! [Both crawl around the floor looking for it.]
character_words: Quick, find that egg!

full_text: Shows Aang, Teo and Katara at the door of the airbending room.
character_words: NA

full_text: I can't believe I'm finally going to see what's inside!
character_words: I can't believe I'm finally going to see what's inside!

full_text: Aang airbends into the door's contraption, flipping three dials so air comes out of them. Cut to Sokka and the mechanist searching for the egg.
character_words: NA

full_text: How can something so small that you can't even see it make such a big stink!?
character_words: How can something so small that you can't even see it make such a big stink!?

full_text: The mechanist looks up from searching.
character_words: NA

full_text: That's the solution to our problem!
character_words: That's the solution to our problem!

full_text: Yeah ... [Both turn toward each other.] if we put a whole mess of rotten eggs in the cellar where the gas seeps up ...
character_words: Yeah ...  if we put a whole mess of rotten eggs in the cellar where the gas seeps up ...

full_text: ... The gas will mix with the smell of rotten eggs!
character_words: ... The gas will mix with the smell of rotten eggs!

full_text: Then, if there's a leak ...
character_words: Then, if there's a leak ...

full_text: ... You smell rotten eggs! Then, you just follow your nose to the place where the smell is coming from ...
character_words: ... You smell rotten eggs! Then, you just follow your nose to the place where the smell is coming from ...

full_text: And plug up the hole where the gas is escaping!
character_words: And plug up the hole where the gas is escaping!

full_text: Both throw up their hands.
character_words: NA

full_text: You're a genius! [Bell rings on one of his desks.]
character_words: You're a genius!

full_text: Something's wrong. [Stands up.] I've go to go! [Runs out the door and Sokka follows.]
character_words: Something's wrong.  I've go to go!

full_text: Shows Aang, Teo, and Katara walking into the large room. It's filled with Fire Nation weapons, tools and a red hot air balloon with the Fire Nation insignia on it.
character_words: NA

full_text: This is a nightmare.
character_words: This is a nightmare.

full_text: [Walks in with Sokka behind him.] You don't understand!
character_words: You don't understand!

full_text: [Accusingly.] You're making weapons for the Fire Nation!
character_words: You're making weapons for the Fire Nation!

full_text: [Angrily.] You make weapons for the Fire Nation?!
character_words: You make weapons for the Fire Nation?!

full_text: Explain all this! Now!
character_words: Explain all this! Now!

full_text: [He is hesitant, but resigned as he begins to explain.] It was about a year after we moved here. Fire Nation soldiers found our settlement. You were too young to remember this, Teo. They were going to destroy everything! Burn it to the ground! I pleaded with them, I begged them to spare us! They asked what I had to offer. I offered ... my services. You must understand. I did this for you!
character_words: It was about a year after we moved here. Fire Nation soldiers found our settlement. You were too young to remember this, Teo. They were going to destroy everything! Burn it to the ground! I pleaded with them, I begged them to spare us! They asked what I had to offer. I offered ... my services. You must understand. I did this for you!

full_text: Teo looks away in shame and the mechanist leaves. The scene cuts to him in his workshop, placing two eggs with smiley faces in his hot air balloon model, along with a candle to make it float. He looks rather depressed. He lets go of the bottom and it starts to float. As this happens, the door opens, with Aang and Teo standing in the doorway.
character_words: NA

full_text: When are they coming?
character_words: When are they coming?

full_text: Soon. [Candle pops once.] Very soon.
character_words: Soon.  Very soon.

full_text: You can't give them more weapons.
character_words: You can't give them more weapons.

full_text: If I don't give them what they want, they will destroy this place! [The model of the hot air balloon catches fire and crashes. The mechanist puts the fire out with a cloth.]
character_words: If I don't give them what they want, they will destroy this place!

full_text: How can I be proud of you when your inventions are being used for murder?
character_words: How can I be proud of you when your inventions are being used for murder?

full_text: I need some time to think. [Bell rings on his desk.] You need to leave! Go!
character_words: I need some time to think.  You need to leave! Go!

full_text: We're not leaving!
character_words: We're not leaving!

full_text: Then hide! Quickly! [They hide behind some of his inventions. the mechanist pulls a rope that opens a trapdoor, and a war minister from the Fire Nation is lifted into the room.]
character_words: Then hide! Quickly!

full_text: You know better than to keep me waiting. Give me what you owe us so we can be on our way. [The mechanist looks down.] Well? Is there a problem?
character_words: You know better than to keep me waiting. Give me what you owe us so we can be on our way.  Well? Is there a problem?

full_text: [Hurredly.] No, right this way. [Gestures toward the door.]
character_words: No, right this way.

full_text: Qin is about to go out the door, but Aang airbends it shut. He jumps in front of the door.
character_words: NA

full_text: The deal's off.
character_words: The deal's off.

full_text: The Avatar ...
character_words: The Avatar ...

full_text: Aang, don't get involved!
character_words: Aang, don't get involved!

full_text: If I don't get what I came here for, the Fire Nation will burn this place to rubble!
character_words: If I don't get what I came here for, the Fire Nation will burn this place to rubble!

full_text: Get out of here! [Slaps him in the face with an air swipe; continues off screen.] You're leaving empty-handed!
character_words: Get out of here!  You're leaving empty-handed!

full_text: Then the destruction of this temple [Pointing at Aang.] will be on your head! [He leaves through the trap door and Aang airbends it shut.]
character_words: Then the destruction of this temple  will be on your head!

full_text: The four children are now talking on the tall bridge.
character_words: NA

full_text: This is bad.
character_words: This is bad.

full_text: Very bad!
character_words: Very bad!

full_text: Aang, what are we going to do? How can we possibly keep them all away?
character_words: Aang, what are we going to do? How can we possibly keep them all away?

full_text: I'll tell you how. We have something they don't. [Points to the sky.] Air power. We control the sky. That's something the Fire Nation can't do. We can win!
character_words: I'll tell you how. We have something they don't.  Air power. We control the sky. That's something the Fire Nation can't do. We can win!

full_text: I want to help. [He appears at the door.]
character_words: I want to help.

full_text: Good. We'll need it.
character_words: Good. We'll need it.

full_text: Cuts to an aerial shot of the temple, before cutting to the mechanist's workshop. He is standing behind a table with Sokka. The model hot air balloon, a few plans, and a candle are resting on the table. Aang, Katara, and Teo are on the other side, surrounded by other colonists.
character_words: NA

full_text: We finally got the war balloon working, thanks to Sokka. This boy's a genius!
character_words: We finally got the war balloon working, thanks to Sokka. This boy's a genius!

full_text: Thank you. You're a genius!
character_words: Thank you. You're a genius!

full_text: Thank you! [Katara and Aang exchange unamused glances.]
character_words: Thank you!

full_text: See, the problem with the old war balloon was you could get it air-borne, [Places the candle in the model.] but once it did, it just kept going. [He pulls a string connected to the model, putting it on the table.] You could put a hole in the top, but then all the hot air would escape. So the question became, how do you keep a lid on hot air?
character_words: See, the problem with the old war balloon was you could get it air-borne,  but once it did, it just kept going.  You could put a hole in the top, but then all the hot air would escape. So the question became, how do you keep a lid on hot air?

full_text: Ugh, if only we knew. [Teo, Katara, and Aang laugh.]
character_words: Ugh, if only we knew.

full_text: A lid is actually the answer. If you control the hot air, you control the war balloon.
character_words: A lid is actually the answer. If you control the hot air, you control the war balloon.

full_text: Huh, that's actually pretty smart.
character_words: Huh, that's actually pretty smart.

full_text: Okay, we've got four kinds of bombs: [He begins listing them off on his fingers.] smoke, slime, fire, and ...
character_words: Okay, we've got four kinds of bombs:  smoke, slime, fire, and ...

full_text: Stink! Never underestimate the power of stink!
character_words: Stink! Never underestimate the power of stink!

full_text: Cut to exterior shot of temple. Everyone is outside, watching anxiously for any sign of the Fire Nation.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Looking over a ledge.] They're coming!
character_words: They're coming!

full_text: Are we ready?
character_words: Are we ready?

full_text: [Worriedly.] Yes. But where's Sokka with the war balloon?
character_words: Yes. But where's Sokka with the war balloon?

full_text: [Jumping off Appa.] We'll have to start without it.
character_words: We'll have to start without it.

full_text: Cut to shot of people readying their flying machines for take off. They begin the assault as their gliders fly off into the air. Cheers from the crowd below. Cut to Fire Nation troops climbing the cliff path. They are attacked by the various bombs thrown at them. Cut back to Aang and the other flyers going down through the clouds. The gliders fly over the Fire Nation troops dropping bombs below. Cut to Fire Nation troops on the cliff edge.
character_words: NA

full_text: Take them out of the sky. Now!
character_words: Take them out of the sky. Now!

full_text: Cut to more gliders dropping bombs. Fire Nation soldiers cough and some fall off the cliff. Cut to Aang jumping onto an air scooter, moving across a ledge, causing snow to fall onto soldiers below before jumping back onto his glider. Cut to the soldiers retreating.
character_words: NA

full_text: We've got them on the run! We need more slime!
character_words: We've got them on the run! We need more slime!

full_text: Cut to gliders flying up through the clouds to Appa and receiving more bombs from Katara. Hooks fly through the clouds nearly hitting Appa and latching onto the cliff. Cut to tanks scaling the cliffs via the chains. Aang sees this and manages to remove one hook. The tank falls before sending out another hook. Cut to distance shot of temple with tanks closing in. Gliders continue to fly dropping bombs in an attempt to slow the tanks down. Many cuts to interiors of tanks showing soldiers firebending out of them. Aang lands and airbends the tanks away. The tanks flip over and readjust themselves before continuing on. Cut to Katara and Teo in sky.
character_words: NA

full_text: Those things are unstoppable!
character_words: Those things are unstoppable!

full_text: [Thoughtfully, trying to remember what he knew.] I think I know how they work. I remember my dad tinkering with the counterbalancing system. Something to do with water. Works great, huh?
character_words: I think I know how they work. I remember my dad tinkering with the counterbalancing system. Something to do with water. Works great, huh?

full_text: Water? Can you get me close to one?
character_words: Water? Can you get me close to one?

full_text: No problem!
character_words: No problem!

full_text: Cut to aerial view of Aang fending off firebending blasts. Cut to Katara landing next to him. Katara freezes multiple tanks with waterbending. Camera zooms out to show more tanks. Aang defends Katara from fire blasts before Appa drops in front and knocks the tanks away. Cut to behind Appa showing Katara and Aang climbing up his tail. Cut to Aang and Katara looking down at the oncoming force. Cut to the temple balcony with Katara, Aang and Teo.

full_text: We're out of bombs!

full_text: Hey, why aren't they shooting at us?

full_text: [Close-up of Sokka on war balloon.] Then I guess they won't see this coming. [Slices rope attached to a large bomb.]

full_text: [Cut to view of both balloon and advancing army.] Bombs away!
character_words: Bombs away!

full_text: Cut to ground view of soldiers being washed away by slime. Cut to above war balloon showing Sokka cut another rope. Cut back to view of soldiers and balloon showing the bombs stopping some of soldiers and tanks. Cut to shot under balloon showing Sokka and the mechanist looking down.
character_words: NA

full_text: Oh no, that was the last one. [Cut to tanks beginning to scale the cliffs.]
character_words: Oh no, that was the last one.

full_text: [Cut back to Sokka and the mechanist.] Wait a second. You smell that?

full_text: Rotten eggs! [Cut to a view of the balloon and a large crevice in the ground below.] There! That's were the gas is escaping.

full_text: Cut to close-up of Sokka with the expression of having an idea. Cut to tanks scaling cliff side. Cut to Earth Kingdom civilians trying to knock the hooks away.
