writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I'm afraid I don't understand.
character_words: I'm afraid I don't understand.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: You said the tides would not allow us to bring the ship in. [In a sharper tone.] Do the tides command this ship?
character_words: You said the tides would not allow us to bring the ship in.  Do the tides command this ship?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: No, princess.
character_words: No, princess.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: And if I were to have you thrown overboard, would the tides think twice about smashing you against the rocky shore?
character_words: And if I were to have you thrown overboard, would the tides think twice about smashing you against the rocky shore?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Worried.] No, princess.
character_words: No, princess.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Runs fingers through her bangs.] Well then, maybe you should worry less about the tides who have already made up their mind about killing you, and worry more about me, who's still mulling it over. [Turns to face the captain angrily.]
character_words: Well then, maybe you should worry less about the tides who have already made up their mind about killing you, and worry more about me, who's still mulling it over.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I'll pull us in.
character_words: I'll pull us in.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: He leaves. Cuts to a close-up of Azula, who glares and narrows her eyes in suspicion. The scene switches to the team flying on Appa.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Rises to view their destination.] There it is!
character_words: There it is!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The gang arrives at General Fong's base, where he and his soldiers are waiting.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Welcome, Avatar Aang! [Cuts to shot of the team stretching after riding on Appa.] I am General Fong, and welcome, to all of you great heroes! Appa, Momo, brave Sokka, the mighty Katara ...
character_words: Welcome, Avatar Aang!  I am General Fong, and welcome, to all of you great heroes! Appa, Momo, brave Sokka, the mighty Katara ...
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Pleased.] Mighty Katara? I like that.
character_words: Mighty Katara? I like that.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Fireworks go off, launched by the soldiers using earthbending.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Viewing the display.] Not bad, not bad.
character_words: Not bad, not bad.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The scene cuts to inside the base, where General Fong and the team are sitting in a spacious discussion room.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Camera view depicts entire room.] Avatar Aang, we were all amazed at the stories of how you singlehandedly wiped out an entire Fire Navy fleet at the North Pole. [Closes up to Fong, stroking his beard.] I can't imagine what it feels like to wield such devastating power. It's an awesome responsibility.
character_words: Avatar Aang, we were all amazed at the stories of how you singlehandedly wiped out an entire Fire Navy fleet at the North Pole.  I can't imagine what it feels like to wield such devastating power. It's an awesome responsibility.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Casually.] I try not to think about it too much.
character_words: I try not to think about it too much.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Calmly.] Avatar, you're ready to face the Fire Lord now.
character_words: Avatar, you're ready to face the Fire Lord now.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Shocked.] What? No I'm not!
character_words: What? No I'm not!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Holds out her hand in reasoning.] Aang still needs to master all four elements.
character_words: Aang still needs to master all four elements.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Why? With the kind of power he possesses, power enough to destroy hundreds of battle ships in a matter of minutes, he could defeat the Fire Lord now!
character_words: Why? With the kind of power he possesses, power enough to destroy hundreds of battle ships in a matter of minutes, he could defeat the Fire Lord now!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: But sir, the thing is, Aang can only do those things when he's in the Avatar State.
character_words: But sir, the thing is, Aang can only do those things when he's in the Avatar State.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: See, it's this special state where-
character_words: See, it's this special state where-
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Sharply.] I'm well aware! Your eyes and tattoos glow and you're able to summon unbelievable power. Without you, we'd be slaughtered before we even reach their shores. [Looks at map and guides finger from the location of the base to the location of the Fire Nation Capital.] But with you leading the way, as the ultimate weapon, we could cut a swath right through to the heart of the Fire Nation.
character_words: I'm well aware! Your eyes and tattoos glow and you're able to summon unbelievable power. Without you, we'd be slaughtered before we even reach their shores.  But with you leading the way, as the ultimate weapon, we could cut a swath right through to the heart of the Fire Nation.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Doubtfully.] Right, but, I don't know how to get in or out of the Avatar State, much less what to do once I'm there.
character_words: Right, but, I don't know how to get in or out of the Avatar State, much less what to do once I'm there.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: So, it's decided then. I'll help you figure out how to get into the Avatar State and then you'll face your destiny.
character_words: So, it's decided then. I'll help you figure out how to get into the Avatar State and then you'll face your destiny.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [The group rises; angrily.] No, nothing's decided. We already have a plan. Aang's pursuing his destiny his way.
character_words: No, nothing's decided. We already have a plan. Aang's pursuing his destiny his way.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Well, while you take your time learning the elements, the War goes on. May I show you something? [Leads Aang to a window.] That's the infirmary, and those soldiers are the lucky ones. [Several soldiers are injured and walking slowly.] They came back. Every day, the Fire Nation takes lives. People are dying, Aang! You could end it, now. Think about it.
character_words: Well, while you take your time learning the elements, the War goes on. May I show you something?  That's the infirmary, and those soldiers are the lucky ones.  They came back. Every day, the Fire Nation takes lives. People are dying, Aang! You could end it, now. Think about it.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Aang averts his eyes to the side, looking unsure. The scene changes to Azula's ship, where she is training. She stands perfectly straight, holding her fingers in her hand. The camera cuts to where Lo and Li are sitting, overseeing her training. Cuts to shot of Azula, as she moves her arms in a circular motion, generating lightning and firing the bolt into the sky.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Almost perfect.
character_words: Almost perfect.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: One hair out of place.
character_words: One hair out of place.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Close-up of her face as she pushes a loose strand of hair away.] Almost isn't good enough!
character_words: Almost isn't good enough!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: She repeats her actions, generating lightning again and firing it off into the distance. Cuts to a shot of Iroh, who suddenly awakens from a nap, sits up and peers in curiosity. The scene changes to nightfall at Fong's base.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: General Fong?
character_words: General Fong?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Come in, Aang. Have you thought about our discussion?
character_words: Come in, Aang. Have you thought about our discussion?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I'm in. I'll fight the Fire Lord.
character_words: I'm in. I'll fight the Fire Lord.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The scene changes to where Aang has entered a room with several plain beds, where the team is resting for the night.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Sits on his bed.] I told the general I'd help him, by going into the Avatar State.
character_words: I told the general I'd help him, by going into the Avatar State.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Sits up.] Aang, no! This is not the right way!
character_words: Aang, no! This is not the right way!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Resting on his bed with his arms behind his head.] Why not? Remember when he took out the Fire Navy? [Widens his eyes.] He was incredible!
character_words: Why not? Remember when he took out the Fire Navy?  He was incredible!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: There's a right way to do this. Practice, study, and discipline!
character_words: There's a right way to do this. Practice, study, and discipline!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Casually.] Or just glow it up and stop that Fire Lord!
character_words: Or just glow it up and stop that Fire Lord!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Rises and throws her hands up in surrender.] If you two meat heads want to throw away everything we've worked for, fine, go ahead and glow it up! [Exits.]
character_words: If you two meat heads want to throw away everything we've worked for, fine, go ahead and glow it up!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Katara, I'm just being realistic! I don't have time to do this the right way!
character_words: Katara, I'm just being realistic! I don't have time to do this the right way!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Aang casts a mournful look. The scene changes to the next day where Fong, the team, and another soldier are sitting in an outdoor room. The soldier is pouring tea in a cup.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Drops white food item into the teapot.] This rare chi-enhancing tea is a natural stimulant. In an ordinary warrior, it improves strength and energy ten-fold. In you, it may induce the Avatar State.
character_words: This rare chi-enhancing tea is a natural stimulant. In an ordinary warrior, it improves strength and energy ten-fold. In you, it may induce the Avatar State.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Ten-fold energy, huh?
character_words: Ten-fold energy, huh?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Aang drinks the tea, causing his eyebrows to twitch slightly. The camera pans downward to the same scene where Aang is riding rapidly on an air scooter, hyper from the energy boost.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Quickly in a high-pitched voice.] Is it working? Is it working? I can't tell! Somebody tell me if I'm in the Avatar State 'cause I don't have a good view of myself! Am I talking too loud?
character_words: Is it working? Is it working? I can't tell! Somebody tell me if I'm in the Avatar State 'cause I don't have a good view of myself! Am I talking too loud?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Sitting on the floor, tired out by Aang's actions.] I guess he could talk the Fire Lord to death.
character_words: I guess he could talk the Fire Lord to death.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Aang hits a pillar and falls backward. The scene switches to where Aang is sitting on the ground, Sokka standing a few feet away.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Maybe I can shock you into the Avatar State.
character_words: Maybe I can shock you into the Avatar State.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I love surprises!
character_words: I love surprises!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Camera cuts to view from Aang's perspective, Katara covering his eye with her hands. She uncovers his eyes to reveal Sokka towering over Aang, his head instead replaced with Momo's, who screeches. Aang screams and glances at his arrow tattoos.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Holding up hands.] Still not glowing.
character_words: Still not glowing.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Cuts to view of the entire team as Sokka steps backward, loses his balance and falls to the ground off camera. Fong shakes his head in dismay. The scene changes to a dimly lit room where Aang is standing, wearing an outfit consisting of a Water Tribe cloak, an Earth Kingdom hat with leaves coming out of the top, part of a Fire Nation soldier outfit and what appears to be a belt.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: You are wearing a ceremonial piece of clothing from each of the bending nations. Now I will join the four elements into one! Water [Pours jug of water into the bowl.], earth [Pours in bowl of dirt.], fire [Takes nearby torch and throws it in.], air! [Releases air gust from wooden contraption.] Four elements together as one!
character_words: You are wearing a ceremonial piece of clothing from each of the bending nations. Now I will join the four elements into one! Water , earth , fire , air!  Four elements together as one!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The oracle raises the bowl and flings the contents at Aang, coating him in mud.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Annoyed.] This is just mud!
character_words: This is just mud!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Quizzically.] So ... do you feel anything?
character_words: So ... do you feel anything?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Aang raises his finger, catching everyone's interest, only to sneeze, causing mud to fly everywhere, coating Fong, Katara, and Sokka.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Rubs mud from face.] We have to find a way.
character_words: We have to find a way.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The scene changes to Zuko and Iroh's place of stay, the room dark inside. Several various shells fall from a bag onto the table. The camera pans up to where Iroh is standing at the table, picking up and examining the different shells.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Holds up one shell.] Look at these magnificent shells! [Picks up a conch.] I'll enjoy these keepsakes for years to come.
character_words: Look at these magnificent shells!  I'll enjoy these keepsakes for years to come.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: We don't need any more useless things! You forget, we have to carry everything ourselves now!
character_words: We don't need any more useless things! You forget, we have to carry everything ourselves now!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [From the corner, sitting at the table; calmly.] Hello, brother. Uncle.
character_words: Hello, brother. Uncle.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Angrily.] What are you doing here?
character_words: What are you doing here?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Holds up a shell in her hand.] In my country, we exchange a pleasant hello before asking questions. [Rises and walks toward Zuko and Iroh.] Have you become uncivilized so soon, Zuzu?
character_words: In my country, we exchange a pleasant hello before asking questions.  Have you become uncivilized so soon, Zuzu?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Angrily.] Don't call me that!
character_words: Don't call me that!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Clearly upset.] To what do we owe this honor?
character_words: To what do we owe this honor?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Hmmm ... must be a family trait. Both of you so quick to get to the point. [Breaks the shell she was holding with her fingertips, leaving Iroh angry.] I've come with a message from home. Father's changed his mind. Family is suddenly very important to him. He's heard rumors of plans to overthrow him; treacherous plots. Family are the only ones you can really trust. [Pauses briefly.] Father regrets your banishment. He wants you home. [Silence.] Did you hear me? You should be happy. Excited. Grateful. I just gave you great news.
character_words: Hmmm ... must be a family trait. Both of you so quick to get to the point.  I've come with a message from home. Father's changed his mind. Family is suddenly very important to him. He's heard rumors of plans to overthrow him; treacherous plots. Family are the only ones you can really trust.  Father regrets your banishment. He wants you home.  Did you hear me? You should be happy. Excited. Grateful. I just gave you great news.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I'm sure your brother simply needs a moment.
character_words: I'm sure your brother simply needs a moment.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Furiously.] Don't interrupt, Uncle! [To Zuko.] I still haven't heard my thank you. [Annoyed.] I'm not a messenger. I didn't have to come all this way.
character_words: Don't interrupt, Uncle!  I still haven't heard my thank you.  I'm not a messenger. I didn't have to come all this way.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Surprised.] Father regrets? He ... wants me back?
character_words: Father regrets? He ... wants me back?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I can see you need time to take this in. I'll come to call on you tomorrow. Good evening.
character_words: I can see you need time to take this in. I'll come to call on you tomorrow. Good evening.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: She exits, leaving Zuko to ponder what has just been said. Meanwhile, at Fong's base, Aang and Katara stand on a balcony, the sun setting over the horizon.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Can we talk about something?
character_words: Can we talk about something?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Sure.
character_words: Sure.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Cuts to side-shot of Aang and Katara.] Do you remember when we were at the air temple and you found Monk Gyatso's skeleton? It must have been so horrible and traumatic for you. I saw you get so upset that you weren't even you anymore. [Closes up to Katara.] I'm not saying the Avatar State doesn't have incredible and helpful power ... but you have to understand ... for the people who love you, watching you be in that much rage and pain is really scary.
character_words: Do you remember when we were at the air temple and you found Monk Gyatso's skeleton? It must have been so horrible and traumatic for you. I saw you get so upset that you weren't even you anymore.  I'm not saying the Avatar State doesn't have incredible and helpful power ... but you have to understand ... for the people who love you, watching you be in that much rage and pain is really scary.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I'm really glad you told me that. But I still need to do this.
character_words: I'm really glad you told me that. But I still need to do this.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Upset.] I don't understand.
character_words: I don't understand.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Cuts to overall view of Aang and Katara.] No, you don't. Every day, more and more people die. I'm already one hundred years late. Defeating the Fire Lord is the only way to stop this war. I have to try it!
character_words: No, you don't. Every day, more and more people die. I'm already one hundred years late. Defeating the Fire Lord is the only way to stop this war. I have to try it!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Sadly.] I can't watch you do this to yourself. I'm not coming tomorrow. [Begins to exit.] Good night.
character_words: I can't watch you do this to yourself. I'm not coming tomorrow.  Good night.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Sadly.] Good night.
character_words: Good night.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The scene changes to nightfall at Zuko and Iroh's house. Cuts to inside the house.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Packing belongings.] We're going home! After three long years, it's unbelievable!
character_words: We're going home! After three long years, it's unbelievable!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Staring out the window thoughtfully.] It is unbelievable. I have never known my brother to regret anything.
character_words: It is unbelievable. I have never known my brother to regret anything.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Did you listen to Azula? Father's realized how important family is to him! [Irritated.] He cares about me!
character_words: Did you listen to Azula? Father's realized how important family is to him!  He cares about me!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Turns to face Zuko and holds out arms in gesture.] I care about you! And if Ozai wants you back, well, I think it may not be for the reasons you imagine.
character_words: I care about you! And if Ozai wants you back, well, I think it may not be for the reasons you imagine.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Turns his back to Iroh.] You don't know how my father feels about me. You don't know anything!
character_words: You don't know how my father feels about me. You don't know anything!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Zuko, I only meant that in our family, things are not always what they seem.
character_words: Zuko, I only meant that in our family, things are not always what they seem.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Turns to face Iroh.] I think you are exactly what you seem! A lazy, mistrustful, shallow old man who's always been jealous of his brother!
character_words: I think you are exactly what you seem! A lazy, mistrustful, shallow old man who's always been jealous of his brother!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Zuko walks away, leaving Iroh saddened. Meanwhile, Aang is caught in another dream. The dream takes place in the Southern seas on Zuko's ship, where the Avatar State Aang rises from the water, riding a water vortex, similar to the way Aang did in the beginning of the series. The personage lands on deck and sweeps away the real Aang with waterbending. The personage turns to Zuko and performs the same downward, cutting motion as seen in previous dreams before the dream abruptly ends and Aang awakens.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Sits up in his bed.] Sokka! Sokka, wake up.
character_words: Sokka! Sokka, wake up.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Huh?
character_words: Huh?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I don't think we should be trying to bring on the Avatar State.
character_words: I don't think we should be trying to bring on the Avatar State.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: You sure?
character_words: You sure?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Yes.
character_words: Yes.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Nonchalantly.] Okay.
character_words: Okay.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Do you think the general will be mad?
character_words: Do you think the general will be mad?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: What can he say? You're the Avatar. Who knows better than you?
character_words: What can he say? You're the Avatar. Who knows better than you?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Aang lies back on his bed, resting his head on his arms. The next morning, we cut back to Zuko, who is getting ready to return home. He descends a stone staircase, carrying his bags.

full_text: [Humbly.] The thing is, I don't think we'll ever be able to trigger it on purpose. So I guess that's it.

full_text: [Calmly.] You sure I can't change your mind?

full_text: I'm sure. I can only reach the Avatar State when I'm in genuine danger.

full_text: I see. I was afraid you'd say that.

full_text: The camera focuses on soldiers, who prepare to fire large earth coins at Aang using earthbending. Cuts to a shot of Aang, looking nervously about him. The camera zooms out to a shot of him and his attackers before switching to a soldier, who sends an earth coin at him. Aang avoids two oncoming coins and soars in the air parallel to the ground between two more coins that are thrown at him. He lands safely to the ground.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Looking about cautiously.] I'm not your enemy! I won't fight you!
character_words: I'm not your enemy! I won't fight you!

full_text:
He jumps into the air as four earth coins are sent his way, crashing into each other. As Aang begins his descent, another earth coin is sent skidding toward him; the coin crashes into one of the four stationery coins. Aang lands on the ground where the coin was standing just moments ago. Two of the other stationery coins are closed together. The camera cuts to a shot of Aang trapped inside the holes of the earth coins, rolling speedily away. An earthbender breaks the coins, crumbling them to bits. Aang lands on the ground, rises and faces the rest of the soldiers.
Meanwhile, Sokka, who was being held down by the two soldiers, raises his feet and steps on their bare feet forcefully. The two soldiers release their grip and fall forward onto the ground in pain while Sokka runs away to aid Aang.
Outside, Aang narrowly avoids two earth coins sent at him, one flying above him, one flying below him. Two more earth coins are sent from opposite sides of the ring, threatening to crush him. Aang manages to escape by dodging through the holes in the coins just as they collide together and fall to the ground.
Riding an air scooter, Aang zigzags past several soldiers who attempt to slow him down by conjuring up rock walls in his path. Two soldiers riding ostrich horses chase after him as Aang rides past and scales up the wall of the base. As he is seen riding up the wall on the air scooter, the two soldiers use earthbending to propel themselves upward. Aang's air scooter runs out of air and he begins running up the wall, the two soldiers following him in hot pursuit. Cuts to a top view of Aang scaling the wall, only to narrowly dodge two spears coming his way.
He falls to the ground. The two soldiers land on the wall and descend to the ground after him. Aang somersaults forward as he avoids their spear attacks yet again. He lands onto the ground, an earth coin embedded into it. The earth coin is suddenly sent upward and dragged forward, Aang being trapped in its hole. The earth coin lands in front of Fong.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: You can't run forever!
character_words: You can't run forever!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: You can't fight forever!
character_words: You can't fight forever!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Fong leaps forward and crushes the earth coin, just as Aang jumps to avoid the attack. Dust from the impact is sent flying toward the screen. The scene changes to where Zuko and Iroh are approaching Azula's ship. The camera pans upward and focuses on a shot of Azula standing quietly on top of a ramp leading up to the ship. Royal Procession guards stand on either side of them as they walk, forming an aisle. Iroh averts his eyes suspiciously between the guards. They reach the ship and bow; the guards behind them walk forward and close the aisle.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Brother! Uncle! Welcome! I'm so glad you decided to come.

full_text: The camera cuts to a side-shot of Iroh, opening his eyes slightly and casting a suspicious glance at the guards.
character_words: NA

full_text: Are we ready to depart, Your Highness?
character_words: Are we ready to depart, Your Highness?

full_text: [Sweetly.] Set our course for home, captain.

character_words: Home.

full_text: The captain widens his eyes in realization at his mistake and looks at Azula. Zuko and Iroh stop, looking surprised. Cut to Azula with a look of surprise on her face. The camera rushes to her face as her expression turns to fury. Cut back to the captain, his eyes wide.

He pushes them off the edge of the walkway and sends fire blasts their way. Cuts to a side-shot of Zuko, as he stomps furiously up the ramp and throws the captain off.
character_words: NA

full_text: You lied to me! [Cut to Azula, who appears confident.]

full_text: [Smugly.] Like I've never done that before.

Zuko crosses his arms and spreads them outward, deflecting the attacks and shouts as he charges onto the ship. The scene changes to Aang, who avoids three earth coins that slam onto the ground, threatening to crush him. He runs to the left of the screen as another coin rolls his way. The scene changes to the team's bedroom, where Katara is lying on her bed, listening to the noises outside.

character_words: I wonder what crazy thing they're trying to do now.  Maybe we should just make sure Aang's okay.

character_words: The general's gone crazy! He's trying to force Aang into the Avatar State!

Cuts to Aang, who is being chased by another soldier mounted on an ostrich horse. The head of the spear the soldier was holding is suddenly snapped off. He slows down, stunned at this. Cuts to a shot of Katara summoning a water whip.

full_text: The soldiers rotate the earth coins so that their flat sides face Katara. The camera zooms out to the entire arena, the coins forming a triangular pattern around Katara. The waterbender sends a water whip at Fong, who summons up dust pillars that deflect the water and turn it to mud. He uses earthbending to begin sinking her into the ground. She twists around, buried knee deep.

full_text: [Struggling to break free.] I can't move!

full_text: [Worried; clenches his fists.] Don't hurt her!
character_words: Don't hurt her!

writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Riding the ostrich horse.] Katara! No!
character_words: Katara! No!

full_text: He gallops toward her, but Fong sinks the animal's feet into the ground, flinging Sokka off the ostrich horse. Sokka slams into the hole of an earth coin, leaving him dangling.

writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Desperately and clutching onto Fong's arm.] Stop this! You have to let her go!
character_words: Stop this! You have to let her go!

full_text: You could save her if you were in the Avatar State!
character_words: You could save her if you were in the Avatar State!

full_text: [Tears forming around his eyes.] I'm trying ... I'm trying!
character_words: I'm trying ... I'm trying!

full_text: [Frantically.] Aang, I'm sinking! [Twists around again and is buried chest deep.]

full_text: [Desperately.] Please!

full_text: He clenches his fist tight, sinking Katara completely. She cries out in fear before being completely buried in the ground. Aang leaps forward and attempts to save her, however, he falls short. Closes up on Aang, as his arrow tattoo begins to glow a bright white. He turns his head to face Fong, the Avatar State now triggered.

full_text: [Triumphantly.] It worked! It worked!
character_words: It worked! It worked!

full_text:
An air blast is sent his way and his triumphant expression soon becomes one of fear as he realizes the situation. Cuts to Aang, who performs the downward cutting motion as seen in his previous dreams and pushes Fong back with a powerful air blast. Fong lands roughly on the ground. Cuts to Aang, who begins rising on an earth vortex.
The scene changes to Zuko, who leaps onto the deck of the ship and blasts the two guards off the ship with two fire blasts. He lands on deck. The camera zooms out to where Azula is standing patiently several feet away, her back turned to him. Focuses on Azula, who smirks. Cuts to Zuko, who clenches his fists and prepares fire daggers. Cuts to Iroh, who continues to attack the guards on the walkway.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Pushes several guards away; grabs one and wrestles him.] Zuko! Let's go!
character_words: Zuko! Let's go!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: He hurls the guard over the edge and steps to the side to avoid another guard's attack and push him aside. Cuts back to Zuko, who charges at Azula with fire daggers. Zooms out to where he attempts to strike Azula, only for the princess to acutely dodge all of his blows. Cuts to close-up of her as she smirks at her brother. Zooms out to both siblings as Zuko keeps attacking and Azula keeps avoiding. Zuko brings down his right hand to land another blow, however, Azula manages to push him away.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: You know, Father blames Uncle for the loss of the North Pole. And he considers you a miserable failure for not finding the Avatar! [Cuts to Zuko, who is panting heavily.] Why would he want you back home, except to lock you up [Cuts back to Azula.] where you can no longer embarrass him?
character_words: You know, Father blames Uncle for the loss of the North Pole. And he considers you a miserable failure for not finding the Avatar!  Why would he want you back home, except to lock you up  where you can no longer embarrass him?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text:
Zuko conjures up two fire daggers again. He leaps into the air and sends a powerful fire blast at Azula using his foot. She jumps and lands safely on the deck several feet away. Zuko charges at her as she rises to her feet. After dodging several more attacks, she manages to scrape his forehead with her fingernails, leaving three scratch marks on his temple. Zuko falls back a few feet from the impact and yells as he charges at her again.
The two continue to duel, eventually making their way up a stairway that leads to the central control area of the ship. Azula manages grab hold of Zuko's arm. A few seconds pause as the two stand silently, Zuko widening his eyes in alarm. Cuts to a side-shot of the stairway where Azula knocks him to his feet with a blue fire blast. Zuko lands roughly at the bottom of the stairwell. Cuts to a shot from Zuko's perspective, the screen slightly blurred to show the effects of the blow. The camera travels upward from side to side before landing on Azula, who moves both her arms in a circular motion, generating lightning. Cuts to shot of her readying the attack and firing the bolt at her brother, only for Iroh to step in suddenly, grab hold of her right hand and redirect the lightning, causing it to strike a far-off cliff side. He bends her downward and kicks her off the ship. Azula lands in the water below with a splash. Cuts to Zuko and Iroh, who run away from the ship.
The scene changes to Fong's base, where Aang is rising on the earth vortex, still under the control of the Avatar State.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Pleading.] Avatar Aang! Can you hear me? Your friend is safe! [Brings Katara back above ground; cuts to close-up of her as she looks up at Aang in misery.] It was just a trick to trigger the Avatar State ... [Cuts back to Fong, who smiles maniacally.] and it worked!
character_words: Avatar Aang! Can you hear me? Your friend is safe!  It was just a trick to trigger the Avatar State ...  and it worked!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text:
Aang swivels about on the vortex and lands on the ground forcefully, causing a flurry of dust to spread. Fong is sent back several feet while Katara remains rooted to the ground where she was. Cuts to the left of the arena where several soldiers are standing, a torrent of dust rumbling their way. The dust clears to reveal the ground broken and in ruins. Cuts to right of the arena, where several soldiers on ostrich horses stand. The dust torrent passes over them and clears, revealing that side in ruins. Cuts to another area of the base, where several houses lie. Again, the torrent passes over, leaving the houses considerably damaged.
Cuts to Aang, who is still under the influence of the Avatar State. His spirit is seen leaving his body and rising into the air. Cuts to bird's-eye view of the base as Roku's dragon, Fang passes by, Avatar Roku and Aang riding atop the beast.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Looking at Aang.] It's time you learned.
character_words: It's time you learned.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: They fly higher above the dusty clouds. Cuts to side shot of the dragon, many small figures seen floating in the distance.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Cuts to Roku.] The Avatar State is a defense mechanism, designed to empower you with the skills and knowledge of all the past Avatars.
character_words: The Avatar State is a defense mechanism, designed to empower you with the skills and knowledge of all the past Avatars.

full_text: Cuts to Avatar Kyoshi, who stands surrounded by rocky mountain terrain. Her eyes glow for a moment and she assumes a fighting stance. The camera zooms out to reveal two large earthen statues, somewhat resembling badgermoles. She performs a series of moves which cause the statues to rise into the air, and send them past toward the camera.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The glow is the combination of all your past lives, focusing their energy through your body.
character_words: The glow is the combination of all your past lives, focusing their energy through your body.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Cuts to a shot of Avatar Kuruk, riding atop a raft in the middle of the ocean. His eyes glow momentarily before he raises his arms and summons a gigantic tsunami-like wave. He is seen rapidly riding atop the wave toward the screen. Cuts to Avatar Yangchen, who stands in a grassy field surrounded by a forest area. Her eyes glow briefly as she swings her arms and swivels around, conjuring powerful winds. The camera zooms out to the entire field and the forest blown violently by the wind.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: In the Avatar State, you are at your most powerful, [Cuts to an unnamed fire Avatar, who summons lava spouts from four volcanoes; the lava washes over the screen and the scene cuts back to Roku and Aang.] but you are also at your most vulnerable.
character_words: In the Avatar State, you are at your most powerful,  but you are also at your most vulnerable.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: What do you mean?
character_words: What do you mean?
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: If you are killed in the Avatar State, [The figures of him and the Avatars in the background are blown away like dust.] the reincarnation cycle will be broken [Shows the line of Avatars with Aang standing at the end; the Avatars begin to fade away in succession down the line.] and the Avatar will cease to exist.
character_words: If you are killed in the Avatar State,  the reincarnation cycle will be broken  and the Avatar will cease to exist.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text:
Aang is shown with a worried look on his face. The scene cuts to the base where Fang flies over Fong's base. Cuts to Aang's body, surrounded by a dome of air. Fang flies downward, head first, passing through Aang's body and into the ground. Aang's spirit is brought back to his physical self and he exits the Avatar State.
He falls to the ground weak and surveys the damage he caused to the base. Cuts to the ruins of the arena, houses destroyed and earth coins flung about. Cuts to Katara, completely unharmed from the whole ordeal, who approaches Aang and hugs him.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: [Embracing her; regretfully.] I'm sorry, Katara. I hope you never have to see me like that again.
character_words: I'm sorry, Katara. I hope you never have to see me like that again.

full_text: [Triumphantly.] Ha! Are you joking? That was almost perfect! [Thoughtfully.] We just have to find out a way to control you when you're like that.
character_words: Ha! Are you joking? That was almost perfect!  We just have to find out a way to control you when you're like that.

full_text: [Holds up wanted poster of her brother and uncle.] Anyone who harbors these traitors will face the wrath of the Fire Lord! [She lays a hand on the balcony, causing the two massagers to cower in fear; cuts to close-up of her.] There will be no place left to hide!
character_words: Anyone who harbors these traitors will face the wrath of the Fire Lord!  There will be no place left to hide!
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The scene changes to a riverside. The shadowy reflections of two figures on the run can be seen in the water. Cuts to view of the river bank and the area nearby as Zuko and Iroh run frantically. Cuts to riverbank as the two stop and fall to the ground, catching their breath.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: I think we're safe here.
character_words: I think we're safe here.
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Cuts to shot from Zuko's perspective as he pulls out a small dagger. Cuts to close-up of Zuko holding the dagger, its blade reflecting the sunlight. Cuts briefly to Iroh, who closes his eyes, seemingly aware of his nephew's actions. He casts a look at Zuko, who holds the knife under his ponytail. Cuts to close-up of his ponytail, as he slices it off with the knife. He holds it in his hand and looks at it for a moment before passing the knife to Iroh, who cuts off his topknot. Cuts to Zuko's hand, as he releases his ponytail. Cuts to the surface of the river, as the two topknots are released and float down the river. The camera zooms out to where Zuko and Iroh stand quietly on the bank of the river.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: Fades to credits.
character_words: NA
writer: Elizabeth Welch Ehasz, Tim Hedrick, Aaron Ehasz, John O'Bryan

full_text: The episode opens to show a cliff with a small body of water, where Team Avatar is residing. The camera pans downward and cuts to where Sokka is relaxing peacefully, floating on a large leaf in the water with Momo sleeping on his stomach, while Katara and Aang are facing each other while practicing waterbending.
character_words: NA

full_text: [With his hair covering his eyes.] You guys are going to be done soon, right? We have a lot of ground to cover if we're going to make it to Omashu today.
character_words: You guys are going to be done soon, right? We have a lot of ground to cover if we're going to make it to Omashu today.

full_text: [Rises from her hunched-over position; turns to face Sokka smugly.] What? Like you're ready to go right now, naked guy? [Smiles at him smugly.]
character_words: What? Like you're ready to go right now, naked guy?

full_text: I could be ready in two minutes. Seriously, [Pulls back the hair covering his eyes.] whenever.
character_words: I could be ready in two minutes. Seriously,  whenever.

full_text: So you were showing me the octopus form?
character_words: So you were showing me the octopus form?

full_text: [Turns her attention back to Aang.] Right, let me see your stance.
character_words: Right, let me see your stance.

full_text: Aang assumes a defensive stance. After careful consideration, Katara walks over to him.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Walks under his right arm.] Your arms are too far apart. [Positions his arms closer together.] See, if you move them closer together, you protect your center. You got it?
character_words: Your arms are too far apart.  See, if you move them closer together, you protect your center. You got it?

full_text: [Blushing.] Oh, yea ... thanks.
character_words: Oh, yea ... thanks.

full_text: [Walks away and assumes a fighting stance.] Okay, let's see what you got.
character_words: Okay, let's see what you got.

full_text: Aang bends the water, creating a globule which eventually transforms into eight whip-like water tentacles. He carefully maneuvers them, fending off shards of ice that Katara repeatedly sends at him by throwing them away or dodging them. At length, he manipulates one of the tentacles, curling it around her leg, gripping it firmly and pulling on it.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Proudly.] You make a fine octopus, Pupil Aang.
character_words: You make a fine octopus, Pupil Aang.

full_text: The camera cuts to where Aang dances playfully, suspended in a globule of water shaped like an actual octopus. Suddenly, music can be heard in the distance. The group witnesses a strange group of nomads playing music on instruments and singing, approaching them.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Singing.] Da, da, da. Don't fall in love with the traveling girl. She'll leave you broke and brokenhearted. [Cuts to shot of the team standing in the lake. Sokka unexpectedly falls off his leaf into the water. Cuts to nomads. Chong stops singing and points at the group.] Hey, river people!
character_words: Da, da, da. Don't fall in love with the traveling girl. She'll leave you broke and brokenhearted.  Hey, river people!

full_text: We're not river people.
character_words: We're not river people.

full_text: [Puzzled.] You're not? Well then what kind of people are you?
character_words: You're not? Well then what kind of people are you?

full_text: Just ... people.
character_words: Just ... people.

full_text: Aren't we all, brother?
character_words: Aren't we all, brother?

full_text: [Walks over and says accusingly.] Who are you?
character_words: Who are you?

full_text: I'm Chong and this is my wife, Lily. We're nomads, happy to go wherever the wind takes us! [He suddenly strums his lute-like instrument in a crazy fashion much like a rock star strums crazily on their guitar.]
character_words: I'm Chong and this is my wife, Lily. We're nomads, happy to go wherever the wind takes us!

full_text: [Starts out with a somewhat puzzled tone, but changes it to an excited one.] You guys are nomads? That's great! I'm a nomad!
character_words: You guys are nomads? That's great! I'm a nomad!

full_text: [Just as excitedly.] Hey, me too!
character_words: Hey, me too!

full_text: [Blankly.] I know ... you just said that.
character_words: I know ... you just said that.

full_text: Oh. [Noticing Sokka.] Nice underwear ...
character_words: Oh.  Nice underwear ...

full_text: Cut to close shot of Sokka, who is only wearing his swimsuit; Aang and Katara are standing behind him. Sokka's eyes bulge at the sudden realization that he is wearing very little in front of complete strangers. He grabs Momo and places him strategically over his underwear and slides rapidly off the screen. The scene switches to a forest landscape, where Zuko and Iroh are now living as fugitives. The camera shows a close-up of Iroh's face, as he gasps and stares in awe at a red and white flower. Cuts to full view of him and an area behind him.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Emerging from the bushes, now sporting short, black hair.] I didn't find anything to eat! I can't live like this! I wasn't meant to be a fugitive. [Raises fists in the air and yells at the sky.] This is impossible! [Looking over at Iroh.] Uncle, what are you doing?
character_words: I didn't find anything to eat! I can't live like this! I wasn't meant to be a fugitive.  This is impossible!  Uncle, what are you doing?

full_text: [Cuts to Iroh who dotes over the flower. Zuko appears behind him.] You're looking at the rare white dragon bush. Its leaves make a tea so delicious, it's heartbreaking. That, or it's the white jade, which is poisonous.
character_words: You're looking at the rare white dragon bush. Its leaves make a tea so delicious, it's heartbreaking. That, or it's the white jade, which is poisonous.

full_text: We need food, not tea. I'm going fishing. [Walks away.]
character_words: We need food, not tea. I'm going fishing.

full_text: [Dreamily.] Hmm ... delectable tea? [More suspiciously.] Or deadly poison?
character_words: Hmm ... delectable tea?  Or deadly poison?

full_text: The scene switches to where Team Avatar and the band of nomads are lounging nearby Appa, whose fur is braided. Chong is casually strumming his lute. Sokka approaches.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Wearing a wreath of pink flowers on his head.] Hey, Sokka, you should hear some of these stories. These guys have been everywhere!
character_words: Hey, Sokka, you should hear some of these stories. These guys have been everywhere!

full_text: [Stops playing.] Well not everywhere, Little Arrowhead. But where we haven't been, we've heard about through stories and songs.
character_words: Well not everywhere, Little Arrowhead. But where we haven't been, we've heard about through stories and songs.

full_text: They said they'll take us to see a giant night crawler!
character_words: They said they'll take us to see a giant night crawler!

full_text: [Lying on the ground; in a dreamy voice.] On the way, there's a waterfall that creates a never-ending rainbow!
character_words: On the way, there's a waterfall that creates a never-ending rainbow!

full_text: Look, I hate to be the wet blanket here, but since Katara is busy, I guess it's up to me.
character_words: Look, I hate to be the wet blanket here, but since Katara is busy, I guess it's up to me.

full_text: Katara shoots him a glare as Lily braids her hair.
character_words: NA

full_text: We need to get to Omashu. No sidetracks, no worms and definitely no rainbows.
character_words: We need to get to Omashu. No sidetracks, no worms and definitely no rainbows.

full_text: Wow, sounds like someone has a case of destination fever. You're worried too much about where you're going.
character_words: Wow, sounds like someone has a case of destination fever. You're worried too much about where you're going.

full_text: You got to focus less on the "where" and more on the "going". [She makes gestures with her hand, accidentally tugging on Katara's braid.]
character_words: You got to focus less on the "where" and more on the "going".

full_text: [Impatiently.] O. Ma. Shu!
character_words: O. Ma. Shu!

full_text: Sokka's right. We need to find King Bumi, so Aang can learn earthbending somewhere safe.
character_words: Sokka's right. We need to find King Bumi, so Aang can learn earthbending somewhere safe.

full_text: Sounds like you're headed to Omashu.
character_words: Sounds like you're headed to Omashu.

full_text: Sokka smacks his forehead in frustration.
character_words: NA

full_text: There's an old story about a secret pass right through the mountains.
character_words: There's an old story about a secret pass right through the mountains.

full_text: Is this real or a legend?
character_words: Is this real or a legend?

full_text: Oh, it's a real legend. And it's as old as earthbending itself. [Begins strumming his lute and singing.] Two lovers, forbidden from one another, the war divides their people and the mountain divides them apart! Built a path to be together! [Stops playing.] Yeah, I forget the next couple of lines, but then it goes ... [Resumes singing.] Secret tunnel! Secret tunnel! Through the mountains, secret, secret, secret, secret tunnel! Yeah!
character_words: Oh, it's a real legend. And it's as old as earthbending itself.  Two lovers, forbidden from one another, the war divides their people and the mountain divides them apart! Built a path to be together!  Yeah, I forget the next couple of lines, but then it goes ...  Secret tunnel! Secret tunnel! Through the mountains, secret, secret, secret, secret tunnel! Yeah!

full_text: A shot showing everyone around Appa, including the nomads. who had been dancing and clapping.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Unamused while folding his arms.] I think we'll just stick with flying. We've dealt with the Fire Nation before. We'll be fine.
character_words: I think we'll just stick with flying. We've dealt with the Fire Nation before. We'll be fine.

full_text: Yeah, thanks for the help, but Appa hates going underground. [Flashing a smile.] And we need to do whatever makes Appa most comfortable ...
character_words: Yeah, thanks for the help, but Appa hates going underground.  And we need to do whatever makes Appa most comfortable ...

full_text: The scene changes to a mountainous cliffside where Fire Nation soldiers are attacking the team by launching fireballs at them as they desperately try to escape on Appa.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Pointing at the trio on Appa.] Launch!
character_words: Launch!

full_text: Several catapults are activated, launching an assault of fireballs at the team, who manages to narrowly avoid them.
character_words: NA

full_text: Ahhhh!
character_words: Ahhhh!

full_text: The scene cuts to the trio, covered in ash and scorch marks, casually strolling past the nomads.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Pointing forward.] Secret love cave, let's go.
character_words: Secret love cave, let's go.

full_text: The scene switches to the forest, where Zuko has arrived from his fishing expedition. When the camera pans upward, it is revealed that he has only managed to spear a single, tiny fish which flaps about helplessly on the large branch he used for a fishing pole. Cuts to Iroh hunched over, his back to the camera.
character_words: NA

full_text: Zuko, [Cut to a wide, overhead shot of Zuko standing behind Iroh.] remember that plant I thought might be tea?
character_words: Zuko,  remember that plant I thought might be tea?

full_text: [Shocked.] You didn't ...
character_words: You didn't ...

full_text: I did ... [Turns around.] and it wasn't. [Reveals himself to be swollen and covered in red marks.]
character_words: I did ...  and it wasn't.

full_text: [Cut back to Zuko who drops the branch out of shock.] Ahh!
character_words: Ahh!

full_text: [Surprisingly calmly.] When the rash spreads to my throat, I will stop breathing. [Excitedly.] But look what I found. [Iroh holds out his arm to reveal berries.] These are bacui berries, known to cure the poison of the white jade. [Unenthusiastically.] That, or maka'ole berries that cause blindness.
character_words: When the rash spreads to my throat, I will stop breathing.  But look what I found.  These are bacui berries, known to cure the poison of the white jade.  That, or maka'ole berries that cause blindness.

full_text: [Grabbing branch of berries and hurling it into the bushes.] We're not taking any more chances with these plants! We need to get help.
character_words: We're not taking any more chances with these plants! We need to get help.

full_text: But where are we going to go? [Kneeling down and scratching his rash vigorously.] We're enemies of the Earth Kingdom and fugitives from the Fire Nation. [Camera zooms in on his reddened leg.]
character_words: But where are we going to go?  We're enemies of the Earth Kingdom and fugitives from the Fire Nation.

full_text: If the Earth Kingdom discovers us, they'll have us killed.
character_words: If the Earth Kingdom discovers us, they'll have us killed.

full_text: [Rises.] But if the Fire Nation discovers us, we'll be turned over to Azula.
character_words: But if the Fire Nation discovers us, we'll be turned over to Azula.

full_text: They look at each other and pause briefly.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Nodding and walking away with Iroh.] Earth Kingdom it is.
character_words: Earth Kingdom it is.

full_text: The scene changes to where Team Avatar and the band of nomads are journeying to the tunnels along a wide street surrounded by the ruins of a temple.
character_words: NA

full_text: How far are we from the tunnel?
character_words: How far are we from the tunnel?

full_text: Actually, it's not just one tunnel. The lovers didn't want anyone to find out about their love, so they built a whole labyrinth!
character_words: Actually, it's not just one tunnel. The lovers didn't want anyone to find out about their love, so they built a whole labyrinth!

full_text: [Halts in his tracks; in shock.] Labyrinth?
character_words: Labyrinth?

full_text: [Casually.] Oh, I'm sure we'll figure it out.
character_words: Oh, I'm sure we'll figure it out.

full_text: All you need to do is trust in love ... according to the curse.
character_words: All you need to do is trust in love ... according to the curse.

full_text: Sokka, who had resumed walking, halts once more. The others pass by him. After several moments, he flinches in terror.
character_words: NA

full_text: [In a somewhat whining voice.] Curse!
character_words: Curse!

full_text: Camera pans to the dark entrance of the cave.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey-hey! We're here!
character_words: Hey-hey! We're here!

full_text: [Cuts to shot of inscription on the side of the cave entrance.] What exactly is this curse?
character_words: What exactly is this curse?

full_text: The curse says that only those who trust in love can make it through the caves. Otherwise, you'll be trapped in them forever.
character_words: The curse says that only those who trust in love can make it through the caves. Otherwise, you'll be trapped in them forever.

full_text: And die.
character_words: And die.

full_text: Oh yeah, and die. [Brightening.] Hey, I just remembered the rest of that song! [Stands before the entrance and strums lute, while singing an ominous line in a low voice.] And die!
character_words: Oh yeah, and die.  Hey, I just remembered the rest of that song!  And die!

full_text: That's it! There's no way we're going through some cursed hole!
character_words: That's it! There's no way we're going through some cursed hole!

full_text: [Turns head to observe gray smoke rising from the horizon, which he proceeds to point at.] Hey, someone's making a big campfire!
character_words: Hey, someone's making a big campfire!

full_text: [In a serious tone.] That's no campfire, Moku.
character_words: That's no campfire, Moku.

full_text: [Grimly.] It's Fire Nation. They're tracking us.
character_words: It's Fire Nation. They're tracking us.

full_text: [Making sure he understands.] So all you need to do is trust in love to get through these caves?
character_words: So all you need to do is trust in love to get through these caves?

full_text: That is correct, Master Arrowhead.
character_words: That is correct, Master Arrowhead.

full_text: Aang turns to stare at Katara, who has her back to him. Her clothes and hair sway slightly as a breeze passes by. The camera closes up to his face, his eyes shining in adoration.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Smiling.] We can make it.
character_words: We can make it.

full_text: [Gesturing to the cave; somewhat commanding.] Everyone into the hole!
character_words: Everyone into the hole!

full_text: They all begin to enter the cave. Cuts to a close-up of Appa as he groans. Several Fire Nation tanks rumble across the terrain toward the entrance of the tunnel and pause once they reach the mouth of the cave.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hold on! It's too dangerous. Haven't you heard the song? Just close them in. The mountain will take care of the rest.
character_words: Hold on! It's too dangerous. Haven't you heard the song? Just close them in. The mountain will take care of the rest.

full_text: The tanks fire rotating grappling hooks from canisters into the tunnel and release them after a few moments, unleashing a myriad of boulders. The scene switches to where the group has begun navigating their way through the tunnels only to turn and witness the entrance being closed off. Appa begins to frantically paw the walls of the tunnel.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's okay, Appa. We'll be fine. I hope.
character_words: It's okay, Appa. We'll be fine. I hope.

full_text: We will be fine. All we need is a plan. Chong, how long do those torches last?
character_words: We will be fine. All we need is a plan. Chong, how long do those torches last?

full_text: [Casually.] Uh, about two hours each.
character_words: Uh, about two hours each.

full_text: [Lighting the rest of the torches in her hand.] And we have five torches, so that's ten hours!
character_words: And we have five torches, so that's ten hours!

full_text: [Grabbing torches and stomping out the fire.] It doesn't work like that if they're all lit at the same time!
character_words: It doesn't work like that if they're all lit at the same time!

full_text: Oh, right.
character_words: Oh, right.

full_text: I'm going to make a map to keep track of exactly where we've been. Then we should be able to solve it like a maze and get through.
character_words: I'm going to make a map to keep track of exactly where we've been. Then we should be able to solve it like a maze and get through.

full_text: Katara and Aang look at each other with unsure expressions. The scene changes to a village. Camera cuts to a hospital before switching to the inside of the building. One doctor is treating a man with what appears to be a cupping treatment. The man grits his teeth in pain. The camera pans over to where a girl is treating Iroh's allergic reaction. Zuko is seated on a bench.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Wringing cloth.] You two must not be from around here. We know better than to touch the White Jade, much less make it into tea and drink it. [Flicks Iroh's hand away when he scratches his rash.]
character_words: You two must not be from around here. We know better than to touch the White Jade, much less make it into tea and drink it.

full_text: [The girl moves away from the camera's eye, revealing Iroh to be in an even worse condition than before with the rash having spread to his face and his cheeks swollen.] Whoops!
character_words: Whoops!

full_text: So where are you traveling from?
character_words: So where are you traveling from?

full_text: [Nervously; rises from his seat as she moves his hand down so she could wash it.] Yes, we're travelers.
character_words: Yes, we're travelers.

full_text: Do you have names?
character_words: Do you have names?

full_text: Names? Of course we have names. [Song turns to see Iroh scratching and glares at him, before slapping his hand away.] I'm, uh ... Lee and this is my Uncle, uh ... Mushi?
character_words: Names? Of course we have names.  I'm, uh ... Lee and this is my Uncle, uh ... Mushi?

full_text: [Shoots him angry look. Cuts to shot of Song taking a lotion from a jar. She begins slathering it over the inflamed areas.] Yes, my nephew was named after his father, so we just call him Junior. [Leans over to the side to give Zuko a pleased smile.]
character_words: Yes, my nephew was named after his father, so we just call him Junior.

full_text: Zuko glares angrily at Iroh and moves his finger across his neck signaling that he's dead meat, but abruptly halts and puts his hands behind his back when Song turns to look at him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Mushi and Junior, huh. My name is Song. You two look like you could use a good meal. [Slaps Iroh's hand away when he goes to scratch his rash.] Why don't you stay for dinner?
character_words: Mushi and Junior, huh. My name is Song. You two look like you could use a good meal.  Why don't you stay for dinner?

full_text: [Looking away.] Sorry, but we need to be moving on.
character_words: Sorry, but we need to be moving on.

full_text: [Screwing the cap back on the lid.] That's too bad. [Gives an innocent smile.] My mom always makes too much roast duck.
character_words: That's too bad.  My mom always makes too much roast duck.

full_text: [Excitedly.] Where do you live exactly?
character_words: Where do you live exactly?

full_text: The scene changes to the dark tunnel where Sokka is standing with a map in his hands, the map taking up most of the screen. He tilts it to the side a few times before drawing it closer to him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sokka, this is the tenth dead end you've led us to.
character_words: Sokka, this is the tenth dead end you've led us to.

full_text: This doesn't make sense. We already came through this way.
character_words: This doesn't make sense. We already came through this way.

full_text: We don't need a map. [Sokka passes by him.] We just need love. The little guy knows it.
character_words: We don't need a map.  We just need love. The little guy knows it.

full_text: Yeah, but I wouldn't mind a map also.
character_words: Yeah, but I wouldn't mind a map also.

full_text: [Cuts to an overhead shot of the group standing in the dark cave before switching to Sokka who looks up from the map.] There's something strange here. There's only one explanation. [Cuts to shot of the rest of the group before switching to Sokka who turns to face the camera.] The tunnels are changing.
character_words: There's something strange here. There's only one explanation.  The tunnels are changing.

full_text: A wave of surprise passes over everyone as the tunnels shake. The scene cuts to nighttime to a house. Cuts to a shot of an open-wall dining room where Zuko and Iroh are sitting around Song's kitchen table.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Setting down a platter of roast duck and taking a seat.] My daughter tells me you're refugees. We were once refugees ourselves.
character_words: My daughter tells me you're refugees. We were once refugees ourselves.

full_text: [Sadly.] When I was a little girl, the Fire Nation raided our farming village. All the men were taken away. That was the last time I saw my father.
character_words: When I was a little girl, the Fire Nation raided our farming village. All the men were taken away. That was the last time I saw my father.

full_text: [Close-up of the prince.] I haven't seen my father in many years.
character_words: I haven't seen my father in many years.

full_text: [Sorrowfully.] Oh, is he fighting in the War?
character_words: Oh, is he fighting in the War?

full_text: Zuko hesitates. Iroh is seen slurping up a bowl of noodles.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sets down dish.] Yeah. [Looks away in dismay.]
character_words: Yeah.

full_text: The scene changes to the cave.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Frantically.] The tunnels, they're a-changin'. It must be the curse! I knew we shouldn't have come down here!
character_words: The tunnels, they're a-changin'. It must be the curse! I knew we shouldn't have come down here!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Right, if only we listened to you.
character_words: Right, if only we listened to you.

full_text: [Hold up a hand in warning.] Everyone be quiet. Listen.
character_words: Everyone be quiet. Listen.

full_text: Cuts to shot of Sokka looking into the dark tunnel, his back to the camera. A low snarl can be heard from within the darkness of the tunnel. Momo flees from his shoulder. Sokka suspiciously holds the torch up to the tunnel to inspect the strange sound. Suddenly, a wolfbat flies from the darkness of the cave toward the camera, causing everyone to panic.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's a giant flying thing with teeth!
character_words: It's a giant flying thing with teeth!

full_text: [The creature lands. Off-camera.] No! It's a wolfbat!
character_words: No! It's a wolfbat!

full_text: The wolfbat takes off again. In a frenzy, Sokka swats at the creature with the lit torch. Several hot cinders are thrown about and land on Appa's skin. Yelping in pain, the bison begins running around the tunnel, releasing a discharge of rocks and debris. Aang quickly airbends Sokka and the band of nomads out of the way of the falling rocks. He races toward Katara and pushes her out of the way. The camera cuts to where he and Katara rise from the impact and witness the division of the tunnel. Meanwhile, Sokka attempts to dig his way through the barrier that divides the two groups.
character_words: NA

full_text: Yeah, it's no use. We're separated. But at least you have us!
character_words: Yeah, it's no use. We're separated. But at least you have us!

full_text: [Horrified.] Nooooo!
character_words: Nooooo!

full_text: He resumes digging through the rocks only to have a pile of debris fall on him. The scene changes to where Zuko is sitting on Song's front porch. Song comes outside and sits beside him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Can I join you? I know what you've been through. We've all been through it. [Witnessing Zuko's scar.] The Fire Nation has hurt you.
character_words: Can I join you? I know what you've been through. We've all been through it.  The Fire Nation has hurt you.

full_text: She reaches out to touch his scar only to have Zuko push her hand away.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Compassionately.] It's okay. They've hurt me, too. [Pulls up pants leg to reveal burn scars on her leg.]
character_words: It's okay. They've hurt me, too.

full_text: Zuko casts her a surprised look upon seeing this. The scene cuts to where Chong and his group are singing much to Sokka's annoyance.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Singing as he and the nomads pass the angry warrior.] Oh, don't let the cave-in get you down! [Cuts to shot of him.] Don't let the falling rocks turn your smile into a frown! Cuts to Sokka who tries to avoid the badgermole's swipes.
