full_text:
Close-up of Mai, who is seen for the first time with a faint smile on her face. She spreads her arms at Aang, causing tiny arrows to fly toward him. Aang quickly jumps up, avoiding the arrows which bury themselves in the stack of construction material Aang lands on. Aang, Katara, Sokka and Momo run away as two of the Fire Nation guards are climbing up ladders to get to them.
Katara quickly turns around and uses the water from her pouch to form a water whip and send the two guards flying off into the deep. As you see them falling, we see Mai reaching the top. While she is running toward Katara, she stretches out her right hand, shooting off some more arrows. Katara raises a shield of ice to protect herself as the arrows embed themselves in it. Mai keeps charging Katara, who runs away. Mai jumps over the icy wall in hot pursuit of Katara. Aang awaits Katara and lets her pass as he awaits the arrival of Mai. With a spinning sweep of wind, he causes some of the construction scaffolding to collapse. Mai sees the scaffolding collapse and directs a throwing star right at Aang. He twirls his staff in front of him and catches the flying star with it. Mai stands on one side of the collapsed scaffolding and has a clear shot on Aang, Katara, Sokka and Momo. As she throws more arrows at them, the ground beneath the team opens up, making them disappear and rapidly closes again. Mai looks at the place where her targets disappeared, letting out a deep sigh. She turns around and walks away.
Cut to a tunnel scene. The image shows the rectangle where the kids fell through. Green sewage waste drips from the ceiling. The camera moves down, revealing a group of people who are looking at the three kids. Aang and Sokka are rubbing their heads, while Katara just sits there a bit disorientated. Cut to a shot of Yung, flanked by two other men.
The picture switches to an upside down shot of some grass. When the view pans up, we see mountains, circus tents and some people working in the background. Azula, also upside down, walks in.
character_words: NA

full_text: Ty Lee, could that possibly be you?
character_words: Ty Lee, could that possibly be you?

full_text: The camera moves to show a close-up of a girl, Ty Lee, standing on her index fingers. She smiles when she sees Azula.
character_words: NA

full_text: Azula!
character_words: Azula!

full_text: Ty Lee flips from her stance and spins around in a graceful twirl to bow down before Azula. She runs forward to embrace Azula.
character_words: NA

full_text: It is so good to see you!
character_words: It is so good to see you!

full_text: Please, don't let me interrupt your ... [Raises an eyebrow in wonder.] whatever it is you were doing.
character_words: Please, don't let me interrupt your ...  whatever it is you were doing.

full_text: Ty Lee, still smiling, does a back flip and ends up lying on her chest with one leg stretched out over her head and the other straight up to the sky.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Glances around.] Tell me, what is the daughter of a nobleman doing here? [Looks back at Ty Lee.] Certainly our parents didn't send us to the Royal Fire Academy for Girls to end up in ... [Looks to her side.] places like this.
character_words: Tell me, what is the daughter of a nobleman doing here?  Certainly our parents didn't send us to the Royal Fire Academy for Girls to end up in ...  places like this.

full_text: Azula looks as three men are trying to move a platypus bear. The Bear groans and moves up to reveal that it has laid an egg. Azula looks at this in disgust and turns her attention back to Ty Lee, grinning once more.
character_words: NA

full_text: I have a proposition for you.
character_words: I have a proposition for you.

full_text: Cut to Ty Lee who is still lying on the ground, watching the same Platypus bear as Azula, but she looks happy to see what has happened. When Azula addresses her, she diverts her attention away from the bear and looks at Azula in a wondering gaze.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm hunting a traitor. [While looking casually at her nails.] You remember my old fuddy-duddy uncle, don't you?
character_words: I'm hunting a traitor.  You remember my old fuddy-duddy uncle, don't you?

full_text: [Resting on her chest and elbows, but now with her both feet resting on her head.] Oh yeah. He was so funny.
character_words: Oh yeah. He was so funny.

full_text: I would be honored if you would join me on my mission.
character_words: I would be honored if you would join me on my mission.

full_text: Oh ... I ... uh ... would love to. [She stands up in a fluid elegant movement.] But the truth is, I'm really happy here. [Smiling sincerely.] I mean, my aura has never been pinker!
character_words: Oh ... I ... uh ... would love to.  But the truth is, I'm really happy here.  I mean, my aura has never been pinker!

full_text: [Raising up her hand in a "stop" motion to Ty Lee.] I'll take your word for it. Well, I wouldn't want you to give up the life you love just to please me.
character_words: I'll take your word for it. Well, I wouldn't want you to give up the life you love just to please me.

full_text: [Bows in respect.] Thank you, Azula. [Continues stretching.]
character_words: Thank you, Azula.

full_text: [While walking away.] Of course, before I leave, I'm going to catch your show.
character_words: Of course, before I leave, I'm going to catch your show.

full_text: Ty Lee's accidentally breaks her stance, as she gasps in panic. She continues her stretch once more and the expression of panic changes to one of worry.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Hesitantly.] Uh ... yeah ... sure ... uh ... of course ...
character_words: Uh ... yeah ... sure ... uh ... of course ...

full_text: Cut back to Omashu, where a lot of people have gathered in some sort of underground cave. At the other side of the room, Aang, Sokka, and Katara enter the large space through a tunnel; they are talking to three other men.
character_words: NA

full_text: So, is King Bumi with you guys? Is he leading the resistance?
character_words: So, is King Bumi with you guys? Is he leading the resistance?

full_text: Cut to a close-up of Yung who angrily balls his fist as he answers Aang's question.
character_words: NA

full_text: Of course not! The day of the invasion, we readied ourselves for battle. We were prepared to defend our city ... to fight for our lives and for our freedom. But before we even had a chance, King Bumi surrendered.
character_words: Of course not! The day of the invasion, we readied ourselves for battle. We were prepared to defend our city ... to fight for our lives and for our freedom. But before we even had a chance, King Bumi surrendered.

full_text: The camera moves slowly toward Aang, who is clearly disconcerted by the news. Katara gives Aang a look of concern.
character_words: NA

full_text: The day of the invasion, I asked King Bumi what he wanted to do. [Cut to his close-up.] He looked me in the eye and said ...
character_words: The day of the invasion, I asked King Bumi what he wanted to do.  He looked me in the eye and said ...

full_text: A flashback shows the day Omashu was under attack. King Bumi and Yung stand atop one of the city's walls, looking down while fire balls decorate the sky.
character_words: NA

full_text: I'm going to do ... nothing! [He starts to laugh and snort like the mad lunatic he is.]
character_words: I'm going to do ... nothing!

full_text: The flashback fades away to make room for another close-up of Yung.
character_words: NA

full_text: It doesn't matter now. [Cut to Aang who sadly lowers his eyes as the resistance leader continues.] Fighting the Fire Nation is the only path to freedom. [Switch to a close-up of Yung again.] And freedom is worth dying for.
character_words: It doesn't matter now.  Fighting the Fire Nation is the only path to freedom.  And freedom is worth dying for.

full_text: As Yung ends his speech, a smile plays on his face. Aang sadly leans on his staff. He raises his eyes as while he addresses Yung.
character_words: NA

full_text: Actually there's another path to freedom. You could leave Omashu. You're directing all your energy to fight the Fire Nation. [The camera pans to the right, showing several Earth Kingdom soldiers.] But you're outnumbered. You can't win. Now's the time to retreat, so you can live to fight another day.
character_words: Actually there's another path to freedom. You could leave Omashu. You're directing all your energy to fight the Fire Nation.  But you're outnumbered. You can't win. Now's the time to retreat, so you can live to fight another day.

full_text: You don't understand. They've taken our home, and we have to fight them at any cost! [He makes some powerful hand gestures to make his point more clear.]
character_words: You don't understand. They've taken our home, and we have to fight them at any cost!

full_text: [In a soft tone.] I don't know, Yung, living to fight another day is startin' to sound pretty good to me.
character_words: I don't know, Yung, living to fight another day is startin' to sound pretty good to me.

full_text: [He takes a step forward and points toward himself. He addresses Yung with a decisive tone.] Yeah, I'm with the kid!
character_words: Yeah, I'm with the kid!

full_text: Yung looks at all the people who have taken refuge under ground and now are living in the sewer tunnels while they whisper among themselves. He looks back at Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: Fine. But there's thousands of citizens that need to leave. How're we going to get them all out?
character_words: Fine. But there's thousands of citizens that need to leave. How're we going to get them all out?

full_text: Switch to Sokka whose hand is on his chin as he is cooking up a plan. He points at Yung as he exclaims his idea.
character_words: NA

full_text: Suckers!
character_words: Suckers!

full_text: Katara raises one eyebrow and just stares at Sokka. The rest of the group follows her example. Momo chirps questionably. Sokka blinks, shifting his eyes right and left, smiling broadly.

full_text: You're all about to come down with a nasty case of pentapox.
character_words: You're all about to come down with a nasty case of pentapox.

full_text:
Cut to a shot of a bucket of water filled with pentapi. A hand reaches in and takes one out. The civilian, whose face is already covered with the marks of removed pentapi, places it on his exposed left arm. Its jellylike body moves up and down a bit. After a few seconds, someone else removes the pentapus by gently rubbing its head. We see several shots of people placing and removing pentapi from their face, shoulders and arms.
Switch to a top view of the people as Sokka walks over to them to address them. While he speaks, the camera pans out, showing a close-up of all the inhabitants of Omashu covered with the suction spots of the pentapi.
character_words: NA

full_text: The marks make ya look sick, but you gotta act sick too. Ya gotta sell it!
character_words: The marks make ya look sick, but you gotta act sick too. Ya gotta sell it!

full_text: An old man hobbles into view, leaning heavily on his cane. He clutches his back while moaning in pain.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Grabs the guy who is standing next to him and points at the old man.] Now that's what I'm talkin' about.
character_words: Now that's what I'm talkin' about.

full_text: The man turns around, smiling. He taps his wooden leg with his cane.
character_words: NA

full_text: Years of practice.
character_words: Years of practice.

full_text: Okay everyone! Into sick formation.
character_words: Okay everyone! Into sick formation.

full_text: Sokka and the other civilians start walking toward the gates of Omashu. Just as Katara wants to join them, she notices that Aang is walking off in the other direction.

full_text: Aang, what are you doing? Aren't you coming with us?
character_words: Aang, what are you doing? Aren't you coming with us?

full_text: [He turns around.] No. I'm not leaving until I find Bumi.
character_words: No. I'm not leaving until I find Bumi.

full_text: Momo jumps on Aang's shoulders, tugging Aang's lips. He grabs Momo by his neck and places him back on the ground.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sorry Momo, I'll feed you later.
character_words: Sorry Momo, I'll feed you later.

full_text:
Aang uses airbending to propel him unto the air. He whizzes away, jumping from one rooftop to the other.
Switch to some Fire Nation soldiers with spears who are guarding the gates of Omashu. A moaning crowd of 'sick' people walks toward them from every direction. They move like zombies, swaying back and forth. One of them even falls down. The guards back away as the sick crowd reaches them. Sokka theatrically grabs his face and moans painfully, before stretching out his hands toward the frightened guards.
character_words: NA

full_text: Plague! Plague!
character_words: Plague! Plague!

full_text:
The guards on the ground start to retreat into the citadel behind them, away from the sick, while another guard rings the gong to alert everyone of the problem at hand.
Switch to the governor of Omashu and his family, including Mai, who is eating a bowl of fire flakes, watching on one of his balconies, looking out over the city.
character_words: NA

full_text: What is going on down there?
character_words: What is going on down there?

full_text: I saw some kids yesterday who were sick with pentapox. It must have spread!
character_words: I saw some kids yesterday who were sick with pentapox. It must have spread!

full_text: Pentapox! [He pulls his beard.] Hmm, I'm pretty sure I've heard of that.
character_words: Pentapox!  Hmm, I'm pretty sure I've heard of that.

full_text: Oh, this is terrible.
character_words: Oh, this is terrible.

full_text: What should we do?
character_words: What should we do?

full_text: Drive them out of the city [He points toward the gates.] ... but don't touch them! We have to rid the city of this disease!
character_words: Drive them out of the city  ... but don't touch them! We have to rid the city of this disease!

full_text: The guard bows in respect before leaving to spread the governor's orders. Mai calmly offers her dad the bowl of fire flakes.

full_text: Fire flakes, Dad?
character_words: Fire flakes, Dad?

full_text: [Gasping.] How awful!
character_words: How awful!

full_text:
The governor's family is shown from behind. As his wife hugs her husband, the little baby beside her, Mai's brother Tom-Tom toddles away from the group.
Switch to Aang running through the streets of the city. He nimbly climbs a house and balances on the railing, before landing on a flat rooftop. He spots a giant, white creature below, sadly pushing forth a turnstile. Aang jumps down to discover that the creature is Flopsie, King Bumi's pet goat gorilla.
character_words: NA

full_text: Flopsie!
character_words: Flopsie!

full_text: As Aang calls his name, Flopsie turns around and happily tries to reach his friend. His chains hold him back, so he sadly ceases his attempts. Aang jumps over him and uses the water from his drinking bowl to freeze the lock on his chains. With one swing of his staff, Aang destroys the lock, freeing Flopsie. The happy animal hugs and licks Aang's face.
character_words: NA

full_text: Come on, Flopsie. [He climbs on top of Flopsie.] You gotta help me find Bumi. Yip Yip! [Flopsie does not move a muscle.] Oh ... I guess that doesn't work with you. Let's go!
character_words: Come on, Flopsie.  You gotta help me find Bumi. Yip Yip!  Oh ... I guess that doesn't work with you. Let's go!

full_text: Flopsie races off at great speed. Meanwhile Momo is soaring through the city. He lands on a balcony and peeks through a window. We see a cluttered room with dressing panels at the back. A teddy bear is thrown repeatedly in the air by someone behind the panels. Momo spots a full scale of berries and starts to drool. He quickly enters the chamber through the window and starts to stuff his face. He rapidly spits out the seeds. Some of them land behind the panels. Cut to Tom-Tom who is playing with the stuffed animal behind the panels. He notices the seeds and crawls away, following their path. The trail of seeds leads right back to Momo, who is still sitting on the table, his tail dangling over the edge. Tom-Tom sits up in wonder as he examines the tail before pulling it. Cut to a surprised Momo who is pulled down to the ground in mid bite. He pulls a giggling Tom-Tom along as he tries to get away from his grasp. Momo pulls free and jumps out of the window on to the railing. As he looks back, he sees that the baby stumbles toward him with his arms spread out wide. Momo backs away, leaping of the railing and flying away.
character_words: NA

full_text: The baby is too late to grab Momo, so he tumbles off the railing. While he is sliding down the roof, he cannot stop giggling. He lands in a box of berries sliding down one of Omashu's chutes. Momo lands on the same box and starts to stuff his face again. His eyes open wide as Tom-Tom emerges behind him. The baby grabs Momo's tail and bites it. The lemur jumps in the air and frantically flaps his wings in an attempt to get away once more. As the slope becomes steeper, Momo is able to lift himself as well as Tom-Tom who is still clinging on to his tail. The lemur cannot bear the weight and they start to descend. Tom-Tom is being dragged over the ground as they crash-land. Tom-Tom rolls over the ground and lands on top of Momo, pinning him to the ground, and causing him to screech and shake around desperately.
character_words: NA

full_text: The moaning crowd passes them by, diverting Tom-Tom attention away from Momo. Momo escapes into the crowd. The baby pushes himself to his feet and staggers after the crowd, out of the gates.
character_words: NA

full_text: We're deeply honored to have the Fire Lord's daughter at our humble circus.
character_words: We're deeply honored to have the Fire Lord's daughter at our humble circus.

Switch to a shot of Azula and Shuzumu, who are both looking up, fascinated by Ty Lee's performance.

full_text: Incredible. Do you think she'll fall?
character_words: Incredible. Do you think she'll fall?

character_words: Then wouldn't it make it more interesting if you removed the net?

character_words: Uh ... the thing is ... the performers ...

full_text: You're right, you're right. That's been done. [After a short pause, she continues with a tone of dark pleasure.] I know. Set the net on fire.
character_words: You're right, you're right. That's been done.  I know. Set the net on fire.

full_text: [Worried.] Of course, Princess.
character_words: Of course, Princess.

full_text:
With a worried look upon his face, Shuzumu leaves the box to set the net of fire. Ty Lee looks down in concern at the consuming flames beneath her. She continues with her act.
Cut back to the box seat, where Shuzumu is balling his fist and clenching his teeth, hoping that Ty Lee will not fall off.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Ecstatic.] Brilliant, just brilliant! [She looks down at Shuzumu and asks happily.] Ooh, what kind of dangerous animals do you have?
character_words: Brilliant, just brilliant!  Ooh, what kind of dangerous animals do you have?

full_text: Shuzumu looks up, hopeful that he can change the subject to the animals and save Ty Lee from her burning peril.
character_words: NA

full_text: Well, our circus boasts the most exotic assortment-
character_words: Well, our circus boasts the most exotic assortment-

character_words: Release them all!

Shuzumu looks utterly shocked by Azula's command. Close-up again of Ty Lee's worried face, as she is still balancing on one hand above the flames. Cut to an outside-view of the circus. As the camera pans up, several animal noises fill the night.

full_text: [Sadly.] We looked everywhere. No Bumi.
character_words: We looked everywhere. No Bumi.

Katara hugs him. Flopsie moans sadly, so Sokka turns around and hugs Flopsie's face.
The arrival of Yung interrupts their hugs.

character_words: Oh no. Did someone get left behind?

character_words: No, we have an extra.

The governor rests his hands on the railing of the balcony as he stares out over his city. His sobbing wife, apathetic daughter and two guards stand behind him. Zoom toward the governor as he speaks.

character_words: So, the resistance has kidnapped my son. Everything so clever, so tricky. Just like their King Bumi.

full_text: What do you want to do, sir?
character_words: What do you want to do, sir?

The camera moves back as Sokka snatches the club out of the baby's hands.

full_text: Does that look like the face of a killer to you?
character_words: Does that look like the face of a killer to you?

full_text: It's from the Fire Nation governor. He thinks we kidnapped his son. [Switch to another view. character_words: Count me in. Anything to get me out of this place.

full_text: Cut to a large red flag with the black Fire Nation mark on it. The camera pans down and shows that Azula is sitting on the throne of Omashu, flanked by two Fire Nation guards. The governor and his wife are in front of her, as well as Mai and Ty Lee.

full_text: I apologize. [Switch to a closer shot of the governor who squatting down on a pillow.] You've come to Omashu at a difficult time. At noon we're making a trade with the resistance to get Tom-Tom back.
character_words: I apologize.  You've come to Omashu at a difficult time. At noon we're making a trade with the resistance to get Tom-Tom back.

full_text: Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, but really, [She crosses her legs and clasps her hands.] what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave? [She stands up, addressing the governor in a harsher tone.] My father has trusted you with this city and you're making a mess of things! [She emphasizes her words with a hand gesture.]
character_words: Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, but really,  what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave?  My father has trusted you with this city and you're making a mess of things!

full_text: The governor and his wife prostrate themselves before her.
character_words: NA

full_text: Forgive me, Princess.
character_words: Forgive me, Princess.

full_text: Azula walks between the four bowing people in front of her, looking down upon the governor.
character_words: NA

full_text: You stay here. [Mai and Ty Lee get up behind her.] Mai will handle the hostage trade so you don't have a chance to mess it up. [Cut to a shot of the still smoking city of Omashu, followed by some shots of Fire Nation construction sites.] And there is no more "Omashu". I'm renaming it in honor of my father, the city of New Ozai.
character_words: You stay here.  Mai will handle the hostage trade so you don't have a chance to mess it up.  And there is no more "Omashu". I'm renaming it in honor of my father, the city of New Ozai.

full_text:
The camera stops on a large statue of Ozai, still in its scaffolds. The camera pans down. A long overview shot reveals Aang, Katara and Sokka standing on a large wooden scaffold. They look serious as a party of three girls approaches, with Mai leading the way.
A crane is shown, lowering a metal cage. A close-up of the cage reveals that it is used to contain King Bumi. Only his head is left uncovered.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Chuckling.] Hi, everybody!
character_words: Hi, everybody!

full_text: Aang smiles as he sees his friend. The cage touches the ground behind Azula and the rest.
character_words: NA

full_text: You brought my brother?
character_words: You brought my brother?

full_text: He's here. We're ready to trade.
character_words: He's here. We're ready to trade.

full_text: [To Mai.] I'm sorry, but a thought just occurred to me. Do you mind?
character_words: I'm sorry, but a thought just occurred to me. Do you mind?

full_text: Bumi follows the conversation, shifting his eyes from one speaker to the other.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Turning to Azula.] Of course not, Princess Azula.
character_words: Of course not, Princess Azula.

full_text: We're trading a two year old for a king. [Looks up at Bumi.] A powerful, earthbending king?
character_words: We're trading a two year old for a king.  A powerful, earthbending king?

full_text: [Nods.] Mmm hmmm!
character_words: Mmm hmmm!

full_text: It just doesn't seem like a fair trade, does it?
character_words: It just doesn't seem like a fair trade, does it?

full_text: Close-up of Mai's gray eyes as she ponders over the idea. She looks at her brother who yawns and happily rests his head against Sokka's shoulder.
character_words: NA

full_text: You're right. [Azula smiles slyly while Mai walks forward.] The deal's off.
character_words: You're right.  The deal's off.

full_text: Mai holds up her hand, gesturing the guards to pull Bumi back up. As the chains reel in from above, the King is suspended in the air once again.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Clearly amused by all this.] Whhhoa! See you all later!
character_words: Whhhoa! See you all later!

full_text: Bumi chuckles and snorts as he is lifted from the scenery. Aang watches him go.

full_text: Bumi!
character_words: Bumi!

full_text: He sprints forward with his glider at the ready, increasing his speed with airbending. Azula tries to stop him by blocking his path with a mighty stream of blue flames. Aang dodges these by leaping high up into the air. Azula is completely shocked by this incredible jump. Aang briefly touches the scaffolding around the statue and pushes himself off, opening his glider in mid air. While opening his glider, he loses his hat, leaving his arrow tattoo exposed. He holds on to the hat with his teeth.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Surprised.] The Avatar!
character_words: The Avatar!

full_text: Aang circles up toward Bumi's coffin. Cut back to Azula who smiles smugly.
character_words: NA

full_text: My lucky day.
character_words: My lucky day.

full_text:
She runs over to a pulley and blast through the rope that serves as a break. The winch begins to spin rapidly. Azula grabs hold to the rope and is pulled up rapidly toward the top of the construction scaffolding.
Aang lands on the top of Bumi's metal cage.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Surprised.] Aang, is that you? Where did you come from?
character_words: Aang, is that you? Where did you come from?

full_text: Hang on! We're gonna get you out of here.
character_words: Hang on! We're gonna get you out of here.

full_text:
He takes a deep breath of starts to blow a cold wind on the chain that is lifting Bumi up. The chain slowly starts to freeze.
On the ground, Mai and Ty Lee charge Sokka and Katara. Mai readies her stiletto's while Katara takes on a defensive position.
character_words: NA

full_text: We've got to get the baby out of here!
character_words: We've got to get the baby out of here!

full_text: [Blows on the bison whistle before looking at his sister with a big smile.] Way ahead of ya! [Tom-Tom reaches for the whistle and starts to play with it.]
character_words: Way ahead of ya!

full_text:
Cut to an overview shot of Sokka and Katara running to the edge of the big platform. Before they can reach it, Ty Lee's fist emerges from one of the holes in the floor and punches Sokka's foot, causing him to fall over and slide toward the edge. He protectively clutches the baby in his arms, preparing for the worst, but they stop just in time.
Switch back to Katara, who sees Ty Lee jumping out of the hole in the floor and setting course for Sokka. She bends water from her pouch to attack her, but notices something behind her. Cut to a close-up of Mai, who throws four knives at Katara. Katara reacts by quickly by using her water whip to raise up several wooden planks. A close-up of Katara shows that the wooden board is just in time to prevent the knives from piercing her face. The knives embed themselves in the wood. Katara uses her water whip again to shoot the wooden boards to Mai. She turns around in one fluent motion toward Ty Lee who has almost reached Sokka and the baby by now. The water whip grabs Ty Lee by the ankle, pulling her to the ground. This gives Sokka the time he needs to get up and head for a nearby ladder. He slides down and starts his descend of the scaffolding.
Switch to Bumi and Aang, who are still being raised in the air. Aang is still trying to freeze the chain with his breath.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aang, stop your blowing for a minute.
character_words: Aang, stop your blowing for a minute.

full_text: A close-up shows that he finally succeeds in freezing the chain, when an explosion occurs on top of the scaffolding. Azula is propelled in the air and shoots a plume of blue fire toward Aang with a powerful kick. Aang startles by her sudden appearance and swift attack. He deflects the flame with a strong air current of his own.
character_words: NA

full_text: Now hold on just a [The swing of Aang's staff breaks the frozen chain and they freefall down.] duahhh!!!
character_words: Now hold on just a  duahhh!!!

full_text:
Aang turns over Bumi's coffin, so he would crash to the ground head first. As they are about to crash upon one of Omashu's chutes, Aang creates an air ball under them to break their fall. They rapidly slide down the chute they landed in.
Cut to Azula who was following the spectacle from atop the scaffolding. She frowns and sprints to a nearby chute, pursuing the Avatar and the King down the chute in a box of her own.
Switch to a laughing Aang standing on Bumi's coffin.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's just like old times, isn't it, Bumi?
character_words: It's just like old times, isn't it, Bumi?

full_text: [Looking serious.] Aang, I need to talk to you!
character_words: Aang, I need to talk to you!

full_text: It's good to see you too!
character_words: It's good to see you too!

full_text: While Aang is still smiling, he notices the fast approach of something in a chute on his left. He turns to see what it is, just as Azula shoots several fire missiles toward them. He spins his staff above his head to deflect them. Both chutes come together and Azula is now behind them. Aang directs a gust at her, but she parts it with her hands clasped together in front of her. She retaliates with several fire blasts. Aang ducks underneath them and starts to peddle with his staff, increasing their speed. They enter a portion of the chute that has wooden arches over it at short intervals. Aang cuts these through with an air blade, making them collapse upon the track. Azula is caught in the dust cloud, knocked up by the falling debris. When her box emerges again, it seems to be empty. Aang does not see Azula anymore and sighs in relief, but his sigh quickly turns into a scream as Azula emerges again from the box, sending another beam of fire toward him. Aang drops flat on his belly to avoid it. Cut back to the large wooden platform where Mai and Katara are still fighting. Mai dodges Katara's water whips and answers her attacks by shooting stiletto's out of the launcher attached to her leg. Katara easily defends herself by freezing the water to create an ice wall. Mai uses this time to charge Katara head on. The waterbender defends herself by capturing Mai's right arm in a stream of water and freezing it. Mai tries to break the ice, but fails. Ty Lee climbs on the platform behind Katara. She bounces toward Katara and hits her with several quick jabs on her arms. Katara is surprised by this attack and loses control over her water stream that splashes on the ground. She tries to raise the water again, but it only moves a little.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Taunting.] How are you gonna fight without your bending?
character_words: How are you gonna fight without your bending?

full_text: Mai pulls out a sai from her robe and takes aim at a shocked Katara. Just as she is about to throw the weapon, Sokka's boomerang knocks it out of her hand. Ty Lee and Mai spin around to see Sokka flying in on Appa.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Catching the boomerang.] I seem to manage!
character_words: I seem to manage!

full_text:
Sokka and Appa land between Katara and her attackers. As Appa lands, he slams his tail hard on the ground, sending Mai and Ty Lee flying off the scaffolding.
Sokka and Katara are flying down the chutes of Omashu atop Appa's head. Katara looks and points to her left.
character_words: NA

full_text: There's Aang!
character_words: There's Aang!

full_text: [Gazing in the direction Katara pointed.] We can catch him!
character_words: We can catch him!

full_text:
With a growl, Appa changes course toward Aang.
Cut to Azula who is still on the offensive, directing multiple beams of fire at Aang. He spins his staff around in defense while they are still rocketing down the chute. Appa pulls up next to him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hang on, Bumi! Our ride's here!
character_words: Hang on, Bumi! Our ride's here!

full_text:
Appa swerves to avoid another blue fire blast. As he pulls closer again, Aang lifts up the coffin by hitting the side of the chute. Katara and Sokka try to grab hold of the coffin as it passes overhead, but they cannot reach it. Bumi screams as he and Aang fall down. Aang moves the coffin to a more horizontal position in midair. Their fall is broken by another chute as they land crosswise on it, breaking right through. They land on another chute and start to slide down once again with Azula on their trail.
Switch to Azula who creates a whirling disk of flames and sends it down the chute. It rapidly gains on Aang and Bumi. Bumi peeks at the upcoming fire disk and clenches his teeth in effort. A pillar of earth rises in the middle of the chute, protecting them from the disk. Azula gasps for air as she notices that her path is blocked. She jumps up in the nick of time and slides down the chute on foot, while her box slams to pieces against the rock. She eventually halts in the middle of the chute, looking displeased at Aang and Bumi who continue their descent.
Cut to Aang and Bumi who are nearing the end of the chute.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Shocked.] You could earthbend? All along?
character_words: You could earthbend? All along?

full_text: Well, they didn't cover my face.
character_words: Well, they didn't cover my face.

full_text: Bumi strains himself again in effort and raises another earth pillar to stop their descent down the chute. The coffin hits it and ends up standing straight atop the rock, while Aang lands in front of it, looking up at his friend.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Slightly annoyed and angry.] I don't understand. Why didn't you free yourself? Why did you surrender when Omashu was invaded? What's the matter with you, Bumi?
character_words: I don't understand. Why didn't you free yourself? Why did you surrender when Omashu was invaded? What's the matter with you, Bumi?

full_text: [Calmly.] Listen to me, Aang. There are options in fighting, called jing. It's a choice of how you direct your energy.
character_words: Listen to me, Aang. There are options in fighting, called jing. It's a choice of how you direct your energy.

full_text: [Cut to a close-up of an annoyed Aang, counting along on his fingers as he sums up the different jings.] I know! There's positive jing when you're attacking, and negative jing when you're retreating.
character_words: I know! There's positive jing when you're attacking, and negative jing when you're retreating.

full_text: [Happily smiling.] ... and neutral jing when you do nothing!
character_words: ... and neutral jing when you do nothing!

full_text: [He looks shocked at his three raised fingers.] There are three jings?
character_words: There are three jings?

full_text: Well, technically there are eighty-five, but let's just focus on the third. Neutral jing is the key to earthbending. It involves listening and waiting for the right moment to strike.
character_words: Well, technically there are eighty-five, but let's just focus on the third. Neutral jing is the key to earthbending. It involves listening and waiting for the right moment to strike.

full_text: [Starting to understand.] That's why you surrendered, isn't it?
character_words: That's why you surrendered, isn't it?

full_text: Yes, and it's why I can't leave now.
character_words: Yes, and it's why I can't leave now.

full_text: Aang sadly turns around.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Disappointed.] I guess I need to find someone else to teach me earthbending.
character_words: I guess I need to find someone else to teach me earthbending.

full_text: Your teacher will be someone who has mastered neutral jing. You need to find someone who waits and listens before striking.
character_words: Your teacher will be someone who has mastered neutral jing. You need to find someone who waits and listens before striking.

full_text: Momo lands on Aang's shoulders.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Happily.] Hey, Momo!
character_words: Hey, Momo!

full_text: Momo's mastered a few jings himself!
character_words: Momo's mastered a few jings himself!

full_text: Momo screeches loudly at Bumi.
character_words: NA

full_text: Goodbye, Aang. I'll see you when the time is right.
character_words: Goodbye, Aang. I'll see you when the time is right.

full_text:
King Bumi lets his coffin tumble backward and begins his ascend of the chute. He laughs and snorts like a mad man while he uses his earthbending to drive him back to the top of the chute, leaving Aang and Momo behind.
Cut to the royal palanquin being carried out the city, flanked by Mai and Ty Lee.
character_words: NA

full_text: So, we're tracking down your brother and Uncle, huh?
character_words: So, we're tracking down your brother and Uncle, huh?

full_text: [Turning to Mai.] It'll be interesting seeing Zuko again, [Teasing.] won't it, Mai?
character_words: It'll be interesting seeing Zuko again,  won't it, Mai?

full_text: Mai looks away as a smile plays upon her face.
character_words: NA

full_text: It's not just Zuko and Iroh anymore. [Cut closer to Azula who continues on a serious tone.] We have a third target now.
character_words: It's not just Zuko and Iroh anymore.  We have a third target now.

full_text: Scene fades to Aang that night, peeking down over the gutter of the governor's house. The governor holds his wife while they are looking over the city with a sad expression on their face. Aang silently lands behind them and drops off Tom-Tom. Aang takes off again while the child toddles toward his parents. As they hear the cooing of the child, they turn around, gasping with surprise and excitement.
character_words: NA

full_text: Tom-Tom!
character_words: Tom-Tom!

full_text: The governor and his wife joyfully take the baby up into their arms under the watchful eye of Aang who is sitting on the roof. He smiles at the happy scene of the reunited family before he takes off.

full_text:
The episode opens with an overhead shot of rice paddies. The camera pans down, revealing an Earth Kingdom village. The scene cuts to a shot of a bridge over a nearby stream. People carrying backpacks and other loads walk back and forth over the bridge, either entering or departing the small village.
The scene cuts to a street within the village. Iroh and Zuko are sitting on straw mats, their stolen ostrich horse lying behind them. A cart with masks for sale passes by in front of them; one of the masks is seen to be the Blue Spirit mask. As the cart passes, another pedestrian walks in front of Iroh. Iroh holds his hat out to the pedestrian and begins to talk to him.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Somewhat enthusiastically.] Spare coins for weary travelers?
character_words: Spare coins for weary travelers?

full_text: The pedestrian tosses a couple of copper pieces into Iroh's hat as Zuko turns to Iroh in anger.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Angrily, with his arms folded.] This is humiliating! We're royalty! These people should be giving us whatever we want.
character_words: This is humiliating! We're royalty! These people should be giving us whatever we want.

full_text: They will if you ask nicely. [A peasant woman strolls past; somewhat dramatically.] Spare change for a hungry old man?
character_words: They will if you ask nicely.  Spare change for a hungry old man?

full_text: [Withdrawing a coin from her sleeve.] Aw, here you go.
character_words: Aw, here you go.

full_text: The coin is appreciated, but not as much as your smile!
character_words: The coin is appreciated, but not as much as your smile!

full_text: Zuko slaps his forehead in frustration as the young girl giggles lightly and walks away. As soon as she walks away, a man with dual broadswords on his back wanders up to Iroh and Zuko.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Smiling.] How about some entertainment in exchange for ... a gold piece? [He pulls the piece from his pocket with a flourish.]
character_words: How about some entertainment in exchange for ... a gold piece?

full_text: [Annoyed.] We're not performers.
character_words: We're not performers.

full_text: [Standing up.] Not professional anyway. [He puts the hat down and stands up, swaying lightly as he begins to sing.] It's a long, long way to Ba Sing Se, but the girls in the city, they look so pretty!
character_words: Not professional anyway.  It's a long, long way to Ba Sing Se, but the girls in the city, they look so pretty!

full_text: [Annoyed with the quality of the entertainment.] Come on, we're talking a gold piece here! Let's see some action! [Zuko glances up sharply as the man withdraws his swords.] Dance!
character_words: Come on, we're talking a gold piece here! Let's see some action!  Dance!

full_text: The man begins to slice the ground near Iroh's feet; Iroh hops up and down to "dodge" the attacks while Zuko struggles to control his anger at the man. A birds-eye shot of the street shows other citizens have stopped to watch the spectacle.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Singing.] They kiss so sweet that you really got to meet the girls from Ba Sing Se!
character_words: They kiss so sweet that you really got to meet the girls from Ba Sing Se!

full_text: [Stops slicing and laughs.] Ha, ha! Nothing like a fat man dancing for his dinner! Here ya go! [Tosses the gold coin onto the ground and walks away.]
character_words: Ha, ha! Nothing like a fat man dancing for his dinner! Here ya go!

full_text: [Dramatically; close to tears.] Such a kind man.
character_words: Such a kind man.

full_text: Zuko glares after the man in anger and humiliation. The camera cuts to Appa, flying through a gray sky over a large forested area; it is covered somewhat by fog, and looks rather menacing. Sokka is rubbing a whetstone against his machete, while Katara is studying a scroll. Aang stares at the swamp, and seems to be in a trance. Sokka notices they were slowly flying down, and notices Aang's trance-like state.

full_text: [To Aang.] Hey, you taking us down for a reason? [Aang continues to stare at the swamp.] Aang, [Aang snaps out of the trance.] why are we going down?
character_words: Hey, you taking us down for a reason?  Aang,  why are we going down?

full_text: [Confused.] What? I didn't even notice.
character_words: What? I didn't even notice.

full_text: The camera zooms out to see Appa flying down toward the swamp
character_words: NA

full_text: Are you noticing now?
character_words: Are you noticing now?

full_text: [Moving to the front of the saddle.] Is something wrong?
character_words: Is something wrong?

full_text: [He still seems somewhat dazed by the swamp.] I know this is going to sound weird, but I think the swamp is calling to me.
character_words: I know this is going to sound weird, but I think the swamp is calling to me.

full_text: [Holding his stomach.] Is it telling you where we can get something to eat?
character_words: Is it telling you where we can get something to eat?

full_text: No, I ... I think it wants us to land there.
character_words: No, I ... I think it wants us to land there.

full_text: [Shrugging.] No offense to the swamp, but I don't see any land there to land on.
character_words: No offense to the swamp, but I don't see any land there to land on.

full_text: I don't know. Bumi said to learn earthbending I would have to wait and listen, and now I'm actually hearing the earth. Do you want me to ignore it?
character_words: I don't know. Bumi said to learn earthbending I would have to wait and listen, and now I'm actually hearing the earth. Do you want me to ignore it?

full_text: Sokka, Katara and Momo look over Appa's saddle down at the swamp
character_words: NA

full_text: Yes.
character_words: Yes.

full_text: I don't know. There's something ominous about that place.
character_words: I don't know. There's something ominous about that place.

full_text: Momo hides inside Appa's saddle as Appa groans.
character_words: NA

full_text: See, even Appa and Momo don't like it here.
character_words: See, even Appa and Momo don't like it here.

full_text: [Resignedly.] Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this, [Looks at swamp.] bye swamp. [Shakes Appa's rope.] Yip, Yip!
character_words: Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this,  bye swamp.  Yip, Yip!

full_text: Appa groans and flies upward, away from the swamp. A tornado suddenly emerges from out of nowhere, heading right for Appa. Sokka, hearing something, turns around and finally sees it.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Panicked.] You better throw in an extra "yip"! We gotta move!
character_words: You better throw in an extra "yip"! We gotta move!

full_text: Appa starts to fly faster, attempting to avoid the tornado, however he is not fast enough to get away. As the tornado begins to move closer to Appa, the wind pulls Sokka right off from the saddle. Katara manages to grab his hand, holding him back from flying into the tornado. Aang jumps up onto Appa's saddle and creates an air shield around Appa, stabilizing the air and allowing Sokka to fall back into the saddle, uninjured. The wind sucks Appa, who is still protected by the air shield, into the tornado. Aang struggles to maintain the air shield, however as it shrinks, one of Appa's legs slips from the protective air, thereby breaking it. Aang, Katara, and Sokka fall off Appa, with Aang landing lightly in muddied water as the latter two land quite roughly. Appa and Momo are thrown elsewhere in the swamp.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Looking around the swamp and at his friends.] Where's Appa and Momo? [Aang jumps up to the top of the trees, looking for his animal friends as he uses the height to search for them.] Appa! Momo!
character_words: Where's Appa and Momo?  Appa! Momo!

full_text: The scene cuts back to Katara and Sokka. Katara glances at her elbow before looking up at her brother.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Pointing blandly.] Sokka, you've got an elbow leech.
character_words: Sokka, you've got an elbow leech.

full_text: [He spins around, panicking, trying to find it.] Where? Where?
character_words: Where? Where?

full_text: A creature is shown sticking on to Sokka's elbow.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Crosses her arms; sarcastically.] Where do you think?
character_words: Where do you think?

full_text: [Ripping off the elbow leech and throwing it behind to Katara. He cries out angrily.] Why do things keep attaching to me?!
character_words: Why do things keep attaching to me?!

full_text: Aang swings over the muddied water on a vine, waiting for it to stop moving so he can land.
character_words: NA

full_text: You couldn't find them?
character_words: You couldn't find them?

full_text: [Jumping down into the muddy water.] No, and the tornado ... it just disappeared.
character_words: No, and the tornado ... it just disappeared.

full_text: Katara and Sokka turn to face the darkness in the swamp. The scene switches to Appa, who is hanging suspended over the swamp, caught in a mass of vines. Momo jumps up from the saddle and begins chewing through the vines. Appa falls, with Momo, into the muddy water. He shakes the water from his fur and takes off flying, before again becoming trapped. Appa groans as Momo berates him, before the lemur begins to cut the vines, again. The scene switches back to Aang, Katara, and Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Cutting the vines with his machete.] We better speed things up.
character_words: We better speed things up.

full_text: [To Sokka.] Maybe we should be a little nicer to the swamp.
character_words: Maybe we should be a little nicer to the swamp.

full_text: [Continuing to cut the vines.] Aang, these are just plants. Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth?
character_words: Aang, these are just plants. Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth?

full_text: Maybe you should listen to Aang. Something about this place feels ... alive.
character_words: Maybe you should listen to Aang. Something about this place feels ... alive.

full_text: I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can.
character_words: I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can.

full_text: Sokka continues to slice through the vines. The shot changes perspective to show Aang, Katara and Sokka through the vines, as though someone is looking at them. The scene changes to Appa and Momo. Appa is walking on the wet, muddy ground, trailing his footprints behind, carrying Momo on his back. A tree trunk happens to be in Appa's way, and the bison collapses to the ground, unwilling to attempt flying over it or crawling beneath it. Momo takes Aang's bison whistle and blows it to make Appa move. The bison ignores it the first time, growling angrily, but when Momo blows it a second time, he uses his tail to squash the lemur. Dazed from the blow, Momo sways and collapses. The scene changes back to Aang, Katara, and Sokka, now walking through a foggier part of the swamp.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Yelling.] Appa! Momo!
character_words: Appa! Momo!

full_text: There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them. We'll have to make camp for the night.
character_words: There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them. We'll have to make camp for the night.

full_text: Several flies surround Sokka. Sokka swings his machete at them, trying to shoo them away. At that moment, a huge bubble of swamp gas rises from the muddy water below them. The gas grows closer to Aang, Katara, and Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: What was that?
character_words: What was that?

full_text: Nothing, just swamp gas. [Indicating.] Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here.
character_words: Nothing, just swamp gas.  Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here.

full_text: The three groan as the smell reaches them, with Sokka waving his hand in front of his nose as Katara clamps hers shut. Suddenly, the quiet is shattered by a terrifying scream, causing them all to scream and huddle together, looking around wide-eyed for the source. The camera zooms backward, showing a small, grumpy-looking white bird. It opens its beak extremely wide, emitting the terrifying scream, and flutters off.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sweating, his voice cracking.] I think we should build a fire.
character_words: I think we should build a fire.

full_text: Sokka runs off to a nearby tree and cuts pieces of wood from its roots. Aang and Katara walk up to Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sokka, the longer we're here, the more I think you shouldn't be doing do that.
character_words: Sokka, the longer we're here, the more I think you shouldn't be doing do that.

full_text: No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine. [Grabs a nearby root.] Right, swamp? [Shakes the root and fakes a reply.] "No problem, Sokka!"
character_words: No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine.  Right, swamp?  "No problem, Sokka!"

full_text: Sokka continues to chop up the roots, while Aang looks somewhat annoyed. The scene changes to a later shot of the trio around a fire. Katara glancing around at the swamp.
character_words: NA

full_text: Does anyone else get the feeling that we're being watched?
character_words: Does anyone else get the feeling that we're being watched?

full_text: Sokka is shown with a fly buzzing around him. He does not seems scared anymore.
character_words: NA

full_text: Please, we're all alone out here.
character_words: Please, we're all alone out here.

full_text: Sokka uses his machete to try and scare the fly off. The fly turns into a big, shining ball of light. It flies away from the gang, illuminating over a dozen pairs of eyes staring at them. They turn around and see them.
character_words: NA

full_text: Except for them.
character_words: Except for them.

full_text: They turn back around and huddle together.
character_words: NA

full_text: [His calm demeanor vanishing.] Right, except for them.
character_words: Right, except for them.

full_text:
The scene changes to Appa and Momo, who are lying down on a giant tree branch. The constant nocturnal noises echoing around them has Momo scuttling frantically from one end of the saddle to the other whilst chittering in fear. Appa, unable to sleep by the noise, growls loudly, causing the noises to stop, and Momo settles down on Appa's saddle. As Momo begins to close his eyes, another small sound is heard, causing his ears to perk up and his eyes to widen. The scene changes back to Aang, Katara, and Sokka. The camp fire is beginning to die out, and the three friends are huddled together, sleeping. Another perspective shot shows someone looking at them through the vines. A vine snakes its way to Sokka's leg, which is sticking out, and begins to wind around both it and Sokka's whole body.
The shot cuts to an overhead view of the three, each tied up by several vines that snake out of the frame. The scene cuts to a close-up profile shot of the three. For a moment, they are still asleep - Sokka holding his machete and drooling - but they awake screaming as the vines simultaneously yank them all out off the screen and away from each other.
The scene cuts to Sokka. He plants the blade of his machete in the ground as he is dragged away. Both Katara and Aang are also dragged off into the mist. Sokka gets up and looks around for his sister and Aang. The respite does not last long as vines are suddenly thrown at him. They wrap around him and attempt to drag him away again. Before he can travel too far, Sokka starts hacking the vines with his machete. He frees himself and runs back down the tree root, pursued by more vines.
The scene cuts to Katara, struggling to free herself from the vines. Using a water whip she cuts through her bonds and runs off into the mist.
The scene cuts to Aang, who frees himself by creating an air bubble around him and expanding it. His bonds attach to the bubble, and Aang jumps away before they ensnare him again. He jumps through the trees, closely pursued by more vines. He escapes a vine that pulls him to the ground using his airbending to propel himself far away and soon finds himself alone in the swamp. Cut to a wide shot of Aang looking around for his friends.
character_words: NA

full_text: Guys?
character_words: Guys?

full_text: The scene fades to a shot of Appa's footprint, which is now filled with swamp water. Two figures are looking down at the footprint. Due is tall and skinny, while his friend Tho is short and fat. Both wear small, animal skin loincloths and have a single, large leaf on their heads to serve as a hat. Tho is carrying a stick, and uses it to indicate the animal track.
character_words: NA

full_text: What'd you reckon make a track like that, Tho?
character_words: What'd you reckon make a track like that, Tho?

full_text: Don't know, Due. [Points his stick at the footprint.] Some'in with six legs. Pretty big'uns too.
character_words: Don't know, Due.  Some'in with six legs. Pretty big'uns too.

full_text: The camera pans up to reveal more of Appa's tracks in the mud.
character_words: NA

full_text: Leaves a nice, wide trail to folla'.
character_words: Leaves a nice, wide trail to folla'.

full_text: You know what's at the end of that trail?
character_words: You know what's at the end of that trail?

full_text: Due shakes his head in the negative. Cut to a close-up of Tho's smiling face.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Grinning.] Dinner.
character_words: Dinner.

full_text:
The scene cuts to Appa swimming in the marshy water before cutting to a close-up of Momo. A fly is buzzing around his head, and he watches it, shifting his eyes from side to side. It flies off, and Momo goes after it. He lands on a nearby tree root, still attempting to catch the fly. He hops from tree root to tree root, following the fly, although unknowingly lands on the back of a catgator. He catches the fly on the last root, but lets go of it as he jumps to fly away from the creature. It pursues Momo as he flies back to Appa. The camera pans left, following the chase. When Momo and the crocodile reach Appa, the sky bison's mouth is open and the catgator swims right into it. Appa holds the creature there for a moment, before spitting it back out. Momo and the catfish crocodile hiss at each other for a moment, and the crocodile swims off. The scene cuts back to Appa, who shakes his head and loudly groans.
Cut to Katara, who is walking through an area where the tree roots are covered in white flowers.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Calling out.] Aang! Sokka!
character_words: Aang! Sokka!

full_text: Ahead of Katara is another Water Tribe woman, her back facing Katara. She wears the same robe as Katara and has the same hair style. Katara begins walking toward the figure.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hello? Hello? Can you help me? [She squints.] Mom? [More loudly and running toward the figure.] Mom!
character_words: Hello? Hello? Can you help me?  Mom?  Mom!

full_text: Katara runs to the figure, her eyes streaming tears of joy. She reaches the figure and places a hand on her shoulder.
character_words: NA

full_text: I can't believe ...
character_words: I can't believe ...

full_text: The smile leaves her face as the scene begins to lighten. Katara stands in front of a tree stump as she realizes the figure was only an illusion. Katara gasps, falling to her knees as she begins to cry. It cuts to an overhead shot of the very devastated Katara, and fades to shot of Sokka's hand holding his machete in the air. The rest of Sokka appears.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aang! [While slashing at the vines.] Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara! [He becomes caught, and grunts with exertion before slicing himself free.] You think you're so tough, huh?
character_words: Aang!  Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara!  You think you're so tough, huh?

full_text: Sokka trips over as he cuts through the vine in which he was tangled, falling offscreen with his face in the mud. Upon lifting up his head, he sees an image of Yue in a beam of light not far in front of him. Sokka stands up, puts away his machete and starts walking toward Yue.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hello? Yue? [He takes a hold of his head, before removing his hands and shrugging, turning away from the apparition.] This is just a trick of the light ... swamp gas ... I ... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy. [Almost fearfully, he turns around and walks closer.]
character_words: Hello? Yue?  This is just a trick of the light ... swamp gas ... I ... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy.

full_text: [Accusingly.] You didn't protect me.
character_words: You didn't protect me.

full_text:
Sokka rubs his eyes in disbelief, opening them to find that Yue has disappeared. Sokka sighs in relief, but as he turns around he falls over backward, startled at seeing Yue right before his eyes again. The image of Yue disappears immediately after that and Sokka stands up and pulls his machete back out, almost threateningly.
The scene switches to Aang, who is wandering the swamp calling the names of his friends.
character_words: NA

full_text: Katara! Appa!
character_words: Katara! Appa!

full_text: Upon wading through the swamp, Aang notices an unfamiliar girl in a dress standing on a hill, accompanied by a winged pig.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hello? Who are you?
character_words: Hello? Who are you?

full_text: The pig flies off and the girl giggles, before turning around and running away.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, come back! [He holds his hand out as though to grab her.]
character_words: Hey, come back!

full_text: Aang jumps to the top of the hill, only to find she has completely disappeared from his sight. Hearing her laugh again, Aang turns around only to see her running across the limbs of another tree. He uses the vines, however before he can even reach his destination, the girl has moved and is now running across the ground tries to chase the girl. Aang continues his wild chase through the treetops, as the scene switches to show Appa with Momo on his back swimming through the river that flows through the swamp. A little further on the stream, covered by fog, is a group of six swamp tribe members divided over three canoes; Due and Tho sitting in the middle canoe. They look at each other in silence for a few moments, Tho wetting his lips using his tongue. Appa halts as Momo chitters at the strange people.
character_words: NA

full_text: Look at that Tho. Is that a little hairy fella ridin' that thing?
character_words: Look at that Tho. Is that a little hairy fella ridin' that thing?

full_text: No, that's what they call a "lemoo". Saw one at a traveling show once. Real smart they say.
character_words: No, that's what they call a "lemoo". Saw one at a traveling show once. Real smart they say.

full_text: Bet he tastes a lot like possum chicken.
character_words: Bet he tastes a lot like possum chicken.

full_text: You think everything tastes like possum chicken.
character_words: You think everything tastes like possum chicken.

full_text: C'mon now, fellas. [He moves to the front of the boat.] Just a little closer. Nice and easy. Nothing to worry about. We just fixin' to eat ya.
character_words: C'mon now, fellas.  Just a little closer. Nice and easy. Nothing to worry about. We just fixin' to eat ya.

full_text: Appa turns around and takes off in the opposite direction.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Annoyed.] What'd you say that fer?
character_words: What'd you say that fer?

full_text: [Shrugging as he tries to appease his friend.] Well, we are!
character_words: Well, we are!

full_text: But you don't have to tell 'em that.
character_words: But you don't have to tell 'em that.

full_text: [He shrugs again.] Well how'd I know they'd understand me?
character_words: Well how'd I know they'd understand me?

full_text: Come on!
character_words: Come on!

full_text: Due stands up in front of the canoe and starts spinning his arms, bending the water behind his canoe in order to chase Appa. The other two canoes follow suit, trailing behind Appa in a 'V' formation. Appa bounds through the river, desperate to escape the strange people hunting him. The scene switches back to Aang, who is still chasing the girl.
character_words: NA

full_text: Who are you?
character_words: Who are you?

full_text: Peering through a wall of vegetation, Aang sees the girl on a small hill. Running after her, it is too late to stop as he notices that it is not the girl, but Katara. Aang runs into the waterbender and they both fall over. Sokka hears the commotion and turns around to investigate with his machete cocked - in the wrong direction, as only a few seconds later, Aang and Katara come barreling down the root he is standing on and hit him in the back, knocking him over too.
character_words: NA

full_text: [He stands up and puts his machete away.] What do you guys think you're doing!? I've been looking all over for you!
character_words: What do you guys think you're doing!? I've been looking all over for you!

full_text: [She has not moved, although her hand is on her head as she sits on the root they have fallen onto.] Well, I've been wandering around looking for you!
character_words: Well, I've been wandering around looking for you!

full_text: [He looks away before airbending himself to his feet. He appears embarrassed that he was not actively searching for his friends like they were him.] I was chasing some girl.
character_words: I was chasing some girl.

full_text: What girl?
character_words: What girl?

full_text: [He walks over to Katara and helps her up before rubbing his ear.] I don't know. I heard laughing and I saw some girl in a fancy dress.
character_words: I don't know. I heard laughing and I saw some girl in a fancy dress.

full_text: [Sarcastically, with exaggerated hand movements.] Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations!
character_words: Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations!

full_text: I thought I saw Mom.
character_words: I thought I saw Mom.

full_text: Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us. That's why we all saw things out here.
character_words: Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us. That's why we all saw things out here.

full_text: [Surprised.] You saw something too?
character_words: You saw something too?

full_text: [He looks away for a moment, before turning back and taking a step closer to his sister.] I thought I saw Yue. But, that doesn't prove anything. Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot.
character_words: I thought I saw Yue. But, that doesn't prove anything. Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot.

full_text: What about me? I didn't know the girl I saw. And all our visions led us right here.
character_words: What about me? I didn't know the girl I saw. And all our visions led us right here.

full_text: Aang begins walking around, as if looking for something.
character_words: NA

full_text: Okay ... so where's here? The middle of the swamp?
character_words: Okay ... so where's here? The middle of the swamp?

full_text: Aang looks around, his gaze finally resting on a massive tree growing right next to him. The camera pans to reveal exactly how enormous the tree really is.
character_words: NA

full_text: Yeah, the center ... it's the heart of the swamp. It's been calling us here. I knew it.
character_words: Yeah, the center ... it's the heart of the swamp. It's been calling us here. I knew it.

full_text: It's just a tree. [He raises his arms above his head.] It can't call anyone. For the last time, there's nothing after us and there's nothing magical happening here.
character_words: It's just a tree.  It can't call anyone. For the last time, there's nothing after us and there's nothing magical happening here.

full_text: As Sokka finishes his tirade, a seaweed monster jumps out from the water. The gang huddles together and screams, separating as the monster begins to attack them. The seaweed monster goes after Sokka first as the trio split up, each running in different directions. Sokka is picked up and swung around, only being released as Aang uses airbending to slice part of the monster's arm off. The monster goes after Aang, flicking the monk away and into the surrounding trees. Sokka is shown fighting with the vines that had him captured only seconds ago, and so intent was he at destroying them, he failed to notice a column rising behind himself. The column attaches to the seaweed monster and Sokka is swiped from the ground. Katara comes to his rescue this time as she slices at the monster's arm. It did not have the desired effect, as more vines grew to patch up the hole her waterbending created. She manages to push the monster back a little, however it is not long before she is flung away. Aang stops to watch her, giving the monster time to attack him. Sokka is absorbed into the chest of the monster as the scene changes to Appa continuing his escape from the Foggy Swamp members. Momo throws objects at them from the back of his friend, attempting to slow them down. One of these such items was a shirt that appears to belong to Sokka at a Foggy Swamp member, resulting in the boat that member was on to spin out of control.
character_words: NA

full_text: Now, what would a lemoo need a shirt fer?
character_words: Now, what would a lemoo need a shirt fer?

full_text: Tho manages to capture Momo after the latter hits a low tree branch and is thrown backward. The loss of his friend encourages Appa to run faster. The scene changes back to the gang fighting the seaweed monster. After using a tornado-like airbending move, Katara freezes Sokka in place before shooting him with water, expelling him from the monster's body. The fight ends as Katara begins to waterbend repeatedly at the monster, slicing through the vines and not allowing the monster to regenerate. A person is seen inside the monster, bending the vines.
character_words: NA

full_text: There's someone in there! He's bending the vines!
character_words: There's someone in there! He's bending the vines!

full_text: With a final slice, Katara cuts through the mask on the seaweed monster, the whole top half falling off. However, this does not stop the monster, and vines spring out of the marsh, capturing Katara high on a pillar. Aang airbends over to the monster and, using his native bending, rips apart the vines.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Demanding offensively.] Why did you call me here if you just wanted to kill us!?
character_words: Why did you call me here if you just wanted to kill us!?

full_text: Wait! [The vines drop to reveal a slightly larger man wearing nothing but a leaf loincloth.] I didn't call you here.
character_words: Wait!  I didn't call you here.

full_text: [He shares a look of confusion with Sokka, who is also in an offensive stance.] We were flying over and I heard something calling to me, telling me to land.
character_words: We were flying over and I heard something calling to me, telling me to land.

full_text: He's the Avatar. Stuff like that happens to us a lot.
character_words: He's the Avatar. Stuff like that happens to us a lot.

full_text: The Avatar? Come with me.
character_words: The Avatar? Come with me.

full_text: The trio drop their stances and look at each other. The scene cuts to Huu, leading the gang to the top of the giant tree Aang noticed earlier.
character_words: NA

full_text: So, who are you then?
character_words: So, who are you then?

full_text: [Bending a vine out of the way.] I protect the swamp from folks that want to hurt it, like this fella with his big knife.
character_words: I protect the swamp from folks that want to hurt it, like this fella with his big knife.

full_text: See, completely reasonable. [He finally puts his machete away.] Not a monster, just a regular guy defending his home. Nothing mystical about it.
character_words: See, completely reasonable.  Not a monster, just a regular guy defending his home. Nothing mystical about it.

full_text: Oh the swamp is a mystical place all right. It's sacred. I reached enlightenment right here under the banyan-grove tree. [He sits on the tree, looking at the group as he explains.] I heard it calling me, just like you did.
character_words: Oh the swamp is a mystical place all right. It's sacred. I reached enlightenment right here under the banyan-grove tree.  I heard it calling me, just like you did.

full_text: [Humoring Huu.] Sure you did. It seems real chatty.
character_words: Sure you did. It seems real chatty.

full_text: [The camera zooms out as he explains, slowly revealing more and more of the swamp. It shows how large the banyan-grove tree is compared to the others, but at the final magnification, it is impossible to distinguish it from the other trees.] See this whole swamp is actually just one tree spread out over miles. Branches spread and sink, take root, and spread some more. One big, living organism. Just like the entire world.
character_words: See this whole swamp is actually just one tree spread out over miles. Branches spread and sink, take root, and spread some more. One big, living organism. Just like the entire world.

full_text: [Cuts back to Aang, looking at Huu. He is still openly skeptical.] I get how the tree is one big thing, but the whole world?
character_words: I get how the tree is one big thing, but the whole world?

full_text: Sure. You think you're any different from me or your friends or this tree? If you listen hard enough, you can hear every living thing breathing together. [Another shot shows the swamp river. There are the sounds of several animals heard in the background.] You can feel everything growing. We're all living together, even if most folks don't act like it. We all have the same roots and we are all branches of the same tree.
character_words: Sure. You think you're any different from me or your friends or this tree? If you listen hard enough, you can hear every living thing breathing together.  You can feel everything growing. We're all living together, even if most folks don't act like it. We all have the same roots and we are all branches of the same tree.

full_text: [She and her friends are now sitting, listening to Huu.] But what did our visions mean?
character_words: But what did our visions mean?

full_text: In the swamp, we see visions of people we've lost, people we loved, folks we think are gone. [The shot cuts to show the people that Sokka and Katara saw in the swamp, before cutting back to Huu.] But the swamp tells us they're not. We're still connected to them. Time is an illusion and so is death.
character_words: In the swamp, we see visions of people we've lost, people we loved, folks we think are gone.  But the swamp tells us they're not. We're still connected to them. Time is an illusion and so is death.

full_text: But what about my vision? It was someone I had never met.
character_words: But what about my vision? It was someone I had never met.

full_text: You're the Avatar. You tell me.
character_words: You're the Avatar. You tell me.

full_text: [He looks down as he tries to understand.] Time is an illusion. So, it's someone I will meet.
character_words: Time is an illusion. So, it's someone I will meet.

full_text: Huu nods.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to find Appa and Momo.
character_words: Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to find Appa and Momo.

full_text: I think I know how to find them. [Aang kneels down and places his hand on the tree.] Everything is connected. [Energy travels from Aang's hand to Appa's location. Appa is seen being captured by the Foggy Swamp members. Back at the banyan-grove tree, Aang stands up.] Come on! We've got to hurry!
character_words: I think I know how to find them.  Everything is connected.  Come on! We've got to hurry!

full_text: Back to the Foggy Swamp members, Appa is trapped inside a net while Tho sings.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Singing and tapping the side of his canoe. Momo is seen struggling inside the sack he has been placed in.] Set my lines by the river bed! Caught ten fish and I killed 'em dead! Cut 'em and gut 'em and I tossed the heads in the water to keep them catgators fed.
character_words: Set my lines by the river bed! Caught ten fish and I killed 'em dead! Cut 'em and gut 'em and I tossed the heads in the water to keep them catgators fed.

full_text: The boats stop when a jet of water appears and destroys the boat next to Tho and Due's. The two people from the destroyed boat fly into the water as Aang appears on a tree branch.
character_words: NA

full_text: Appa!
character_words: Appa!

full_text: Aang airbends a stream of air, throwing Tho into the water and freeing Momo who was being held by Tho.
character_words: NA

full_text: We're under attack!
character_words: We're under attack!

full_text: Due scoops up a puddle of water and sends it toward Aang and Katara. The three become engaged in a waterbending fight, with neither side gaining an advantage.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, you guys are waterbenders!
character_words: Hey, you guys are waterbenders!

full_text: You too! That means we're kin! [Due ceases waterbending, followed by a slightly disgusted Katara. He watches as Sokka and Huu run up to the branch Katara and Aang are standing on.] Hey Huu! How you been?
character_words: You too! That means we're kin!  Hey Huu! How you been?

full_text: You know, scared some folks, swung some vines, the usual.
character_words: You know, scared some folks, swung some vines, the usual.

full_text: Huu?
character_words: Huu?

full_text: The scene cuts to the gang sitting around a fire in the Foggy Swamp Tribe. There is a member waterbending some liquid in a pot to stirs it, and Due grabs a fish from the pot before moving over to the fire.
character_words: NA

full_text: How you like that possum chicken?
character_words: How you like that possum chicken?

full_text: Tastes just like arctic hen. So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa? [He indicates the catgator lying behind Tho.] You've got plenty of those big things wandering around.
character_words: Tastes just like arctic hen. So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa?  You've got plenty of those big things wandering around.

full_text: You want me to eat old Slim? He's like a member of the family!
character_words: You want me to eat old Slim? He's like a member of the family!

full_text: Due pulls the fish off the branch and gives it to Slim.
character_words: NA

full_text: Nice Slim!
character_words: Nice Slim!

full_text: Sokka throws a bug at the catgator; it bounces off his nose and he growls at Sokka, who cowers slightly.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Laughing.] Oh, he don't eat no bugs! That's people food.
character_words: Oh, he don't eat no bugs! That's people food.

full_text: Where'd you say you was from?
character_words: Where'd you say you was from?

full_text: [Smiling. Sokka is shown chewing nonchalantly next to her.] The South Pole.
character_words: The South Pole.

full_text: Didn't know there was waterbenders anywhere but here. They got a nice swamp there, do they?
character_words: Didn't know there was waterbenders anywhere but here. They got a nice swamp there, do they?

full_text: No, it's all ice and snow.
character_words: No, it's all ice and snow.

full_text: Hmm. No wonder you left.
character_words: Hmm. No wonder you left.

full_text: [To Katara.] Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here. [He raises his arms for emphasis.] Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.
character_words: Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here.  Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.

full_text: What about the visions?
character_words: What about the visions?

full_text: I told you, we were hungry. I'm eating a giant bug!
character_words: I told you, we were hungry. I'm eating a giant bug!

full_text: Sokka holds up said giant bug, taking a bit of its abdomen. He swallows it with some difficulty before exhaling sharply, sticking his tongue out.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Feeding Momo.] But what about when the tree showed me where Appa and Momo were?
character_words: But what about when the tree showed me where Appa and Momo were?
