character_words: Wake up, buddy!

full_text: Cuts to shot of one of Appa's eyes as it slowly creaks open and widens in realization of the current situation. Having awakened, he resumes his normal flight, soaring just above the treetops. Toph, Sokka, Katara and Momo sway to the side still tightly gripping the saddle. Appa soars through the trees, colliding into and snapping several branches. Cuts to shot of the team members who brace against the impact. The camera zooms out to depict a flock of birds resting in the trees, fleeing from the incident, before panning downward to show Appa on the ground, having created a channel way behind him from the impact. Cuts to shot of Appa sleeping once more; Aang slides off his head and onto the ground.
character_words: NA

full_text: Appa's exhausted.
character_words: Appa's exhausted.

full_text: [Trudging across the ground, carrying his sleeping bag.] Okay, we've put in a lot of distance between us and them. The plan right now is to follow Appa's lead and get some sleep.
character_words: Okay, we've put in a lot of distance between us and them. The plan right now is to follow Appa's lead and get some sleep.

full_text: [Irritated.] Of course, we could've gotten some sleep earlier, [Depicts shot of Toph lying on the ground sleepily.] if Toph didn't have such issues.
character_words: Of course, we could've gotten some sleep earlier,  if Toph didn't have such issues.

full_text: [Wakes up and slams the ground; screams furiously.] What!?
character_words: What!?

full_text: [Trying to calm the tension.] All right, all right, everyone's exhausted! Let's just get some rest.
character_words: All right, all right, everyone's exhausted! Let's just get some rest.

full_text: [Rises and faces Katara.] No, I want to hear what Katara has to say. You think I have issues?
character_words: No, I want to hear what Katara has to say. You think I have issues?

full_text: [Irritated.] I'm just saying. Maybe if you helped out earlier, we could have set up our camp faster and gotten some sleep [Shouting.] and then maybe we wouldn't be in this situation!
character_words: I'm just saying. Maybe if you helped out earlier, we could have set up our camp faster and gotten some sleep  and then maybe we wouldn't be in this situation!

full_text: Cuts to shot of entire campsite, Katara, Toph and Aang standing by Appa, while Sokka lies sleepily on his sleeping bag several yards away.
character_words: NA

full_text: You're blaming me for this?
character_words: You're blaming me for this?

full_text: Katara tosses aside her sleeping bag and gestures with her hands, challenging Toph to move closer. Aang jumps in between the two.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Desperately.] No! No, she's not blaming you.
character_words: No! No, she's not blaming you.

full_text: [Angrily.] No, I'm blaming her!
character_words: No, I'm blaming her!

full_text: Hey, [Shoves Aang out of the way.] I never asked you for diddly-doo-dah. [Points her thumb at herself.] I carry my own weight. Besides, if there's anyone to blame, it's Sheddy over here!
character_words: Hey,  I never asked you for diddly-doo-dah.  I carry my own weight. Besides, if there's anyone to blame, it's Sheddy over here!

full_text: [Sitting on Appa's tail.] What? You're blaming Appa?
character_words: What? You're blaming Appa?

full_text: Yeah, you want to know how they keep finding us? [Grabs a handful of Appa's fur and lets the sheddings blow away in the wind.] He's leaving a trail everywhere we go!
character_words: Yeah, you want to know how they keep finding us?  He's leaving a trail everywhere we go!

full_text: [Jumps down to face her.] How dare you blame Appa! He saved your life three times today! If there's anyone to blame it's you! You're always talking about how you carry your own weight, but you're not. He is! Appa's carrying your weight. He never had a problem flying when it was just the three of us!
character_words: How dare you blame Appa! He saved your life three times today! If there's anyone to blame it's you! You're always talking about how you carry your own weight, but you're not. He is! Appa's carrying your weight. He never had a problem flying when it was just the three of us!

full_text: [Stomps the ground, launching her pack into the air which she catches.] I'm out of here.
character_words: I'm out of here.

full_text: [Moves in front of Toph, his arms outstretched to halt her.] Wait!
character_words: Wait!

full_text: Toph uses earthbending to shift Sokka off to the side, leaving him surprised. Cuts to shot of fur drifting in the sky. Cuts to ground level view of the tank train speeding across the terrain. Cuts to overhead shot of Aang who raises his arms up, his eyes sorrowful.
character_words: NA

full_text: What did I just do? [Slumps.] I can't believe I yelled at my earthbending teacher. Now she's gone.
character_words: What did I just do?  I can't believe I yelled at my earthbending teacher. Now she's gone.

full_text: [Regretfully.] I know. We're all just trying to get used to each other. And I was so mean to her.
character_words: I know. We're all just trying to get used to each other. And I was so mean to her.

full_text: [From afar, drinking from a cup.] Yeah, you two were pretty much jerks.
character_words: Yeah, you two were pretty much jerks.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Thanks, Sokka.
character_words: Thanks, Sokka.

full_text: No problem.
character_words: No problem.

full_text: We need to find Toph and apologize.
character_words: We need to find Toph and apologize.

full_text: Okay, but what are we going to do about the tank full of dangerous ladies chasing us?
character_words: Okay, but what are we going to do about the tank full of dangerous ladies chasing us?

full_text: [Grabs a handful of fur and watches as it blows away in the wind.] I have a plan.
character_words: I have a plan.

full_text: The scene changes to where Appa lies in the water. The camera zooms out to a shot of him lounging in the Nan Shan River, two arched streams of water showering him on either side. Cuts to shot of the river's surface where clumps of fur collect in the water. Cuts to a shot of the top of Appa's head where Momo lands, holding a brush. He scrubs the bison's head and is forced to hastily take flight when a stream of water is bent his way. Cuts to shot of Appa's head, Sokka standing in the river several feet away, holding a brush. He groans as he becomes drenched by the stream of water. The scene changes to the campsite where Appa stands on the ground, his fur still wet from the bath. Sokka can be seen standing by the riverbank, wringing out his shirt.
character_words: NA

full_text: Toph was right. The fur was leaving a trail right to us. But now that he's clean, no more trail.
character_words: Toph was right. The fur was leaving a trail right to us. But now that he's clean, no more trail.

full_text: Are you sure he's okay to fly?
character_words: Are you sure he's okay to fly?

full_text: He'll be fine as long as we leave his saddle and all our stuff here. [Kneels down and places pieces of Appa's fur into his satchel.] I'm going to use Appa's fur to make a fake trail to lead the tank off-course.
character_words: He'll be fine as long as we leave his saddle and all our stuff here.  I'm going to use Appa's fur to make a fake trail to lead the tank off-course.

full_text:
Cuts to shot of the treetops. Appa grunts and takes flight, Sokka and Katara riding atop him. As he flies away, his body accidentally brushes against the treetops, snapping the topmost limbs off and causing them to fall to the ground. Aang watches as the bison flies away and turns. Taking a running start, he flies away from the scene on his glider, releasing patches of fur from the bag along the way, creating a misleading trail.
Cuts to shot of a mountain range, fog partially obscuring their peaks. The camera pans downward to show Toph walking slowly along a pathway on her own. Cuts to side-view of her as she halts, having detected something nearby. Cuts to ground level shot of her foot which shifts abruptly in the opposite direction. Cuts to shot of her as she turns her head swiftly. She uses earthbending to send a stream of earth toward the unknown source. The stream of earth travels its way to a large rock ahead and a dust cloud erupts in the air from the impact. A grunt of pain is heard from behind the rock. Cuts to shot of Toph who approaches the rock still assuming a fighting stance. Cuts to shot of Iroh, his back to the camera as he kneels over and rubs his rear in pain. Cuts to shot of his face as he grimaces from the incident.
character_words: NA

full_text: Ow ... That really hurt my tailbone.
character_words: Ow ... That really hurt my tailbone.

full_text: The scene changes to the Nan Shan River, the camera panning slightly downward to show patches of Appa's fur clinging to rocks. Azula's hands appear on screen as she grabs hold of two patches of fur and lifts to examine them.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Off camera; dryly.] Wads of wet fur. How delightful.
character_words: Wads of wet fur. How delightful.

full_text: [Thoughtfully.] Hmmm ... they're not wads, they're more like bundles, or bunches? [Scratching her head.] It's got an "uh" sound.
character_words: Hmmm ... they're not wads, they're more like bundles, or bunches?  It's got an "uh" sound.

full_text: [Unamused.] Clumps?
character_words: Clumps?

full_text: [Clasps her hands together and says brightly.] Clumps! They're clumps! [Hugs Mai.]
character_words: Clumps! They're clumps!

full_text: Cuts to close-up of Mai, still being embraced by Ty Lee, who peers down. Cuts to shot of the fake fur trail, the camera panning upward to reveal the direction in which it is traveling.
character_words: NA

full_text: [To Azula, pointing in direction of the trail.] The trail goes this way.
character_words: The trail goes this way.

full_text: Azula, who had been bending over, examining the fur, rises and looks in the direction of the trail. She averts her gaze upward. Cuts to shot of the broken treetops.
character_words: NA

full_text: The Avatar's trying to give us the slip. [Pointing to the broken treetops.] You two head in that direction and keep your eye out for the bison. [Looking down at fur trail.] I'll follow this trail.
character_words: The Avatar's trying to give us the slip.  You two head in that direction and keep your eye out for the bison.  I'll follow this trail.

full_text:
Cuts to shot of Azula who narrows her eyes. Cuts to ground level shot as Mai and Ty Lee ride away on their mongoose lizards. As they disappear from sight, Azula's mongoose lizard comes into view, the Fire Nation princess mounted on top. She pulls on the reigns and heads in the opposite direction, following the fake trail. Cuts to overhead shot of the area, Mai and Ty Lee seen traveling to the right of the screen, Azula to the left. Cuts to shot of Azula, who races toward the camera.
The scene changes to another area of the forest, a cluster of trees growing on a rocky ledge overlooking the rest of the forest, the river channeling right through the landscape. Mountains are seen in the distance. Aang comes into view, flying on his glider, releasing the fur from his satchel. He exits the lush, green landscape area and soars over a more arid, rugged terrain. Camera briefly focuses on him, his eyes tired from lack of sleep as he peers down and looks forward.
The camera pans upward to depict an old abandoned town, Tu Zin, similar to historical Western towns. Aang heads toward the town, still dropping fur. Cuts to side-view of the front of the town as he lands on the ground. Cuts to show the rest of the town. Aang's legs come into view and he twirls his glider staff closed. Cuts to overhead shot of him walking through the middle street way of the town, casually dropping fur. Cuts to shot of old store, the shutters creaking and a bell tolling in the wind. Cuts to side-view of Aang as he continues walking forward. Cuts to close-up of him as he averts his eyes sleepily from side-to-side. Cuts to shot of building and a side-view of him walking shown from in between two buildings.
Cuts to shot of the ground, the camera panning upward to show the satchel being held upside-down, the remaining fur dropping onto the ground. Cuts to overhead shot of him as he opens his glider. He turns to face the horizon. Cuts to shot of him looking into the distance, his back to the screen. He looks down. Cuts to shot of him standing at the end of the town as he twirls his glider closed. He sits down on the ground cross-legged. The camera zooms out on the town. The scene changes to where Appa lazily soars overhead in the forest. Cuts to shot of Sokka and Katara mounted on him.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Surveying the woods.] Toph couldn't have made it too far. [Momo begins to chitter and rears up defensively.] What is it, Momo? Ooooh, no! Katara!
character_words: Toph couldn't have made it too far.  What is it, Momo? Ooooh, no! Katara!

full_text: Cuts to overhead shot of Sokka sitting on Appa's tail, Mai and Ty Lee following the bison in hot pursuit, mounted on mongoose lizards.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Shocked; urges Appa forward.] How did they find us?
character_words: How did they find us?

full_text: Cuts to side-view of Appa who flies dangerously close to the tree line, growing more and more tired.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Urgently.] Appa, come on, we need to go faster!
character_words: Appa, come on, we need to go faster!

full_text: He's too tired!
character_words: He's too tired!

full_text: [Frantically.] Not good, not good! [Appa grunts;. Cuts to ground level view of Mai and Ty Lee chasing after them. Cuts to shot of Appa heading toward the river.] We just need to make it across that river!
character_words: Not good, not good!  We just need to make it across that river!

full_text: [Pleading.] Come on Appa, just a little further ...
character_words: Come on Appa, just a little further ...

full_text: Cuts to side-view of Appa who continues his descent, snapping off several treetops in the process. Cuts to shot from directly beneath Appa who crashes into another treetop, causing it to fall toward the screen. Cuts back to Mai and Ty Lee who chase after them. Cuts to Mai who swings her arm, firing a flurry of stilettos. Cuts back to Sokka who narrowly avoids the weapons by ducking. Cuts to view of Appa skimming the surface of the Nan Shan River before crashing into the ground on the opposite side of the river. Cuts to shot from the other side of the river, Appa's backside seen in the distance.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] We made it! We're safe.
character_words: We made it! We're safe.

full_text: [Voice-over.] You did it Appa!
character_words: You did it Appa!

full_text:
Cuts to riverbank where the siblings embrace. Katara opens her eyes and gasps. Sokka turns around and becomes horrified. Cuts to side-view of the mongoose lizards paddling the water rapidly, allowing for them to walk over the surface of the river. Katara steps forward and spins around, sending a wave of water crashing into Ty Lee's mongoose lizard. Ty Lee leaps off the beast just in time and emerges from the water. She lands near the treetops where she gracefully dodges from tree trunk to tree trunk in pursuit of Katara, who opens her water skin.
Ty Lee somersaults onto the ground. Katara attempts to lash a water whip in her direction, however, is forced to quickly dodge several of the acrobat's blows. She narrowly avoids having her chi blocked and fires several sharp discs of water at her enemy, who cartwheels repeatedly to escape. Cuts to shot of Mai still mounted on her lizard. She turns around and fires several stilettos from uploaded holsters in her sleeves. Cuts to quick shot of the stilettos before one of Katara still fending off Ty Lee, her back to the camera. Sokka steps on-screen and knocks the stilettos off-target with his machete and boomerang.
He throws his boomerang in Mai's direction, however, the knife thrower merely leaps off her lizard, avoiding the attack. She spins around and fires stilettos from a holster in her leg. Sokka knocks them away again with his machete. Cuts to shot of Mai, who runs forward. Cuts to view of Katara, Sokka seen in the background. Katara turns around and is forced on the run when Mai comes charging toward her. Cuts to shot of Ty Lee, who runs toward the camera. She somersaults and leaps into the air where she flips and lands on the ground near Sokka.
She lands several quick blows on Sokka, using chi blocking to incapacitate Sokka's right arm. Sokka drops his boomerang as a result of this. He swings his left arm toward Ty Lee who merely incapacitates that arm, resulting in him dropping his machete. Sokka looks about him nervously and resorts to kicking his leg in order to fend off the acrobat who proceeds to render his leg useless. Sokka proceeds to use his forehead as a shield. Ty Lee strikes his skull and injures her hand in the process. She backs away and shakes her fist in pain before turning to glare at Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Well off-balance.] Good try, but no.
character_words: Good try, but no.

full_text: Cuts to shot of a tree growing near the riverbank. Katara appears on screen and halts in front of the tree. She begins to draw a stream of water with which to attack Mai, however, the knife thrower hurls two shuriken knives her way. Each of the two knives pins her wrists to the tree trunk. Katara gasps in horror. Cuts to side-view of the riverbank as the stream of water falls into the river again and Sokka hobbles on-screen as a result of the paralysis. He falls to the ground.
character_words: NA

full_text: How are you doing?
character_words: How are you doing?

full_text: [Frantically.] Well, you know ...
character_words: Well, you know ...

full_text: [Dryly.] I thought when Ty Lee and I finally caught you guys, it would be more exciting. Oh well, victory is boring.
character_words: I thought when Ty Lee and I finally caught you guys, it would be more exciting. Oh well, victory is boring.

full_text: The two are suddenly swept off their feet by a powerful gust of wind conjured by Appa's tail. They incidentally somersault into the air and land several yards away in the water. Cuts to shot of riverbank, Appa shaking his tail, his back facing the camera.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Still lying on the ground.] Thanks Appa, I don't know what we'd do without you.
character_words: Thanks Appa, I don't know what we'd do without you.

full_text: Appa sweeps his large tongue over Sokka's face, covering him in drool. Sokka expresses irritation at this, his eyebrow twitching. Cuts to overhead shot of the forest behind the river and pans downward to the opposite side of the riverbank where Mai and Ty Lee arrive at its edge, drenched.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Wringing out her braid.] Was it just me, or was that guy kind of cute?
character_words: Was it just me, or was that guy kind of cute?

full_text: Mai casts an annoyed glance off to the side. The scene changes to Tu Zin where Aang still sits cross-legged, awaiting his enemy. Cuts to close-up of his face before a shot of him looking out over the horizon where Azula appears, riding on her mongoose lizard in a cloud of dust. Cuts to a side-view shot of her as she closes in on the town. Cuts to faraway shot of Aang sitting at the end of the village. Azula appears on-screen. Cuts to shot of the ground, covered in fur, where Azula's feet land as she dismounts. Cuts to overhead shot of the town.
character_words: NA

full_text: All right, you've caught up with me. Now, who are you and what do you want?
character_words: All right, you've caught up with me. Now, who are you and what do you want?

full_text: [Coolly.] You mean you haven't guessed? You don't see the family resemblance? Here's a hint. [Covers her eye and deepens her voice, imitating Zuko.] I must find the Avatar to restore my honor! [Aang remains silent; back in her normal voice.] It's okay, you can laugh. It's funny.
character_words: You mean you haven't guessed? You don't see the family resemblance? Here's a hint.  I must find the Avatar to restore my honor!  It's okay, you can laugh. It's funny.

full_text: So what now?
character_words: So what now?

full_text: [Cuts to view of her left side.] Now? Now, it's over. You're tired and you have no place to go. [Cuts to view of her face.] You can run, but I'll catch you.
character_words: Now? Now, it's over. You're tired and you have no place to go.  You can run, but I'll catch you.

full_text: [Rises to face her.] I'm not running.
character_words: I'm not running.

full_text: Cuts to close-up of Azula, who smirks. Cuts to shot of the sun setting over the mountains. The camera pans downward to show Toph and Iroh sitting in a rocky outcrop. Cuts to shot of a tea kettle heating over a fire. Iroh can be seen in the background, sitting next to it. He pours tea into two tin cups.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Handing her a cup of tea.] Here is your tea. [Cuts to shot of Toph staring blankly at the ground and back to Iroh.] You seem a little too young to be traveling alone.
character_words: Here is your tea.  You seem a little too young to be traveling alone.

full_text: [Taking the tea from his hand.] You seem a little too old.
character_words: You seem a little too old.

full_text: [Laughs.] Perhaps I am.
character_words: Perhaps I am.

full_text: [Casually.] I know what you're thinking ... I look like I can't handle being by myself.
character_words: I know what you're thinking ... I look like I can't handle being by myself.

full_text: I wasn't thinking that.
character_words: I wasn't thinking that.

full_text: You wouldn't even let me pour my own cup of tea!
character_words: You wouldn't even let me pour my own cup of tea!

full_text: I poured your tea because I wanted to and for no other reason.
character_words: I poured your tea because I wanted to and for no other reason.

full_text: People see me and think I'm weak. They want to take care of me, but I can take care of myself, by myself.
character_words: People see me and think I'm weak. They want to take care of me, but I can take care of myself, by myself.

full_text: You sound like my nephew, always thinking you need to do things on your own, without anyone's support. There is nothing wrong with letting the people who love you help you. Not that I love you, I just met you.
character_words: You sound like my nephew, always thinking you need to do things on your own, without anyone's support. There is nothing wrong with letting the people who love you help you. Not that I love you, I just met you.

full_text: [Laughs.] So where is your nephew?
character_words: So where is your nephew?

full_text: I've been tracking him actually.
character_words: I've been tracking him actually.

full_text: Is he lost?
character_words: Is he lost?

full_text: [Looks away; slightly sad.] Yes, a little bit. [Cuts to shot of the rocky ledge where the two sit, the mountain region in the background; voice-over.] His life has recently changed and he's going through very difficult times. He's trying to figure out who he is and he went away.
character_words: Yes, a little bit.  His life has recently changed and he's going through very difficult times. He's trying to figure out who he is and he went away.

full_text: So now you're following him.
character_words: So now you're following him.

full_text: I know he doesn't want me around him right now, but if he needs me, I'll be there.
character_words: I know he doesn't want me around him right now, but if he needs me, I'll be there.

full_text: Your nephew is very lucky, even if he doesn't know it. [Gets up to leave.] Thank you.
character_words: Your nephew is very lucky, even if he doesn't know it.  Thank you.

full_text: My pleasure. Sharing tea with a fascinating stranger is one of life's true delights.
character_words: My pleasure. Sharing tea with a fascinating stranger is one of life's true delights.

full_text: [Happily.] No, thank you for what you said. It helped me.
character_words: No, thank you for what you said. It helped me.

full_text: I'm glad.
character_words: I'm glad.

full_text: [Rises to leave, but turns around briefly.] Oh, and about your nephew, maybe you should tell him that you need him, too.
character_words: Oh, and about your nephew, maybe you should tell him that you need him, too.

full_text: Iroh remains silent and sips his tea. The scene changes back to Tu Zin, the camera panning down to depict the town, Azula standing on the opposite side of town as Aang. Cuts briefly to Aang and to Azula who smiles smugly.
character_words: NA

full_text: Do you really want to fight me?
character_words: Do you really want to fight me?

full_text: Zuko suddenly appears from an alleyway, leaping off his ostrich horse onto the ground, creating a cloud of dust. He stands up straight and throws his conical hat aside.
character_words: NA

full_text: Yes, I really do.
character_words: Yes, I really do.

full_text: [Alarmed.] Zuko!
character_words: Zuko!

full_text: [Calmly.] I was wondering when you'd show up, Zuzu.
character_words: I was wondering when you'd show up, Zuzu.

full_text: [Covers mouth to suppress laughter.] "Zuzu"?
character_words: "Zuzu"?

full_text: [Determined.] Back off, Azula! He's mine!
character_words: Back off, Azula! He's mine!

full_text: [Assumes a fighting stance.] I'm not going anywhere.
character_words: I'm not going anywhere.

full_text:
Cuts to overhead shot of the street way where the three opponents stand, prepared for battle. Cuts to shot of Azula, confident as ever. Cuts to shot of Zuko, who averts his gaze first to Azula before looking toward Aang. Cuts to Aang who assumes a fighting stance, pointing his glider at Zuko in fright. Cuts to shot of the three from the perspective of the front porch of a store, the camera panning to the left from Aang to Azula. Cuts to shot of Zuko, who shifts the position of his fingers a bit. Cuts to Aang, who looks about him nervously. Cuts to Azula, who continues to smirk in confidence. Cuts to close-up of Zuko, a shot of Aang, before switching back to Zuko. Cuts to close-up of Azula, whose smile widens. Cuts to brief shot of Zuko.
Cuts to Azula, who moves her arm forward, firing a blast of blue fire at Zuko, who conjures up a fire shield to deflect it. He falls backward onto a front porch. Aang, upon seeing this, expresses horror and attempts to flee the town on his glider. He begins soaring toward the back end of Tu Zin. Cuts to Azula, who swings her arm downward, sending a stream of fire at Aang, who turns over mid-air and closes his glider, twirling the object to deflect the flames. Cuts to side-view of the town as he lands on the ground, still deflecting the flames. He stops twirling his glider.
Cuts to shot of Azula running along the beam of a rooftop, prepared to strike him. Cuts to ground level shot of Aang who rolls over, grabbing hold of his glider just as Azula lands nimbly on the ground, sweeping around, sending a stream of fire his way. Cuts to shot of the street where Azula rises and turns around, Zuko seen standing in the background. Aang leaps on-screen and lands on the ground, in between the other two. Zuko fires a blast at Aang who steps to the side, managing to avoid the attack. Azula fires at the Avatar and misses.
After the three perform several unsuccessful attempts to land a blow, Aang runs past Azula, who sends another sweep of fire his way. Cut to slanted shot of three, Aang trying to escape toward the back end of town, Azula turning to face him and Zuko firing blasts of his own. Aang rounds a bend and runs past Azula once more, this time heading toward the front of town. Azula fires another blast at him, only to miss. Azula fires several more blows, one of which Zuko manages to deflect. He fires a shot at Azula and misses.
Cuts to shot of Azula, who swings her arms about, sending attacks at her opponents. Cuts to overhead shot of the town, the three of them continuing to battle each other. Cuts to shot of Azula, Zuko appearing on-screen, leaping into the air directly behind her and striking the ground, unleashing a firebending attack in the process. Cuts to side-view of the two siblings as two walls of fire, one blue and one orange are created as a result of the impact. Azula fires a blast at Zuko, who ducks and attempts to knock her off her feet. He fires a blast her only for the princess to duck. She sweeps her arm upward, sending a stream of fire his way. Zuko leaps into the air to avoid the attack. Azula turns around and fires at Aang. Cuts to shot of the Avatar, who leaps into the air and lands onto an upper outdoors level of a nearby building.
Azula runs up the stairwell leading to the upper level, forcing Aang to run through the open doorway. Cuts to shot of the inside of the doorway; Azula appears on-screen and her expression suddenly grows alarmed. She halts in her tracks and nearly stumbles. Cuts to view of the entire inside of the building, revealing that there is no floor, merely some jagged wooden paneling lining the edges of the wall. She windmills in an attempt to steady herself. Cuts to Aang perched atop an air ball, smiling gleefully and waving to her. After leaping about a few times, Azula manages to prop herself against the wall and regains her balance. Zuko suddenly appears in the doorway. He has the misfortune of inaccurate timing and falls roughly onto the first level floor with a yell, sending up a cloud of dust. Aang grimaces in sympathy.
The air ball Aang is riding suddenly begins to dissipates. Cuts to Azula, who nimbly sends a blast of fire at him. Cuts back to Aang, who leaps out of the way just as the air ball is terminated. He runs along the edges along the thin floor paneling and knocks Azula onto the first floor in the process. Azula lands nimbly onto the ground near Zuko, who is still recovering from his fall. Cuts to the outside of the building as Aang exits through the doorway, narrowly avoiding a blue fire blast sent by Azula off-screen.
He lands onto the ground just as Azula bursts through the wall of the building through the use of firebending. Zuko lands on the ground unconscious. Cuts to shot of Aang, who looks at Zuko before turning around and seeing Azula heading straight toward him. He flees and leaps out of the way just as Azula sends another blast at him. Aang begins alternately jumping between two buildings, with Azula firing blasts off-screen at each spot he lands on. Aang finally reaches the rooftop of the left building and scrambles to prop himself up.
Azula sends a blast of fire, slicing a portion of the rooftop off. Aang leaps off the crumbling portion onto another spot on the roof, only for Azula to repeat the same action. Cuts to shot Aang, who scrambles to prop himself up only for the ceiling to cave in. He lands on the ground inside the building, trapped beneath a pile of wooden planks. Azula enters the building through the doorway and sends two streams of fire along the sides of the wall. The blue fire spreads around the perimeter of the room and turns an orange hue. Cuts to Aang, who looks horrified and attempts to break free.
Cuts to Azula, who smirks and holds up one hand, two fingers pointing outward, her typical lightning generation pose. Katara suddenly appears in the doorway and sends a water whip at Azula, guiding her hand off course. Katara bends the stream of water around her and slices the wooden planks, thus freeing Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Thrilled.] Katara!
character_words: Katara!

full_text: Azula swiftly turns around and fires a blast at the waterbender, who races out of the building along the porch. Azula follows her in hot pursuit, only to be halted by Sokka, who emerges from another doorway and swings his machete her way. Katara runs off-camera, while Azula is forced to duck. Sokka begins chasing her. Cuts to overhead shot of the town where Azula is now being cornered by him, Katara and Aang. Cuts to shot of Zuko still lying on the ground as he regains consciousness. Cuts to shot of Iroh standing over him from his perspective, the shot slightly blurred to show the effect of being knocked out.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Slightly dazed.] Uncle ...
character_words: Uncle ...

full_text: Get up!
character_words: Get up!

full_text: He helps Zuko get up. Cuts to shot of Aang as he runs straight toward Azula, his back facing the camera. He leaps over her just as Azula fires a blast at him which heads directly toward the camera. She turns around and blocks a water whip Katara sends at her. She fires a blast at Sokka and swings her arm outward to prolong the blast. Aang appears on-screen behind her. She turns around and nearly manages to strike him with another blast. Cuts to overhead shot of the three Team Avatar members and Azula, who swings her arm outward, sending an arched fire blast at the three. Cuts to shot of Azula who stands, poised for attack. Camera pans downward to her feet. She suddenly falls over to the side; Toph appears from an alleyway, having just shifted the ground beneath her feet.
character_words: NA

full_text: I thought you guys could use a little help.
character_words: I thought you guys could use a little help.

full_text: [Happily.] Thanks.
character_words: Thanks.

full_text: Azula rises to her feet and begins running away. Cuts to shot from the view of an alleyway, where Azula appears on-screen and runs through the alley. She leaps over some crates and tries to escape, however, Iroh intervenes, using his rotund belly to knock her off her feet. Zuko appears on-screen next to him. Cuts to overhead shot of Aang, Katara, Sokka, Toph, Zuko and Iroh all cornering Azula against the ruins of a stone wall.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Coolly, backing up as her enemies surround her.] Well, look at this. Enemies and traitors, all working together. I'm done. [Raises her hands in surrender.] I know when I'm beaten. You got me. A princess surrenders with honor.
character_words: Well, look at this. Enemies and traitors, all working together. I'm done.  I know when I'm beaten. You got me. A princess surrenders with honor.

full_text: Cuts to shot of Iroh, who averts his gaze toward the other members, who remain on high alert. The camera switches to his point of view, zooming in on Toph and shifting upward to Aang, Katara and Sokka, who still assume fighting stances. Cuts briefly to Azula, who smirks, before switching to Toph from Iroh's point of view. Cuts to Azula, who smiles and takes a step forward, firing a blast at Iroh, who gets hit. He screams in pain and falls to the ground.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Horrified.] Aaaah!
character_words: Aaaah!

full_text: The remaining five turn to face Azula, four of them bending their respective elements and Sokka throwing his boomerang straight for her. The impact of the elements creates a minor explosion, sending a thick cloud of smoke everywhere. Cuts to buildings in the town now set alight, burning embers falling from the sky. Cuts to shot of Aang as the smoke clears, who looks from his defensive position at the effect. Cuts overhead shot of the group surrounding the corner, the smoke clearing to reveal Azula having vanished from the scene without a trace. Cuts to Zuko, who kneels before his uncle, dismayed at the turn of events.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Angrily.] Ugggh! [Looks at Team Avatar.] Get away from us!
character_words: Ugggh!  Get away from us!

full_text: Cuts to Toph, the camera shifting to her foot, showing that she can detect the vibrations using seismic sense. Cuts to Iroh, who is still breathing, indicating that he is still alive. Katara approaches Zuko.
character_words: NA

full_text: Zuko, I can help.
character_words: Zuko, I can help.

full_text: [Blasts an arc of fire.] Leave!
character_words: Leave!

full_text: The members of Team Avatar all run away off-screen, leaving Zuko still kneeling over Iroh. The camera pans upward to show thick smoke billowing from the fire. The scene fades to a mountain at nightfall where Appa lands. Cuts to shot of Team Avatar sleeping on the saddle. Camera zooms in on Toph and Katara resting next to each other.
character_words: NA

full_text: Fades to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text: The episode opens in a mountainous terrain at sunrise as it pans down and to the right. All of Team Avatar is sleeping. Cut to Aang rising and jumping up with airbending, barefoot, and filled with excitement.
character_words: NA

full_text: Today's the day! [Lands near a sleeping Sokka.] Can you believe it? After all that time searching for a teacher, I'm finally starting earthbending! [Momo chitters and lands on Sokka.] And this place, [Momo moves on to Appa's head.] it's perfect, don't you think? Sokka? [Sokka grumbles and glares at Aang with tired eyes.] Oh, you're still sleeping, huh? [Sokka again grumbles and puts his head back down. Aang whispers.] Sorry.
character_words: Today's the day!  Can you believe it? After all that time searching for a teacher, I'm finally starting earthbending!  And this place,  it's perfect, don't you think? Sokka?  Oh, you're still sleeping, huh?  Sorry.

full_text: The ground shakes, causing Aang to turn to look toward the source of the rumbling. The camera quickly pans to the left to an earth tent, the slabs of which are tossed in every direction mere moments after. As the dust clears, Toph is standing in the middle with her left hand raised in the air.
character_words: NA

full_text: Goooood morning, [She puts both her hands on her hips.] earthbending student!
character_words: Goooood morning,  earthbending student!

full_text: Cut to the side-shot of Appa, with Momo on his head, Sokka, still sleeping and curled up within his sleeping bag with Aang standing at his feet, and Katara, who is sitting upright in her own sleeping bag. Toph walks over to them.
character_words: NA

full_text: Good morning, Sifu Toph.
character_words: Good morning, Sifu Toph.

full_text: [Aang bows slightly to Toph; disappointed and tiredly.] Hey, you never called me Sifu Katara.
character_words: Hey, you never called me Sifu Katara.

full_text: [Scratches the back of his head.] Well, if you think I should ...
character_words: Well, if you think I should ...

full_text: Sokka suddenly sits up, grumbling at Aang. Cut to a closer shot of Aang, who looks down in wonder, and Toph, who has a smile on her face.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sorry, Snoozles, we'll do our earthbending as [Whispers slightly, though with amusement in her voice.] quietly as we can.
character_words: Sorry, Snoozles, we'll do our earthbending as  quietly as we can.

full_text:
Cut to a close-up of Toph's feet as she slams her left heel into the ground, creating a crack. Cut to a side-shot of Sokka, who had laid himself back down. An earth pillar rises up right underneath him, catapulting him screaming into the air. Cut to an aerial shot of the team's camping spot as Sokka flies directly toward the camera. After he has flown so close to the camera that the shot was nothing more than a close-up of this uvula, the scene cuts back to ground level of the campsite, where Katara is standing up and joins Toph and Aang in looking toward the sky. Sokka crashes to the ground in their middle with a loud thud. He immediately jumps to his feet, still in his sleeping bag with only his head visible, and hops toward Aang while grumbling. He stops in front of the Avatar and grumbles to his face, before jumping toward Toph and doing the same to her. He subsequently hops toward the camera and out of the shot, still grumbling angrily. Everyone else turns to watch him go.
Cut to Toph staring after Sokka with her hands to her sides. Aang had jumped up and now softly lands beside her.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Excitedly.] So what move are you going to teach me first? [Stretches out his right arm, his fist clenched, and brings it down like a hammer.] Rock-a-lanche? [He brings his left clenched fist to his right elbow, while his right arm is bent upward, the fist also clenched. He trembles with the motion.] The Trembler? Oh, maybe I could learn to make a [Stretches both arms over his head and starts to spin around.] whirlpool out of land!
character_words: So what move are you going to teach me first?  Rock-a-lanche?  The Trembler? Oh, maybe I could learn to make a  whirlpool out of land!

full_text: [Puts a hand on Aang's chest.] Let's start with ... [Makes the gesture.] move a rock.
character_words: Let's start with ...  move a rock.

full_text: [Claps excitedly.] Sounds good, sounds good!
character_words: Sounds good, sounds good!

full_text: Cuts to another part of the canyon where Toph and Aang are standing in front of two rocks as Katara watches.
character_words: NA

full_text: The key to earthbending is your stance. You've got to be steady and strong. Rock is a stubborn element. If you're going to move it, you've got to be like a rock yourself.
character_words: The key to earthbending is your stance. You've got to be steady and strong. Rock is a stubborn element. If you're going to move it, you've got to be like a rock yourself.

full_text: Like a rock. Got it.
character_words: Like a rock. Got it.

full_text: Good. Now the actual motion of this one is pretty simple. [Slams the rock against the canyon wall.] Okay, you ready to give it a try?
character_words: Good. Now the actual motion of this one is pretty simple.  Okay, you ready to give it a try?

full_text: I'm ready. [Tries to move it, but instead he is forced backward into Appa.]
character_words: I'm ready.

full_text: [Amused.] Rock beats airbender!
character_words: Rock beats airbender!

full_text: Iroh has a flashback in a dream about Lu Ten. Lu Ten pretends to firebend at Iroh who fakes a groan and falls over.
character_words: NA

full_text: I got you, Dad! [Playfully jumps on top of Iroh.]
character_words: I got you, Dad!

full_text: Both laugh as the scene fades to Iroh in a dream sitting over Lu Ten's tomb.
character_words: NA

full_text: My beloved Lu Ten, I will see you again.
character_words: My beloved Lu Ten, I will see you again.

full_text: The scene fades again as Iroh wakes up to Zuko calling him.
character_words: NA

full_text: Uncle ... you were unconscious. Azula did this to you. It was a surprise attack.
character_words: Uncle ... you were unconscious. Azula did this to you. It was a surprise attack.

full_text: Somehow, that's not so surprising. [Groans.]
character_words: Somehow, that's not so surprising.

full_text: [Hands Iroh some tea.] I hope I made it the way you like it. [Iroh takes a sip from the cup and his eyes widen. He lets out a cry of disgust, but manages to mask it.]
character_words: I hope I made it the way you like it.

full_text: [Grimaces.] Good. That was very ... uhhh ... bracing. [He is handed another cup, which he throws out secretly behind his shoulder.]
character_words: Good. That was very ... uhhh ... bracing.

full_text: So Uncle, I've been thinking. It's only a matter of time before I run into Azula again. I'm going to need to know more advanced firebending if I want to stand a chance against her. I know what you're going to say: she's my sister and I should be trying to get along with her.
character_words: So Uncle, I've been thinking. It's only a matter of time before I run into Azula again. I'm going to need to know more advanced firebending if I want to stand a chance against her. I know what you're going to say: she's my sister and I should be trying to get along with her.

full_text: [With the exact opposite of Zuko's thoughts.] No, she's crazy, and she needs to go down. [Zuko nods. Iroh grunts as he stands up.] It's time to resume your training.
character_words: No, she's crazy, and she needs to go down.  It's time to resume your training.

full_text: Back at the canyon. Katara and Toph are standing next to the boulder Aang tried to move. Aang walks up, a hand behind his head.
character_words: NA

full_text: I don't understand what went wrong. He did it exactly the way you did.
character_words: I don't understand what went wrong. He did it exactly the way you did.

full_text: Maybe there's another way ... what if I came at the boulder from another angle?
character_words: Maybe there's another way ... what if I came at the boulder from another angle?

full_text: No. That's the problem. You've got to stop thinking like an airbender. There's no different angle, no clever solution, no trickety-trick that's going to move that rock. You've got to face it head on. And when I say head on, I mean like this ... [Jumps up and destroys the rock with her head.]
character_words: No. That's the problem. You've got to stop thinking like an airbender. There's no different angle, no clever solution, no trickety-trick that's going to move that rock. You've got to face it head on. And when I say head on, I mean like this ...

full_text: Whoa!
character_words: Whoa!

full_text: Toph begins to walk away, but Katara stops her.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Trying to help Toph teach.] I've been training Aang for a while now. He really responds well to a positive teaching experience. Lots of encouragement and praise. Kind words. If he's doing something wrong, maybe a gentle nudge in the right direction.
character_words: I've been training Aang for a while now. He really responds well to a positive teaching experience. Lots of encouragement and praise. Kind words. If he's doing something wrong, maybe a gentle nudge in the right direction.

full_text: Thanks, Katara. A gentle nudge. I'll try that. [Moments later; yelling at the top of her lungs.] Keep your knees high, Twinkle Toes!
character_words: Thanks, Katara. A gentle nudge. I'll try that.  Keep your knees high, Twinkle Toes!

full_text:
Cut to Aang carrying a large rock on his back, struggling to hold it up. The camera zooms out, showing Toph in the background stomping down and causing pillars of rock to rise underneath Aang's feet as he walks. Aang loses his balance and falls off-screen.
The next move shows Toph digging through rock with her fingers. The camera pans over and Aang rubs his hands together and tries to do the same thing, but smashes his hand against the rock and grunts in pain.
character_words: NA

full_text: Rock-like!
character_words: Rock-like!

full_text:
Next, Toph gives Aang one of Sokka's weapons, much to Sokka's dismay. Cut to Sokka's face with Toph's hand holding him back. He grunts, trying to move forward. Cut to a side-view, showing Sokka struggling to get his club back from Toph, who is holding it to the side and preventing Sokka from grabbing it. She shoves him backward and he stalks offscreen. She hands the weapon to Aang. He is blindfolded as he tries to smash rocks Toph brings up. He finally gets one after about five times. Cut to Toph, who nods in approval.
During their next session, Toph builds herself into a shield of rock which Aang has to push back over a marked boundary. He is successful. His training begins to move smoothly.
During another training session Aang is standing on two pillars of earth tossing a rock into the air while switching hands to catch it each time. Toph walks between the two pillars of earth and uses earthbending to shake the pillars.
character_words: NA

full_text: Rock-like!
character_words: Rock-like!

full_text:
The camera pans up to reveal Aang holding a solid stance without losing his balance. Toph appears on a pillar near him and nods. Aang smiles, knowing he is finally getting the hang of it.
In another part of the canyon, Sokka is looking for food when he stumbles upon an animal.
character_words: NA

full_text: You're awfully cute, but unfortunately you're made of meat. Just a bit closer ... [Jumps but falls into a crack that is in the ground. He looks at the cub.] Gotcha! [Sinks further in.] You are one lucky little meat creature.
character_words: You're awfully cute, but unfortunately you're made of meat. Just a bit closer ...  Gotcha!  You are one lucky little meat creature.

full_text: Back at Iroh and Zuko's setup.
character_words: NA

full_text: Lightning is a pure form of firebending, without aggression. It is not fueled by rage or emotion the way other firebending is. Some call lightning the cold-blooded fire. It is precise and deadly, like Azula. To perform the technique requires peace of mind.
character_words: Lightning is a pure form of firebending, without aggression. It is not fueled by rage or emotion the way other firebending is. Some call lightning the cold-blooded fire. It is precise and deadly, like Azula. To perform the technique requires peace of mind.

full_text: I see. That's why we're drinking tea, to calm the mind.
character_words: I see. That's why we're drinking tea, to calm the mind.

full_text: Oh yeah, good point! I mean, yes. [Outside.] There is energy all around us. The energy is both yin and yang. Positive energy and negative energy. Only a select few firebenders can separate these energies. This creates an imbalance. The energy wants to restore balance, and in a moment the positive and negative energy come crashing back together, you provide release and guidance, creating lightning. [Steps up, and generates lightning, and shoots it away from the two.]
character_words: Oh yeah, good point! I mean, yes.  There is energy all around us. The energy is both yin and yang. Positive energy and negative energy. Only a select few firebenders can separate these energies. This creates an imbalance. The energy wants to restore balance, and in a moment the positive and negative energy come crashing back together, you provide release and guidance, creating lightning.

full_text: I'm ready to try it!
character_words: I'm ready to try it!

full_text: Remember, once you separate the energy, you do not command it. You are simply its humble guide. Breathe first.
character_words: Remember, once you separate the energy, you do not command it. You are simply its humble guide. Breathe first.

full_text:
Zuko takes a deep breath. He tries to generate lightning, but instead an explosion launches him back. Iroh shakes his head in disappointment. 
Back at the canyon, Aang's earthbending training continues.
character_words: NA

full_text: This time we're going to try something a little different. Instead of moving a rock, you're going to stop a rock. Get in your horse stance! I'm going to roll that boulder down at you. If you have the attitude of an earthbender, you'll stay in your stance and stop the rock. Like this! [Stretches out, still in stance.]
character_words: This time we're going to try something a little different. Instead of moving a rock, you're going to stop a rock. Get in your horse stance! I'm going to roll that boulder down at you. If you have the attitude of an earthbender, you'll stay in your stance and stop the rock. Like this!

full_text: Sorry Toph, but are you really sure this is the way to teach Aang earthbending?
character_words: Sorry Toph, but are you really sure this is the way to teach Aang earthbending?

full_text: I'm glad you said something. Actually there is a better way. [Blindfolds Aang.] This way, you'll actually have to sense the vibrations of the boulder to stop it. Thank you, Katara.
character_words: I'm glad you said something. Actually there is a better way.  This way, you'll actually have to sense the vibrations of the boulder to stop it. Thank you, Katara.

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, thanks, Katara!
character_words: Yeah, thanks, Katara!

full_text: [Nervously.] Heh.
character_words: Heh.

full_text: Cut to Toph standing at the top of the hill with Aang at the bottom. She shoves the rock forward and it begins to roll down the slope. Aang looks worried and afraid as it rolls toward him. He jumps over the boulder at the last second, causing it to roll past and crash into the cliff. Toph comes running toward Aang.
character_words: NA

full_text: I guess I just panicked. I don't know what to say.
character_words: I guess I just panicked. I don't know what to say.

full_text: There's nothing to say, you blew it! You had a perfect stance, and a perfect form. But when it came right down to it, you didn't have the guts!
character_words: There's nothing to say, you blew it! You had a perfect stance, and a perfect form. But when it came right down to it, you didn't have the guts!

full_text: [Disappointed.] I know. I'm sorry.
character_words: I know. I'm sorry.

full_text: Yeah, you are sorry! If you're not tough enough to stop the rock, then you can at least give it the pleasure of smashing you instead of jumping out of the way like a jelly-boned wimp! Now, do you have what it takes to face that rock like an earthbender?
character_words: Yeah, you are sorry! If you're not tough enough to stop the rock, then you can at least give it the pleasure of smashing you instead of jumping out of the way like a jelly-boned wimp! Now, do you have what it takes to face that rock like an earthbender?

full_text: No, I don't think I do.
character_words: No, I don't think I do.

full_text: Aang, it's no big deal. You'll take a break and try earthbending again when you're ready. Besides, you still have a lot of waterbending to work on. Okay?
character_words: Aang, it's no big deal. You'll take a break and try earthbending again when you're ready. Besides, you still have a lot of waterbending to work on. Okay?

full_text: Yeah, that sounds good.
character_words: Yeah, that sounds good.

full_text: Yeah, whatever, go splash around until you feel better.
character_words: Yeah, whatever, go splash around until you feel better.

full_text: They all exit.
character_words: NA

full_text: Back to Zuko and Iroh. Another attempt by Zuko to generate lightning fails.
character_words: NA

full_text: Why can't I do it? Instead of lightning it keeps exploding in my face ... like everything always does.
character_words: Why can't I do it? Instead of lightning it keeps exploding in my face ... like everything always does.

full_text: I was afraid this might happen. You will not be able to master lightning until you have dealt with the turmoil inside you.
character_words: I was afraid this might happen. You will not be able to master lightning until you have dealt with the turmoil inside you.

full_text: What turmoil?
character_words: What turmoil?

full_text: Zuko, you must let go of your feelings of shame if you want your anger to go away.
character_words: Zuko, you must let go of your feelings of shame if you want your anger to go away.

full_text: But I don't feel any shame at all. I'm as proud as ever.
character_words: But I don't feel any shame at all. I'm as proud as ever.

full_text: Prince Zuko, pride is not the opposite of shame, but its source. True humility is the only antidote to shame.
character_words: Prince Zuko, pride is not the opposite of shame, but its source. True humility is the only antidote to shame.

full_text: Well, my life has been nothing but humbling lately.
character_words: Well, my life has been nothing but humbling lately.

full_text: I have another idea. I will teach you a firebending move that even Azula doesn't know, because I made it up myself. [Zuko smiles.]
character_words: I have another idea. I will teach you a firebending move that even Azula doesn't know, because I made it up myself.

full_text: Back to Sokka, who remains trapped with the small, brown animal.
character_words: NA

full_text: You probably think I deserve this, don't you? Look, I'm sorry I hunted you, but that's just the natural order of things. Big things eat smaller things, nothing personal. But this time it didn't work out that way. I admit it ... you're cute. Okay, you convinced me, if I get out of this alive, it's a karmically correct, vegetarian existence for me. No meat. Even though meat is so tasty. [The cub brings an apple.] Hey, looks like my karma is already paying off! That's okay, I got it. [Tosses his boomerang at it in a desperate attempt.] Now, come back boomerang.
character_words: You probably think I deserve this, don't you? Look, I'm sorry I hunted you, but that's just the natural order of things. Big things eat smaller things, nothing personal. But this time it didn't work out that way. I admit it ... you're cute. Okay, you convinced me, if I get out of this alive, it's a karmically correct, vegetarian existence for me. No meat. Even though meat is so tasty.  Hey, looks like my karma is already paying off! That's okay, I got it.  Now, come back boomerang.

full_text: In a pond in another part of the canyon. Momo tries to grab a frog. Aang and Katara move a single blob of water back and forth among each other in a circular motion.
character_words: NA

full_text: You know this block you're having is only temporary, right?
character_words: You know this block you're having is only temporary, right?

full_text: I don't want to talk about it.
character_words: I don't want to talk about it.

full_text: You do realize that's the problem, don't you? If you face this issue instead of avoiding it–
character_words: You do realize that's the problem, don't you? If you face this issue instead of avoiding it–

full_text: [Frustrated at himself.] I know, I know, I know, I know! I get it, all right? I need to face it head on like a rock, but I just can't do it. I don't know why I can't, but I can't.
character_words: I know, I know, I know, I know! I get it, all right? I need to face it head on like a rock, but I just can't do it. I don't know why I can't, but I can't.

full_text: Aang, if fire and water are opposites, then what's the opposite of air?
character_words: Aang, if fire and water are opposites, then what's the opposite of air?

full_text: I guess it's earth.
character_words: I guess it's earth.

full_text: That's why it's so difficult for you to get this. You're working with your natural opposite. But you'll figure it out. I know you will. Think fast! [Throws a piece of grass at him, but Aang stops it with waterbending.] Excellent. You have the reflexes of a waterbending master.
character_words: That's why it's so difficult for you to get this. You're working with your natural opposite. But you'll figure it out. I know you will. Think fast!  Excellent. You have the reflexes of a waterbending master.

full_text: Thanks, Katara. Sifu Katara. [Bows.]
character_words: Thanks, Katara. Sifu Katara.

full_text: Katara also bows at Aang. Back to Zuko and Iroh.
character_words: NA

full_text: Fire is the element of power. [Draws the firebending insignia in the dirt.] The people of the Fire Nation have desire and will, and the energy to drive and achieve what they want. Earth is the element of substance. [Draws the earthbending insignia.] The people of the Earth Kingdom are diverse and strong. They are persistent and enduring. Air is the element of freedom. [Draws the airbending insignia.] The Air Nomads detached themselves from worldly concerns and found peace and freedom. Also, they apparently had pretty good senses of humor! Water is the element of change. [Draws the waterbending insignia.] The people of the Water Tribe are capable of adapting to many things. They have a deep sense of community and love that holds them together through anything.
character_words: Fire is the element of power.  The people of the Fire Nation have desire and will, and the energy to drive and achieve what they want. Earth is the element of substance.  The people of the Earth Kingdom are diverse and strong. They are persistent and enduring. Air is the element of freedom.  The Air Nomads detached themselves from worldly concerns and found peace and freedom. Also, they apparently had pretty good senses of humor! Water is the element of change.  The people of the Water Tribe are capable of adapting to many things. They have a deep sense of community and love that holds them together through anything.

full_text: Why are you telling me these things?
character_words: Why are you telling me these things?

full_text: It is important to draw wisdom from many different places. If you take it from only one place, it becomes rigid and stale. [Divides the four insignias into separate sections.] Understanding others, the other elements, and the other nations will help you become whole. [Draws a circle around the insignias.]
character_words: It is important to draw wisdom from many different places. If you take it from only one place, it becomes rigid and stale.  Understanding others, the other elements, and the other nations will help you become whole.

full_text: All this four elements talk is sounding like Avatar stuff.
character_words: All this four elements talk is sounding like Avatar stuff.

full_text: It is the combination of the four elements in one person that makes the Avatar so powerful. But it can make you more powerful, too. You see the technique I'm about to teach you is one I learned by studying the waterbenders.
character_words: It is the combination of the four elements in one person that makes the Avatar so powerful. But it can make you more powerful, too. You see the technique I'm about to teach you is one I learned by studying the waterbenders.

full_text: Back to the campsite. Aang is meditating when Toph enters, holding Aang's staff.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aang, I found these nuts in your bag. I figured you wouldn't mind. And besides, even if you did, you're too much of a pushover to do anything about it.
character_words: Aang, I found these nuts in your bag. I figured you wouldn't mind. And besides, even if you did, you're too much of a pushover to do anything about it.

full_text: As a matter of fact, I don't mind. I'm happy to share anything I have.
character_words: As a matter of fact, I don't mind. I'm happy to share anything I have.

full_text: You know, I'm really glad you feel that way. Because I also have this great new nutcracker.
character_words: You know, I'm really glad you feel that way. Because I also have this great new nutcracker.

full_text: She spins Aang's staff above her head. Cut to Aang, who looks over his shoulder with a pained expression on his face. Cut to Toph as she smiles widely, lifts the staff, and starts using it to break nutshells.
character_words: NA

full_text: Actually, I prefer if you didn't ... [Crack.] That's an antique, handcrafted by the monks ... [Crack.] It's a delicate instrument!
character_words: Actually, I prefer if you didn't ...  That's an antique, handcrafted by the monks ...  It's a delicate instrument!

full_text: It's not the only delicate instrument around here. [Walks away, hitting the staff off rocks.]
character_words: It's not the only delicate instrument around here.

full_text: [Resumes meditating.] Ohm.
character_words: Ohm.

full_text: Hey Aang, have you seen–
character_words: Hey Aang, have you seen–

full_text: [Frustrated.] Meditating here!
character_words: Meditating here!

full_text: It's important. It's almost sundown and Sokka isn't back yet. I think we should search for him.
character_words: It's important. It's almost sundown and Sokka isn't back yet. I think we should search for him.

full_text: We'll find him faster if we split up. [The two begin to search.]
character_words: We'll find him faster if we split up.

full_text: Back to Sokka.
character_words: NA

full_text: Okay, karma person or thing, whoever's in charge of this stuff. If I can just get out of this situation alive, I will give up meat and sarcasm. Okay? [Sokka's warrior's wolf tail gets yanked out of his hair by the cub.] Ow! That's all I got. It's pretty much my whole identity. Sokka, the meat and sarcasm guy. But I'm willing to be Sokka, the veggies and straight talk fellow. Deal? [Aang shows up.] Aang! Thank goodness! Have you got any meat?
character_words: Okay, karma person or thing, whoever's in charge of this stuff. If I can just get out of this situation alive, I will give up meat and sarcasm. Okay?  Ow! That's all I got. It's pretty much my whole identity. Sokka, the meat and sarcasm guy. But I'm willing to be Sokka, the veggies and straight talk fellow. Deal?  Aang! Thank goodness! Have you got any meat?

full_text: Sokka! Are you okay? [Tries to pull him out.]
character_words: Sokka! Are you okay?

full_text: Aggh, stop, stop! You're going to pull my fingers off and I don't think the rest of me is coming!
character_words: Aggh, stop, stop! You're going to pull my fingers off and I don't think the rest of me is coming!

full_text: Hmmm ... I bet I can airbend you out of here. [Blows up a gust of wind but Sokka remains trapped.]
character_words: Hmmm ... I bet I can airbend you out of here.

full_text: Seriously Aang, I know you're new at it, but I could use a little earthbending here. How about it?
character_words: Seriously Aang, I know you're new at it, but I could use a little earthbending here. How about it?

full_text: I can't ... I can't do it.
character_words: I can't ... I can't do it.

full_text: Well, if you can't earthbend me out of here, go get Toph.
character_words: Well, if you can't earthbend me out of here, go get Toph.

full_text: I can't do that either.
character_words: I can't do that either.

full_text: You can't? Why not?
character_words: You can't? Why not?

full_text: It would just be really ... uncomfortable.
character_words: It would just be really ... uncomfortable.

full_text: Uncomfortable? [Sarcastically.] Well, I wouldn't want you to feel uncomfortable ...
character_words: Uncomfortable?  Well, I wouldn't want you to feel uncomfortable ...

full_text: Thanks, Sokka. This whole earthbending thing really has me confused. There's so much pressure. Everyone expects me to get it right away. It puts me in a really awkward position.
character_words: Thanks, Sokka. This whole earthbending thing really has me confused. There's so much pressure. Everyone expects me to get it right away. It puts me in a really awkward position.

full_text: Awkward position, I think I know the feeling.
character_words: Awkward position, I think I know the feeling.

full_text: If I try, I fail. If I don't try, I'm never going to get it. I feel like I'm caught between a rock and a hard place.
character_words: If I try, I fail. If I don't try, I'm never going to get it. I feel like I'm caught between a rock and a hard place.

full_text: Hmmm ... how about that. Aang, this is my friend, Foo Foo Cuddlypoops. Foo Foo Cuddlypoops, Aang.
character_words: Hmmm ... how about that. Aang, this is my friend, Foo Foo Cuddlypoops. Foo Foo Cuddlypoops, Aang.

full_text: Awww, what a cute name for a baby saber-tooth moose-lion cub.
character_words: Awww, what a cute name for a baby saber-tooth moose-lion cub.

full_text: Really? He looks nothing like a saber-tooth moose-lion.
character_words: Really? He looks nothing like a saber-tooth moose-lion.

full_text: It's hard to tell before their giant teeth and horns grow in. What are you doing out here little guy? Did you lose your mama?
character_words: It's hard to tell before their giant teeth and horns grow in. What are you doing out here little guy? Did you lose your mama?

full_text: Suddenly, a large moose-lion appears.
character_words: NA

full_text: The scene cuts back to Zuko and Iroh.
character_words: NA

full_text: Waterbenders deal with the flow of energy. A waterbender lets their defense become their offense, turning their opponents' energy against them. I learned a way to do this with lightning.
character_words: Waterbenders deal with the flow of energy. A waterbender lets their defense become their offense, turning their opponents' energy against them. I learned a way to do this with lightning.

full_text: You can teach me to redirect lightning?
character_words: You can teach me to redirect lightning?

full_text: If you let the energy in your own body flow, the lightning will follow it. You must create a pathway from your fingertips, up your arm to your shoulder, then down into your stomach. The stomach is the source of energy in your body. It is called the sea of chi. Only in my case it is more like a vast ocean. [Laughs.] From the stomach, you direct it up again, and out the other arm. The stomach detour is critical. You must not let the lightning pass through your heart, or the damage could be deadly. You may wish to try a physical motion, to get a feel for the pathways' flow, like this. [The two begin to practice the redirection motion.] Now, are you focusing your energy? Can you feel your own chi flowing in, down, up, and out?
character_words: If you let the energy in your own body flow, the lightning will follow it. You must create a pathway from your fingertips, up your arm to your shoulder, then down into your stomach. The stomach is the source of energy in your body. It is called the sea of chi. Only in my case it is more like a vast ocean.  From the stomach, you direct it up again, and out the other arm. The stomach detour is critical. You must not let the lightning pass through your heart, or the damage could be deadly. You may wish to try a physical motion, to get a feel for the pathways' flow, like this.  Now, are you focusing your energy? Can you feel your own chi flowing in, down, up, and out?

full_text: I think so.
character_words: I think so.

full_text: Come on, you've got to feel the flow. [They practice the motion for a few minutes.] Excellent! You've got it!
character_words: Come on, you've got to feel the flow.  Excellent! You've got it!

full_text: Great, I'm ready to try it with real lightning!
character_words: Great, I'm ready to try it with real lightning!

full_text: What, are you crazy? Lightning is very dangerous!
character_words: What, are you crazy? Lightning is very dangerous!

full_text: I thought that was the point! You teaching me to protect myself from it!
character_words: I thought that was the point! You teaching me to protect myself from it!

full_text: Yeah! But I'm not going to shoot lightning at you! If you're lucky, you will never have to use this technique at all!
character_words: Yeah! But I'm not going to shoot lightning at you! If you're lucky, you will never have to use this technique at all!

full_text: Well, if you won't help me, I'll find my own lightning. [Rides away.]
character_words: Well, if you won't help me, I'll find my own lightning.

full_text: Back to the canyon, Aang begins to talk to the saber-tooth moose-lion mother.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey there, we found your cub! See, we have no problem with you! We're friendly!
character_words: Hey there, we found your cub! See, we have no problem with you! We're friendly!

full_text: Aang, this is bad, you've got to get me out of here!
character_words: Aang, this is bad, you've got to get me out of here!

full_text: The moose-lion charges at Sokka, but Aang sends it over his head with airbending.
character_words: NA

full_text: This is really bad! Please Aang, you have to earthbend me out, there's no other way!
character_words: This is really bad! Please Aang, you have to earthbend me out, there's no other way!

full_text: Aang tries, but all his attempts produce nothing.
character_words: NA

full_text: Oh no! [Gets on top of a rock to try and distract the saber-tooth moose-lion.] Woo-hoo, look at me!
character_words: Oh no!  Woo-hoo, look at me!

full_text: The moose-lion charges again but is again held off.
character_words: NA

full_text: Please, don't leave me again.
character_words: Please, don't leave me again.

full_text: I won't.
character_words: I won't.

full_text: He stands his ground, and at the last second, throws the moose-lion back with a blast of air. The beast leaves. Suddenly, slight clapping can be heard. Cut to shot of Toph sitting on a rock nearby.
character_words: NA

full_text: What are you doing here?
character_words: What are you doing here?

full_text: Just enjoying the show.
character_words: Just enjoying the show.

full_text: What? You were there the whole time?
character_words: What? You were there the whole time?

full_text: Pretty much.
character_words: Pretty much.

full_text: Why didn't you do something? Sokka was in trouble! I was in trouble! You could have gotten him out and helped us get away!
character_words: Why didn't you do something? Sokka was in trouble! I was in trouble! You could have gotten him out and helped us get away!

full_text: Guess it just didn't occur to me. [Throws a nut down and attempts to crack it with the staff.]
character_words: Guess it just didn't occur to me.

full_text: [Grabs hold of it.] Enough! I want my staff back! [Takes it away.]
character_words: Enough! I want my staff back!

full_text: Do it now!
character_words: Do it now!

full_text: What?
character_words: What?

full_text: Earthbend, Twinkle Toes. You just stood your ground against a crazy beast. And even more impressive, you stood your ground against me. You've got stuff.
character_words: Earthbend, Twinkle Toes. You just stood your ground against a crazy beast. And even more impressive, you stood your ground against me. You've got stuff.

full_text: But–
character_words: But–

full_text: Do it!
character_words: Do it!

full_text: Aang slams the ground and sends a rock into the canyon wall.
character_words: NA

full_text: You did it! You're an earthbender.
character_words: You did it! You're an earthbender.

full_text: I can't believe it!
character_words: I can't believe it!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Awww, this is a really wonderful, touching moment. So could you get me out of here so I can give you both a big, snuggly hug?
character_words: Awww, this is a really wonderful, touching moment. So could you get me out of here so I can give you both a big, snuggly hug?

full_text: No problem, Sokka!
character_words: No problem, Sokka!

full_text: Actually, you should probably let me do that. You're still a little new to this. You might accidentally crush him.
character_words: Actually, you should probably let me do that. You're still a little new to this. You might accidentally crush him.

full_text: Yeah, no crushing, please.
character_words: Yeah, no crushing, please.

full_text: Toph kicks up the rock and yanks him out. Nightfall hits. Katara meets up with them.
character_words: NA

full_text: You found him! [Embraces Sokka.]
character_words: You found him!

full_text: The whole time, I was in that hole, not knowing if I was going to live or die. It makes a man to think about what's really important. I realized–
character_words: The whole time, I was in that hole, not knowing if I was going to live or die. It makes a man to think about what's really important. I realized–

full_text: [Interrupting Sokka.] Hey Katara, look what I can do! [Bends a rock and slams it on the ground.]
character_words: Hey Katara, look what I can do!

full_text: You did it! I knew you would! [Whispering to Toph.] You tried the positive reinforcement, didn't you?
character_words: You did it! I knew you would!  You tried the positive reinforcement, didn't you?

full_text: [Happily.] Yep, it worked wonders.
character_words: Yep, it worked wonders.

full_text: Appa, Appa, I can earthbend now! The key is being completely rooted. Physically and mentally unmovable!
character_words: Appa, Appa, I can earthbend now! The key is being completely rooted. Physically and mentally unmovable!

full_text: Appa licks him and sends him flying a few feet. Sokka laughs hysterically, and Aang laughs as well. Meanwhile, Zuko has tracked down a storm, seeking lightning.
character_words: NA

full_text: You've always thrown everything you could at me! Well, I can take it, and now I can give it back! [Yelling as loud as he can at the storm.] Come on, strike me! You've never held back before!
character_words: You've always thrown everything you could at me! Well, I can take it, and now I can give it back!  Come on, strike me! You've never held back before!

full_text: No lightning strikes. Tears stream down Zuko's cheeks, and he yells at the top of his lungs.
character_words: NA

full_text: Fade to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text:
The episode begins with a view of the mountains. The camera pans down to show a back shot of Aang sitting in cross legged in a prairie on the ground looking over a vast open savanna landscape. The landscape is mostly barren save for small shoots of grass which bend in the breeze. A range of mountains can be seen in the distance. The ground in front of Aang is littered with holes.
Cut to a shot of the group from the front of Appa, Sokka, Toph, Katara, and Momo standing behind Aang. The Avatar is holding a thin wooden flute in both hands.
character_words: NA

full_text: What's out here?
character_words: What's out here?

full_text: Shot changes to show Appa, Sokka, Toph, Katara, and Momo standing behind Aang, who holds a flute.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Puts her hand on the ground.] A lot, actually. There's hundreds of little ...
character_words: A lot, actually. There's hundreds of little ...

full_text: [Turns around and silences Toph.] Shh! I know you can see underground, but don't ruin the surprise. Just watch. [Blows a note on the flute. A groundhog-type creature pops out of a hole in the ground and mimics the note.] Yeah! [Plays another note and another groundhog mimics it.] I'm putting an orchestra together.
character_words: Shh! I know you can see underground, but don't ruin the surprise. Just watch.  Yeah!  I'm putting an orchestra together.

full_text: [Makes hand motions while looking on with annoyance.] Orchestra, huh? Well, la-di-da.
character_words: Orchestra, huh? Well, la-di-da.

full_text: Three groundhogs pop out of the ground and sing descending notes. Momo jumps into a hole and comes out the middle one, trying to catch the groundhogs. The shot shows all of the holes in the ground. Aang plays four notes and Momo tries to catch the groundhogs that pop up. Aang plays another note as Sokka runs up to Aang and plugs the flute with his finger, causing nothing to play. As Aang's cheeks swell with air, the Avatar looks at Sokka with a sad expression.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Annoyed.] This is great and all, but don't we have more important things to worry about? We should be making plans.
character_words: This is great and all, but don't we have more important things to worry about? We should be making plans.

full_text: We did make plans. We're all picking mini-vacations.
character_words: We did make plans. We're all picking mini-vacations.

full_text: There's no time for vacations.
character_words: There's no time for vacations.

full_text: I'm learning the elements as fast as I can. I practice hard every day with Toph and Katara. I've been training my arrow off!
character_words: I'm learning the elements as fast as I can. I practice hard every day with Toph and Katara. I've been training my arrow off!

full_text: [Walks next to Aang.] Yeah, what's wrong with having a little fun in our down time?
character_words: Yeah, what's wrong with having a little fun in our down time?

full_text: Even if you do master all of the elements, then what? It's not like we have a map of the Fire Nation. [Gestures to the side, sarcastically.] Should we just head west until we reach the Fire Lord's house? [Knocking on an imaginary door.] Knock, knock. Hello, Fire Lord? Anybody home? I don't think so. We need some intelligence if we're going to win this war.
character_words: Even if you do master all of the elements, then what? It's not like we have a map of the Fire Nation.  Should we just head west until we reach the Fire Lord's house?  Knock, knock. Hello, Fire Lord? Anybody home? I don't think so. We need some intelligence if we're going to win this war.
