character_words: NA

full_text: [Moves his hand over to the shell, about to lift it.] Sorry, little lady, but- [Lifts up the shell and sees the rock, which shocks and confuses him.] Huh? [Stares closely at the rock.]
character_words: Sorry, little lady, but-  Huh?

full_text: I won! [She grabs the bag of money, and Sokka grabs his sword as they run off.]
character_words: I won!

full_text: Cut to Toph, Aang, and Sokka heading back to camp, laughing and carrying baskets full of goods. Katara is seen cooking something in a pot as they all drop their baskets onto the ground and Katara looks at the baskets with curiosity.
character_words: NA

full_text: Where did you guys get the money to buy all this stuff?
character_words: Where did you guys get the money to buy all this stuff?

full_text: Toph got us money. [Grabs an apple and takes a bite out of it as he sits down.] She scammed one of those guys in town who moves the shells around all sneaky-like. [He mimics the scam artist moving the shells with his hand. Katara's expression shows disapproval.]
character_words: Toph got us money.  She scammed one of those guys in town who moves the shells around all sneaky-like.

full_text: [Sits down too.] She used earthbending to win the game! Classic!
character_words: She used earthbending to win the game! Classic!

full_text: Ah, so she cheated.
character_words: Ah, so she cheated.

full_text: [Starts to bite her apple, but stops to defend herself.] Hey! I only cheated because he was cheating! [Smiles.] I cheated a cheater. [Closes her eyes in confidence.] What's wrong with that?
character_words: Hey! I only cheated because he was cheating!  I cheated a cheater.  What's wrong with that?

full_text: I'm just saying this isn't something we should make a habit of doing.
character_words: I'm just saying this isn't something we should make a habit of doing.

full_text: Why? Because it's fun? And you hate fun?
character_words: Why? Because it's fun? And you hate fun?

full_text: I don't hate fun! [Places Momo on her head like a hat while grinning unconvincingly.] See? Fun! [Momo slips off her head, screeches at her, and runs away.]
character_words: I don't hate fun!  See? Fun!

full_text: [Stands up.] Katara, [Slightly lifts his headband to reveal his airbender tattoo and bows.] I'll personally make you an Avatar Promise that we won't make a habit of doing these scams.
character_words: Katara,  I'll personally make you an Avatar Promise that we won't make a habit of doing these scams.

full_text:
The camera switches to the city, where Aang goes from bowing to doing tricks with the money in his hands and runs off. A few citizens are seen playing a dice like game. The two winners see Toph holding a bag of money and call her over. She tosses the two die. One lands on three, which is the highest number, and the other is about to go from three to zero. Cut to Toph, who twitches her head to the left slightly without any of the others seeing, causing the die to move back to the three, meaning she wins much to the winners' dismay and Sokka's and Aang's joy.
Cut to an area where a carnival is being hosted, where a big man tries a test-your-strength game, in which you need to use a hammer to launch a ball up to ring the bell, but can only make it about halfway. Toph jiggles a bag of money and walks over. Aang and Sokka watch from behind as she hands the man in charge of the game the money and places her hands on the hammer. She struggles to move it over her head and behind her, which makes all in the crowd snicker and laugh. Toph smiles again as she uses earthbending to launch the hammer's head from behind her to the lever with great force. The ball is launched so hard that it launches out of the game, destroying the top of it, which leaves everyone shocked. She casually grabs her winnings and leaves as the ball crashes into a tent behind, causing everyone to cringe at the sound, and looks back to see the damage.
The camera next cuts to a street where a carriage is being pulled by a dragon moose. Cut to a side-shot of the inside of the carriage where a noble opens his cup of tea to his delight and waves the aroma to his face. Toph emerges from a dark alley and creates a small rock right in front of one of the wheels to stop the cart. She falls back, pretending to have been hit. The noble peeks outside the carriage window and sees Toph. He jumps out of the carriage and starts to run, but is stopped by what looks like a Fire Nation guard, who is really Sokka in his Wang Fire costume. He notices Toph being "run over" and crosses his arms angrily at the noble, who gets on his knees and begs Sokka. He places twelve small bags of money as bribery, one after another in Sokka's arms, and Sokka smiles and winks at him to assure him that Sokka will keep this secret. The camera cuts to back at camp.
character_words: NA

full_text: Guys, I think these scams have gone far enough. If you keep doing them, something bad is gonna happen.
character_words: Guys, I think these scams have gone far enough. If you keep doing them, something bad is gonna happen.

full_text: Could you for once stop being such a sourpuss and just lighten up? [Tosses some money to Katara.]
character_words: Could you for once stop being such a sourpuss and just lighten up?

full_text: [Angrily.] Oh, I'm sorry! You think I should be more like you? Like some wild child? [Tosses the money back at Toph.]
character_words: Oh, I'm sorry! You think I should be more like you? Like some wild child?

full_text: Yeah! Maybe! Maybe then you'd see [Sokka grabs the money off the ground.] how great we have it! I mean, look at us! [Leans back on the rock behind her and crosses her arms behind her head.] We're traveling around the world! Making easy money! Having fun! With no parents to tell us what to do!
character_words: Yeah! Maybe! Maybe then you'd see  how great we have it! I mean, look at us!  We're traveling around the world! Making easy money! Having fun! With no parents to tell us what to do!

full_text: Ah. I see. You're acting like this because of your parents.
character_words: Ah. I see. You're acting like this because of your parents.

full_text: Whatever.
character_words: Whatever.

full_text: They were controlling over you, so you ran away, and now you act like your parents don't exist. You act like you hate them, but you don't. You just feel guilty.
character_words: They were controlling over you, so you ran away, and now you act like your parents don't exist. You act like you hate them, but you don't. You just feel guilty.

full_text: I do hate them.
character_words: I do hate them.

full_text: I don't think so. I think you miss them, but you just don't wanna deal with that, so instead you act like this crazy person.
character_words: I don't think so. I think you miss them, but you just don't wanna deal with that, so instead you act like this crazy person.

full_text: [Stands up; angrily.] Look, I ran away to help Aang!
character_words: Look, I ran away to help Aang!

full_text: You know what? It doesn't matter. These scams put us all at risk, and we don't need that. [Points at her forehead.] We've already got some third-eyed freak after us.
character_words: You know what? It doesn't matter. These scams put us all at risk, and we don't need that.  We've already got some third-eyed freak after us.

full_text: Speaking of that "third-eyed freak", I think I've come up with a name for him. What do you think of "Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man"? [Silence.] Just think about it.
character_words: Speaking of that "third-eyed freak", I think I've come up with a name for him. What do you think of "Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man"?  Just think about it.

full_text: [Angrily.] We have enough money! You need to stop this!
character_words: We have enough money! You need to stop this!

full_text: [Angrily.] I'll stop when I wanna stop and not when you tell me! [Uses earthbending to launch the bag of money behind her into her hand and walks away angrily. Katara shakes her head angrily as Toph sits and creates an earth tent.]
character_words: I'll stop when I wanna stop and not when you tell me!

full_text: [Grabs his bag of money and his sword and stands up.] Speaking of money, I'm off to spend some. See you guys later. [Walks away.]
character_words: Speaking of money, I'm off to spend some. See you guys later.

full_text: In town, Sokka just bought a messenger hawk, which he names Hawky.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner, and as such I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't wanna see any fighting. [Scratches Hawky on the stomach.] Good little messenger hawky. Who's got pretty feathers? [While walking away, he notices a wanted poster he had just past with Toph's picture on it. He gasps in horror and rips it off the wall. Hawky screeches.] You're right, Hawky. This is bad. [Suddenly, the bird poops while standing on Sokka's arm.]
character_words: Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner, and as such I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't wanna see any fighting.  Good little messenger hawky. Who's got pretty feathers?  You're right, Hawky. This is bad.

full_text: The scene changes to back at camp. Katara and Aang are practicing waterbending, while Toph is counting her money. Sokka walks up to her.
character_words: NA

full_text: Toph, while I was in town, I found something that you're not gonna like. [Pulls out the wanted poster and shows it to her.]
character_words: Toph, while I was in town, I found something that you're not gonna like.

full_text: Well it sounds like a sheet of paper, but I guess you're referring to what's on the sheet of paper.
character_words: Well it sounds like a sheet of paper, but I guess you're referring to what's on the sheet of paper.

full_text: It's a wanted poster. Of you. They've nicknamed you the Runaway.
character_words: It's a wanted poster. Of you. They've nicknamed you the Runaway.

full_text: [Happily.] A wanted poster! That's so great! "The Runaway." I love my new nickname. Is there a picture of me? Does it look good?
character_words: A wanted poster! That's so great! "The Runaway." I love my new nickname. Is there a picture of me? Does it look good?

full_text: [Looks a few times at both the wanted poster and Toph.] Well yeah, actually, it does look pretty good. [Gets back on topic.] But, Toph, you're missing the point. Maybe Katara was right. These scams are drawing too much attention to us.
character_words: Well yeah, actually, it does look pretty good.  But, Toph, you're missing the point. Maybe Katara was right. These scams are drawing too much attention to us.

full_text: Don't be such a worrywart like your sister. [Stands up and walks up to Sokka.] Think of it this way: Now you've got plenty of money to help with the invasion plan. [Holds up a bag of money and jiggles it in front of him.]
character_words: Don't be such a worrywart like your sister.  Think of it this way: Now you've got plenty of money to help with the invasion plan.

full_text: [Ponders for a moment.] Well, that is true. I had this idea of making armor for Appa. [Looks at Appa, who is napping, but opens one eye upon hearing this.]
character_words: Well, that is true. I had this idea of making armor for Appa.

full_text: [Takes some money out of the bag and hands the money to him.] Here's a little extra, so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what? [Gives the entire bag to him.] Make it an atlas.
character_words: Here's a little extra, so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what?  Make it an atlas.

full_text: [While taking the bag.] I do like expensive atlases.
character_words: I do like expensive atlases.

full_text: Of course you do. [Grabs the wanted poster and tucks it into her outfit.] And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret. [Walks away.]
character_words: Of course you do.  And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret.

full_text: Aang and Katara walk up to Sokka, who tucks his new money into his outfit
character_words: NA

full_text: Sokka, [Places her hand on her face; annoyed.] tell me you didn't buy a bird.
character_words: Sokka,  tell me you didn't buy a bird.

full_text: Not just a bird, a messenger bird. Now we can send messages all over the world. Even to Gran Gran.
character_words: Not just a bird, a messenger bird. Now we can send messages all over the world. Even to Gran Gran.

full_text: [Excited.] Wow, how does it work?
character_words: Wow, how does it work?

full_text: Hm. Uh, I never actually thought about that. Hawky, [Points away from himself.] Gran Gran, South Pole. [Hawky shakes himself.] I think he gets it.
character_words: Hm. Uh, I never actually thought about that. Hawky,  Gran Gran, South Pole.  I think he gets it.

full_text: Momo appears on Aang's shoulder and screeches at Hawky. He jumps to Sokka and starts chasing Hawky around Sokka's head.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hawky! Make nice! Bad Hawky!
character_words: Hawky! Make nice! Bad Hawky!

full_text: Later on at camp, Katara is mixing something in a cooking pot via waterbending. She waterbends some of it out of the pot and into Appa's mouth, which causes him to lick his lips, while Aang sits on a ledge in front of Appa and drinks something out of a cup. Toph and Sokka, the latter with Hawky on his shoulder, show up carrying big bags of money.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Well. Look who decided to join us. [Stands up.] Where have you two been? Off scamming again?
character_words: Well. Look who decided to join us.  Where have you two been? Off scamming again?

full_text: Yes, we were. [Puts her bag down.]
character_words: Yes, we were.

full_text: [Slides to the right to behind Toph.] And I suppose you don't think what you're doing is dangerous at all?
character_words: And I suppose you don't think what you're doing is dangerous at all?

full_text: No, I don't.
character_words: No, I don't.

full_text: Really?
character_words: Really?

full_text: Yes. Really.
character_words: Yes. Really.

full_text: [Starts to pull something out.] Well then. What's this? [Shows Toph her wanted poster.]
character_words: Well then. What's this?

full_text: [Annoyed.] I don't know! I mean, seriously! What is with you people? I'm blind! [Points at her eyes and pulls down her bottom eyelids to emphasize her words.]
character_words: I don't know! I mean, seriously! What is with you people? I'm blind!

full_text: It's a wanted poster of you! "The Runaway!" Is that what you're called now? Are you proud of this?
character_words: It's a wanted poster of you! "The Runaway!" Is that what you're called now? Are you proud of this?

full_text: [Angrily.] Where did you get that!?
character_words: Where did you get that!?

full_text: It doesn't matter where I got it. The fact is-
character_words: It doesn't matter where I got it. The fact is-

full_text: You went through my stuff! You had no right!
character_words: You went through my stuff! You had no right!

full_text: Your stuff was messy and I was just straightening up, and I happened to stumble across it!
character_words: Your stuff was messy and I was just straightening up, and I happened to stumble across it!

full_text: That's a lie! [Points at her.] You're lying, Katara!
character_words: That's a lie!  You're lying, Katara!

full_text: [Cut to a surprised Katara who glares at Toph. Pushes Toph's pointing hand out of her face.] Fine! It's a lie! But you've been so out of control lately, I knew something was up! I knew you were hiding something and you were! [Shows her the poster again, but Toph grabs it, tosses it and starts to walk past Katara.] Don't you walk away from me while I'm talking to you!
character_words: Fine! It's a lie! But you've been so out of control lately, I knew something was up! I knew you were hiding something and you were!  Don't you walk away from me while I'm talking to you!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Oh really, Mom? Or what are you gonna do? Send me to my room?
character_words: Oh really, Mom? Or what are you gonna do? Send me to my room?

full_text: I wish I could!
character_words: I wish I could!

full_text: Well you can't! Because you're not my mom, and you're not their mom! [Extends her arm at Aang and Sokka, who are sitting on a ledge.]
character_words: Well you can't! Because you're not my mom, and you're not their mom!

full_text: I never said I was!
character_words: I never said I was!

full_text: No, but you certainly act like it! You think it's your job to boss everyone around, but it's not! You're just a regular kid like the rest of us! So stop acting like you can tell me what to do! I can do whatever I want!
character_words: No, but you certainly act like it! You think it's your job to boss everyone around, but it's not! You're just a regular kid like the rest of us! So stop acting like you can tell me what to do! I can do whatever I want!

full_text: I don't act that way! [Looks at Sokka, who jumps as she says his name.] Sokka, do I act motherly?
character_words: I don't act that way!  Sokka, do I act motherly?

full_text: [Puts his hands up defensively.] Hey. I'm staying out of this one.
character_words: Hey. I'm staying out of this one.

full_text: [Looks at Aang.] What do you think, Aang? Do I act like a mom?
character_words: What do you think, Aang? Do I act like a mom?

full_text: [Rubs his eye.] Well. I, uh-
character_words: Well. I, uh-

full_text: [Slightly annoyed.] Stop rubbing your eye and speak clearly when you talk!
character_words: Stop rubbing your eye and speak clearly when you talk!

full_text: [He and Sokka sit straight.] Yes, ma'am.
character_words: Yes, ma'am.

full_text: I can't be around you right now!
character_words: I can't be around you right now!

full_text: Well, I can't be around you!
character_words: Well, I can't be around you!

full_text: Both girls turn and walk away. Hawky, sitting on Sokka's shoulder, screeches.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Rests his head in his hands.] I know, Hawky. Why can't they just get along?
character_words: I know, Hawky. Why can't they just get along?

full_text: Later on at camp, Sokka and Aang are sitting together. Toph and Katara are sitting at separate edges of the cliff, their backs to one another.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, Aang. You wanna test out my messenger hawk with me? I've got an idea.
character_words: Hey, Aang. You wanna test out my messenger hawk with me? I've got an idea.

full_text: Sure. [Leans his head closer to Sokka.]
character_words: Sure.

full_text: [Talks into Aang's ear.] I'm going to send a note to Katara and say it's from Toph, who wants to apologize. Then everyone will be friends again.
character_words: I'm going to send a note to Katara and say it's from Toph, who wants to apologize. Then everyone will be friends again.

full_text: I gotta say, Sokka, you continue to impress me with your ideas.
character_words: I gotta say, Sokka, you continue to impress me with your ideas.

full_text: It's a gift. [Pulls out a pen and ink and a piece of paper and starts to write.] "Dear Katara, sorry for everything. Your friend, Toph."
character_words: It's a gift.  "Dear Katara, sorry for everything. Your friend, Toph."

full_text: Sokka positions Hawky on his arm and places the note in Hawky's message holder. Hawky flies to Katara, who takes the note out, reads it, and angrily stands up.
character_words: NA

full_text: I know this is from you, Sokka! Toph can't write! [Tears the note up into pieces.] Ugh! You're all driving me crazy! [Turns and walks away.]
character_words: I know this is from you, Sokka! Toph can't write!  Ugh! You're all driving me crazy!

full_text: I can't believe we forgot Toph can't write.
character_words: I can't believe we forgot Toph can't write.

full_text: Yup. We're idiots. [Hawky flies back onto his arm.]
character_words: Yup. We're idiots.

full_text: I guess Plan B is we send a note to Toph pretending it's from Katara.
character_words: I guess Plan B is we send a note to Toph pretending it's from Katara.

full_text: I think we're gonna run into a similar problem. [Hawky screeches.] Sorry, Hawky. Looks like I'm gonna have to do this without your help. [Walks to Toph.] Come on. We need to talk.
character_words: I think we're gonna run into a similar problem.  Sorry, Hawky. Looks like I'm gonna have to do this without your help.  Come on. We need to talk.

full_text: Toph exhales, annoyed. The camera cuts to another area of the camp. Katara is bathing in a lake directly below a cliff. Sokka and Toph walk up to the edge of the cliff and sit down, not noticing Katara.
character_words: NA

full_text: So lemme guess: You brought me out here to tell me that your sister's not as annoying as I make her out to be.
character_words: So lemme guess: You brought me out here to tell me that your sister's not as annoying as I make her out to be.

full_text: Nah, she's pretty much a pain. [Katara, looking up at their feet from below and behind, glares and looks away.] She's always got to be right about everything and she gets all bossy and involved and in your business ...
character_words: Nah, she's pretty much a pain.  She's always got to be right about everything and she gets all bossy and involved and in your business ...

full_text: Yeah. I don't know how you could deal with it.
character_words: Yeah. I don't know how you could deal with it.

full_text: Actually, in a way, I rely on it. [Katara looks back up at them.]
character_words: Actually, in a way, I rely on it.

full_text: I don't understand.
character_words: I don't understand.

full_text: When our mom died, that was the hardest time in my life. Our family was a mess, but Katara? She had so much strength. She stepped up and took on so much responsibility. She helped fill the void that was left by our mom.
character_words: When our mom died, that was the hardest time in my life. Our family was a mess, but Katara? She had so much strength. She stepped up and took on so much responsibility. She helped fill the void that was left by our mom.

full_text: I guess I never thought about that.
character_words: I guess I never thought about that.

full_text: I'm gonna tell you something crazy. I never told anyone this before, but honestly? I'm not sure I can remember what my mother looked like. It really seems like my whole life, Katara's been the one looking out for me. She's always been the one that's there. And now, when I try to remember my mom, Katara's is the only face I can picture. [Katara, touched by what Sokka says, is reduced to tears.]
character_words: I'm gonna tell you something crazy. I never told anyone this before, but honestly? I'm not sure I can remember what my mother looked like. It really seems like my whole life, Katara's been the one looking out for me. She's always been the one that's there. And now, when I try to remember my mom, Katara's is the only face I can picture.

full_text: The truth is sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me. [Wipes away tears from her left eye.] You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom. [Katara, deeply touched by Toph's words, sinks slightly into the water. Toph punches Sokka in the arm.] Don't ever tell her I said any of this!
character_words: The truth is sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me.  You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom.  Don't ever tell her I said any of this!

full_text: Hey, my lips are sealed.
character_words: Hey, my lips are sealed.

full_text: At around nightfall, Katara is sitting next to Momo, who is napping with Katara rubbing the top of his head. Katara is looking down in front of her, saddened. She sees Sokka and Toph walking toward her and walks up to Toph. When they reach each other, Sokka keeps walking.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hi, Toph. Um, I wanna-
character_words: Hi, Toph. Um, I wanna-

full_text: [Holds up her hand in a "stop" fashion.] Katara, stop. You don't need to apologize. I was the one being stupid. These scams are out of control, and I'm done with them.
character_words: Katara, stop. You don't need to apologize. I was the one being stupid. These scams are out of control, and I'm done with them.

full_text: [Smiles.] Actually I wasn't going to apologize. I was gonna say ... I wanna pull a scam with you. [Aang and Sokka stare at her from behind, extremely shocked.]
character_words: Actually I wasn't going to apologize. I was gonna say ... I wanna pull a scam with you.

full_text: [Also shocked.] What? You wanna pull a scam?
character_words: What? You wanna pull a scam?

full_text: Not just any scam. The ultimate scam. [Sokka and Aang, still staring at her with shock, look at each other and faint, foaming from the mouth slightly. Katara puts her arm around Toph's shoulder, who gives a sly smile.] Whaddaya say, Toph? Just me and you. One last go. You in?
character_words: Not just any scam. The ultimate scam.  Whaddaya say, Toph? Just me and you. One last go. You in?

full_text: [Excited.] You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours? [They walk away and leave Aang and Sokka behind, who are now unconscious and foaming at the mouth.]
character_words: You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours?

full_text: The scene changes to Katara and Toph going over the plan. Katara is looking at Toph's wanted poster.
character_words: NA

full_text: The plan is simple: This wanted poster says you're worth a lot of money; Ten times more than you've made in all of your scams. So I'm gonna turn you in and collect the reward. Then you metalbend yourself out of jail, and we're on our way. [As she speaks, the screen fades to the beginning of the episode, where Toph is seen running from the authorities and is caught in a net.]
character_words: The plan is simple: This wanted poster says you're worth a lot of money; Ten times more than you've made in all of your scams. So I'm gonna turn you in and collect the reward. Then you metalbend yourself out of jail, and we're on our way.

full_text: [Angrily.] How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!
character_words: How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!

full_text: [Crosses her arms.] You brought this on yourself. I had no choice. [Turns away from Toph.]
character_words: You brought this on yourself. I had no choice.

full_text: Toph is dragged away in the net, all the while glaring back at Katara. Katara glances back slightly and gives a sly smile. She is joined by the chief of authorities.
character_words: NA

full_text: You did the right thing by turning in the Runaway.
character_words: You did the right thing by turning in the Runaway.

full_text: The right thing is its own reward.
character_words: The right thing is its own reward.

full_text: Well, I'm happy to hear you say that.
character_words: Well, I'm happy to hear you say that.

full_text: [Pauses for a moment.] But, I still want the actual reward.
character_words: But, I still want the actual reward.

full_text: Of course. Right this way.
character_words: Of course. Right this way.

full_text: Meanwhile, a female guard drags Toph into a jail. She throws Toph from the net into a wooden cell and closes it. Toph feels the floor of her cell, but is shocked when she can't sense any earth in it. She gets up and looks outside the cell at the guard.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey! What kind of cell is this?
character_words: Hey! What kind of cell is this?

full_text: A wooden one. [She walks away as Toph becomes visibly worried.]
character_words: A wooden one.

full_text: In an office, the town authority grabs a box underneath a desk and looks around in it. A door opens behind Katara, who is standing across the desk from the chief. The chief closes the box and points at Katara.
character_words: NA

full_text: That's her! That's the girl you were looking for!
character_words: That's her! That's the girl you were looking for!

full_text: Katara turns and sees the assassin with the third eye tattooed on his head, aka "Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man", walk in, leaving her shocked and horrified. Meanwhile, at camp, Sokka and Aang are worried, the latter pacing back and forth.
character_words: NA

full_text: Do you think this scam of theirs should be taking this long?
character_words: Do you think this scam of theirs should be taking this long?

full_text: I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out. [To Hawky and Momo.] You two behave. [Pointing at Appa.] Appa's in charge. [Appa lifts his head as the two animals start screeching at each other as soon as Sokka and Aang leave, but stop as soon as Appa roars at them.]
character_words: I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out.  You two behave.  Appa's in charge.

full_text: The camera cuts to Toph's cell, which now holds Katara too. They both are sitting on the floor, downcast, when Toph suddenly realizes something.
character_words: NA

full_text: Wait! It's a trap!
character_words: Wait! It's a trap!

full_text: [Sarcastically.] Really? No kidding! Is that why we're sitting in a wooden cage right now? Gee, how'd you figure out it was a trap?
character_words: Really? No kidding! Is that why we're sitting in a wooden cage right now? Gee, how'd you figure out it was a trap?

full_text: Not for us, Katara! We're the bait! He wants Aang! [Katara's eyes widen with realization.]
character_words: Not for us, Katara! We're the bait! He wants Aang!

full_text: I can't believe I'm so stupid! See? This is exactly why I'm against these scams! I knew this would happen!
character_words: I can't believe I'm so stupid! See? This is exactly why I'm against these scams! I knew this would happen!

full_text: But, this was your idea.
character_words: But, this was your idea.

full_text: I know. I wanted to show that I'm not so motherly. I wanted to show you that I can have fun too.
character_words: I know. I wanted to show that I'm not so motherly. I wanted to show you that I can have fun too.

full_text: Katara, you are fun. If nothing else, you're at least fun to argue with.
character_words: Katara, you are fun. If nothing else, you're at least fun to argue with.

full_text: I know your relationship with your parents is complicated. And I shouldn't have said what I said.
character_words: I know your relationship with your parents is complicated. And I shouldn't have said what I said.

full_text: It's okay. I was really mad when you said that because ... well because, maybe it's true. [Starts to cry.] I try not to think about it, but when I left, I probably really hurt them.
character_words: It's okay. I was really mad when you said that because ... well because, maybe it's true.  I try not to think about it, but when I left, I probably really hurt them.

full_text: Katara embraces Toph. Meanwhile, Sokka and Aang walk around town looking for Katara and Toph. The town is seemingly abandoned.
character_words: NA

full_text: Where do you think they might be?
character_words: Where do you think they might be?

full_text: Where do you think anyone is? [The assassin is seen walking across a rooftop behind them. Aang hears him inhaling and becomes shocked when he turns and sees him.] Sokka, watch out! [He grabs Sokka as they dodge a blast from the assassin and take cover behind an Ozai statue.] It's Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man!
character_words: Where do you think anyone is?  Sokka, watch out!  It's Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man!

full_text: You know, I'm starting to think that name doesn't quite fit.
character_words: You know, I'm starting to think that name doesn't quite fit.

full_text: The assassin jumps down from the roof and fires another blast at them. They barely dodge it, but get sent flying back by the blast, which shakes the ceiling of Toph and Katara's cell. Toph is trying to break out, while Katara is sitting down.
character_words: NA

full_text: What are we gonna do?
character_words: What are we gonna do?

full_text: I don't know. I wish we had some earth or water. We need bendables.
character_words: I don't know. I wish we had some earth or water. We need bendables.

full_text: What about your meteor bracelet? You can make a saw.
character_words: What about your meteor bracelet? You can make a saw.

full_text: I left it back at camp. [Sits down.] I was worried they would take it.
character_words: I left it back at camp.  I was worried they would take it.

full_text: Katara exhales deeply and wipes her forehead with the back of her hand. Her eyes widen with realization as she notices her hand is covered in sweat. She smiles and quickly stands up to start running in place.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Confused.] Um, Katara? Are you okay?
character_words: Um, Katara? Are you okay?

full_text: Just fine.
character_words: Just fine.

full_text: [Still confused.] Well, what are you doing?
character_words: Well, what are you doing?

full_text: I'm making my own water.
character_words: I'm making my own water.

full_text: Katara stops running and wipes her forehead again. This time, she uses waterbending to use the midair sweat as blades to cut through the wooden cage. Toph stands up upon noticing this.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Amazed.] Katara! You're a genius! A sweaty, stinky genius!
character_words: Katara! You're a genius! A sweaty, stinky genius!

full_text: Katara waterbends another blade of sweat, this time from under her arms. Cut to Aang and Sokka being chased by the assassin. The assassin fires a blast at them which they dodge but still get sent flying. Sokka crashes onto a wheelbarrow, which they hide behind.
character_words: NA

full_text: This guy is too good! He shoots fire from his brain!
character_words: This guy is too good! He shoots fire from his brain!

full_text: We should split up. He can't chase us both.
character_words: We should split up. He can't chase us both.

full_text: The assassin walks out of the smoke. Aang runs off from his left and Sokka from his right. The assassin fires a blast at the wheelbarrow and blows it up. Aang runs past him on a roof to his left. The assassin quickly turns and fires another blast, which sends Aang flying into the Ozai statue. He falls from the statue to the ground. He looks up and sees the assassin standing above him inhale, about to fire another blast at Aang, but his head is suddenly encased in ice. The assassin moves and Aang sees Katara, Sokka, and Toph standing behind the assassin.
character_words: NA

full_text: Aang, get up! [She helps him up and they run away.]
character_words: Aang, get up!

full_text: Let's get out of here!
character_words: Let's get out of here!

full_text: The assassin breaks the ice with brute force. He launches another blast at Team Avatar, but Toph quickly launches a boulder at the blast, blowing the boulder up. A pebble from the boulder flies toward the assassin and hits him square in his third eye, which momentarily stuns and angers him. He tries to fire another blast, but with his chi is blocked, he ignites the air around him and gets sent back, head-first into a wall. When he stands up and shakes it off, Team Avatar is gone.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Still running.] Hey, I got it! The perfect name for that guy: "Combustion Man!"
character_words: Hey, I got it! The perfect name for that guy: "Combustion Man!"

full_text: Good job, Sokka. Now let's get outta here before Combustion Man catches us.
character_words: Good job, Sokka. Now let's get outta here before Combustion Man catches us.

full_text: See? It fits so well!
character_words: See? It fits so well!

full_text: Later that night, the gang flies to another camp spot on Appa.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Yawns.] Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy? [Hawky makes a bird call.] Yeah. You're such a lazy little bird.
character_words: Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy?  Yeah. You're such a lazy little bird.

full_text: Aang and Sokka get off Appa. Katara is about to dismount Appa, but is stopped by Toph.
character_words: NA

full_text: Katara? I need your help.
character_words: Katara? I need your help.

full_text: [Sits back down.] What is it, Toph?
character_words: What is it, Toph?

full_text: [Pulls out a sheet of paper.] I need you to write some things down for me. I wanna send a letter to my parents.
character_words: I need you to write some things down for me. I wanna send a letter to my parents.

full_text: [Smiling.] I'll be happy to help.
character_words: I'll be happy to help.

full_text: They place a letter inside Hawky's holder and send him off as he flies away.
character_words: NA

full_text: Hey, where'd Hawky go?
character_words: Hey, where'd Hawky go?

full_text: Fade to credits.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Narrating a preview.] Previously on Avatar ...
character_words: Previously on Avatar ...

full_text: You're looking at the only waterbender in the whole South Pole. This ship has haunted my tribe when Gran-Gran was a little girl. It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks.
character_words: You're looking at the only waterbender in the whole South Pole. This ship has haunted my tribe when Gran-Gran was a little girl. It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks.

full_text: The legend said the moon was the first waterbender. Our ancestor saw how it pushed and pulled the tides, and learned how to do it themselves.
character_words: The legend said the moon was the first waterbender. Our ancestor saw how it pushed and pulled the tides, and learned how to do it themselves.

full_text: I always noticed my waterbending is stronger at night.
character_words: I always noticed my waterbending is stronger at night.

full_text: What are you doing?
character_words: What are you doing?

full_text: I'm making my own water!
character_words: I'm making my own water!

full_text: The episode opens to a waxing gibbous moon glowing in the night sky. The scene cuts to a shot of a field of fire lilies, a mountain in the distance. Cuts to a forested area, where Team Avatar is camping out among the trees. The darkness of the night gives the landscape an ominous feeling.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Telling a ghost story.] Suddenly, they heard something down the hall in the dark. Oooh ... It came into the torchlight ... and they knew the blade of Wing Fung was haunted! [Draws sword, stands up and points it toward the fire; yells dramatically.] Ooh-aaah!
character_words: Suddenly, they heard something down the hall in the dark. Oooh ... It came into the torchlight ... and they knew the blade of Wing Fung was haunted!  Ooh-aaah!

full_text: Cuts to shot of the entire group sitting around the campfire. Aang is lying down, Katara is hunched over in a sitting position and Toph sits casually, all three looking unamused.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Unimpressed.] I think I like "the man with a sword for a hand" better.
character_words: I think I like "the man with a sword for a hand" better.

full_text: Water Tribe slumber parties must stink.
character_words: Water Tribe slumber parties must stink.

full_text: No, wait! I've got one! And this is a true Southern Water Tribe story.
character_words: No, wait! I've got one! And this is a true Southern Water Tribe story.

full_text: [Sitting down.] Is this one of those "a friend of my cousin knew some guy that this happened to" stories?
character_words: Is this one of those "a friend of my cousin knew some guy that this happened to" stories?

full_text: No, it happened to Mom.
character_words: No, it happened to Mom.

full_text: Upon hearing this, Sokka stiffens. Cuts to Aang, who sits up to listen intently.
character_words: NA

full_text: One winter when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom noticed she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So Mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home. [Cuts to ground-level shot of the group sitting around the fire, the camera panning slightly to the right.] Just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice. [In a scary voice.] "It's so cold and I can't get warm!" [Sokka stiffens in fear.] Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but when everyone came back, Nini was gone.
character_words: One winter when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom noticed she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So Mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home.  Just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice.  "It's so cold and I can't get warm!"  Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but when everyone came back, Nini was gone.

full_text: Aang uses Momo's ears to cover his face in fear. The camera shifts to show Sokka hiding behind a gnarled tree stump.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Peering from behind a tree trunk.] Where'd she go?
character_words: Where'd she go?

full_text: No one knows. Nini's house stands empty to this day, but sometimes, people see smoke coming up from the chimney, like little Nini is still trying to get warm.
character_words: No one knows. Nini's house stands empty to this day, but sometimes, people see smoke coming up from the chimney, like little Nini is still trying to get warm.

full_text: The camera zooms out to where the gang is all huddled by the fire. Suddenly, Toph straightens up and places her hands on the ground.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Gasping.] Wait! Guys, did you hear that? [Aang, Katara, and Sokka clutch each other tightly, too stiff to move, with Toph standing alertly.] I hear people under the mountain. And they're screaming.
character_words: Wait! Guys, did you hear that?  I hear people under the mountain. And they're screaming.

full_text: Sokka, assuming Toph is joking, relaxes his grip.
character_words: NA

full_text: Pft! Nice try, Toph.
character_words: Pft! Nice try, Toph.

full_text: [Cuts to shot of the campsite viewed through the ominous looking tree branches.] No, I'm serious. I hear something.
character_words: No, I'm serious. I hear something.

full_text: You're probably just jumpy from the ghost stories ...
character_words: You're probably just jumpy from the ghost stories ...

full_text: It just ... stopped.
character_words: It just ... stopped.

full_text: [Cuts back to him and Katara, still hugging, Sokka sitting close by.] All right, now I'm getting scared.
character_words: All right, now I'm getting scared.

full_text: [Off-camera from behind group.] Hello, children.
character_words: Hello, children.

full_text: Everyone screams in terror upon hearing the strange woman's voice and scrambles from the ground. An elderly woman emerges from the shadows.
character_words: NA

full_text: Sorry to frighten you. My name is Hama. [Cuts to side-view of the campsite.] You children shouldn't be out in the forest by yourselves at night. [Cuts to ground-level shot of Hama standing over the fire.] I have an inn nearby. Why don't you come back there for some spiced tea and warm beds?
character_words: Sorry to frighten you. My name is Hama.  You children shouldn't be out in the forest by yourselves at night.  I have an inn nearby. Why don't you come back there for some spiced tea and warm beds?

full_text: [Sheepishly, places arm behind head.] Yes, please.
character_words: Yes, please.

full_text: Hama smiles and begins walking away. The scene changes to a village, her local inn lying atop a small hill. Cuts to inside the building, where tea is being poured into a teacup. Cuts to shot of the group sitting around the kitchen table.
character_words: NA

full_text: Thanks for letting us stay here tonight. You have a lovely inn.
character_words: Thanks for letting us stay here tonight. You have a lovely inn.

full_text: [Sets teapot down.] Aren't you sweet? [Walks over to her seat and sits down.] You know you should be careful. People have been disappearing in those woods you were camping in.
character_words: Aren't you sweet?  You know you should be careful. People have been disappearing in those woods you were camping in.

full_text: What do you mean "disappearing"?
character_words: What do you mean "disappearing"?

full_text: [Sets her teacup down.] When the moon turns full, people walk in and they don't come out. [Stand up and holds up her teapot; cheerfully smiling.] Who wants more tea?
character_words: When the moon turns full, people walk in and they don't come out.  Who wants more tea?

full_text: Cuts to shot of the group, who has by now fallen completely silent, the camera panning to the right to show all of them sitting around the table.
character_words: NA

full_text: Don't worry, you'll all be completely safe here. [Clasps hands together and smiles.] Why don't I show you to your rooms and you can get a good night's rest?
character_words: Don't worry, you'll all be completely safe here.  Why don't I show you to your rooms and you can get a good night's rest?

full_text: The scene changes to Sokka's room, where he is lying in bed with Momo asleep on the floor. Cuts to shot of him in bed as he rolls over. A creaking noise comes from outside, frightening him. He draws his sword quickly while Momo scampers under the covers.
character_words: NA

full_text: I know, Momo. [Places sword back inside holster and sets it down.] This place is creepy! [Lies back down on the pillow and pulls the covers over him.] I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep!
character_words: I know, Momo.  This place is creepy!  I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep!

full_text: The scene switches over to later in the night, where Sokka is fast asleep in his bed, snoring and drooling on his pillow. As it fades to the morning, he is lying sideways, next to the bed, though still fast asleep. Cut to a close-up of his face as a shadow approaches him. He slowly awakens, rubbing his eye.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Off-camera.] Wakey, wakey! [Cuts to shot of the innkeeper, standing brightly over him.] Time to go shopping!
character_words: Wakey, wakey!  Time to go shopping!

full_text: Katara appears by her side, dressed and happily smiling. The camera shifts counter-clockwise, showing Sokka later in the day, dressed in his ordinary clothes, standing in the marketplace where Hama has just made her purchase. A friendly old man smiles and waves to her as she walks away.
character_words: NA

full_text: That Mr. Yao seems to have a thing for you. Maybe we should go back and see if he'll give us some free komodo sausages?
character_words: That Mr. Yao seems to have a thing for you. Maybe we should go back and see if he'll give us some free komodo sausages?

full_text: [Seriously.] You would have me use my feminine charms to take advantage of that poor man? [Cheerfully.] I think you and I are going to get along swimmingly!
character_words: You would have me use my feminine charms to take advantage of that poor man?  I think you and I are going to get along swimmingly!

full_text: The two walk off camera with Katara smiling at this remark. The scene switches over to two villagers having a conversation by a stand.
character_words: NA

full_text: You won't have any ash bananas till next week?
character_words: You won't have any ash bananas till next week?

full_text: Well, I have to send the boy to Hing Wa Island to get them, and it's a two-day trip.
character_words: Well, I have to send the boy to Hing Wa Island to get them, and it's a two-day trip.

full_text: Oh, right. Tomorrow's the full moon.
character_words: Oh, right. Tomorrow's the full moon.

full_text: [In a lowered voice.] Exactly. I can't lose another delivery boy in the woods.
character_words: Exactly. I can't lose another delivery boy in the woods.

full_text: Cuts to shot of Aang, Sokka, and Toph walking through the marketplace. Aang carrying a package slung over his shoulder, Sokka carrying a package attached to his sword, while Toph carries a large, round basket on her head.
character_words: NA

full_text: People disappearing in the woods, weird stuff happening during full moons? This just reeks of Spirit World shenanigans.
character_words: People disappearing in the woods, weird stuff happening during full moons? This just reeks of Spirit World shenanigans.

full_text: I bet if we take a little walk around town, we'll find out what these people did to the environment to make the spirits mad.
character_words: I bet if we take a little walk around town, we'll find out what these people did to the environment to make the spirits mad.

full_text: [Makes gesture with his hand.] And then you can sew up this little mystery lickety-split, Avatar style!
character_words: And then you can sew up this little mystery lickety-split, Avatar style!

full_text: [Proudly.] Helping people ... that's what I do.
character_words: Helping people ... that's what I do.

full_text: Cuts to overhead shot of the group standing in the marketplace as he, Sokka and Toph approach Katara and Hama.
character_words: NA

full_text: Why don't you take all those things back to the inn? I just have to run a couple more errands. I'll be back in a little while.
character_words: Why don't you take all those things back to the inn? I just have to run a couple more errands. I'll be back in a little while.

full_text: [Walks up to her.] This is a mysterious little town you have here.
character_words: This is a mysterious little town you have here.

full_text: [Extremely close-up. Ominously.] Mysterious town for mysterious children.
character_words: Mysterious town for mysterious children.

full_text: She smiles creepily and saunters away, leaving Sokka feeling suspicious. The scene changes to a shot of Hama's inn, starting outside, before moving inside, where the gang is unpacking groceries. Sokka walks over to a counter and sets his basket down.
character_words: NA

full_text: That Hama seems a little strange. Like she knows something, or she's hiding something.
character_words: That Hama seems a little strange. Like she knows something, or she's hiding something.

full_text: [Unpacking items.] That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay. [Picks up cabbage.] She kinda reminds me of Gran-Gran.
character_words: That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay.  She kinda reminds me of Gran-Gran.

full_text: But what did she mean by that comment, "mysterious children"?
character_words: But what did she mean by that comment, "mysterious children"?

full_text: Gee, I don't know. Maybe because she found four strange kids camping in the woods at night? Isn't that a little mysterious?
character_words: Gee, I don't know. Maybe because she found four strange kids camping in the woods at night? Isn't that a little mysterious?

full_text: I'm gonna take a look around. [Walks away and up a flight of wooden stairs.]
character_words: I'm gonna take a look around.

full_text: [Appears along with the others at the bottom of the stairwell.] Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing? [Off-camera as Sokka peers around the inn.] You can't just snoop around someone's house.
character_words: Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing?  You can't just snoop around someone's house.

full_text: It'll be fine.
character_words: It'll be fine.

full_text: [Off-camera while Sokka peers into a room.] She could be home any minute.
character_words: She could be home any minute.

full_text: [Walking down hallway with the rest of the team.] Sokka, you're gonna get us all in trouble and this is just plain rude!
character_words: Sokka, you're gonna get us all in trouble and this is just plain rude!

full_text: [Tugging on a cupboard door.] I'm not finished yet. [Grunts, as he tries to pull it free.] Come on ...
character_words: I'm not finished yet.  Come on ...

full_text: The cupboard suddenly opens, revealing several wooden puppets stowed inside. The dolls fall forward, held together only by their strings. Everyone gasps; Sokka withdraws his sword, backs up and points it straight at the puppets.
character_words: NA

full_text: Okay, that's pretty creepy.
character_words: Okay, that's pretty creepy.

full_text: [Walks over and closes the cupboard; a bit weirded out.] So she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that. [Angrily.] Sokka, you've looked enough. [Off-camera as Sokka ascends into the attic.] Hama will be back soon.
character_words: So she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that.  Sokka, you've looked enough.  Hama will be back soon.

full_text: Just an ordinary puppet-loving innkeeper, huh? Well then why does she have a locked door up here?
character_words: Just an ordinary puppet-loving innkeeper, huh? Well then why does she have a locked door up here?

full_text: [Annoyed.] Probably to keep people like you from snooping through her stuff!
character_words: Probably to keep people like you from snooping through her stuff!

full_text: We'll see. [Peers through the keyhole into the room. Cuts to shot of the attic from his perspective. Through the keyhole, a small room can be seen, with a chest lying on the ground in the middle. The camera zooms in on the chest.] It's empty, except for a little chest.
character_words: We'll see.  It's empty, except for a little chest.

full_text: Maybe it's treasure!
character_words: Maybe it's treasure!

full_text: Sokka grows excited, his eyes growing wide, and uses his sword to pick the lock.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Approaches him.] Sokka, what are you doing? You're breaking into a private room!
character_words: Sokka, what are you doing? You're breaking into a private room!

full_text: I have to see what's in there.
character_words: I have to see what's in there.

full_text: The door unlocks and creaks open. The four step cautiously inside; Sokka puts away his sword and approaches the small chest.
character_words: NA

full_text: We shouldn't be doing this.
character_words: We shouldn't be doing this.

full_text: Sokka picks up the chest and tries to pry it open, only to discover it is locked.
character_words: NA

full_text: Maybe there's a key here somewhere ...
character_words: Maybe there's a key here somewhere ...

full_text: Ooh! Hand it over!
character_words: Ooh! Hand it over!

full_text: She takes the chest, removes her meteor bracelet from her arm and earthbends it into the shape of a small key, which she sticks into the keyhole of the chest.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Eagerly.] Come on, come on!
character_words: Come on, come on!

full_text: [Annoyed; Katara appears from behind her, peering nervously over her shoulder.] This isn't as easy as it looks!
character_words: This isn't as easy as it looks!

full_text: [Nervously.] Guys, I don't know about this ...
character_words: Guys, I don't know about this ...

full_text: This is crazy! I'm leaving!
character_words: This is crazy! I'm leaving!

full_text: Suit yourself! Do it, Toph!
character_words: Suit yourself! Do it, Toph!

full_text: Katara turns to leave the moment Toph signals that she has successfully opened the chest, holding her thumb up. All four eagerly surround the box in a comical fashion, anticipating what they will find inside.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Off-camera from behind them.] I'll tell you what's in the box.
character_words: I'll tell you what's in the box.

full_text: All, except Toph, scream and turn sharply to find Hama standing in the doorway. Cuts to shot of the group, still looking stunned, except Toph. Sokka guiltily hands her the box. Cuts to shot from inside the chest, as Hama lifts the lid and reaches her hand inside. Cuts to close-up of Sokka, his eyes wide in anxiousness, and a shot of Hama still in the process of lifting the object. Cuts to shot of the team standing together from her perspective. Her left arm appears on-screen, a blue whale tooth comb in her hand. Cuts to shot of her holding the comb, smiling.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Surprised.] An old comb?
character_words: An old comb?

full_text: It's my greatest treasure. It's the last thing I own from growing up in the Southern Water Tribe.
character_words: It's my greatest treasure. It's the last thing I own from growing up in the Southern Water Tribe.

full_text: The camera zooms in on Katara and Sokka, who stare at her in astonishment.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Stunned.] You're from the Southern Water Tribe?
character_words: You're from the Southern Water Tribe?

full_text: [Sets down comb.] Just like you.
character_words: Just like you.

full_text: How did you know?
character_words: How did you know?

full_text: I heard you talking around your campfire.
character_words: I heard you talking around your campfire.

full_text: But why didn't you tell us?
character_words: But why didn't you tell us?

full_text: I wanted to surprise you! I bought all this food today so I could fix you a big Water Tribe dinner. Of course, I can't get all the ingredients I need here, but ocean kumquats are a lot like sea prunes if you stew them long enough.
character_words: I wanted to surprise you! I bought all this food today so I could fix you a big Water Tribe dinner. Of course, I can't get all the ingredients I need here, but ocean kumquats are a lot like sea prunes if you stew them long enough.

full_text: [Sticking his tongue out in disgust.] Great ...
character_words: Great ...

full_text: I knew I felt a bond with you right away.
character_words: I knew I felt a bond with you right away.

full_text: And I knew you were keeping a secret, so I guess we're both right. [Grimaces as Katara hits him in the arm.] But I'm sorry we were sneaking around.
character_words: And I knew you were keeping a secret, so I guess we're both right.  But I'm sorry we were sneaking around.

full_text: Apology accepted. [Turns to the side and motions with her hand.] Now, let's get cooking!
character_words: Apology accepted.  Now, let's get cooking!

full_text: The scene changes to later that night, where Aang races from the inn to the barn located toward the back of the property. Cuts to overhead shot of inside the barn, where Appa and Momo lie. The doors creak open and Aang steps inside. Cuts to ground-level shot of him standing before the bison, tossing a cabbage-like vegetable into Appa's mouth. Momo dances in front of the bison's face and chitters, irritated. Appa opens his mouth and releases the cabbage, which Momo grabs. The lemur skitters away. Cuts to shot of Hama's kitchen table, as she sets down a bowl of soup. Cuts to shot of the entire room, the team and the innkeeper sitting around the table. Sokka is seen chewing on a food item, as Hama takes her seat at the head of the table.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Whispering to Toph.] I'd steer clear of the sea prunes.
character_words: I'd steer clear of the sea prunes.

full_text: I thought they were ocean kumquats.
character_words: I thought they were ocean kumquats.

full_text: Close enough.
character_words: Close enough.

full_text: Who wants five flavor soup?
character_words: Who wants five flavor soup?

full_text: All four raise their hands in acceptance. Hama situates her hands over the bowl and suddenly uses waterbending to summon a globule of soup and fill each of their bowls. Cuts to shot of the team looking at the spectacle in astonishment, the camera panning to the right. Four streams of soup land gracefully into each of their bowls.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Delighted.] You're a waterbender! [Faces Hama in delight.] I've never met another waterbender from our tribe!
character_words: You're a waterbender!  I've never met another waterbender from our tribe!

full_text: [Cuts to side-view of her; sadly.] That's because the Fire Nation wiped them all out. I was the last one ...
character_words: That's because the Fire Nation wiped them all out. I was the last one ...

full_text: Cuts to shot of Sokka and Katara, Katara clasping her hands together, an expression of pity on her face.
character_words: NA

full_text: So how did you end up out here?
character_words: So how did you end up out here?

full_text: [Grimly.] I was stolen from my home.
character_words: I was stolen from my home.

full_text: The scene fades to a flashback of a much younger Hama peacefully sauntering through her Southern Water Tribe village.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] It was over sixty years ago when the raids started.
character_words: It was over sixty years ago when the raids started.

full_text: She approaches her friend, Kanna, and they share a laugh before they notice ashen snow falling from the sky. The two race to the shores, where five Fire Nation ships are rapidly approaching the tribe. Five fireballs are launched from trebuchets and strike the village. Fire Nation soldiers swarm the area, battling the waterbenders, who desperately attempt to fend them off.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] They came again and again, each time rounding up more of our waterbenders and taking them captive.
character_words: They came again and again, each time rounding up more of our waterbenders and taking them captive.

full_text: The battle scene fades to another scene, where Hama and several other waterbenders use waterbending to capsize a Fire Nation vessel.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] We did our best to hold them off, but our numbers dwindled as the raids continued.
character_words: We did our best to hold them off, but our numbers dwindled as the raids continued.

full_text: As she is narrating, Water Tribe civilians who aided in the suspension of the vessel are seen slowly fading, signaling their capture by the Fire Nation. The camera rotates around her and zooms out, revealing dozens of firebenders surrounding her.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] Finally, I too was captured.
character_words: Finally, I too was captured.

full_text: The younger Hama is seen being led by Fire Nation soldiers onto one of their naval vessels, having now been captured herself.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] I was led away in chains. The last waterbender of the Southern Water Tribe.
character_words: I was led away in chains. The last waterbender of the Southern Water Tribe.

full_text: A final scene shows her looking out onto her tribe's members, including her friend, Kanna, in tears as the bow creaks upward. The flashback ends. Now in present time, Katara is seen walking over to Hama and placing her arms around her shoulder comfortingly.
character_words: NA

full_text: They put us in terrible prisons here in the Fire Nation. I was the only one who managed to escape.
character_words: They put us in terrible prisons here in the Fire Nation. I was the only one who managed to escape.

full_text: How did you get away? And why did you stay in the Fire Nation?
character_words: How did you get away? And why did you stay in the Fire Nation?

full_text: I'm sorry. It's too painful to talk about anymore.
character_words: I'm sorry. It's too painful to talk about anymore.

full_text: We completely understand. We lost our mother in a raid.
character_words: We completely understand. We lost our mother in a raid.

full_text: [Sympathetically.] Oh, you poor things.
character_words: Oh, you poor things.

full_text: Aang and Sokka cast their heads down solemnly.
character_words: NA

full_text: I can't tell you what it means to meet you. It's an honor. You're a hero.
character_words: I can't tell you what it means to meet you. It's an honor. You're a hero.

full_text: I never thought I'd meet another Southern waterbender. I'd like to teach you what I know so you can carry on the Southern tradition when I'm gone.
character_words: I never thought I'd meet another Southern waterbender. I'd like to teach you what I know so you can carry on the Southern tradition when I'm gone.

full_text: Yes! Yes, of course! To learn about my heritage, it would mean everything to me.
character_words: Yes! Yes, of course! To learn about my heritage, it would mean everything to me.

full_text: She bows to her newfound friend, who smiles warmly. The scene changes to the next day, where Hama and Katara are strolling on the outskirts of Hama's village.
character_words: NA

full_text: Growing up in the South Pole, waterbenders are totally at home surrounded by snow and ice and seas. But as you probably noticed on your travels, that isn't the case wherever you go.
character_words: Growing up in the South Pole, waterbenders are totally at home surrounded by snow and ice and seas. But as you probably noticed on your travels, that isn't the case wherever you go.

full_text: I know! When we were stranded in the desert, I felt like there was almost nothing I could do.
character_words: I know! When we were stranded in the desert, I felt like there was almost nothing I could do.

full_text: [Stops walking.] That's why you have to learn to control water wherever it exists.
character_words: That's why you have to learn to control water wherever it exists.

full_text: I've even used my own sweat for waterbending.
character_words: I've even used my own sweat for waterbending.

full_text: [Smiling.] That's very resourceful, Katara. You're thinking like a true master. But did you know you could even pull water out of thin air?
character_words: That's very resourceful, Katara. You're thinking like a true master. But did you know you could even pull water out of thin air?

full_text: In a quick movement of her right arm, Hama uses waterbending to manipulate the water vapor in the air, liquefying it and coating her fingertips.
character_words: NA

full_text: You have got to keep an open mind, Katara. [The water around her fingertips freezes, creating ice claws.] There's water in places you never think about.
character_words: You have got to keep an open mind, Katara.  There's water in places you never think about.

full_text:
She proceeds to fire the small daggers at a nearby tree, while Katara looks on in amazement.
Meanwhile, Aang, Sokka, and Toph are wandering about the landscape surrounding the village, trying to uncover any signs of disruption that would anger the spirits.
character_words: NA

full_text: This has got to be the nicest natural setting in the Fire Nation. I don't see anything that would make a spirit mad around here.
character_words: This has got to be the nicest natural setting in the Fire Nation. I don't see anything that would make a spirit mad around here.

full_text: The camera focuses on Toph and Sokka. Toph is standing casually near where Sokka is deeply inhaling the aroma of a bundle of flowers.
character_words: NA

full_text: Maybe the Moon Spirit just turned mean.
character_words: Maybe the Moon Spirit just turned mean.

full_text: [Angrily.] The Moon Spirit is a gentle, loving lady. She rules the sky with compassion and ... lunar goodness!
character_words: The Moon Spirit is a gentle, loving lady. She rules the sky with compassion and ... lunar goodness!

full_text: [Catches sight of a villager walking past.] Excuse me, sir. Can you tell us anything about the spirit that's been stealing people?
character_words: Excuse me, sir. Can you tell us anything about the spirit that's been stealing people?

full_text: Only one man ever saw it and lived and that's Old Man Ding.
character_words: Only one man ever saw it and lived and that's Old Man Ding.

full_text: Where does Old Man Ding live?
character_words: Where does Old Man Ding live?

full_text: The scene changes to a field of fire lilies, where Hama continues to tutor Katara in waterbending.
character_words: NA

full_text: Wow, these flowers are beautiful.
character_words: Wow, these flowers are beautiful.

full_text: They're called fire lilies. They only bloom a few weeks a year, but they're one of my favorite things about living here. And like all plants and all living things, they're filled with water.
character_words: They're called fire lilies. They only bloom a few weeks a year, but they're one of my favorite things about living here. And like all plants and all living things, they're filled with water.

full_text: I met a waterbender who lived in a swamp and could control the vines by bending the water inside.
character_words: I met a waterbender who lived in a swamp and could control the vines by bending the water inside.

full_text: You can take it even further.
character_words: You can take it even further.

full_text: In a sharp, swiveling motion, she draws water from dozens of the surrounding fire lilies and slices a nearby rock clean through.
character_words: NA

full_text: That was incredible! [Sees the wilted lilies.] It's a shame about the lilies, though.
character_words: That was incredible!  It's a shame about the lilies, though.

full_text: They're just flowers. When you're a waterbender in a strange land, you do what you must to survive. Tonight I'll teach you the ultimate technique of waterbending. It can only be done during the full moon, when your bending is at its peak.
character_words: They're just flowers. When you're a waterbender in a strange land, you do what you must to survive. Tonight I'll teach you the ultimate technique of waterbending. It can only be done during the full moon, when your bending is at its peak.

full_text: [Cautiously.] But isn't that dangerous? I thought people have been disappearing around here during the full moon.
character_words: But isn't that dangerous? I thought people have been disappearing around here during the full moon.

full_text: Oh, Katara. Two master waterbenders beneath a full moon? [Begins walking away.] I don't think we have anything to worry about.
character_words: Oh, Katara. Two master waterbenders beneath a full moon?  I don't think we have anything to worry about.

full_text: The two exit the field. The scene fades to later that night, where Aang, Sokka, and Toph are approaching Old Man Ding, who is boarding up his windows.
character_words: NA

full_text: Old Man Ding?
character_words: Old Man Ding?

full_text: Huh? [Accidentally hammers his thumb.] Ow, dang blame it! What? Can't you see I'm busy? Got a full moon rising. And why does everyone call me that? I'm not that old! [Attempts to lift a wooden plank off the ground, but fails to do so. Sighs.] Well, I'm young at heart.
character_words: Huh?  Ow, dang blame it! What? Can't you see I'm busy? Got a full moon rising. And why does everyone call me that? I'm not that old!  Well, I'm young at heart.

full_text: Aang approaches and helps Ding lift the board.
character_words: NA

full_text: Not ready to get snapped up by some moon monster yet at least.
character_words: Not ready to get snapped up by some moon monster yet at least.

full_text: [Proceeds to nail the board to the window frame.] We wanted to ask you about that.
character_words: We wanted to ask you about that.

full_text: Did you get a good look at the spirit that took you?
character_words: Did you get a good look at the spirit that took you?

full_text: Didn't see no spirit, just felt something come over me, like I was possessed. Forced me to start walking toward the mountain. [Points to the mountain.] I tried to fight it, but I couldn't control my own limbs. It just about had me into a cave up there. [Imitates a walking puppet.] And I looked up at the moon for what I thought would be my last glimpse of light. [Cuts to shot of the trio, Sokka quivering in fear.] But then the sun started to rise and I got control of myself again! I just high-tailed it away from that mountain as quick as I could!
character_words: Didn't see no spirit, just felt something come over me, like I was possessed. Forced me to start walking toward the mountain.  I tried to fight it, but I couldn't control my own limbs. It just about had me into a cave up there.  And I looked up at the moon for what I thought would be my last glimpse of light.  But then the sun started to rise and I got control of myself again! I just high-tailed it away from that mountain as quick as I could!

full_text: Why would a spirit want to take people to a mountain?
character_words: Why would a spirit want to take people to a mountain?

full_text: Oh no! [Sokka and Aang assume defensive positions.] I did hear people screaming under the mountain. The missing villagers must still be there!
character_words: Oh no!  I did hear people screaming under the mountain. The missing villagers must still be there!

full_text: They all stare at the mountain. The scene changes to where Aang, Sokka, and Toph are racing through the dark forest in search of the imprisoned villagers.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Feels the ground with her hand.] I can hear them. They're this way!
character_words: I can hear them. They're this way!

full_text: The trio proceeds to sprint toward the mountain. Meanwhile, Hama and Katara venture into the moonlit forest.
character_words: NA

full_text: Can you feel the power the full moon brings?
character_words: Can you feel the power the full moon brings?

full_text: She inhales deeply through her nose and stretches her arms outward, flexing her limbs which causes her veins to bulge out, while Katara looks on in disgust.
character_words: NA

full_text: For generations it has blessed waterbenders with its glow, allowing us to do incredible things!
character_words: For generations it has blessed waterbenders with its glow, allowing us to do incredible things!

full_text: The camera depicts a shot of her standing beneath the full moon.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Extreme close-up; in a sinister tone.] I've never felt more alive.
character_words: I've never felt more alive.

full_text: The scene changes to Aang, Sokka, and Toph, who have arrived at the mountain and are standing before the mouth of the cave.
character_words: NA

full_text: This is the place.
character_words: This is the place.

full_text: I can't see anything down there.
character_words: I can't see anything down there.

full_text: [Grabs Sokka's hand.] That's why you have me. Let's go!
character_words: That's why you have me. Let's go!

full_text: The three descend into the dark cave and approach a solid metal door, torches nearby. Using metalbending, Toph breaks it down, while the trio proceeds to make their way through the tunnel, Aang and Sokka lighting their path with the torches. They arrive to see several villagers chained to the walls of the cave.
character_words: NA

full_text: We're saved!
character_words: We're saved!

full_text: Toph unfastens her meteor bracelet and begins to unlock the prisoners' shackles.
character_words: NA

full_text: I didn't know spirits made prisons like this. Who brought you here?
character_words: I didn't know spirits made prisons like this. Who brought you here?

full_text: It was no spirit.
character_words: It was no spirit.

full_text: It was a witch!
character_words: It was a witch!

full_text: A witch? What do you mean?
character_words: A witch? What do you mean?

full_text: [Speaking, as Toph unlocks her shackles.] She seems like a normal old woman, but she controls people like some dark puppetmaster!
character_words: She seems like a normal old woman, but she controls people like some dark puppetmaster!

full_text: [Gritting.] Hama!
character_words: Hama!

full_text: Yes, the innkeeper!
character_words: Yes, the innkeeper!

full_text: I knew there was something creepy about her!
character_words: I knew there was something creepy about her!

full_text: We have to stop Hama!
character_words: We have to stop Hama!

full_text: I'll get these people out of here. You go!
character_words: I'll get these people out of here. You go!

full_text: Aang and Sokka flee from the scene, while Toph stays behind. The scene switches to the forest. A cat owl hoots and flies away. The camera focuses on Hama and Katara, their backs facing the camera, the wind blowing their hair slightly, looking toward the moon.
character_words: NA

full_text: What I'm about to show you, [Cuts to close-up of Hama glaring menacingly.] I discovered in that wretched Fire Nation prison.
character_words: What I'm about to show you,  I discovered in that wretched Fire Nation prison.

full_text: The scene fades to a flashback of a younger Hama imprisoned within a cage. She peers through the bars of her cell and looks down mournfully. The camera zooms out to the entire prison room.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] The guards were always very careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air and had us suspended away from the ground. Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend. [A side-view is shown of Fire Nation guards giving water to a tied up prisoner.] Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution. [Cuts to shot of the full moon in the sky during present day.] And yet each month, I felt the full moon enriching me with its energy. [Cuts to shot of Hama.] There had to be something I could do to escape. [Scene fades to flashback of the prison.] Then I realized that where there is life, there is water. [A younger Hama is shown bending the water inside an elephant rat that had wandered its way into her cage.] The rats that scurried across the floor of my cage were nothing more than skins filled with liquid and I passed years developing the skill that would lead to my escape. [A close-up is shown of Hama smiling at her discovery. The scene fades back to present day. Ominously.] Bloodbending. [Cut to a scared Katara.] Controlling the water in another body, [Cut to ground shot of both Hama and Katara.] enforcing your own will over theirs. [The scene fades back to a flashback of young Hama controlling a horde of rats using bloodbending.] Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.
character_words: The guards were always very careful to keep any water away from us. They piped in dry air and had us suspended away from the ground. Before giving us any water, they would bind our hands and feet so we couldn't bend.  Any sign of trouble was met with cruel retribution.  And yet each month, I felt the full moon enriching me with its energy.  There had to be something I could do to escape.  Then I realized that where there is life, there is water.  The rats that scurried across the floor of my cage were nothing more than skins filled with liquid and I passed years developing the skill that would lead to my escape.  Bloodbending.  Controlling the water in another body,  enforcing your own will over theirs.  Once I had mastered the rats, I was ready for the men.

full_text: The camera switches over to show a Fire Nation guard strolling past the cages when a sudden feeling comes over him. Using bloodbending, Hama forces the guard to grab hold of his keys and unlock her cell, thus marking her escape.
character_words: NA

full_text: [Voice-over.] And during the next full moon, I walked free for the first time in decades. [The guard attempts to get up, but Hama quickly forces him back down to the ground. She walks unsteadily away.] My cell unlocked by the very guards assigned to keep me in. [Scene changes back to present day; camera focuses on a close-up of Hama.] Once you perfect this technique, you can control anything or [Looks at Katara from the corner of her eyes sadistically.] anyone.
